Section 1
Opening – Prior to Meeting Sokolov
Opening
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button unavailable)
An MC-130E Combat Talon 1 special operations aircraft, which entered service in 1966, heads for Soviet airspace. It's night, and visibility is good. The Talon is approaching probably from either the east, China, or the south, elsewhere in Asia. The camera fixes on the gunship from above, its entire fuselage coming into view. On its nose we see the "whiskers" used for catching recovery balloon cables.
Caption: 5:30AM August 24, 1964 Pakistani airspace
*The text appears one letter at a time in a 1960s sort of style.

PILOT

Flying over Pakistan, altitude 30,000 feet. Approaching Soviet airspace.
The MC-130E's service ceiling is 33,000 feet (approximately 10,000 meters).
The loadmaster is in the cargo hold with Snake, but he doesn't appear on-screen.
A loadmaster, or LM, is tasked with managing aerial cargo.

LM

Twenty minutes to dropoff... Commencing internal depressurization (until it's the same level as 10,000 feet).

LM

Equipment check...

LM

Arm main parachute.
Inside the aircraft, in a prefab, airtight operations room geared for electronic warfare. A figure (Zero) looks over data. Zero is wearing a leather bomber jacket. We get a glimpse of a woman (Para-Medic) next to him. Since the Virtuous Mission is set to take only around three hours, they'll monitor the situation from the air.

ZERO

All right, you ready to go?

PILOT

Drop zone still showing a high pressure mass. CAVOK! (Cloud and Visibility OK)
The MC-130E operates independently, without any support whatsoever, so it's equipped with an array of advanced sensors. A screen shows weather radar information.

ZERO

Good, we've got high visibility.
In the cargo hold, a man kicks back with a cigar. We can see the smoke.
His face is silhouetted, so we don't get a look at it. Blue tobacco smoke rises into the air.

LM

Put out that cigar. (Fire is strictly prohibited when breathing 100% oxygen.)

LM

Connecting oxygen hose to interior connector...
*If the player chose "I'm playing the MGS series for the first time!" or "I like MGS1!" when starting the game

LM

Put on your mask... Does this pantywaist know what he's doing?
*If the player chose "I like MGS2!" when starting the game

LM

Put on your mask... Does this pantywaist know what he's doing?
The flow of oxygen begins.
But the man is still smoking. In fact, there's no indication he plans on stopping.

PILOT

Approaching release point...

LM

Ten minutes to dropoff.

ZERO

Hey! Are you deaf? He said put out the cigar and put on your mask.
The man throws the cigar to the floor.
He puts on the mask.
Close-up of the mask. Light from the cargo hold's meters and gauges bounces off the eyepieces.
The cargo hold's lights go out, and red lights (low-illumination infrared lighting) come on.

LM

Depressurization complete.

LM

Checking oxygen supply.

LM

Six minutes to dropoff! Opening rear hatch!
The red lights bring the man into full view. His mask covers his face completely, but through the eyepieces we see an intense stare. The rest of his expression remains hidden. The rear cargo door opens.
This time, the red image of the sun hits the eyepieces.
Morning light has started to creep above a dim horizon.

LM

Sunrise...
The man is silhouetted against the background of the rising sun. The colors of the sky are gradually tinged with indigo blue. A strong wind batters the man, but he doesn't seem the slightest bit bothered by it.

LM

External temperature, minus 46 degrees Celsius.
Outside temperature at an altitude of 10,000 meters (33,000 feet) is -50F (roughly -46C) or below.

LM

Two minutes to dropoff... Stand up.
The man stands up and quickly double-checks his HALO gear.
The loadmaster prepares by removing the hose from the internal oxygen connector.

ZERO

You'll be falling at 130 miles (200 kilometers) per hour. Try not to get frostbite from the wind chill.
Thanks to the parachute attached to his torso, the man's appearance resembles that of a pregnant fly. For his backpack, containing gear from these early days, he's employed the British method—it's attached upside-down to the back of his thighs (in the American method it's attached to the front of the thighs). Zero will later explain the differences between these two methods over the radio.
The man continues to not utter a word. All we hear through his mask is the sound of his breathing.

LM

One minute to dropoff... Move to the rear.
The man moves to the ramp door. He's about a meter from the edge.

LM

Activate bailout bottle.

ZERO

This is one for the history books; the world's first HALO jump. (HALO = high altitude - low opening.)

LM

Ten seconds to dropoff... Standby.
The man's oxygen device activates.

LM

Status OK, all green!
The red lights turn green.

PILOT

Prepare for dropoff... Countdown 5, 4, 3, 2, 1...

ZERO

Spread your wings and fly! God be with you!
The morning sun reflects off the mask's eyepieces.
The man throws himself from the gunship.
He plummets toward the ground.
The briefing, which took place before the gunship took off, is shown during the descent. It will be depicted via Shinkawa Theater1. Historical events and facts will be shown through real footage and/or photographs, if we can use film in the game. It will feature the voices of Major Zero, the operational commander, and Jack (Snake) only, in a radio drama style like that used in MGS1 and MGS2. The aim is dramatic effect with the minimum amount of information.
Opening
Movie Cutscene 1
(Shinkawa Theater & real news footage)
The mission briefing inside the gunship.
Silhouetted in a small command room are Jack (Snake) and Zero (Tom). It's just the two of them. Behind them are monitors, maps, and documents.

ZERO

Jack, I've got some important news. The head of the CIA2 has finally given us the green light for the Virtuous Mission.

JACK

Virtual Mission?

ZERO

No, the Virtuous Mission. The future of our FOX Unit depends on it. If it succeeds, we'll be officially organized into a unit.

JACK

Virtuous Mission? Sounds like some kind of initiation ritual (to join the CIA).

ZERO

Don't get cocky. This isn't a training op.

JACK

Right... So, what exactly is this wonderful mission?

ZERO

Well...
Berlin Wall (illustration or real footage).

ZERO

About two years ago a certain Soviet scientist requested asylum in the West through one of our (the West's) moles.

ZERO

His name is Nikolai Stepanovich Sokolov. He's head of the OKB-754 Design Bureau, one of the Soviets' top-secret weapon research facilities, and the East's foremost expert on weapons development.
We see numerous covert photos of Sokolov. He's a tall, lean, bespectacled man in middle age.
He appears to be the highly strung type too.
There is also a photo of him with his family—a wife and daughter. (Foreshadowing.)
Editor's Note: The photo of Sokolov's family is not shown at this point.

JACK

Sokolov... isn't he that famous rocket scientist?
Video, photos, illustrations, etc., of the Vostok 1, the A1 rocket, etc. Real footage would be fine.

ZERO

The very same. On April 12, 1961, the Soviets achieved the first manned space flight in history.

JACK

The Earth was blue. But there was no God.

ZERO

Well spoken. The rocket that carried Yuri Gagarin into orbit was the A1, known as the Vostok rocket. Sokolov is said to be the man most responsible for the multi-engine cluster used in that rocket.

ZERO

After Gagarin's flight, Sokolov left rocket development to become the head of the newly established Design Bureau.

JACK

From a lowly technician to head of a Design Bureau. That's quite a success story. So why'd he want to defect?
Video or illustrations of rocket experiments, etc., such as Sputnik.

ZERO

It seems he'd become afraid of his own creations.

JACK

Afraid?

ZERO

Call it a crisis of conscience.

JACK

And for that, he left his country and his family behind and went over the fence?

ZERO

Not exactly. One of his conditions was that his family was also to be taken safely to the West. We used a mole to get the family out first, and succeeded in sneaking Sokolov over the Berlin Wall shortly afterwards.
Sokolov getting over the Berlin Wall, and the Western moles aiding him.

ZERO

I was the one who conducted the operation.

JACK

The security on the eastern side was still full of holes back then. Then what?
Sokolov being hospitalized. He's asleep in bed, hooked up to an IV. His hands and feet are bandaged.

ZERO

We got Sokolov over in one piece, but the whole ordeal had left him exhausted, and we checked him into a hospital in West Berlin.

ZERO

It took him two weeks and more than 600 miles (1,000 kilometers) to get from the research facility in the Soviet Union to Berlin. He was in no condition to say anything coherent.

ZERO

And it was only a week later that we had something much bigger on our hands.

JACK

The Cuban Missile Crisis...
Illustrations depicting the Cuban Missile Crisis.
Cuba's missiles, Kennedy and Khrushchev, transport ships heading to Cuba, etc. A crowd watches JFK give a speech out in public. Real footage would be fine.

ZERO

October 16, 1962. President Kennedy received word that the Soviets were in the process of deploying intermediate-range ballistic missiles in Cuba3.

ZERO

The President demanded that the Soviets dismantle and remove the missiles. At the same time, he announced a naval blockade to prevent further missile shipments from reaching Cuba.

ZERO

But the Soviets didn't back down, instead placing their armed forces on secondary alert. Soviet transport ships carrying missiles continued on course toward Cuba. U.S. and Soviet forces went on alert for an all-out nuclear war. Frantic negotiations were conducted through the UN's Emergency Security Council and unofficial channels to end the hair-trigger standoff. Finally, on October 28, the Soviet Union agreed to remove its missiles from Cuba. And so the world avoided a nuclear holocaust...

ZERO

But in order to get the Soviets to pull their missiles out, we had to make a deal.

JACK

You mean the one where the U.S. agreed to remove its IRBMs from Turkey?

ZERO

No. The Jupiter IRBMs deployed in Turkey were obsolete, and we were going to get rid of them anyway. They had no strategic value whatsoever to either the U.S. or the Russians.

ZERO

The Turkey deal was a ruse - a cover story that was fed to the other intelligence agencies around the world.

JACK

So what did the Russians really want?

ZERO

Sokolov. They wanted us to return Sokolov.

JACK

You mean the Soviets pulled out of Cuba just to get their hands on Sokolov?

ZERO

That's right.

JACK

... What the hell was he working on?

ZERO

At the time, we had no idea.
Kennedy and Khrushchev's secret agreement. The location where Robert Kennedy and the Soviet Union's representative met, the Oval Office, etc.
Editor's Note: This footage does not appear in the game.

ZERO

We were running out of time.

ZERO

It was either give up Sokolov or risk full-scale nuclear war. In the end, we had no choice.

ZERO

President Kennedy gave into Khrushchev's demand.
Sokolov being transported to the Berlin Wall. Sokolov running away from the checkpoint.

ZERO

The next day, I got Sokolov out of the hospital and handed him over to agents on the eastern side. Sokolov kept on screaming "Save me!" until he disappeared from my sight.
The checkpoint controlling access through the Berlin Wall closes.

ZERO

Then, a month ago, we received some new information from one of our moles.

JACK

About Sokolov?

ZERO

Yes. He was taken back to the research facility and forced to continue working on the weapon in question under KGB4 supervision. What's more, it's on the verge of completion.

JACK

So? What kind of weapon is it? Something to do with space rockets?

ZERO

No, missiles.

JACK

Same technology.

ZERO

I guess you're right. We don't know the details, but it appears to be a new kind of nuclear device.
Illustration depicting a nuclear test.

ZERO

For half a year now, the Soviets have been conducting frequent nuclear tests at Semipalatinsk...

JACK

Something to do with the weapon, I assume.

ZERO

We're talking about a secret weapon so big that Khrushchev was ready to pull out of Cuba to get it back.
Map of the Soviet Union, plus a map indicating the transport aircraft's infiltration route.

JACK

Is Sokolov still in the facility?

ZERO

No, according to our intelligence he's in Tselinoyarsk5, a place in the mountains about three miles(4.8 kilometers) to the west that's known as the "Virgin Cliffs."

JACK

The Virgin Cliffs. Nice name for a Virtuous Mission.

ZERO

They moved him there just recently.

JACK

Why? (Why was he taken out of his design bureau?)

ZERO

Apparently they're conducting a field test of the weapon. But it's our best chance to get him back. This mission would never have been possible if he were still in the research facility.

ZERO

This is our last chance. Sokolov must have known that, too, when he contacted us.
Opening
3D Cutscene 2
3D cutscene (morning - change view button available)
Jack is still in the middle of his HALO jump, dropping like a bullet.
In this cutscene, the player can look at the ground with the First Person View Button.
First person prompt appears on-screen.
*Taking Advantage of a Feature of Real-time 3D Cutscenes
MGS3, like previous entries in the series, utilizes real-time 3D cutscenes for its cinematic sequences. When possible, the player will be able to switch to a first person camera during a cutscene by pressing the First Person View Button. However, they cannot move this first person camera, and for some scenes, it will not be possible to switch to first person, be it due to rendering, animation, effects, staging, flow, or other considerations. Such scenes will work just like previous titles. Also like before, the player will be able to zoom in with the right stick. They will be notified about when they can enter First Person View by a prompt that will appear beneath the cutscene window. The player can only enter First Person View during sequences containing this notification. In particular, for solo scenes like the HALO jump, jungle scenes, the dives into the waterfall and river, and the rapids scene, the level of immersion experienced by going into First Person View will be even greater.
•Applies to all binoculars scenes
•Applies to all scenes featuring The Sorrow

ZERO

Listen up, Jack. Your mission is to infiltrate Tselinoyarsk in the Soviet Mountains, ensure the safety of Sokolov, and bring him back to the West.

ZERO

If we don't get Sokolov back before that weapon is complete, we'll be facing a major crisis.

ZERO

The clock is ticking.
The parachute opens.
The man is tossed about by strong winds as he floats down into Soviet territory.

ZERO

Once we've confirmed the rescue of Sokolov, stand by at the recovery point.

ZERO

A recovery balloon will be dropped at that point.

ZERO

Helium will be pumped into the balloon to inflate it. The process takes about 20 minutes...

ZERO

Once it's complete, the gunship's arm will latch onto the balloon and pull it up.

JACK

The Fulton Surface-To-Air Recovery System. I'm familiar with the theory.
Inside the Combat Talon Operations room. Zero's face is illuminated by the monitor in front of him.
The monitor shows data on the Fulton Recovery System.

ZERO

Take it easy. It has been combat-proven.
The man's voice comes through over the radio.

JACK

(I've undergone training, but...) Do you think Sokolov's up to it?

ZERO

(There will be high G forces, but...) The shock will be less than during a parachute jump. And the arm can handle up to 500 pounds.

JACK

So, you're planning on going over the border in a single Combat Talon?

ZERO

She's equipped with two 6-barrel 20 millimeter Vulcan cannons as well as two 40 millimeter machine guns.

JACK

Sounds like she could hold her own against a battalion of tanks.
The man continues his rapid descent.

ZERO

Even with the fuel in the reserve tank, we're facing a 4-hour time limit...

ZERO

If all goes well, it shouldn't take more than a few hours.

JACK

Home in time for dinner.

ZERO

But if anything goes wrong...

ZERO

You'll be eating dinner, breakfast, and all the rest of your meals in the jungle.
Hinting at the game's survival mechanics.
The forest approaches. Jack collides with some trees. One of them rips his backpack away.
*If the player chose "I'm playing the MGS series for the first time!" or "I like MGS1!" when starting the game-->Opening 3D Cutscene 3
*If the player chose "I like MGS2!" when starting the game-->Opening 3D Cutscene 4
Opening
3D Cutscene 3
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button unavailable)
Jack completes his parachute landing in masterful fashion, cutting the parachute loose the moment he touches the ground. MC3 parachute.
Jack takes off his mask.
He snaps his head around to look behind him. Beneath the mask is the Snake we're all familiar with.
Vigilant, Snake surveys the area.
Snake has on jungle face paint.
Caption: Snake's name and voice actor, Snake (David Hayter)
Snake moves into cover behind a nearby tree and takes out his radio.
Opening
Radio Call 1
(mandatory incoming call)
On the radio screen, Snake appears as a 3D model in silhouette. There are lip flaps, nods, and other basic animations. The other party's screen consists of illustrations that give the impression of being part of a file on them. In addition, the player can do things like move the stick to view information on them.

ZERO

Do you copy? You're already in enemy territory, and somebody might be listening in. From here on out, we'll be using code names to refer to each other.

ZERO

Your code name for this mission will be Naked Snake. I'll be referring to you as Snake from now on.

ZERO

You are not to mention your real name.

JACK

"Snake"?

ZERO

You don't like snakes?

JACK

What do you mean?

ZERO

You've eaten one before, haven't you?

JACK

In survival training.
Zero grins as he answers.

ZERO

I'm glad to hear that.

SNAKE

I don't know if I'd ever order one in a restaurant, but...

ZERO

Be careful. You might not have a choice.

SNAKE

What about you, Major? What should I call you?

ZERO

Hmm, let's see... I'll be... *thinks a little*

ZERO

I'll be Tom. Call me Major Tom.
-->Taking off the Mask Radio Call 2
Opening
3D Cutscene 4
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button unavailable)
Jack completes his parachute landing in a masterful fashion, cutting the parachute loose the moment he touches the ground. MC3 parachute.
Jack takes off his mask.
He snaps his head around to look behind him. Beneath the mask is the face of Raiden. His long, silver locks flutter in the wind. Vigilant, Raiden surveys the area.
Caption: Jack's name and voice actor, Jack (David Hayter)
The player can move around in-game for a bit, still as Raiden. A mandatory radio call soon comes in.
Taking Off the Mask
Radio Call 3
(mandatory incoming call)

ZERO

Do you copy? You're already in enemy territory, and somebody might be listening in. From here on out, we'll be using code names to refer to each other.

ZERO

Your code name for this mission will be Naked Snake. I'll be referring to you as Snake from now on.

ZERO

You are not to mention your real name.

JACK

"Snake"?

ZERO

You don't like snakes?

JACK

What do you mean?

ZERO

You've eaten one before, haven't you?

JACK

In survival training.
Zero grins as he answers.

ZERO

I'm glad to hear that.

SNAKE

I don't know if I'd ever order one in a restaurant, but...

ZERO

Be careful. You might not have a choice.

SNAKE

What about you, Major? What should I call you?

ZERO

Hmm, let's see... I'll be... *thinks a little*

ZERO

I'll be Tom. Call me Major Tom.

MAJOR TOM

Oh, and Snake...

SNAKE

Yeah?

MAJOR TOM

The crew isn't watching anymore. You can take off the disguise now.

SNAKE

Good idea. This (Raiden) isn't right.

SNAKE

Time for the snake to shed his skin. (Also in Substance.)
Taking Off the Mask
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (do-over as Snake)
Snake takes off the mask disguise and gazes up at the sky looking refreshed.
Snake has on jungle face paint.
Snake basks in the sunlight filtering through the trees. Leaves fall around him.
Caption: Snake's name and voice actor, Snake (David Hayter)
Snake snaps out of his reverie, moves into cover behind a nearby tree, and takes out his radio.
-->Taking off the Mask Radio Call 2
Taking off the Mask
Radio Call 2

MAJOR TOM

This will be a sneaking mission. You must not be seen by the enemy. You must leave no trace of your presence. Is that clear? This kind of infiltration is the FOX Unit's speciality.

MAJOR TOM

In other words, weapons and equipment are procure on-site... That goes for food as well. You're completely naked, just as your name implies.

SNAKE

Great. Now I see why you asked me if I like snakes. I suppose calling me "Snake" was your idea of a joke, too.

MAJOR TOM

No, there's a good reason for that. I'll tell you later, when the time is right. (After The Boss has appeared.)

SNAKE

Gotcha. Getting back to the subject (of food), how exactly am I supposed to feed myself?

MAJOR TOM

You've been issued a knife and a tranquilizer gun. Use them to hunt for food. You'll also find some medical supplies in your backpack.

SNAKE

Yeah, about the backpack... I lost it in a tree on the way down.
Radio Miniscreen: Video of the backpack hanging from the tree.

MAJOR TOM

I see. Well, you'd better go back and get it, then. Do you know where it is? (It's time to practice climbing trees.)

SNAKE

No problem. I can see it from here. It's stuck on a branch...
Radio Miniscreen: Video of Snake climbing the tree.

MAJOR TOM

To climb a tree, stand in front of a tree that's covered in ivy and press the Action Button.

MAJOR TOM

I'll be monitoring your progress over the radio. We can't risk violating Soviet airspace, but I'll be in the gunship. My frequency is 140.85. I'll give you a CALL if I need to talk to you.

MAJOR TOM

If you need to talk to me, use the SEND function. (Same line as always.)

MAJOR TOM

OK, Snake. Go get your backpack.
After Recovering Backpack
Radio Call 1
Snake climbs the tree and recovers his backpack.
Snake jumps down from the tree, then gets a call from Major Tom.

MAJOR TOM

I see you've retrieved your backpack, Snake.
Radio Miniscreen: Video of weapon and item windows.

MAJOR TOM

To equip a weapon, it is necessary to take it out of your backpack.

MAJOR TOM

In the Survival Viewer, choose "WEAPON" from the "BACKPACK."

MAJOR TOM

Your available weapons will be displayed in a window in the upper-left.

MAJOR TOM

From that list, choose the weapon you want to equip and press the Enter Button.

MAJOR TOM

For other equipped items, just do the same thing from "ITEM."

SNAKE

Got it! Use the Survival Viewer "BACKPACK."

MAJOR TOM

Yep, that's right.

MAJOR TOM

Survival is fundamental to this mission.

MAJOR TOM

After you've been out in the field for a while, your stamina will start to drop. If your stamina gets too low, it'll affect your performance. You won't be able to shoot accurately, for example, and your wounds won't heal as smoothly. Keep an eye on your stamina so you don't run out.

MAJOR TOM

To recover lost stamina, you can hunt for local flora and fauna.
Radio Miniscreen: Video of the Survival Viewer.

MAJOR TOM

You can use either your tranquilizer gun or your knife to hunt.

SNAKE

My only weapon is a Mk22 Hush Puppy tranquilizer gun?

MAJOR TOM

That's right. It's been fitted with its own suppressor.

MAJOR TOM

However, the suppressor will deteriorate every time you fire. Once its durability reaches zero, the noise suppression effect will be gone. So don't get too trigger happy with it. The suppressor's durability is shown in the icon.

MAJOR TOM

Any weapons and equipment beyond what you're carrying now, you'll have to find as you go.

SNAKE

I have to find my own weapons and equipment? Whose crazy idea was this, anyway?

MAJOR TOM

Solo covert actions are standard FOX operating procedure.

MAJOR TOM

You can't leave any traces of your presence. No weapons, equipment, footprints, sweat, or bodily wastes - the same goes for bullets and cartridges, too.

MAJOR TOM

Your presence in enemy territory is already a violation of international conventions of warfare. There aren't supposed to be any American soldiers in Russia. It could spark an international incident.

MAJOR TOM

You can't let anyone see you. You can't let the enemy know you're there. This is a stealth mission.

MAJOR TOM

You're a ghost, Snake, in every sense of the word.

MAJOR TOM

There'll be no rescue if you're captured. The military and the U.S. government will deny any involvement in the affair.

SNAKE

Then I'll just have to take care of myself, huh.

MAJOR TOM

I'm afraid so. You've been given a "fake death" pill for that purpose.

MAJOR TOM

SIS6 guidelines stipulate that soldiers on covert ops like this one, be issued a potassium cyanide capsule. Tape it to your body, so you can take it when you need to.

SNAKE

How generous of you.
Radio Miniscreen: Fake death screen.

MAJOR TOM

Use it if you're taken prisoner by the enemy. It'll send you into a state of false death for a short time.

SNAKE

... fooling them into thinking I'm really dead. So how do I come back to life?

MAJOR TOM

Just take the revival pill.

SNAKE

You mean that thing they put in my tooth before the mission?

MAJOR TOM

That's the one. But be careful. If you remain in a state of false death for too long, nothing will be able to bring you back. Remember that.

SNAKE

I'll keep it in mind. You said this was a solo mission, right?

MAJOR TOM

Right.

SNAKE

I guess that means I can't count on any reinforcements.

MAJOR TOM

Correct. The mission rests entirely in your hands.

SNAKE

A real one-man army.

MAJOR TOM

Relax, there's a support team ready to back you up over the radio.

SNAKE

Who?

MAJOR TOM

I'll introduce them to you. This time, survival is of utmost importance. The first member of the support team will be in charge of monitoring your physical condition - acting as a medic, so to speak - as well as recording your mission data. She's a member of FOX as well, and she's here on the gunship with me.

SNAKE

"She"?
Para-Medic appears in the radio window.

PARA-MEDIC

Hello, Snake. I'm Para-Medic. Nice to meet you.

SNAKE

Para...Medic?

PARA-MEDIC

As in a medic who comes in by parachute.

SNAKE

Aren't you going to tell me your real name?

PARA-MEDIC

Are you going to tell me yours, Mr. Snake?
Since it's radio, they can only hear each other's voices.

SNAKE

My name, huh... it's John Doe7.

PARA-MEDIC

And they call you Jack for short? (Surely that can't be the reason.)

PARA-MEDIC

You're a regular Captain Nemo8.

SNAKE

A name means nothing on the battlefield. After a week, no one has a name.

SNAKE

What's your name?

PARA-MEDIC

Jane Doe7.

SNAKE

Very funny.

PARA-MEDIC

I wasn't joking, but I'll tell you my name only if you manage to make it back alive.

PARA-MEDIC

My frequency is 145.73.

MAJOR TOM

She's also in charge of recording (saving) your mission data. Whenever you want to SAVE, SEND a message over the reserved SAVE frequency, 140.96.

SNAKE

So saving lets me record my mission data?

PARA-MEDIC

That's right. It also records the state of your health.

SNAKE

Good to know.

MAJOR TOM

There's one more person I want to introduce you to, Snake.

SNAKE

?

MAJOR TOM

Speaking of snakes, you remember The Boss, don't you?

MAJOR TOM

A legendary soldier, and your mentor.

MAJOR TOM

Actually, it was The Boss that got the DCI's authorization in the first place (for you to be dispatched with FOX).

MAJOR TOM

She's going to be serving as FOX's mission advisor.

SNAKE

The Boss is?

MAJOR TOM

She also helped me plan this mission. She and I were at SAS9 together.
The Boss appears in the radio window, and the frequency changes.

THE BOSS

Jack, is that you? How many years has it been?

SNAKE

Boss??

THE BOSS

That's right, it's me.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

Talk to me. Let me hear your voice.

SNAKE

It's been 5 years, 72 days, and 18 hours. (The fact that he's been counting the time shows how innocent Snake is at this point in his life.)

THE BOSS

You've lost weight.

SNAKE

You can tell just by the sound of my voice?

THE BOSS

Of course I can. I know all about you.

SNAKE

Really. Well, I don't know anything about you.

THE BOSS

What's that supposed to mean?

SNAKE

... Why'd you disappear on me all of a sudden? *like a child throwing a tantrum*

THE BOSS

I was on a top-secret mission.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

You didn't need me anymore.

SNAKE

But there were still so many things I wanted you to teach me.

THE BOSS

No, I taught you everything you needed to know about fighting techniques.

THE BOSS

I taught you all I could. (We spent 10 years together.)

THE BOSS

The rest you needed to learn on your own.

SNAKE

Techniques, sure. But what about how to think like a soldier?

THE BOSS

How to think like a soldier? I can't teach you that.

THE BOSS

A soldier needs to be strong in spirit, body, and technique - and the only thing you can learn from someone else is technique.

THE BOSS

In fact, technique doesn't even matter.

THE BOSS

What's most important is spirit.

THE BOSS

Spirit and body are like two sides of a single coin. They're the same thing.

THE BOSS

I can't teach you how to think.

THE BOSS

You'll just have to figure it out for yourself.

THE BOSS

Listen to me, Jack. Just because soldiers are on the same side (are allies) right now, doesn't mean they always will be.

THE BOSS

Having personal feelings about your comrades is one of the worst sins you can commit.

THE BOSS

Politics determine who you face on the battlefield.

THE BOSS

And politics are a living thing. They change along with the times.

THE BOSS

Yesterday's good might be tomorrow's evil.

SNAKE

Is that why you abandoned me?

THE BOSS

No. It had nothing to do with you. I already told you, Jack. I was on a top-secret mission.

THE BOSS

A soldier has to follow whatever (outrageous) orders he's given. It's not his place to question why. But you're looking for a reason to fight. You're a natural born fighter, but you're not quite a soldier.

THE BOSS

A soldier is a political tool, nothing more. That's doubly true if he's a career soldier. Right and wrong have no place in his mission.

THE BOSS

He has no enemies and no friends. Only the mission.

THE BOSS

You follow the orders you're given. That's what being a soldier is.

SNAKE

I do whatever I have to do to get the job done. I don't think about politics.

THE BOSS

That's not the same thing. Sooner or later, your conscience is going to bother you...

THE BOSS

In the end, you have to choose whether you're going to live as a soldier, or just another man with a gun (a mercenary)...

THE BOSS

There's a saying in the Orient: "Loyalty to the end." Do you know what it means?

SNAKE

Being... patriotic?

THE BOSS

It means devoting yourself to your country.

SNAKE

I follow the President and the top brass. I'm ready to die for them if necessary.

THE BOSS

The President and the top brass won't be there forever. Once their terms are up, others will take their place.

SNAKE

I follow the will of the leader, no matter who's in charge.

THE BOSS

People aren't the ones who dictate the missions.

SNAKE

Then who does?

THE BOSS

The times (the Philosophers). People's values change over time. And so do the leaders of a country. So there's no such thing as an enemy in absolute terms. Those we fight are only enemies in relative terms, constantly changing with the times.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

As long as we have "loyalty to the end," there's no point in believing in anything... even in those we love. (The Sorrow.)

SNAKE

And that's the way a soldier's supposed to think?

THE BOSS

The only thing we can believe in with absolute certainty...

THE BOSS

... is the mission, Jack.

SNAKE

All right. But do me a favor.

THE BOSS

What is it?

SNAKE

Call me Snake. (For this mission, anyway.)

THE BOSS

Snake? Oh, right, your code name is Snake. It suits you well.

MAJOR TOM

That's right. The legendary unit that The Boss put together during World War II was a snake. The Cobra Unit... a group of heroes that brought the war to an end and saved the world. As long as you've got a legendary hero backing you up, you'll be fine. Isn't that right, Snake?

SNAKE

Yeah. I can't think of anyone else I'd rather have with me. Oh, and one more thing, Boss...

THE BOSS

Yes?

SNAKE

It's good to hear your voice again.

THE BOSS

Same here. After all, who knows if either of us will make it out alive... Snake, you were always best at urban warfare and infiltrating buildings. But this is the jungle. Survival is going to be key. Those CQC techniques I taught you are sure to come in handy.

SNAKE

CQC - close quarters combat, huh... I've been in the Green Berets for the past few years. I'm probably pretty rusty.

THE BOSS

Not to worry. I'll be here to help you remember. After all, this is your first actual survival mission. I'll be supporting you over the radio.

SNAKE

Where are you, Boss? Next to the major?

MAJOR TOM

The Boss is communicating with us by radio from aboard a Permit-class submarine in the Arctic Ocean.

THE BOSS

My frequency is 141.80. Call me if you need my advice on battle techniques.

SNAKE

Gotcha.

MAJOR TOM

Your mission is to retrieve Dr. Sokolov.
Radio Miniscreen: Video of the abandoned factory.

MAJOR TOM

Dr. Sokolov is being held in an abandoned factory located to the north of your current position. Avoid heavy combat and don't let anyone see you. Don't forget that this is a stealth mission.
After Recovering Backpack
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (change view button unavailable)
Snake stands up from the crouched position he's been in.

THE BOSS

Snake, try to remember some of the basics of CQC...
Keeping an eye on his surroundings, Snake unsheathes the CQC knife on his chest and draws his tranquilizer gun.
He reveals his CQC stance.

SNAKE

Commencing Virtuous Mission... now.
Having recovered his backpack, Snake makes his way through the jungle. Luck is on his side, as he reaches an area of high ground without any encounters with the enemy.
Enemy Recon
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (change view button partially available)
Sensing a presence from this high ground, Snake takes out his binoculars.
He spots a pair of hooded soldiers in combat uniforms.

SNAKE

Major, I've spotted two enemy soldiers...

MAJOR TOM

They're probably KGB troops sent to guard Sokolov.
Change view notification. First person prompt appears.
Snake follows the enemy soldiers with his binoculars, but the player doesn't see what he sees.
They only see the view through his binoculars if they enter First Person View.
The soldiers are KGB, and they're carrying AKs.

SNAKE

AK-47s and grenades...
Enemy Recon
Radio Call 1

MAJOR TOM

Snake, your presence in Soviet territory is already a violation of international law. We can't let the Kremlin find out that the CIA and the American government are involved. Contact with the enemy is strictly prohibited. Don't engage them in battle, either. This is a stealth mission. Got that?

THE BOSS

The major is right. The point of this mission is to sneak through the jungle without being seen. The success of the mission depends on how well you use your camouflage.
Radio Miniscreen: Video of changing camo patterns.

THE BOSS

Change your camouflage by selecting "CAMOUFLAGE" from the Survival Viewer.

THE BOSS

The "UNIFORM" option lets you pick your uniform, while the "FACE" option lets you change your face paint. Choosing camouflage that blends in with your surroundings will help you conceal yourself more effectively.
Radio Miniscreen: Video contrasting how, even when Snake is the same distance from an enemy, if he runs he'll be spotted, whereas if he crawls he won't.

THE BOSS

Also, don't forget that anything that moves will stand out in the jungle.

THE BOSS

If you just stand up and run around like an idiot, you're bound to be spotted.

THE BOSS

But if you crawl instead, you should be able to sneak by without being noticed.
Radio Miniscreen: Close-up of Camo Index section of the screen.

THE BOSS

You can see how effective your camouflage is by looking at the Camo Index. The Camo Index shows how well your current camouflage blends in with the surrounding area. The higher the value, the harder you are to spot, and vice versa.

THE BOSS

The key is to make yourself one with nature. Keep that in mind as you go along, OK?
Slipping past the soldiers, Snake continues through the jungle, crosses a rope bridge, then arrives in front of the abandoned factory.
Front of Abandoned Factory
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (change view button available)
Now in front of the factory, Snake senses another presence and takes his binoculars out again.

SNAKE

Major, I've reached the abandoned factory where Sokolov is supposedly being held... This place is a dump.
Change view notification. First person prompt appears.
Snake goes over the abandoned factory through his binoculars. The game remains in binoculars mode only while the player has the button pressed.

SNAKE

I can't see Sokolov from here...

SNAKE

The security is pretty tight...

SNAKE

There are sentries posted around the perimeter...

SNAKE

I wonder how many are inside...
Front of Abandoned Factory
Radio Call 1

MAJOR TOM

Your objective - Sokolov - is inside the factory... They should be holding him in a room in the northeast section.

SNAKE

The northeast section. Got it.

MAJOR TOM

Be careful. Your mission is to bring Sokolov back alive. He must not be exposed to any kind of danger. Do not approach Sokolov while in the Alert Phase.
*Explanation of game rules. The reason the door won't open during Alert Phase is because Sokolov is holding it shut out of fear.

SNAKE

Right.

MAJOR TOM

... Oh, and one more thing, Snake.

SNAKE

You mean there's more?

MAJOR TOM

No... it's just... when you get to Sokolov, I want you to tell him something from me.

SNAKE

And that is?

MAJOR TOM

"Sorry for being so late."

SNAKE

Is that all?

MAJOR TOM

Yes.

SNAKE

... Understood. Beginning my approach to the target.
Footnotes
1Cutscenes that utilize artwork by Yoji Shinkawa, character designer for the MGS series.
2Acronym for the Central Intelligence Agency, an organization within the American government whose main function is intelligence gathering required for foreign affairs and national defense policymaking.
3A U-2 photographed the missile base on the 14th. The photos were analyzed and it was determined the base was housing missiles on the 15th. Kennedy was briefed about this intelligence and convened ExComm on the 16th. He then went on television and informed the public about the situation in Cuba and announced the US's hard-line stance on the 22nd.
4Acronym for the Soviet Union's Komitet Gosudarstvennoy Bezopasnosti ("Committee for State Security"). Its main roles were intelligence activities both domestically and internationally, as well as cracking down on dissidents.
5Tselinoyarsk is a fictitious place name created by combining Tselina ("virgin lands," "uncultivated lands"), yar ("precipice"), and sk (a suffix). All locations in MGS3 use fictitious names such as this one. EVA will tell the player the meanings of these names over the radio.
6Acronym for the Secret Intelligence Service, the formal name of MI6 (Military Intelligence, Section 6), the UK's foreign intelligence service. Its primary mission is intelligence gathering overseas.
7In the U.S., placeholder names are used when a body cannot be identified—John Doe for men, Jane Doe for women.
8A character in one of French writer Jules Verne's major works "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea." "Nemo" means "no name" in Latin.
9Acronym for the U.K. military's Special Air Service, one of the most elite counter-terrorism units in the world.
Radio Conversations
•Major
Prior to Recovering Backpack
Get your backpack
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, first you need to find that backpack you lost on the way down.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

Your backpack got caught on a tree to the north. Try heading in that direction.
How to climb trees
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, you said your backpack got caught on a tree branch, right?

SNAKE

Yeah.

MAJOR TOM

Was there ivy growing on the tree?

SNAKE

There was but... (What of it?)

MAJOR TOM

Perfect.

SNAKE

Perfect?

MAJOR TOM

Indeed.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

You can climb any ivy-covered tree by standing in front of the ivy and pressing the Action Button.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

Climb the tree and retrieve your backpack.
In front of backpack tree

MAJOR TOM

Snake, your backpack is stuck on a tree branch, right? Climb the tree and get it back.
-->How to climb trees (2)
If player has climbed backpack tree, but won't pick up backpack
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, did you climb that tree?

SNAKE

Yes.

MAJOR TOM

Good. So the backpack...?

SNAKE

Not yet.

MAJOR TOM

Not yet?

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Don't tell me you went up the tree just to take in the view?

SNAKE

... (The Major hit the nail on the head.)

MAJOR TOM

I must admit, that is not a bad idea. Climbing a tree DOES give you a wider range of view. You can use it for scouting.

MAJOR TOM

But what you need to do now is retrieve your backpack. Understood?

SNAKE

Yeah...
(2)

MAJOR TOM

The backpack is on the branch pointing east on that tree, right?

MAJOR TOM

Walk along the branch and get it. Be careful not to fall.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

You should be able to grab your backpack if you hang from the branch by pressing the Action Button.
Player ignores backpack
*Mandatory incoming call if player, despite being told to recover their backpack, ignores this order and tries to proceed anyway

ZERO

Snake, where do you think you're going!?

ZERO

You can't expect to proceed with the mission without any weapons or equipment.

ZERO

First, you'll need to recover your backpack. It's caught on a tree to the south.

ZERO

Press the Action Button to climb the tree and retrieve your backpack. Is that clear?
•Major
Prior to Appearance of Enemy Soldiers
Head north

MAJOR TOM

Sokolov should be at the abandoned factory to the north, so head in that direction.
Now's the time to get prepared
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, intelligence indicates that that area is outside the enemy's cordon.

MAJOR TOM

So, you shouldn't have any unexpected encounters with enemy patrols.

MAJOR TOM

I think it will be a good idea to take this time to get accustomed to using your camouflage, hunting for food, and navigating the Survival Viewer.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

If you have any questions about camouflage or CQC, ask The Boss.
(3)
*If player hasn't contacted The Boss yet

MAJOR TOM

The Boss' frequency is 141.80.
(4)

MAJOR TOM

Para-Medic is the medical correspondent for this mission. Ask her about hunting for food and medical treatment.

MAJOR TOM

Also, she has documents detailing flora and fauna in the operation locale.

MAJOR TOM

Contact her if you need detailed information on any of the plants and animals in your area.
(5)
*If player hasn't contacted Para-Medic yet

MAJOR TOM

Para-Medic's frequency is 145.73.
You'll be facing the enemy soon

MAJOR TOM

Snake, once you head further north you'll be entering enemy territory.

MAJOR TOM

You'd best get used to using camouflage and hunting for food while you have the convenience.
•Major
Prior to Reaching Abandoned Factory
KGB soldiers

SNAKE

Major, you said the enemy was KGB, right?

ZERO

I did.

SNAKE

What unit are they from? The Sixth Directorate?

ZERO

No, the Ninth Directorate.

SNAKE

The Ninth?

ZERO

Yes.

SNAKE

But I thought that was...

ZERO

Exactly. It's the unit that protects the Kremlin and provides bodyguards for high-level VIPs.

SNAKE

But they're assigned to protect Party and government figures. I thought that only meant high-ranking officials and their families.

SNAKE

And now they're being sent out to stand watch over a field exercise?

ZERO

That's the idea.

SNAKE

What's really going on?

ZERO

I don't know.

SNAKE

...

ZERO

What I do know is that the director of the Ninth Directorate is a well-known protégé of Khrushchev.

ZERO

The premier may have wanted to assign this mission to someone he knew he could trust.

SNAKE

So he can't trust any other units?

ZERO

Ever since the withdrawal from Cuba, Khrushchev's position has been getting weaker day by day.

ZERO

This secret test is an act of desperation by a cornered man.

ZERO

If nothing else, the completion of Sokolov's new weapon in this test should help reestablish Khrushchev's authority in Moscow.

SNAKE

So what you're saying is, there's also a good chance that whoever doesn't want to see that happen is going to try and interfere?

ZERO

Most likely. Khrushchev must have anticipated this and sent his most loyal unit - his trump card - to make sure all goes well.
After entering enemy area

MAJOR TOM

Snake, what's the situation?

SNAKE

No problems so far. Except... something seems odd...

MAJOR TOM

What seems odd?

SNAKE

These men are on routine guard, but they seem strangely alert.

MAJOR TOM

It's a drill for a top-secret new weapon. Of course security is going to be tight.

SNAKE

Yes, but a drill is just a drill. But these guys... it almost seems like it's not...

MAJOR TOM

Not a drill?

SNAKE

Exactly. And this is Soviet territory, but these guys are acting as tensed up as the guys on the frontlines. Like they expect the enemy to attack them any moment.

MAJOR TOM

You think they know about our operation?

SNAKE

No, but... something is strange.

MAJOR TOM

Be on guard.

SNAKE

I will.
Rope bridge tactics - Major

MAJOR TOM

A suspension bridge, is it? If you cross that, you'll be revealed to enemies in every direction. To cross the bridge, you'll have to do something about the enemies in the area first.

MAJOR TOM

You could put them to sleep with a long-range tranquilizer shot... Or you could get in close, lure them to you, and take them out.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Rope bridge tactics (2)
Falling from rope bridge means death

MAJOR TOM

Snake, I'm sure you realize that a fall into that canyon would be instant death.

MAJOR TOM

Of course, the same goes for enemies... (Hint for the player.)
Rope bridge - if player has eliminated all enemies

MAJOR TOM

You've killed all the enemies. Now you can cross the suspension bridge without worrying about being spotted.

MAJOR TOM

Sokolov is in the abandoned factory to the north. Find him right away.
•The Boss
Prior to Reaching Abandoned Factory
Rope bridge tactics - The Boss

THE BOSS

It's going to be tough to cross over that suspension bridge without being seen by the enemy. You'll have to figure out some way to get rid of the sentries first.
Rope bridge tactics (2) - The Boss

THE BOSS

Use a First Person View attack to hit enemies from afar. But be warned: if you don't take them out in one hit, your cover will be blown.

THE BOSS

When attacking from afar, it's crucial that you hit a vital spot dead-on.
Rope bridge tactics (3) - The Boss

THE BOSS

To lure an enemy to you, deliberately make a noise, or throw food at him to get his attention.
Rope bridge tactics (4) - The Boss
(1)

THE BOSS

You said it's a suspension bridge, right?

SNAKE

Yeah.

THE BOSS

Supported by rope?

SNAKE

That's right.
(2)

THE BOSS

If you cut the rope, the suspension bridge should sway quite a bit. You may be able to shake the enemies off the bridge.

THE BOSS

Your weapons aren't the only way to take out enemies. Use your head.
•Major
Prior to Meeting Sokolov
Sokolov is in the northeast
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, Sokolov is imprisoned in the northeast area of the factory.
(2)

SNAKE

Got it. To the northeast.

MAJOR TOM

Yes. And don't engage the enemy.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

The object of this mission is to bring Sokolov back safely, and nothing more.

MAJOR TOM

Contact Sokolov without being spotted by the enemy, and bring him out discreetly.

MAJOR TOM

If you must dispose of an enemy, do it with the tranquilizer gun.
Sokolov is off-limits during Alert Phase

MAJOR TOM

Snake, as I said before, this mission is only to bring Sokolov back safely.

MAJOR TOM

You must not put Sokolov in danger. You're not allowed to contact him during the Alert Phase. Period.
Player tries to open door during Alert Phase
*This call occurs if player tries to open the door to the room Sokolov is in when the game is in Alert or Evasion Phase
(1)

SNAKE

Major, I'm in front of Sokolov's cell but... the door won't open.

MAJOR TOM

Hold on, Snake... What's the current condition?

SNAKE

Condition?

MAJOR TOM

Yeah, what phase is it now?
(2)
*If game is in Alert Phase

SNAKE

Alert...
(3)
*If game is in Evasion Phase

SNAKE

Evasion...
(4)

MAJOR TOM

Exactly. I already said you can't contact Sokolov during battle. Don't you listen to people when they're talking?

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Well, anyway, the reason that door won't open is probably because Sokolov is blocking it himself. He's scared. And no wonder.

MAJOR TOM

In order to break Sokolov out of there, you'll need his cooperation as well. So stop scaring him!
(5)

MAJOR TOM

Contact Sokolov later after you've disengaged the enemy.

MAJOR TOM

Once things have stabilized, try it again. Got it?
Player backtracks from the factory considerably
*If player backtracks after reaching abandoned factory

MAJOR TOM

Snake!

SNAKE

!!

MAJOR TOM

Where are you going?

SNAKE

Uh, I...

MAJOR TOM

Are you abandoning your mission?

SNAKE

Absolutely not.

MAJOR TOM

I didn't think so.

SNAKE

I didn't think you thought so.

MAJOR TOM

Hah hah hah.

SNAKE

Hah hah hah!

MAJOR TOM

*jumps right back to his usual, no-nonsense self* Sokolov is back there in the factory. Head back north.

SNAKE

Roger...
Player tries to proceed past the factory
(1)
*An invisible wall prevents the player from going any further

MAJOR TOM

Snake, where are you going?

SNAKE

Oh, Major. I was actually trying to head this way but... (Not sure what to do since he can't advance.)

MAJOR TOM

You've got quite the frontier spirit, huh?
(2)

MAJOR TOM

You don't need to go that way. Sokolov is in the northeast area of the factory. Hurry back and make contact with Sokolov.
Section 2
Meeting Sokolov – End of Virtuous Mission
Snake eliminates all the soldiers guarding the factory. He arrives at the room where Sokolov is being held.
Meeting Sokolov
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (change view button partially available)
Room in the abandoned factory. Sokolov is inside.
He's in the middle of hurling documents into a fireplace.
Among the papers are photos of the (old model) Shagohod.
Fearing Volgin's forces have arrived, Sokolov is burning everything as fast as he can to prevent them from getting their hands on the Shagohod. Snake enters the room. He speaks in Russian.

SNAKE

*in Russian* You must be Sokolov.

SOKOLOV

Are you one of Volgin's men!? You'll never get it (the Shagohod) from me!
Caption: Sokolov (Brian Cummings)

SNAKE

No. I'm a CIA agent. I've come to escort you back to the other side of the Iron Curtain.

SOKOLOV

You're CIA?

SNAKE

Yeah. I was sent by Major Zero, the man who got you out two years ago.

SOKOLOV

Zero...

SNAKE

I have a message from him.

SOKOLOV

What is it?

SNAKE

He said to tell you "sorry for being so late."
Sokolov smiles.

SOKOLOV

Did he now?

SNAKE

What does it mean?

SOKOLOV

It means he's a man of his word.

SOKOLOV

But we've got no time for this. You have to get me out of here before they arrive!

SNAKE

Who's "they"?

SOKOLOV

Colonel Volgin of GRU1. You in the West know him as Thunderbolt.

SNAKE

Thunderbolt?... Never heard of him.
Meeting Sokolov
Movie Cutscene 1
(Shinkawa Theater)

SOKOLOV

He's a member of the army's extremist faction. A man who seeks to seize control of the motherland.

SOKOLOV

Ever since the Cuban Missile Crisis two years ago, Khrushchev2 has been pursuing a policy of peaceful coexistence with the West.

SOKOLOV

Despite resistance and criticism from hawks in the army and the provincial authorities, Khrushchev has managed to suppress the opposition so far. But the failure of his agricultural policies has put him in a precarious position. And on top of that, the tragedy last November.

SNAKE

*agonized expression, just like any patriot would have* President Kennedy's assassination...

SOKOLOV

Precisely. In a sense, Khrushchev has lost his biggest partner, and his power base is rapidly crumbling away.

SOKOLOV

A certain group is plotting to use this opportunity to seize power by rallying the anti-government forces, overthrowing Khrushchev, and installing Brezhnev and Kosygin in his place. The mastermind behind this plot is Colonel Volgin of the GRU.

SOKOLOV

He has control over another secret weapons research facility much like this one - OKB-812, known as the Granin Design Bureau - and is using it to further his plans.

SOKOLOV

But that is not enough to satisfy him. Now he is plotting to seize the secret weapon I have been developing here and use it as leverage in his bid for power.
Meeting Sokolov
3D Cutscene 2
3D cutscene (change view button partially available)

SOKOLOV

The intelligence says that they are going to make their move during the test.

SNAKE

Then the soldiers outside...

SOKOLOV

Exactly. They wouldn't need that many men just to keep me inside. Their orders were to prevent Colonel Volgin from capturing me. Even if it meant killing me in the process, or so it would seem.

SOKOLOV

Volgin will come. I am sure of it. You must get me out of here before then.

SNAKE

Leave it to me.

SOKOLOV

By the way, your Russian is superb. Where did you learn to speak it?

SNAKE

From my mentor (The Boss).

SOKOLOV

Is that so? America is truly a frightening country.

SNAKE

Having second thoughts?

SOKOLOV

No. I have no love for this place. Let's go.
Snake contacts Major Tom on the radio.
Meeting Sokolov
Radio Call 1

SNAKE

Major, this is Snake.

SNAKE

Sokolov is safe with me. He's doing fine. No injuries.

MAJOR TOM

Good work, Snake. Now hurry up and get Sokolov to the recovery point! We'll rendezvous with you there.

SNAKE

Roger.

MAJOR TOM

What about the sentries?
*If player has killed them

SNAKE

I had to kill them... There was no other way. But no one will know we (the Americans) were involved.
*If player has knocked them out

SNAKE

I put them to sleep... Nice and clean.
*If player wasn't spotted

SNAKE

No one spotted me.
*All-purpose

SNAKE

I managed to get past them.

MAJOR TOM

I see.

SNAKE

What about The Boss?
The Major doesn't answer straight away.

MAJOR TOM

We lost contact with The Boss some time ago.

SNAKE

What happened?

MAJOR TOM

It's probably just a weak signal. Just hurry and get Sokolov out of there.
The Boss doesn't answer if the player tries to call her.
Snake heads outside.
Meeting Sokolov
3D Cutscene 3
3D cutscene (change view button partially available)
Snake goes outside ahead of Sokolov. Something's not right. It's too quiet. He cautiously continues.
There's no sign of the KGB soldiers the player eliminated.
Snake presses on, ever vigilant. Sokolov follows behind.
Then, someone pops up behind Snake or from behind a factory wall.
Without making a sound, six KGB soldiers appear from the left and right and point their guns at Sokolov. They've also caught Snake from behind.

SOLDIER 1

Freeze!
Snake stops in his tracks. He goes to turn around with his gun still aimed.
But then, up ahead he sees a man come walking toward them. The player can get a look at him if they go into First Person View. The sounds of his boot spurs (for horse-riding) against the ground echo across the remains of the factory.

OCELOT

So this is the legendary Boss? We meet at last.
The man has emerged from the forest. He wears a beret pulled down over his face. All we can see of it is the piercing look in his eyes. He has on his full dress uniform, as well as boots with horse-riding spurs, and a red scarf with matching gloves. His chest is decorated with medals. He spins a Makarov as he approaches. The KGB soldiers recoil upon seeing him.

SOLDIER 1

You... you're from the Ocelot Unit of Spetsnaz!
Several of the soldiers point their weapons at the man, but he pays no attention to them as he continues to spin his gun and walk up to them. He's still quite a distance away—far enough to mistake Snake for The Boss.

SOLDIER 1

What's a GRU soldier doing here?
The man stops. He has taken offense to the use of "soldier."

OCELOT

Soldier?
Snake lowers his weapon and watches what is playing out.
The man holsters his gun. The soldiers relax their guard slightly.
The man then raises his beret, giving us our first good look at his face.
The KGB soldiers are shocked to realize who it is!

SOLDIER 1

He's the Ocelot commander!
The man adjusts his beret and strikes what will be his signature pose.

OCELOT

That's Major Ocelot to you. And don't you forget it!
Caption: Ocelot (Josh Keaton)
The KGB soldiers become agitated, but quickly apply some coercive pressure to the man.

SOLDIER 1

Sokolov is ours. Now get out of here.

OCELOT

An ocelot never lets his prey escape.

SOLDIER 1

What!?
The man draws his gun with lightning speed.
The soldiers point their weapons at him. Snake gets down, pulling Sokolov to the ground with him!
Ocelot pulls back the slide, ejecting a cartridge, then takes out five of the soldiers in rapid succession.

SOLDIER 1-5

*screams*
The man is a quick shot. What's more, with every round, he twists his elbow to absorb the recoil. This may come off as theatrics, but it's actually an advanced technique.
The entire squad has been wiped out... except for one soldier left on the roof!
Ocelot ricochets a bullet to eliminate him too.

SOLDIER 6

*screams from being shot*
He has used a Russian weapon to perform a saucy technique seen in Spaghetti Westerns (one-handed shooting).
The soldier falls to the ground.

SOLDIER 6

*screams from falling*
A survivor, half-dead, tries to get away. Ocelot puts a bullet in him without hesitation.

SOLDIER 1

*screams*
Snake can't believe what he's just witnessed!
Ocelot spins his gun before holstering it.
Ocelot has been informed by Volgin about the situation, which is why he thinks Snake is The Boss. Snake hasn't picked up on the meaning behind Ocelot's use of the phrase "the legendary Boss."

OCELOT

I can't say it feels good to kill a comrade, even if it is for the GRU (the army).

SOKOLOV

*raises his voice after seeing all the bodies*

SNAKE

Sokolov, take cover!
Sokolov hides in the factory.
Snake stands up.
Ocelot takes a long, hard look at Snake's face. He finally realizes he's got the wrong person.

OCELOT

... you're not The Boss, are you?
Snake readies his tranquilizer gun in a CQC stance.
Ocelot signals his men (mimics an ocelot's meow).

OCELOT

*mimics an ocelot's meow*
Four members of the Ocelot Unit emerge from the factory, also without a sound. Their movements are clearly on another level when compared to the KGB soldiers.
Ocelot's and his unit's uniforms are different from the KGB's, so for now, Snake waits to see how things play out.
The members of the unit swoop in and point their guns at Snake.

SOKOLOV

GRU operatives...
Ocelot is perplexed by Snake's unusual stance and gun.

OCELOT

What is that stance? That gun? (Why do you have a tranquilizer gun?)

OCELOT

*laughs*
Ocelot laughs as he looks at his men to elicit agreement.
He then looks at Snake, spinning his gun as he ejects the empty magazine.

OCELOT

If you're not The Boss, then die!
Ocelot says the above as he inserts a fresh magazine and pulls back the slide, but the gun jams!

OCELOT

*grunts*
While Ocelot and his men are distracted by this unexpected occurrence, Snake uses CQC to slam Ocelot to the ground. His Makarov bounces off of it (this occurs in slow motion, as though the scene were shot with a high-speed camera).
Ocelot exhales after hitting the ground.

OCELOT

*groans*
Snake points his tranquilizer gun at Ocelot's head. Ocelot has no idea what's just happened.
Sokolov runs off in terror, charging through the forest for dear life (towards the rope bridge).

SOKOLOV

*screams*

OCELOT UNIT SOLDIER 1

Major!
The Ocelot Unit is flustered—they don't know whether to go after Sokolov or take out Snake.

OCELOT

Leave him. Shoot the other one!
The unit snaps out of it, and they attack Snake. Too close to engage with weapons, they use punches, etc., to avoid friendly fire3.
Snake once again uses his almost superhuman CQC abilities to dodge the four enemies' attacks and knock them all to the ground.

OCELOT UNIT SOLDIER 1-4

*screams*
The soldiers are flat on their backs.
Sokolov escapes, making it to the rope bridge to the south.
Ocelot seizes the opportunity, reaching for his Makarov (still jammed) and coming after Snake once more. However, yet again Snake defuses the attack with another CQC move, knocking the Makarov out of Ocelot's hand.

OCELOT

*groans*
The magazine and the cartridge that was stuck in the chamber are ejected (high-speed camera).
Ocelot hits the ground hard.

OCELOT

*groans*
The magazine and this fateful cartridge land in front of Ocelot's face. Ocelot wears the cartridge around his neck in the main part of the game, fiddling with it as a habit.

OCELOT

Impossible...
Ocelot has never known defeat. He cannot believe this has happened. His self-esteem is shattered.
Snake trains the barrel of his gun on Ocelot. He speaks to him in a no-nonsense manner, like an instructor.

SNAKE

*feels like saying something to this youngster who's tried to copy a trendy technique just from seeing it* You ejected the first bullet by hand, didn't you? I see what you were trying to do. But testing a technique you've only heard about in the middle of battle wasn't very smart. You were asking to have your gun jam on you.

OCELOT

...

SNAKE

Besides, I don't think you're cut out for an automatic in the first place.

OCELOT

?

SNAKE

You tend to twist your elbow to absorb the recoil. That's more of a revolver technique.
Ocelot draws the knife on his hip and challenges Snake one more time.

OCELOT

You filthy American dog!
But Snake easily sends him back to the ground with more CQC.

OCELOT

*groans*
As a result of this overwhelming humiliation, Ocelot develops a sort of attraction to Snake. Also, just before the first Ninja fight in MGS1, he borrows what Snake is about to say to him here.

SNAKE

But that was some fancy shooting... You're pretty good.

OCELOT

Pretty good...
Ocelot shudders, then loses consciousness.
Snake gets back on the radio.
Meeting Sokolov
Radio Call 2

SNAKE

Major, do you read me?

MAJOR TOM

I read you. Snake, are you all right?

SNAKE

I've run into a few snags.

SNAKE

These guys were after Sokolov, too. Apparently they were taking orders from a GRU colonel named Volgin.

MAJOR TOM

A GRU colonel?

SNAKE

Part of an internal Soviet power struggle, according to Sokolov.

SNAKE

Something between the KGB and GRU, between Khrushchev's supporters and Volgin's...

MAJOR TOM

Sokolov was being guarded by the KGB and hunted by GRU? Snake, it sounds like this could be even hotter than Cuba.

SNAKE

I don't like it. Something about the whole thing stinks.

MAJOR TOM

I agree. You'd better hurry.

SNAKE

Sokolov ran off by himself, but I'll catch up to him.

MAJOR TOM

We're counting on you.
Snake goes after Sokolov, who got a head start when he escaped the factory.
Snake retraces his steps, catching up with Sokolov at the rope bridge over the canyon.
Rope Bridge
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (change view button partially available)
Snake arrives at the bridge. Sokolov has his eyes fixed on the test site.

SNAKE

You OK?

SOKOLOV

Those men were from the Ocelot Unit.

SNAKE

Spetsnaz?

SOKOLOV

Yes. The best GRU has to offer. They're coming for me. I'm finished!

SNAKE

Calm down. I'll get you out of here, I promise. And we've got some of the best backup (The Boss) we could ask for.
Their conversation is interrupted by the sound of a large cannon. It comes from their side of the bridge, from the direction of the Sokolov Design Bureau.

SOKOLOV

Look!
Snake aims his binoculars at the direction Sokolov is pointing.
Change view notification. First person prompt appears.
If the player presses the First Person View Button, the view changes to that of the binoculars.
We see the Shagohod. Its front arms are dug into the ground, allowing it to sit upright. Its cannon is pointed straight up. Smoke rises from it into the sky. (This is the old Shagohod, and it's shown in silhouette.)

SNAKE

That's what they were making you build?

SOKOLOV

Yes. The Shagohod- "The Treading Behemoth" - a tank capable of launching nuclear IRBMs.

SNAKE

It can launch nuclear missiles from that kind of terrain?

SOKOLOV

Oh yes. And without support from friendly units.

SNAKE

A nuclear-equipped tank capable of operating solo...

SNAKE

Is that thing finished?

SOKOLOV

No, this is only the end of Phase 1. It won't be truly finished until we complete Phase 2.
Snake puts away his binoculars and looks at Sokolov.

SNAKE

Phase 2?

SOKOLOV

The weapon's true form. If it is completed and the Colonel gets his hands on it, it will mean the end of the Cold War.

SNAKE

The end of the Cold War?

SOKOLOV

And then the age of fear will truly begin...

SNAKE

A world war?

SOKOLOV

*making excuses* I had no choice but to cooperate! I didn't want to die. I wanted to see my wife and child again in America...

SOKOLOV

Please, take me to America, quickly. They cannot complete it without my help!

SNAKE

Got it. Let's go!
The two of them start to make their way across the bridge.
Rope Bridge
3D Cutscene 2
They can only cross single file, so Snake walks onto it first. Sokolov follows.
But then, a figure approaches from the other side. Snake stops.
The figure proceeds slowly. The bridge is unaffected by their presence, almost like the figure is weightless. They're carrying a large case in each hand (Davy Crocketts4).
The figure continues to approach, then stops. We recognize the face.
Caption: The Boss (Lori Alan)

SNAKE

Boss?
The Boss drops the cases, causing the bridge to sway violently.
This knocks Sokolov, still behind Snake, to the ground.

SOKOLOV

! (Vocalization blurted out after losing his balance.)
The cases bear a United States insignia, as well as lettering indicating they contain a nuclear warhead. They also have the official name of the Davy Crockett and its range—Atomic Battle Group Delivery System M29 "Heavy" Launcher: 2.5 mi (approxmately 4 kilometers).

THE BOSS

Good work, Jack.

SNAKE

What are you doing here?
The Boss answers Snake in a cold voice, as if she were talking to a complete stranger.

THE BOSS

Sokolov comes with me.
Suddenly, the sky turns dark, like when the sun goes behind a cloud. This is followed by the sound of hornets.
Snake looks up at the sky. A dark cloud has indeed formed, now blocking out the sun entirely.
Snake immediately gets into a CQC stance. A swarm of hornets has appeared, and he can no longer see The Boss. In fact, he can barely see at all. The hornets whizz back and forth in front of him.

SNAKE

Hornets!?
The nature of the "cloud" has become clear.

SOKOLOV

*screams*
From behind Snake comes the sound of Sokolov screaming. Snake turns around. Out of the darkness, The Fear swiftly drops down (like a spider), grabs Sokolov, and shoots back up.
At the same time, the sound of the hornets crossfades into the sound of a helicopter's rotors. The cloud dissipates, revealing a Soviet transport helicopter (a Hind) hovering behind the bridge. The cloud then gathers around the body (both arms) of The Pain, who hangs out of the chopper's cargo area.
Other members of the old Cobra Unit are also on-board the chopper—The End, The Fear, and The Fury.
The Fear has set down Sokolov behind them.
The End is asleep. The Fury is shown in silhouette only.
Editor's Note: These two shots were cut from the release version.
These survivors of the Cobra Unit have come to pick up The Boss.
From atop the rope bridge, The Boss looks up at her old comrades and greets them with a slight nod.

THE BOSS

My friends, let us fight together again!
The Cobras rejoice upon hearing these words.

THE FEAR

I have waited long for this day.

THE PAIN

We will fight with you once more.
The End's eyes pop open, to the point where they look like they're about to literally pop out their sockets.
Perched on his shoulder is the same parrot that belongs to Emma in MGS2.
The End doesn't move. He simply mutters (without looking at The Boss).

THE END

Welcome back, Boss.
The Boss is stern-faced.

THE BOSS

Now that all five of us (including me) are together, it's time we go to the depths of hell itself...
Suddenly, it starts to rain blood.
A figure emerges behind The Boss. It is a man (The Sorrow) in a hoodie.

THE BOSS

It's raining blood... Is he crying?
The Sorrow floats across the bridge, stopping next to The Boss to be by her side. We don't see his face. Just two red, glowing eyes.
He whispers something into The Boss' ear ("I'm here"), but she can't hear it. The Sorrow died in battle here in Tselinoyarsk, and is now a spirit cursed to wander it.
The Boss is taken aback. She looks around, but no one is there.
The Sorrow disappears, becoming a long trail of smoke that rises up to the chopper (he's a haunting spirit).
A drop of The Sorrow's bloody tears has landed on The Boss' shoulder. They fought here together two years ago.
From behind, a man in a coat (Colonel Volgin) approaches The Boss on the bridge. His coat is Soviet military (the GRU). Sparks flicker from the edges of his coat, giving us a look at his face. The rain has already turned to drizzle. Volgin hates the rain. To help avoid being struck by lightning, he mutters the word "kuwabara5."

VOLGIN

Kuwabara, Kuwabara... (Intonation.)
The rain stops. Volgin speaks to The Boss.

VOLGIN

Ah, what a joyful scene.
The Boss doesn't turn around.

THE BOSS

Colonel Volgin...

VOLGIN

Welcome to my country... and to my unit.
Caption: Colonel Volgin (Neil Ross)
The Boss approaches Snake.

SNAKE

Boss? What is this?

THE BOSS

I'm defecting to the Soviet Union. Sokolov is a little gift for my new hosts.
The helicopter circles above. Volgin picks up both cases and carries them under his arms.

VOLGIN

Recoilless nuclear warheads... These will make a fine gift for me...
Volgin can speak English.

SNAKE

This can't be happening!
Volgin looks at Snake.

VOLGIN

Who is he? Another one of your disciples? Are we taking him with us?

THE BOSS

No, this one is still just a child. Too pure for us Cobras.

THE BOSS

He has not yet found an emotion to carry into battle. (The Cobras' code names are the emotions they each take into battle.)

SNAKE

What are you talking about!?
Snake points his gun at The Boss.

THE BOSS

Think you can pull the trigger?
Snake gets a tighter grip on his gun, but the barrel won't stop shaking.
The Boss closes in on Snake in the blink of an eye, then slams him to the bridge with CQC.

SNAKE

*groans from being slammed*
She field strips his tranquilizer gun (high-speed camera). Snake gets back up and comes back at The Boss with his knife, but she again neutralizes him with CQC.

SNAKE

*groans from being knocked down*
The sequence of cuts here shows just how incredible CQC is. Snake used it to defuse Ocelot, but even he is like a child before The Boss.
She then breaks Snake's arm.

SNAKE

*screams*
The Boss remains cool and unaffected.
Things on the bridge settle down a little.

VOLGIN

He's seen my face. We can't let him live. If Khrushchev (the KGB) finds out about this, we're finished. He must die.
Volgin takes his hands out of his pockets. He's wearing a pair of crimson gloves. Electricity arcs from his hands. He removes rifle cartridges from his belt (sticking them between his fingers) and gets into a fighting stance, both arms cocked (his Bullet Punch stance). The bullets don't fire yet. The arcs from his fingertips illuminate his tongue, which sticks out of his mouth.
The Boss stops Volgin.

THE BOSS

Wait. He's my apprentice (son). I'll take care of him.
She faces Snake.

THE BOSS

Jack, you can't come with us.
The Boss offers him her hand. Snake is momentarily confused.
After this hesitation, Snake takes her hand, clinging to it as though seeking help. This is met, however, with another CQC blow!
The Boss flings Snake from the rope bridge like a ragdoll.
The Cobras look on from the helicopter. Behind them is The Sorrow.
Editor's Note: This shot was cut. In the release version, only The Pain looks on.

THE PAIN

The new blood has been rejected...
Volgin glances at Snake being carried away by the river.

VOLGIN

Are we done here?

THE BOSS

Now, on to Sokolov's research facility.

VOLGIN

Shagohod is ours!
The Boss watches Snake get swallowed by the muddy waters. She mutters under her breath.

THE BOSS

Drift away. My place is with them now.
Overhead, the chopper descends (high-speed camera).
Rope Bridge
3D Cutscene 3
Snake washes up on the bank of the river. The water is dirty.
Snake is lying face-down.
We hear the non-stop sound of a radio call.
Snake is only semi-conscious.
Washed Ashore
3D Cutscene 1
Snake starts to regain full consciousness.
It's been about 2 hours since he was thrown into the river. It's started to get dark.
His broken arm is bent at an odd angle.
The radio call sound continues.
Washed Ashore
Radio Call 1

MAJOR TOM

Snake! Can you hear me?

SNAKE

Yeah, just barely...

MAJOR TOM

Snake, listen to me! You need emergency medical treatment. Can you move?
Snake tries to move, but the pain is intense.

SNAKE

*screams*

MAJOR TOM

You've got to get those wounds treated. Hang in there!

MAJOR TOM

All right, let's get you fixed up... Para-Medic?
Washed Ashore
Survival Viewer Sequence 1

PARA-MEDIC

OK, Snake. Just relax and it'll all be over before you know it.
Snake is barely breathing. He doesn't even have the energy to spring a joke.

SNAKE

... (Faint breathing.)

PARA-MEDIC

Stay with me! I've seen people in worse shape before. Think you can handle it?

SNAKE

Major? The Boss... she's defected.

MAJOR TOM

We'll talk about that later. First we've got to get you patched up.

PARA-MEDIC

OK, here we go!
Snake has to perform first-aid on himself.
Video of opening Survival Viewer-->selecting Cure.

PARA-MEDIC

First, open the Survival Viewer with the Menu Button.

PARA-MEDIC

If you select "CURE" you can start the treatment.
Close-up video of Left and Right Step Button functions in the Cure menu.

PARA-MEDIC

Healing is divided into treatment using medicine with the Item Window Button, and surgical treatment using the Weapon Window Button.
Video of selecting wounds with the cursor.

PARA-MEDIC

Your injuries include a fractured left elbow and rib bone, and lacerations on your upper arms, right elbow, and abdomen.

PARA-MEDIC

They need to be fixed using surgical treatment.
Video of selecting a cut and using Disinfectant.

PARA-MEDIC

Move the healing cursor with the left analog stick to the affected part of your body.

PARA-MEDIC

Once you've selected the affected area, hold the Weapon Window Button and use the left analog stick to select the medical item and then press the Enter Button.

PARA-MEDIC

With this method, you can use items to help your recovery process.
Video of selecting a broken bone and using a Splint and a Bandage.

PARA-MEDIC

To treat a bone fracture, first secure the affected area with a fastener and then wrap it in bandages. That should do it.
Video of selecting a cut and using Disinfectant, a Suture Kit, Styptic, and a Bandage.

PARA-MEDIC

For lacerations, you'll need disinfectant to clean the wound, sutures to stitch it up, styptic to slow the flow of blood, and bandages to wrap the wound.
Video of performing and completing treatment.

PARA-MEDIC

If you do everything I mentioned, the wound should heal completely.

PARA-MEDIC

Understood?

SNAKE

Yeah...(Starting to space out.)

PARA-MEDIC

Stay with me! Go into the Survival Viewer and treat those wounds!
When the player has finished treating themselves, another call comes in.

PARA-MEDIC

Good job, Snake!

MAJOR TOM

We're coming to get you now. Just stay where you are... We'll drop a recovery balloon. Can you set it up?
Washed Ashore
3D Cutscene 2
Snake lies face-up at the edge of the river. His body is covered in bandages.
As his consciousness fades, he looks up to the sky. Against the setting sun, he sees the massive frame of the Shagohod being airlifted by five Hind helicopters. The Boss and the Cobras are aboard one of them.
The Boss is windblown.
As the chopper passes over the river, she takes off her bandana and throws it. The bandana dances gracefully in the wind, like a snake flying through the air.
Editor's Note: This sequence is not in the release version. In that version, Snake grabs the bandana off The Boss' head when he is thrown from the bridge.

SNAKE

Shagohod...
Snake holds his hand up high, as if desperately reaching out for The Boss.
The Boss' bandana comes flying down on the wind. Snake grabs it.
Washed Ashore
3D Cutscene 3
In the cargo area of another of the Hinds are Volgin, Ocelot, and his Ocelot Unit. Ocelot is not himself. He stares at the Makarov that jammed and the cartridge that caused it. EVA is also on-board, dressed in her secretary attire (close-up of her glasses and bangs). Directly ahead (below) is the massive frame of the Shagohod, airlifted by two large transport helicopters. The Boss and the Cobra Unit are on one of them. On the other are scientists abducted from the Sokolov Design Bureau.

VOLGIN

Excellent. A great success.
Volgin nods to himself as he opens one of the Davy Crockett cases.

VOLGIN

Thanks to The Boss and her Cobras, I have both Sokolov and the Shagohod.
He's infatuated with the Davy Crocketts.
Meanwhile, Ocelot starts sniffing.

OCELOT

*sniffs*
He's reacting to EVA's perfume (foreshadowing).
Ocelot looks at her, sitting in the rear seat. She averts her gaze.

OCELOT

What are we going to do with the girl?
Volgin glances at her.

VOLGIN

Who is she?

OCELOT

Apparently she's Sokolov's woman (lover).
Volgin reacts to her.
He brings his face close to EVA's, lifts her chin, and evaluates her.
Her lips are blood red. (Foreshadowing the lipstick pistol.)

VOLGIN

She's a nice catch. I'll take her.
Sensing danger, EVA searches her pocket.
But Volgin realizes what she's doing and grabs her arm.

VOLGIN

Not so fast, my dear.
EVA looks away from Volgin. He slowly pulls her arm out of her pocket and brings her hand up to his face. She's holding a tube of lipstick (a lipstick pistol, a.k.a. the Kiss of Death).
Volgin takes the lipstick from her. He opens it, then notices the gun barrel.

VOLGIN

A Kiss of Death?
Ocelot reacts to those words.

OCELOT

...Are you KGB?
EVA is looking away.

VOLGIN

We may be able to use her.
Volgin sneers. He returns the lipstick to EVA.

VOLGIN

She has spunk.
He lets her go. EVA sinks into her seat. Ocelot address Volgin.

OCELOT

Shall we take her back to the base?

VOLGIN

Perhaps we should.
Volgin returns his full attention to the Davy Crockett.
He puts it together.

VOLGIN

We have no further use for Sokolov's research facility. I think it's time I gave this marvelous new toy a try.
Volgin shoulders the Davy Crockett and aims it at the Sokolov Design Bureau below.

OCELOT

Colonel! Even if they are our enemies, they're still our countrymen!

VOLGIN

But it won't be me that pulled the trigger. It will be our friend the American defector.

OCELOT

You're going to nuke your fellow Russians!?

VOLGIN

"Remember the Alamo."

OCELOT

Colonel!!!
Volgin fires. Ocelot is shocked at this act of insanity.
Washed Ashore
3D Cutscene 4
Snake is near death on the riverbank.
A package containing his recovery balloon drops down.
If the player switches to First Person View, they can see the remains of The Sorrow, buried in the dirt.
