At the Sokolov Design Bureau, the nuclear warhead detonates. A mushroom cloud appears behind the five Hinds and the Shagohod.
Snake lifts his head. He sees the giant mushroom cloud beyond the river.
The game's title appears on top of this.
Footnotes
1Acronym for the Soviet Union's Glavnoye Razvedyvatelnoye Upravlenie ("Main Intelligence Directorate"). A secretive state apparatus set up within the military, its subordinate organizations involved the use of Spetsnaz special forces.
2First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, he succeeded Stalin and Malenkov. Removed from power in 1964.
3Accidentally firing upon or bombing a friendly combatant.
4See the Sigint Radio Conversation: "The Davy Crockett" for details (p. 908).
5The legend of Sugawara no Michizane, 9th century Japanese aristocrat: After being exiled to Kyushu and dying there in agony, Michizane returned as a god of lightning and attacked Kyoto to exact his revenge, though the land he had owned—Kuwabara ("mulberry field")—was spared. "Kuwabara" thus became an incantation to ward off lightning, similar to the English phrase "rain rain go away."
Radio Conversations
•Major
Reached Rope Bridge
Return to the rope bridge
(1)

ZERO

Snake, stay alert. The KGB and GRU both have their sights set on Sokolov.

ZERO

GRU is a military espionage outfit, the intelligence wing of the Soviet Defense Ministry's General Staff Office. It competes with the KGB, which is under the Ministry of Internal Affairs, and the two are always watching each other.

SNAKE

Never let the left hand know what the right hand is doing.

ZERO

Exactly. Now, added to that rivalry, there's a vicious power struggle going on between the Khrushchev faction and the anti-Khrushchev faction.

SNAKE

So Khrushchev is using the KGB, and Volgin and the anti-Khrushchev forces are using the GRU?

ZERO

That's the idea. The two factions are fighting over Sokolov. We're in an extremely dangerous situation here.

SNAKE

Yeah. I'm aware of that.
(2)

ZERO

Get Sokolov out of there safely. He must not be turned over to the KGB or to the GRU.

ZERO

Sokolov took off in the direction of the rope bridge. Get after him. Hurry!
Lost contact with The Boss
(1)

SNAKE

Major, have you been able to contact The Boss?

ZERO

No.
(2)
*If player tried calling her but received no response

ZERO

What about you?

SNAKE

No good.
(3)

SNAKE

You really think it's bad reception?

ZERO

We're looking into it.

SNAKE

Major...

ZERO

Snake, you've got more important things to worry about than contacting The Boss.

ZERO

Right now, Sokolov is out there wandering around the jungle alone. What are you going to do if he gets caught by the enemy?

SNAKE

...
(4)

ZERO

We're still looking into why we lost contact with The Boss. I'll let you know as soon as we find anything out.

ZERO

In the meantime, it's your job to find Sokolov and get him to safety. Got it?
Granin Design Bureau

SNAKE

Major, what's this Granin Design Bureau Sokolov was talking about?

ZERO

OKB-812. It's the same type of top-secret facility as Sokolov's own OKB-754.

ZERO

The director is a man by the name of Aleksandr Leonovitch Granin. He's Sokolov's archrival, and the two have competed fiercely against each other since the days of the war.

ZERO

To hear Sokolov tell it, though, the rivalry was really all in Granin's head.

ZERO

In any case, Granin seems to harbor an unusually intense hatred for Sokolov.

ZERO

Knowing that Sokolov was protected under the aegis of Khrushchev, Granin threw in his lot with Volgin, the vanguard of the anti-Khrushchev movement.

ZERO

Apparently, Granin meant to use the funds provided by these opposition forces in order to defeat his old foe.

ZERO

Volgin, for his part, was intrigued by the possibility of using the high-tech weapons Granin created in the fight against Khrushchev.

ZERO

Thus, the two formed an alliance, and Volgin took the Granin Design Bureau under his control.

SNAKE

But now Volgin's got his sights set on Sokolov?

ZERO

Yes. It would seem he and Granin aren't getting along so well after all.
Who is Thunderbolt?

SNAKE

Major, do you know anything about this GRU colonel Sokolov was talking about?

ZERO

Yes.

SNAKE

Who is he?

ZERO

A most dangerous man indeed.

ZERO

His name is Yevgeny Borisovitch Volgin. His code name in the West is "Thunderbolt."

ZERO

He's gained a reputation as the most brutal and cold-blooded of the Soviet spymasters.

ZERO

During the war, Volgin was assigned to the domestic branch of the NKVD. He was stationed in the rear of the Soviet line to catch and punish any troops who tried to retreat or desert.

ZERO

He's also notorious for his "accomplishments" in anti-guerilla operations in the Ukraine and the Baltic states. Apparently, he likes to boast that he "disposed of" over 100,000 anti-communists.

ZERO

We also know that he was instrumental in putting down the 1953 insurrection in East Germany and the 1956 uprising in Hungary.

ZERO

He is truly a fearsome man. There's no telling what he might be plotting. Be careful.

SNAKE

I will.
Snake's lesson for Ocelot
*If player calls the Major

ZERO

By the way, Snake, what were you doing back there?

SNAKE

Back where?

ZERO

You were giving some kind of advice to a GRU commander, weren't you?

SNAKE

Yeah...

ZERO

He's your enemy. What the hell were you think...

PARA-MEDIC

*cuts in* Really! What was all that about doing the thing with your hand on the first round or whatever?

SNAKE

Mmm...
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Snake's lesson for Ocelot (2)
•Para-Medic
Reached Rope Bridge
Snake's lesson for Ocelot
(1)
*If player calls Para-Medic

PARA-MEDIC

By the way, Snake.

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

What was that little lecture back there?

SNAKE

Lecture?

PARA-MEDIC

You were instructing the GRU commander, weren't you? Something about the first round, or his hand.

SNAKE

Yeah...

SNAKE

What was that supposed to mean?

SNAKE

Mmm...
(2)

SNAKE

Whenever he put a new clip in his gun he'd always load the first round by hand, whether there was a round left in the chamber or not.
(3)

SNAKE

It's a technique they teach in the Middle East. By making sure there's always a round in the chamber, you eliminate the risk of pulling the trigger with nothing to fire.

SNAKE

He must have heard about it from someone, or read it somewhere... In any case, he probably wanted to try it out for himself.

SNAKE

And he was obviously motivated by vanity to show off his new technique. That's when you make mistakes.

SNAKE

The battlefield is an unforgiving place. The only techniques you can rely on are the ones you've mastered through experience and practice.

PARA-MEDIC

Uh huh. And what were you saying about him being more suited to revolvers?
(4)

SNAKE

When he fired, he was bending his elbow sharply to avoid the recoil.
(5)

SNAKE

It looked like he wasn't aware he was doing it, but that habit can be either a fatal flaw or a gift.

PARA-MEDIC

What do you mean?

SNAKE

Automatic weapons use recoil to operate, so if you don't let the recoil hit you, it interferes with the operating cycle of the gun.

SNAKE

Basically, he shouldn't be trying to avoid the impact like that.

SNAKE

But with a revolver, there's no need to let the recoil hit you.

SNAKE

Just the opposite - avoiding the recoil lets you reduce the strain on your hand and arm.

SNAKE

That kid might just be handy with a high-caliber revolver.

PARA-MEDIC

Handy...?

PARA-MEDIC

Are you listening to yourself?

SNAKE

What do you mean?

PARA-MEDIC

He's the enemy! Why are you giving him advice?

SNAKE

*pondering since he honestly doesn't know why* I...

PARA-MEDIC

Snake?

SNAKE

... I don't know. For some reason, I couldn't help but point it out to him...

PARA-MEDIC

*a little worried since he's said something she can't comprehend* ...Snake, are you all right?

SNAKE

*still pondering* ... Yeah...
•Major
End of Virtuous Mission
Serious injuries Cure event - before treatment

ZERO

Snake, hurry and get those injuries treated!
Serious injuries Cure event - during treatment

ZERO

Snake, you're not done treating your injuries. Go into the Survival Viewer and treat the rest of your injuries!
•Para-Medic
End of Virtuous Mission
Before treatment

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, what are you doing!? Hurry up and treat those wounds!
-->Survival Viewer explanation conversation (p. 72)
During treatment

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you're not done treating yourself. Go back into the Survival Viewer and treat the rest of your wounds!
-->Survival Viewer explanation conversation (p. 72)
Section 3
Start of Operation Snake Eater – Prior to Meeting EVA
Main Story Opening
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button unavailable)
Night. Ultra-high altitude. It's pitch black overhead, and there's a sea of clouds far below. A YF-12A (loaded with a drone) shoots through the sky at the speed of sound. We can't see anything below the Blackbird for the cloud cover. The impression here is almost identical to that of the prologue. This isn't a transport aircraft, so the sense of speed is entirely different.
Caption: One week later. 11:30PM August 30, 1964 Arctic Ocean airspace
*The text appears one letter at a time in a 1960s sort of style.
Radio conversation between pilot and loadmaster.

PILOT

Currently flying over the Arctic Ocean. Altitude 30,000 feet. Approaching Soviet airspace. Arriving at the designated drone launch point.

PILOT

Drone oil pressure and voltage are nominal.

PILOT

Payload (Snake's) oxygen supply is nominal.

PILOT

Power supply to payload antifreeze system shows no problems.

PILOT

No gusts. All systems go for drone detachment.
Major Zero delivers a succinct overview of the mission and the insertion method.

ZERO

Snake, we can't risk a HALO jump this time around. Airspace Security has gotten tighter since we were last here. We can't get as close to the ground as we did during the Virtuous Mission.
The drone is on the back of the Blackbird.

ZERO

So instead we'll be using one of our newest weapons (a drone)... Snake, you're being given an honor on par with Alan Shepard1.

ZERO

This is our last chance. Show your patriotism.

ZERO

If you fail, you'll be back in a hospital bed again, waiting for the firing squad.
The Blackbird does a barrel roll as it gracefully arcs across the sky, then flies upside down.
Major Zero and Snake's conversation during their second briefing plays out here.
Main Story Opening
Movie 1
(Shinkawa Theater)
A conversation in a hospital ICU room.
Snake is connected to tubes (though he can still walk).

ZERO

So, how does it feel to be a patient in one of the most advanced ICUs in the world?

SNAKE

Would you do me a favor and tell the suits about visiting hours? I'll never get better with them assaulting me day and night with their questions.

ZERO

Must be part of the top brass' inquiry.

SNAKE

More like an interrogation. According to them, I'm a traitor and an accomplice to The Boss' defection.

ZERO

They're just looking for a scapegoat.

SNAKE

Does that mean they're after you, too?

ZERO

Let's just say neither one of us is going to be made a national hero out of this.

SNAKE

Does this mean FOX is going to die? (FOXDIE.)

ZERO

No. This fox is still one step ahead of the hounds. (FOX NEVER HOUNDS.)

ZERO

The reason I came to see you today... Jack, it's time for FOX to clear its name.

SNAKE

What are you talking about?

ZERO

The situation has changed. We've still got a chance to come out of this one alive.

SNAKE

Yeah? What kind of chance?

ZERO

Don't get too excited. Here, have a cigar... It's Cuban.
Snake accepts the king-size cigar and takes a long drag.
He exhales as he ponders the situation.

ZERO

This morning, I had a meeting with the CIA.

SNAKE

They decided when they're going to execute us?

ZERO

No. Something even bigger.
Main Story Opening
Movie 2
(Shinkawa Theater)

ZERO

Yesterday, the White House received an unexpected call.

KHRUSHCHEV

President Johnson2?

JOHNSON

Yes, I hear you, Mr. Chairman.

ZERO

It was a hotline call from Khrushchevto President Johnson.

SNAKE

From the head of the Soviet Union?

ZERO

That's right.
Depict the leaders of the US and the Soviet Union, the historical background, events, etc., with illustrations and movies. 60s style. Shows a map illustrating the eastern 4 kilometers (2.5 miles) of Tselinoyarsk.

KHRUSHCHEV

A few days ago, one of our country's main Design Bureaus, OKB-754, was destroyed in a nuclear explosion. At about the same time, our anti-aircraft radar picked up a signature that appeared to come from one of your military aircraft. Does any of this sound familiar to you?

KHRUSHCHEV

In retaliation, I have placed our armed forces on secondary alert. Depending on your response, I may be left with no choice but to order the military to maximum alert and unleash Armageddon.

KHRUSHCHEV

With the help of your predecessor (Kennedy), I was able to survive the Cuban incident.

KHRUSHCHEV

But my power (within the party/over the Brezhnev faction) is not as great as it once was. If I am to survive this crisis, I must have your (the American government's) full cooperation.
Faced with a second Cuban Missile Crisis, the president is frank.

JOHNSON

I should have contacted you myself... Did you know that one of our soldiers defected to your country a week ago?

KHRUSHCHEV

... No.

JOHNSON

So you haven't heard, then.

JOHNSON

The man who arranged the defection was a GRU colonel by the name of Yevgeny Borisovitch Volgin.
Show photo of Colonel Volgin, his bio, etc.

KHRUSHCHEV

Volgin? Of the Brezhnev3 faction (leading the power struggle)?... Go on. Who was this soldier?

JOHNSON

Her name is The Boss. She's a living legend. During World War II, she was the one who led us (the U.S. and Soviet Union) to victory in that war.

JOHNSON

In Russia, you know her as Voyevoda4.
Data, bios, etc., for The Boss and the Cobra Unit.

KHRUSHCHEV

You mean... THE Boss? The mother of your Special Forces?

JOHNSON

Yes, that's the one.

JOHNSON

And she took two miniature nuclear shells along with her.

KHRUSHCHEV

The Boss took two miniature nuclear shells?

JOHNSON

I'm afraid so... I believe they were a gift for her new hosts.

JOHNSON

The "Davy Crockett" Atomic Battle Group Delivery System was completed two years ago. But serious problems were found with the launcher's range and precision. Although they were mass-produced, they've never been deployed in battle.

KHRUSHCHEV

But Sokolov's research facility was completely wiped out. The whole area is polluted!

JOHNSON

I can only offer you my deepest condolences over this terrible tragedy.

KHRUSHCHEV

So... The Boss, with Colonel Volgin's help, stole two experimental nuclear shells and took them with her as a gift when she defected. Then, shortly thereafter, Sokolov's design lab, a top-secret military research facility was destroyed by one of these weapons. Am I right so far?

JOHNSON

Yes, that's correct.

KHRUSHCHEV

And the American government denies any involvement in the affair, is that right as well?

JOHNSON

That's correct. We were not involved in any way.

KHRUSHCHEV

Then what was a U.S. military aircraft doing on our radar screen?

JOHNSON

...

KHRUSHCHEV

It was clearly in violation of our airspace.

KHRUSHCHEV

And yet you say it was not acting under your orders?

JOHNSON

That's correct.

KHRUSHCHEV

You expect me to believe that this was all the work of a single soldier?

JOHNSON

I don't know what else to tell you.

KHRUSHCHEV

The army insists that this is all a ploy on your part.

JOHNSON

I've said it once and I'll say it again. Our government had nothing to do with it.

KHRUSHCHEV

And I would like dearly to believe you. However, I'm afraid my power over the military has weakened since the Cuban incident.

KHRUSHCHEV

I will need some kind of proof that this was not the action of the American government.

KHRUSHCHEV

You have one week (while I'm still in power).

KHRUSHCHEV

You must catch The Boss yourselves and recover the remaining nuclear device.

KHRUSHCHEV

Then, you must find some way to prove your innocence.

JOHNSON

Prove our innocence?

KHRUSHCHEV

Yes. Preferably something... painful... (an assassination)

KHRUSHCHEV

Prove to me that this is not merely another one of your tricks.

JOHNSON

The Boss should be close to Colonel Volgin. How about a little coaction?

KHRUSHCHEV

I would not expect too much if I were you. The political situation here is unstable.

KHRUSHCHEV

And Colonel Volgin is a member of the Brezhnev faction, which seeks to topple my government...

KHRUSHCHEV

One week. You have only one week... and, if it is not too much to ask, do something about Volgin as well...

JOHNSON

What is that supposed to mean?

KHRUSHCHEV

Nothing... It means nothing. Call it a modest gentleman's agreement... to ensure our continued relationship.

JOHNSON

What if we can't "prove our innocence"?

KHRUSHCHEV

Then I will be unable to restrain the military. I will be ousted... and they will seek their revenge.

JOHNSON

A nuclear attack on the United States?

KHRUSHCHEV

I leave the disposal of this situation entirely to your discretion, Mr. President.

JOHNSON

Disposal, huh...

KHRUSHCHEV

If you fail, it will mean the beginning of a new world war.

ZERO

To put it simply, in order to avoid a full-scale nuclear conflict, we have to prove that America was not involved in that explosion.

SNAKE

And eliminating The Boss ourselves will prove America's innocence?

ZERO

The higher-ups have decided that you're the only one capable of pulling this off. You were her last apprentice (son). Screw this one up, and we'll both be six feet under.

ZERO

There's no choice.
Main Story Opening
3D Cutscene 2
3D cutscene (night - change view button unavailable)
Night. We're back to the Blackbird.
The northern lights dance in the background. They're approaching from the North Pole this time.
More of the conversation from the hospital plays over the Blackbird insertion sequence.

SNAKE

Are the Russians going to be helping us?

ZERO

The KGB has promised to lend us one of their communications satellites so that you and I can talk to each other.

SNAKE

That's it?

ZERO

They've also put us in touch with a couple of insiders.

SNAKE

Insiders?

ZERO

There was a defection in September 1960... Do you remember it?

SNAKE

You mean the two NSA code breakers who went over to the Soviet Union?

ZERO

Precisely. Since then, they've apparently been training with the KGB for exactly this kind of situation. Their code names are ADAM and EVA... I've been told that ADAM has infiltrated Volgin's ranks.
The D-21 reconnaissance drone is released. It slowly pulls away from the carrier aircraft.

ZERO

We've also arranged for him to provide you with an escape route.

ZERO

You'll need to rendezvous with him when you get there.
Once it's reached safe distance, the drone's ramjet engine kicks in!
To return to safe positions, the Blackbird and the drone barrel roll as they pull away from each other (the drone is headed for the ground).
A MiG, part of the tight aerial surveillance in place (Snake has already infiltrated once), picks up the drone on its radar.

MIG PILOT

Control, unidentified aircraft detected. Altitude, 30,000 feet.
The MiG attempts to approach the drone.

MIG PILOT

It's fast! Estimated air speed, exceeding Mach 3. Bearing south... I'm about to lose it.
The flying object gets smaller and smaller before the pilot's eyes, and is soon out of sight.
Main Game Opening
3D Cutscene 3
3D cutscene (night - change view button unavailable)
The drone rockets through the air at incredible speed. Like a Tomahawk missile, the drone flies at an ultra-low altitude undetectable by radar, infiltrating Soviet airspace. It has crossed national borders.
The drone fires its reverse thrusters. Simultaneously, the ramjet engine cuts off.
A parachute deploys from the belly of the drone!
Snake rolls out of the drone, pulled by the parachute.
The drone disappears into the jungle, carried onward by inertial energy.
It collides with trees and rocks, flying around in a circle as it comes to a stop, though it doesn't explode.
Snake descends by parachute for one map south (he drifts).
The night forest draws closer. Snake drops into the jungle. He hits the ground and rolls forward.
Radio call. Snake crouches down and touches his fingers to his head (the radio switch). Reminiscent of Snake's nanomachine5 communication pose in MGS1. He's wearing camo fatigues.
Since it's night, he has on black face paint.
Editor's Note: In the release version, Snake doesn't have on face paint, though he does have on The Boss' bandana, which he got from her during the Virtuous Mission.
Main Story Opening
Radio Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call)

SNAKE

This is Snake. Do you read me?

ZERO

Loud and clear. Glad to see you landed safely.

SNAKE

I got blown pretty far off target...

ZERO

Snake, let's go over your mission objectives one more time. Rescue Sokolov. Find out what's happened to the Shagohod - then destroy it. And finally, eliminate The Boss...

SNAKE

Eliminate The Boss...

ZERO

This mission will be code-named "Operation Snake Eater."

SNAKE

Because I'll be taking on The Boss and her Cobra Unit, right?

ZERO

Don't forget about Colonel Volgin.

SNAKE

I'm not a hired killer.

ZERO

I know. But that was the Kremlin's demand.

SNAKE

Demand? You mean it wasn't just a request. What's it to us if the Khrushchev regime is threatened by the Colonel and his faction?

ZERO

If supporting the current regime helps us avoid a nuclear exchange, then that's what we'll do.

SNAKE

And what are the CIA's (our country's) demands?

ZERO

Our priorities are the rescue of Sokolov and the destruction of the Shagohod.

SNAKE

Roger that, Major Tom.

ZERO

Hold on, Snake.

SNAKE

What now?

ZERO

I'm changing my code name. It turns out "Tom" wasn't the most auspicious choice.

SNAKE

What do you mean?

ZERO

Well, the truth is, when I chose my code name... I picked the wrong one.

SNAKE

The wrong one?

ZERO

Did you ever see the movie "The Great Escape"? It came out last year.

SNAKE

Must have missed that one.

ZERO

Anyway, it's based on a true story about prisoners who escaped from a POW camp in Nazi Germany. The prisoners dig three tunnels as part of their plan. But the Nazis find two of the tunnels before they're finished. The prisoners succeed in escaping by using the last remaining tunnel.

ZERO

The names of those three tunnels were Dick, Harry, and Tom.

SNAKE

I get it. You used the name of the tunnel they escaped in as your code name because you thought it would bring you good luck.

ZERO

Yes, that's exactly right. At least, that was the plan...

SNAKE

... But?

ZERO

But I got the name wrong. The one they escaped in was Harry.

ZERO

Tom was one of the unlucky tunnels - it was discovered by the Nazis before it was finished.

ZERO

I watched the movie again, just to make sure.

ZERO

In fact, I even ordered the actual film from the movie company.

SNAKE

Yeah, it doesn't sound like the greatest name to use. So, what should I call you?

ZERO

Hmm. You know, let's just use Zero, like we've been doing all along.

SNAKE

All right, then. Major Zero it is. We'll start over from square one.

ZERO

From square zero. My frequency is 140.85.

ZERO

Oh, I almost forgot... Para-Medic is with us again on this mission.
She and Snake exchange the kind of pleasantries they did when they first met.
Para-Medic reminds Snake he should really still be in the hospital.
After this mission is over, her medical license is revoked, but she will lend a hand to the paramedic movement.

SNAKE

Is this her last chance, too?

ZERO

If we fail, she'll have her medical license revoked. It's more or less the same kind of fate...

ZERO

Her frequency is the same as during the Virtuous Mission, 145.73.

ZERO

She'll be recording your mission data as well, just like last time. That frequency is also the same: 140.96.

ZERO

And there's one more person on your support team. His name is Mr. Sigint. He's an expert on the latest in weapons and equipment technology. You'll be going up against some of the world's most advanced weaponry when you infiltrate the research facility. If you have any questions, just ask him. His frequency is 148.41.

SNAKE

Mr. Sigint. Got it.

ZERO

ADAM, your KGB contact, is waiting for you at the abandoned factory up ahead.

SNAKE

The same factory Sokolov was being held in last week.

ZERO

Yes. Meet up with ADAM first. He's cleared the way for you to rescue Sokolov.

SNAKE

How will I know this ADAM guy when I see him?

ZERO

You'll know once you reach the factory. The whole area's been polluted by the fallout from that nuclear blast. No one else would dare come close. The password is..."Who are the Patriots?" and "La-Li-Lu-Le-Lo."

SNAKE

"La-Li-Lu-Le-Lo." Gotcha.

ZERO

You've been equipped with a .45 for this mission. Be careful... It's noisy.

SNAKE

I thought standard FOX procedure was procure on site weapons acquisition.

ZERO

The circumstances are different this time. You're now on an official mission for the United States government...

ZERO

It will be necessary to make your presence known to a certain extent. To the Khrushchev regime, at the very least.

ZERO

But remember - this is still a sneaking mission. Snake, if you fail this mission, it will mean an all-out nuclear war. Keep that in mind and proceed with extreme caution.

SNAKE

Understood. Commencing Operation Snake Eater.
Having successfully completed his drop into the jungle, Snake makes his way deeper into it. He soon hears a horse neighing. Snake continues in that direction.
The Boss Post-Drop Encounter
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button partially available)
A beautiful white horse (an Andalusian) is standing deeper into the forest. Its mane is colored. Snake approaches it. It's calm. It snorts. The moonlight accentuates its beauty. As Snake admires it, he hears a voice from behind him.

THE BOSS

Looks like death wasn't ready for you yet.
Snake turns around and aims his 1911 Government in a CQC stance.
The Boss stands there unprotected. She wears a cloak on top of a white Sneaking Suit.

SNAKE

Boss?

THE BOSS

That arm still hurt?
Snake is on guard.

SNAKE

What are you doing here? (Her defection is a ruse, so she knows about Operation Snake Eater.)
In one quick motion, The Boss sheds her cloak and closes the gap.
She launches into another impressive display of CQC! More high-speed camera action!
She slams Snake to the ground.

THE BOSS

*yells*

SNAKE

*groans*
The Boss then field strips Snake's 1911.

THE BOSS

Go home!
Snake challenges her again.
But The Boss uses her CQC again! And again! All in high-speed camera!
Snake sinks to the ground.

THE BOSS

*yells*

SNAKE

*groans*

THE BOSS

Go home! GRU and my sons (the Cobras) are waiting up ahead. You don't have a prayer of finishing your mission — you're not even armed.
Snake rises.

SNAKE

Boss!!
But The Boss delivers a finishing CQC blow! Snake lies on the ground, exhausted.

THE BOSS

*yells*

SNAKE

*groans*
The damage Snake sustains here is not reflected in-game.

THE BOSS

I'm not your boss anymore (America is).
The Boss draws her Patriot pistol from her hip.

THE BOSS

There's nothing for you here. Go home. Go back to your boss.

THE BOSS

There's no need to prove that you are virtuous here.

THE BOSS

This isn't America.
She fires her Patriot at the drone (high-speed camera).
The gun barrel is short, meaning the bullets spin like hollow point rounds (shown via high-speed camera). Maybe the sound they make resembles the warning sound a rattlesnake makes? No one hears this sound and lives.
The bullets fire without interruption, punching countless holes in the drone. It explodes, but The Boss continues to pull the trigger. She continues to fire, as though trying to quell some sort of anger within her. The fire from the drone spreads to the forest, quickly turning it into a sea of flames. This sequence serves to demonstrate the power of the Patriot. The Boss continues to fire. The forest (Yakushima6) burns.

THE BOSS

That should stir things up a bit. You'd better hurry.
The Boss holsters the Patriot.
There is a clap of thunder, and a flash of lightning reveals The Sorrow behind The Boss.
If the player doesn't press the First Person View Button, the camera stays on Snake's expression.
First person prompt appears on-screen.
If the player looks in First Person View, they see The Sorrow standing close to The Boss.

THE BOSS

The border is 60 miles (100 kilometers) south of here. You ought to be able to run that far.
The Boss turns and walks away without looking back at Snake.
It starts to rain. Snake is kneeling on the ground.

SNAKE

Why'd you defect?
The Boss approaches her horse and stops.
The rain turns into a downpour, extinguishing the surrounding flames.

THE BOSS

I didn't.

THE BOSS

I'm loyal... to the "end." To my purpose.
The Boss turns back around.

THE BOSS

What about you, Jack?

THE BOSS

What's it going to be? Loyalty to your country, or loyalty to me? Your country, or your old mentor? The mission, or your beliefs? Your duty to your unit? Or your personal feelings?
She puts her cloak back on and continues making her way toward her horse.

THE BOSS

You don't know the truth yet. But sooner or later you'll have to choose. I don't expect you to forgive me. But you can't defeat me, either. You know me too well.
The Boss hops on her horse and walks it right up to Snake.
She turns her nose up at him and points at his bandana.

THE BOSS

Just look at that bandanna. If you can't put the past behind you, you won't survive long.
She pulls on the reins, causing the horse to rear.
One of its hooves comes crashing down on Snake's hand.
Snake yells in pain (this is not reflected in the Survival Viewer).

SNAKE

*groans*

THE BOSS

If we meet again, I'll kill you.

THE BOSS

Now, go home!
The Boss gallops away.
Snake gets up, cradling his hand. He calls Major Zero on the radio.
The Boss Post-Drop Encounter
Radio Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call)

SNAKE

This is Snake. Major Zero?

ZERO

I read you, Snake.

SNAKE

I was ambushed by The Boss.

ZERO

You were what!?

SNAKE

The drone's been shot to hell. It's up in flames.

ZERO

That's not good. Enemy scouts are going to come looking for you.

SNAKE

Yeah, I know. But what was The Boss doing here in the first place? There's got to be a leak somewhere.

ZERO

No, that's impossible. The man The Boss is working with, Volgin, isn't exactly on speaking terms with Khrushchev.

SNAKE

I lost my gun... The Boss destroyed it...

ZERO

Snake, I know how you're feeling. It's hard for me to believe, too - that a legendary hero like The Boss would go over to the Russians, that she'd double-cross us like this... But that's how it is, and if you don't accept it, you'll never be able to beat her.

SNAKE

That's not the problem. In terms of sheer technique, I'll never be able to beat her. I know that all too well.

ZERO

You've got to do it, Snake. She's your enemy and your objective.

SNAKE

Enemy! We were together for 10 years. And now you tell me she's my enemy?

ZERO

Enough. Hurry to the factory where ADAM is waiting. Scouts have probably already been sent out to investigate the explosion. You've lost your weapon, right? That means you've got no chance of winning in a battle situation. Whatever you do, don't let them see you.
Despite losing to The Boss and losing his weapon yet again, Snake manages to slip through the enemy's security net and makes it to the abandoned factory, where he's supposed to rendezvous with ADAM.
Meeting EVA
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button partially available)
Snake arrives in front of the factory, CQC knife in hand. Suddenly, he's hit with a bright light. He turns his face away and covers his eyes.
First person prompt appears on-screen.
If the player goes into First Person View, they can see the headlights of a motorcycle. With the backlighting, only the outline of a person is visible.
The person on the bike speaks. Its engine is running.

VOICE

Sorry I'm late. (Said in English.)
Snake can't make them out. All he knows is the voice is that of a woman.
First person prompt disappears.

SNAKE

Cut the engine. They'll hear us.

VOICE

Are you the agent they sent?

SNAKE

Are you ADAM? I thought you were supposed to be a man.

VOICE

ADAM couldn't make it.
Snake strains his eyes, but he still can't make out who's speaking.

SNAKE

All right, say the password.
Snake tries to confirm the individual's identity. She becomes slightly flustered.

SNAKE

Who are the Patriots?
The individual still doesn't answer. Snake grows uneasy.

SNAKE

Who are the Patriots?
The individual is now frantic.

SNAKE

Answer me.
Tired of waiting, Snake is about to take action, but suddenly, out of the darkness, a GRU unit of four appears, surrounding him.

SNAKE

!
Snake doesn't have a gun, and now there are four of them pointed at him. He can't see well enough to use CQC either.

SNAKE

Trapped?

VOICE

Get down! (Said in English.)
Snake gets down. The figure, still on the bike, draws a Mauser Military and pulls the trigger without hesitation (high-speed camera). She uses a special shooting technique for full auto fire (she holds the pistol sideways, allowing her to use the kick from the full auto to sweep the gun horizontally and take out her adversaries in one fell swoop).
The intense muzzle flashes traveling horizontally (high-speed camera) light up the darkness. In the blink of an eye, she has emptied the gun's 10-round magazine. The enemy soldiers don't even have time to react, and all of them fall.

SOLDIER 1-4

*screams*
The biker ejects the magazine and inserts another.
Snake gets back up.

VOICE

There... (referring to the magazine) ... is your answer.
The woman turns off the light and removes her full face helmet, shaking her head as her long blond hair is freed.
As she stands there under the moonlight, Snake is overwhelmed by her beauty.

EVA

The name's EVA.
Caption: EVA (Suzetta Miñet)
First person prompt appears on-screen.
If the player goes into First Person View here, they'll get a look at EVA's cleavage. Only those who go into First Person View will understand just how Snake feels.

SNAKE

*amazed*
Meeting EVA
3D Cutscene 2
3D cutscene (night - change view button partially available)
Fade in. Snake and EVA have moved to the room Sokolov was in.
Snake is sitting on the bed. EVA watches him from a little distance away. Her helmet is sitting next to her. The Mauser Military is still in her holster. She's unzipped her coveralls quite low (she's relaxed).
Snake is naked from the waist up, treating the injuries The Boss inflicted upon him.
Editor's Note: In the release version, he's smoking a cigar.

SNAKE

This wasn't part of the plan. What happened to ADAM?

EVA

What's your code name?

SNAKE

It's... Snake.

EVA

Snake, huh? Well, I'm EVA... Are you here to tempt me?

SNAKE

*ignores EVA's quip* What happened to ADAM?
EVA's somewhat sour expression and body language hint that she wants to say to Snake "Well you're no fun."

EVA

Colonel Volgin is a very suspicious man. He decided ADAM wasn't the right person for this mission.

SNAKE

And you were?

EVA

Yes.

SNAKE

Why?

EVA

Because I can do things he can't.
EVA twists her body a little.
Snake looks at her appearance.

SNAKE

I heard you used to be a codebreaker for the NSA (National Security Agency).

EVA

I was. Four years ago, I defected to the Soviet Union with ADAM.
The Mauser on EVA's hip reminds Snake of her shooting performance earlier.

SNAKE

Mauser Military... the "Broomhandle."

EVA

It packs quite a punch. Nice to have when you're on a bike.

SNAKE

You held it sideways and used the muzzle jump to create a horizontal sweep - that was impressive.

EVA

Bet you've never seen that technique (the Chinese technique) in the West.
EVA shows Snake the Mauser Military. He catches a glimpse of the engraving.

SNAKE

It's imitation, isn't it?

EVA

Yeah, it's a Chinese Type 17 pistol.

EVA

Around here, even that's hard to come by.
Snake sees right through the fact that it's a Chinese model. EVA deflects.

EVA

Don't worry, though. The one I've got for you is American made.
EVA takes out a custom 1911 Government and hands it to Snake.

SNAKE

.45, huh.
Snake instantly notices all the meticulous modifications this pistol has. He's blown away.

SNAKE

*amazed* Incredible...
Snake starts to really study the gun closely.

EVA

Do you like it?
Snake handles it like a pro as he checks all its parts and mutters to himself. Quick cuts.

SNAKE

The feeding ramp is polished to a mirror sheen...

SNAKE

The slide's been reinforced. And the interlock with the frame is tightened for added precision.

SNAKE

The sight system is original, too.

SNAKE

The thumb safety is extended to make it easier on the finger...

SNAKE

A long-type trigger with non-slip grooves...

SNAKE

A ring hammer...

SNAKE

The base of the trigger guard's been filed down for a higher grip.

SNAKE

And not only that, nearly every part of this gun has been expertly crafted and customized.
Sigint provides a more detailed explanation over radio later.
Snake checks the sound of the hammer. He's in love with this custom firearm.

SNAKE

Where'd you get something like this?

EVA

I grabbed it from a Western munitions armory. It probably used to belong to one of your officers, and there are more where that came from.
EVA also places Snake's tranquilizer gun on the bed. (She reassembled it after The Boss field stripped it on the rope bridge during the Virtuous Mission.)
Snake glances at it before going back to the 1911. He checks its trigger pull.

EVA

You had this with you, didn't you?

EVA

Better take this, too.
EVA places a scientist disguise on the bed as well.

SNAKE

What's that?

EVA

A disguise to make you look like a scientist.

SNAKE

A disguise?

EVA

Yes. You're here to rescue Sokolov, right?

SNAKE

... Sokolov's still safe, then.

EVA

Yes. He's being forced to continue his work on the Shagohod.

SNAKE

Where?

EVA

At the lab. They've got a whole army of scientists there developing new weapons. Security is tight, but if you disguise yourself as a scientist, you might be able to sneak in.

SNAKE

Can we get Sokolov out of there?

EVA

We'll see, won't we.

SNAKE

Tell me how to get to the lab.
As he listens to EVA, Snake takes his CQC knife and starts carving into the 1911's wooden grip.
Split-screen: One half explains the route Snake has to take, the other shows what he's doing with the gun..

EVA

The safest way in is from the rear.

EVA

First, you'll need to head north through the jungle. You'll come to a heliport used for shipping materials.

EVA

Pass the heliport and continue north, and there will be a large crevice. Descend into that area and you'll reach a cave.

EVA

Move through the cave and you will arrive at a mangrove swamp.

EVA

After the swamp, there'll be a warehouse. Make your way through the warehouse, and you'll come out just south of the lab.

SNAKE

Got it.

EVA

And just what are you doing there?
EVA doesn't understand why Snake is carving into the grip.

SNAKE

In close-range combat, a knife can sometimes be more useful than a gun. By doing this, I'll be able to hold a knife at the same time and still keep the gun steady. That way, I can instantly switch between a gun battle and a knife fight.
Snake readies the 1911 in a CQC stance again. He finally seems happy with it. Snake lowers his weapon.

SNAKE

Right. Let's get going...

EVA

Wait a minute!

SNAKE

What now?

EVA

You must be tired. Why don't you take a little rest?

SNAKE

I'll be fine.

EVA

You'll never make it in your condition. It's a jungle out there.

EVA

There's still an hour before dawn. It's dangerous to be out in the jungle at night without a guide.

SNAKE

What about you? (You're not going to guide me?)

EVA

I have to get back. I can't be gone for too long. They'll start to suspect something.

SNAKE

...

EVA

Don't worry. I'll keep you updated over the radio.

SNAKE

That's it?

EVA

My orders are to provide you with information. Nothing more.

SNAKE

...

EVA

You look disappointed.

EVA

All right, then. I'll do something special for you.
EVA leans in to Snake.

EVA

I'll stand watch until dawn. Now be a good boy and lie down.
But Snake doesn't lie down.

EVA

What's the matter?

SNAKE

I don't know you well enough to trust you.

EVA

How well do you have to know me to trust me?

SNAKE

I don't know if I can trust anybody. (Not after The Boss betrayed him.)
EVA's body language indicates she's thinking "Oh, boy."
Snake's radio rings.

EVA

Gonna get that?
Snake answers.
Meeting EVA
Radio Call 1
Para-Medic advises Snake to get some rest too.

PARA-MEDIC

She's right, Snake. You should get some sleep.

PARA-MEDIC

Although, in your condition you really ought to be back in the ICU...
Para-Medic gives Snake a tutorial about sleeping (saving).

PARA-MEDIC

Whenever you save the game and quit, you'll go to sleep. Sleeping allows you to gain back stamina naturally. Depending on how long you sleep, you may also recover naturally from sickness and injury.

PARA-MEDIC

When you're tired or hurt, the best thing to do is just get some sleep. So do yourself a favor and take a nap. Doctor's orders. OK?

SNAKE

Yeah, OK...
Meeting EVA
3D Cutscene 3
Snake is asleep.
Outside the window, EVA uses a portable Russian radio to send a message. (She's contacting China.)
The next day, Snake's LIFE and stamina have regenerated (An exception—this was a practice run for the player).
Day breaks.
Meeting EVA
3D Cutscene 4
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button partially available)
The next morning (fade in).
First person prompt appears on-screen.
EVA is in her underwear, putting on her coveralls.
While not visible through the normal camera, if the player goes into First Person View they can get a look at her panties.
Outside, there's a noise. The Ocelot Unit is launching a raid.
First person prompt disappears.
Snake jumps up. He peeks outside the window to see the Ocelot Unit has surrounded them.

EVA

What's the matter?
He hides at the window and looks around.

SNAKE

We're surrounded...

SNAKE

I see... Four of them...

EVA

We've got company! It's the Ocelot Unit!
If the player goes into First Person View again, they'll get another look at EVA's cleavage.

EVA

Let's get out of here! Hurry!

EVA

Don't forget your gear!
EVA walks to the middle of the room and places her helmet on the bed.

EVA

Here, give me a hand.
EVA grabs the edge of the bed. Snake grabs another edge and they move it, revealing a trapdoor. EVA opens it. Until this point, the player can't open this door from underneath.

EVA

We can use this to get to the basement.
EVA jumps down under the floor.
She peeks out the building from below. She sees the legs of the Ocelot Unit in motion.
On the other side of their legs she sees Ocelot himself.

EVA

Dammit!... Ocelot!
EVA pops her head up the trapdoor.

EVA

I'll get past them on my bike. I'll call you later!

SNAKE

OK. I'll keep them busy.
EVA gives Snake a sharp look as she brings her face close to his. But she surprises him by giving him a peck on the cheek.

SNAKE

!

EVA

Don't go dying on me now.
EVA puts on her helmet, concealing her face.
She crawls away beneath the building.
After this cutscene ends, the player won't know where EVA or her bike are. She won't answer the radio either.
The members of the elite Ocelot Unit attack. Snake moves about the abandoned factory, taking them out. Once he has eliminated them all, he attempts to leave.
After Ocelot Unit Battle
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button partially available)
Snake leaves the factory. He hears gunshots behind him.
Snake turns around.

OCELOT

I've been waiting for this moment...
First person prompt appears on-screen.
Snake takes his 1911 out in a CQC stance.
He sees Ocelot holding EVA (helmet still on) from behind in a full nelson. He has a knife in his left hand.
EVA is now Ocelot's hostage.
Ocelot has brought a revolver with him this time. The cartridge that jammed on him hangs from his neck. It's got an attachment on it, which allows it to be fired from even a revolver.
He's placed that Makarov round in a ring of the same diameter as Single Action Army rounds, then turned it into a pendant. When he wants to fire it, he can simply take it off and load it into the SAA.

OCELOT

*happily* That's it! That's the stance! (He's been hoping he'd get to see it again)
Ocelot is decidedly happy to see Snake again.
Actually, he's ecstatic. EVA squirms in an attempt to get away.

OCELOT

I don't think so!
Ocelot points his gun at Snake and tightens his hold on EVA. In the process of doing so he touches her breast, and now realizes that she's a woman.

OCELOT

Wha...?
Ocelot grabs a handful of EVA's breast and squeezes it to double-check.

OCELOT

A female spy?
He brings his nose close to her neck and sniffs.

OCELOT

This bitch is wearing perfume.
This fragrance almost blows EVA's cover during the later torture scene.
Snake slowly closes in. Ocelot being on a higher floor of the abandoned factory puts Snake at quite the disadvantage.

OCELOT

Stay where you are! I've had enough of your judo (CQC)!
Snake stops. Ocelot points his revolver at him.
It has an engraving.

SNAKE

*buying time to try to seize an opportunity since EVA is a hostage* I see you've got yourself a single action army. (You've changed from the Makarov.)

OCELOT

That's right. There'll be no accidents this time.

SNAKE

You call that an accident? Well... It wouldn't have happened if you hadn't been showing off.

OCELOT

What did you say!?

SNAKE

It's a nice gun, I'll give you that. But the engraving gives you no tactical advantage whatsoever. Unless you were planning to auction it off as a collector's item.

OCELOT

*pretty hurt*

SNAKE

And you're forgetting one more very basic thing...

OCELOT

?

SNAKE

You don't have what it takes to kill me.

OCELOT

We'll see!!
Ocelot pulls the trigger.
Click!

OCELOT

! *shocked*
He's surprised.
He pulls the trigger again.
Click!
And again.
Click!
The revolver is empty. The Makarov holds 8+1, so with Ocelot having fired 6, it's out of ammo! Ocelot is used to a Makarov. He got careless.
As Ocelot tries to reload, EVA springs into action.
She breaks free from his hold and knocks him off the platform with a body blow or a kick.

EVA

*yells*

OCELOT

*groans*
Wasting no time, EVA then jumps down onto her bike.
She starts the engine.
Ocelot jumps down after her and grabs her arm.
The two of them struggle. Snake can't pull the trigger.
EVA revs the accelerator all the way, rears the bike like a horse, and attacks Ocelot with its front tire.
Ocelot loses his balance, but she can't shake him.
EVA spins the rear wheel in place a little.
Editor's Note: This part of the scene was cut from the release version.
Ocelot comes at EVA with his knife.
While up on the rear wheel, EVA spins the front tire to block the knife.
She then goes full throttle, doing a somersault with the bike and running over Ocelot's face with its rear tire (high-speed camera).
He's thrown up and hits the ground hard. His knife flies through the air.

OCELOT

*groans*
EVA takes off and hits the brakes hard a few steps away from Ocelot!
She's situated next to Snake.
EVA grabs Ocelot's falling knife. His revolver lands in front of him a moment later.
Snake approaches Ocelot in a CQC stance, keeping his gun pointed at him.
Snake looks at Ocelot's gun.

SNAKE

Six shots.

OCELOT

?
Ocelot looks up at Snake.
Snake continues the lecture.

SNAKE

That thing only carries six shots. The Makarov carries eight. You have to get a feel for how many you have left.
Ocelot scowls as he has to swallow this second humiliation. But it also makes him like Snake even more.

SNAKE

This is a high-class weapon. It's not meant for shooting people.
Ocelot slaps his own head as he picks up the empty revolver and stands.
EVA and her bike are next to Snake.
Ocelot makes up his mind to flee.

OCELOT

Damn! This isn't over yet!
He goes running off. EVA takes out her Mauser and is about to kill him.
But Snake pushes her gun away.

SNAKE

Don't! (He's started to like Ocelot.)

EVA

Why?

SNAKE

He's still young.

EVA

You'll regret stopping me.
EVA holsters her Mauser and revs the engine.

EVA

Dammit! I've got to get back before he does (so I don't blow my cover).
She races off on her bike to get back to Volgin ASAP!
Snake watches her leave.
She drives up the factory stairs, then does a massive jump!
She lands on the roof, then revs the engine some more! After a run-up, she does another massive jump off the roof!
She drops down on the fence that blocked Snake's path before, destroying it with her jump.
EVA disappears into the forest.
Footnotes
1The first American to travel into space. On May 5, 1961, Shepard orbited the Earth for 15 minutes aboard space capsule Freedom 7.
236th president of the United States.
3Khrushchev's political rival. Ousted Khrushchev in 1964, following which he became General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
4English: Voyevoda, Russian: Воевода. Can refer to a warrior, a knight (traveling to gain skill), a leader or chief of a town or municipality, or one who wields power in the military or government. In the case of a female character, it also has the meaning of "lady knight/warrior," and when one looks at all the famous queens throughout Russian history, this isn't at all an odd choice of characterization—in fact, it's a poetic, complimentary way to refer to someone.
5In MGS1, all communications with Snake's support team were conducted through body-internal communications powered by nanomachines.
6Refers to Dremuchij, this forest area of the game. It was based on Yakushima, a Japanese island with a temperate forest, so it came to be called this by the development team.
Radio Conversations
•Major
Prior to Meeting The Boss
Head for the abandoned factory to the north
(1)

ZERO

Snake, your first task is to meet up with ADAM, the contact provided by the KGB.

ZERO

The rendezvous point is the abandoned factory to the north of your current position. Head north.
(2)

SNAKE

The abandoned factory... that's where I met Sokolov during the Virtuous Mission.

ZERO

Correct. But we can't afford to have the same thing happen this time.

SNAKE

I know.
Camouflage yourself

ZERO

Like the Virtuous Mission, Operation Snake Eater is a solo sneaking mission.

ZERO

There are no units in the field to back you up. Avoid engaging the enemy whenever possible. Your first priority is to remain unseen.

ZERO

Use the "CAMOUFLAGE" option in the Survival Viewer and choose your camouflage wisely. Proceed with caution.
It was daytime before, this time it's night
(1)

ZERO

Unlike the Virtuous Mission, this is a night operation.

ZERO

You'll get lost more easily in the dark, but it will also make your camouflage more effective and make it harder for the enemy to see you. On the other hand, it will also be more difficult for you to see them.

ZERO

You'll also find that different animals are active. Some of these nocturnal animals are poisonous. So stay alert.
(2)

ZERO

Para-Medic is with us again to provide information on the local plants and animals. Give her a call if there's anything you need to know.
Prior to The Boss appearing - procuring food
(1)

ZERO

Operation Snake Eater is different from the Virtuous Mission in that you won't be able to complete it in just a few hours.

ZERO

The time limit set by Khrushchev is one week. Within that time, you'll have to rescue Sokolov, defeat Volgin, destroy the Shagohod and... (He's about to say "and kill The Boss" but he can't bring himself to do it.)

SNAKE

I know. (Saying it so he himself hears it.)

ZERO

... Good.

ZERO

In any event, you will not be allowed to return until you've accomplished your objectives.

ZERO

Survival in the field will be critical in this mission. And the most important survival technique of all is, of course, finding food.
(2)

ZERO

You can get food in the same way you did during the Virtuous Mission - by capturing it.

ZERO

The enemy presence in that area is still light. You should try and get as much food as possible while you can.
The crashed drone

SNAKE

Major, what should I do with this wreck of a drone?

ZERO

Just leave it there.

SNAKE

Are you sure?

ZERO

Yes.

SNAKE

But isn't this thing top secret?

ZERO

Yeah, it is.

ZERO

After the U2 spy plane incident four years ago, plans were laid out for future spy missions in Soviet airspace to be carried out by an unmanned craft.

ZERO

That craft was the D21 spy drone, the basis of the one you came in on.

ZERO

The D21 is launched from a craft called the M21. The M21 itself is a derivative of the A-12, a supersonic long-range spy plane currently being developed as the successor to the U2.

ZERO

However, for this mission we used a modified YF-12A, a long-range interceptor version of the A-12.

ZERO

After being released from the mother ship, the drone can achieve speeds upwards of Mach 3 at high altitude using its ramjet engine.

ZERO

It can't be shot down by ground-to-air missiles, and it's nearly undetectable by radar.

ZERO

With Tselinoyarsk in such a high state of alert after our last escapade, this was the only reliable way to get you in.

SNAKE

This is all top-secret military technology. Are you telling me I'm supposed to just leave it here?

ZERO

That's right.

SNAKE

Why?

ZERO

The purpose of Operation Snake Eater is to send an American agent into the field in order to eliminate a defector and traitor. Namely, The Boss.

ZERO

Part of that mission involves making sure the Soviets find out what we're doing.

SNAKE

So we have to leave behind some kind of evidence that the U.S. was involved.

ZERO

Don't worry. The technologically sensitive components of the craft were rigged to self-destruct when it landed.

ZERO

The only thing the Soviets are going to find is a pile of American-made scrap metal.

SNAKE

Got it. Just one thing, though.

ZERO

What is it?

SNAKE

I think they'd better redesign the landing impact buffer. People are gonna get hurt landing that thing.

ZERO

I'll let them know.
The situation following the Virtuous Mission

ZERO

Thanks to last week's nuclear incident, the Soviet Union is now on secondary alert. We're one step away from a nuclear war.

SNAKE

Defcon 2, huh.

ZERO

In American parlance, yes.

ZERO

From what Western intelligence has been able to gather, the radical elements in the Soviet command are showing signs of impatience.

ZERO

They say we're on the brink of World War III here.

ZERO

And with Khrushchev's position getting weaker every day, I worry whether he'll be able to hold them back...

SNAKE

...One week. (That's how much time Khrushchev has given them.)

ZERO

Yes. America must eliminate The Boss by its own hand to prove its "innocence." There is no other way to resolve the crisis.

ZERO

Everything rests on your shoulders, Snake. Failure is not an option.

SNAKE

... I know.
Voyevoda

ZERO

The Soviet intelligence community must be up in arms about The Boss' defection.

ZERO

The great Voyevoda has abandoned America and embraced the Soviet Union.

SNAKE

Voyevoda?

ZERO

Apparently that's what they call The Boss behind the Iron Curtain.

ZERO

It means "warrior" or "mighty soldier" in Russian. When used to refer to a woman, it means something close to "lady knight."

ZERO

In Russia, where they've had a number of female emperors throughout their history, it's a term of great respect. Well, poetic, in a way.

ZERO

The Boss' exploits have made her name famous in the East as well.
The Boss' defection

SNAKE

Major, why did The Boss defect?

ZERO

I don't know. But I will tell you this. America is all too eager to get rid of her.

SNAKE

What do you mean?

ZERO

She knows too many of our secrets.

ZERO

If she were to relay all the top-secret information she knows to the Soviet bloc, it would put us at a severe disadvantage.

ZERO

It might even lead to the downfall of the West.

ZERO

Even if we survive, The Boss is still too much of a hero to us.

ZERO

With her in the Soviet camp, we'd suffer a fatal loss of morale at home.

ZERO

There are even whispers that some of the less stalwart elements of the military might follow her example and defect themselves.

ZERO

I assume you're aware that since your last mission, several key figures within the CIA have been placed under house arrest.

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

The loss of The Boss has been a painful one indeed.

SNAKE

What about you?

ZERO

Me? I still can't believe it. As a comrade, I would have placed my trust in her before my own family.

ZERO

But now that I think about it, The Boss always seemed to have an aura of mystery about her.

ZERO

I never would have expected it to manifest in this way, though.

SNAKE

...

ZERO

Ah well, it won't do to get all misty-eyed about it. She's an enemy now, worthy of nothing more than our contempt.

SNAKE

Understood.
Go investigate that horse neigh
(1)

ZERO

You just heard a horse?

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

You're sure it wasn't something else?

SNAKE

I know a horse when I hear one.

ZERO

Para-Medic, are there any wild horses in Tselinoyarsk?

PARA-MEDIC

Do you really expect me to say "yes"?

ZERO

No.

SNAKE

So what should I do?

ZERO

There's only one way through that area. All you can do is move forward.
(2)

ZERO

Head towards the sound of that horse. It came from the north. Be careful.
•Para-Medic
Prior to Meeting The Boss
Effects of the injuries sustained during the Virtuous (VR) Mission

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake! It's so good to hear from you again.

SNAKE

Same here. It's been a week, hasn't it?

PARA-MEDIC

Four days, actually.

SNAKE

?

PARA-MEDIC

I visited you in the hospital. You were still unconscious, though.

SNAKE

Huh. Then you must have seen me naked.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. But you were all wrapped up in bandages and tubes, so I couldn't do anything but look.

SNAKE

Better luck next time.

PARA-MEDIC

Let's hope so... But seriously, don't forget that you were like that until just yesterday. In fact, you really shouldn't even be on this mission.

PARA-MEDIC

Keep an eye on your stamina gauge. If you start to run low, don't push yourself. Eat something to replenish your stamina.

PARA-MEDIC

And try not to get yourself hurt. If you're wounded, or get bitten by a venomous animal, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and treat yourself using "CURE."

SNAKE

Yeah, yeah. I can see you still know how to nag.

PARA-MEDIC

You're welcome. And I can see you still don't know when to keep your mouth shut.

SNAKE

Maybe so... By the way, I heard you're going to lose your medical license if this mission fails.

PARA-MEDIC

Yes, there was talk of that, but the mission won't fail, WILL it?

SNAKE

Of course not.

PARA-MEDIC

Good, I believe in you... But you know what? I really don't care about my medical license.

SNAKE

Didn't they use that to force you to participate in this operation?

PARA-MEDIC

No. I volunteered.

SNAKE

Why?

PARA-MEDIC

So that I could watch over you.

SNAKE

?

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you're the best agent I've ever seen. But you push yourself too hard. You're reckless.

PARA-MEDIC

Someone has to stop you from getting into trouble... to make sure you and The Boss don't kill each other.

SNAKE

... (hit the nail on the head)

PARA-MEDIC

So that's why I volunteered. I mean, you couldn't ask for a better guardian angel than me, right?

SNAKE

... Thanks.

PARA-MEDIC

Stop right there!

SNAKE

?

PARA-MEDIC

You can thank me when you get back.

SNAKE

All right.
Nocturnal flora and fauna

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, unlike the Virtuous Mission, this is a night operation.

PARA-MEDIC

You'll be encountering nocturnal animals that you didn't encounter your last mission.

PARA-MEDIC

Some of them are venomous, like the king cobra, so be careful.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get bitten by a venomous animal, the poison will spread through your body and rapidly drain your LIFE gauge.

PARA-MEDIC

If that's the case, go into the "CURE" screen in Survival Viewer immediately and inject yourself with serum. Got it?
•Major
Prior to Reaching Abandoned Factory
After The Boss appears - head for the abandoned factory
(1)

SNAKE

Major...

ZERO

*reminding himself too* Snake, The Boss is your enemy. You've got to accept that reality.

SNAKE

...
(2)

ZERO

ADAM is waiting for you at the abandoned factory to the north of your current position. Head north.
After The Boss appears - head for the abandoned factory (2)

ZERO

Remember that you've lost your gun. You don't stand a chance in a fight against an enemy unit.

ZERO

Use your camouflage and don't let the enemy see you.
After The Boss appears - enemy soldiers will show up

ZERO

The enemy must have seen the drone explode. They've probably already sent out patrol units.

ZERO

You never know when you'll encounter the enemy. Use your camouflage wisely and proceed with caution.
After The Boss appears - security leak?
(1)

SNAKE

Major, why was The Boss there... Did they detect my infiltration?

ZERO

That's impossible. The drone shouldn't have been picked up by their radar at all.

SNAKE

Then how did she know? It couldn't have been...? (A leak?)

ZERO

That's also out of the question. We've taken all measures to ensure this mission stays secret.

SNAKE

... Then what's going on?

ZERO

I don't know.

SNAKE

...

ZERO

It won't do you any good to dwell on it, Snake.
(2)

ZERO

Hurry to your rendezvous with ADAM. Head for the abandoned factory to the north.

ZERO

Watch out for enemy patrols. Stay alert at all times. Okay?
The Boss' betrayal

SNAKE

Major...

ZERO

What is it.

SNAKE

... Why did The Boss betray us?

ZERO

Leave it alone, Snake.

SNAKE

But...

ZERO

We've been through this before. Besides, asking for reasons now won't change anything.

SNAKE

*not listening* I thought I'd find out if I met her face to face. I thought for sure she'd tell me. But... (When he met her she kicked his butt.)

ZERO

Then you'll have to find your own answers.

SNAKE

... By completing my "mission"? (His mission being to eliminate The Boss.)

ZERO

Yes.

SNAKE

...
You don't have a gun, so use your knife to capture food

ZERO

Snake, you don't have a tranquilizer gun right now. That means you'll just have to capture animals with your bare hands or with your survival knife.

ZERO

You should be able to harvest mushrooms and other low-lying plants with no problem by punching them or using your knife.

ZERO

It'll be tougher to catch small animals, but you might have a chance if you use stalking from behind.
Rope bridge tactics without a gun
(1)

ZERO

A rope bridge, huh... You'll stick out like a sore thumb if you walk on top of it. To cross it without being seen, you'll have to do something about the enemies.
(2)
*If player didn't hear about this during Virtuous Mission

SNAKE

Seems that way.
(3)
*If player did hear about this during Virtuous Mission

SNAKE

You told me this before.

ZERO

Did I?

SNAKE

Yeah.
(4)

ZERO

In the Virtuous Mission, you had your tranquilizer gun to use, but this time around you're unarmed. You won't be able to take out the enemies safely from a distance.

ZERO

You'll have to find some way of reeling them in close.

ZERO

Try distracting the enemy by making a noise or throwing something.

ZERO

You might also try cutting one of the ropes with your survival knife to make the bridge shake...
•Major
Prior to Meeting EVA
ADAM's location at the abandoned factory
(1)

ZERO

You've arrived at the factory, I see.

SNAKE

Yeah. Now to meet up with this ADAM guy.

ZERO

Good, go to it.

SNAKE

So where is he?

ZERO

We weren't given an exact location.

SNAKE

How about a time?

ZERO

Nothing was specified.

SNAKE

A physical description.

ZERO

I'm not sure.

SNAKE

... How am I supposed to find him, then?

ZERO

You won't need to.

SNAKE

?

ZERO

He'll find you.

SNAKE

...
(2)

ZERO

Why don't you try the room to the northeast where you met Sokolov? ADAM might be in there.
ADAM will only appear during Normal Phase
(1)

ZERO

ADAM is a spy sent by the KGB to infiltrate Volgin's ranks. You'll need to be extremely careful in how you approach him.

SNAKE

Obviously. He can't let Volgin know he's meeting me.

ZERO

That's right.
(2)

ZERO

ADAM won't show up if you're being pursued by the enemy.

ZERO

Before you go to rendezvous with ADAM, make sure you haven't been seen by the enemy.

ZERO

Meet up with him in Normal Phase. Got it?
•Ocelot Unit Battle
Ocelot Unit battle - take them all out
(1)

ZERO

It appears you've been completely surrounded.

SNAKE

Yeah. So I gathered.

ZERO

If EVA is to escape from there...

SNAKE

Right. I'll have to take them all out.
(2)

ZERO

Snake, you must defeat all the Ocelots. That's the only way to ensure EVA's safe escape, as well as your own.

ZERO

But you're up against a lot of them. Don't try to take them head on. Approach them without being seen, and dispatch them one by one. And don't forget to use your camouflage.
Ocelot Unit battle - get out of that room
(1)

ZERO

Snake, they're conducting a sweep of the inside of the factory. Sooner or later, they'll come to your room.

ZERO

If you're just standing there doing nothing, they'll find you and they will kill you.
(2)

ZERO

Get out of that room, quickly. Use the trapdoor that EVA showed you!
(3)

ZERO

You might be able to wait it out by hiding in a locker as well.
Ocelot Unit battle - basic tactics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, don't try to engage the Ocelots head on. There are too many of them. If they surround you, you'll be finished.

ZERO

Use your camouflage to approach them without being seen, and take them out one by one.
(2)

ZERO

If you don't camouflage yourself properly, you run the risk of being spotted and attacked by snipers or other far away enemies.

ZERO

Don't forget to use the "CAMOUFLAGE" screen in the Survival Viewer to disguise yourself.

ZERO

Always maintain a high Camo Index.
Ocelot Unit battle - file of enemy soldiers

ZERO

Snake, enemy soldiers who move in file pose a serious threat. Try to take them out one at a time starting with the one at the back.
Ocelot Unit battle - drums

ZERO

Snake, there were drums filled with fuel in the factory.

ZERO

If you shoot a bullet into one of those drums, the resulting explosion should send any nearby enemies flying. Use them to your advantage!
Ocelot Unit battle - enemies in hiding

ZERO

Snake, there's no telling where the enemy might be hiding. Be sure to check the ceilings and the bushes. Don't let your guard down, even for an instant.
Ocelot Unit battle - never mind EVA

ZERO

EVA needs you to distract the enemies until she can escape on her motorcycle. She's probably out there somewhere waiting for her chance.

ZERO

Don't worry about her. Focus on defeating the enemy. Understood?
Ocelot Unit battle - watch out for snipers

ZERO

Snake, it appears they've got snipers in place.

ZERO

Snipers are excellent shots. If they hit you, you're likely to be wounded.

ZERO

Find the snipers and neutralize them before they can shoot you. If you do get shot at, take cover behind something. Understood?
Ocelot Unit battle - that's not all of them

ZERO

Snake, it's too early to relax yet. There are still enemies out there somewhere. Find them and eliminate them.
•Sigint
Ocelot Unit Battle
Ocelot Unit battle - suppressors
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, if you fire that thing without a suppressor attached, the bang and the muzzle flash will give your position away to the enemy.
(2)

SIGINT

Attach a suppressor and you won't have to worry about all that. To attach a suppressor, open the Weapon Window and press the Enter Button.
Watch out for stun grenades
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, they're usin' stun grenades - watch out!
(2)

SNAKE

Stun grenades?

SIGINT

Yeah. It's a new weapon they invented themselves. It uses an intense blast of light and sound to knock out the enemy temporarily.
(3)

SIGINT

If you're lookin' at the light from one of those things when it goes off, you can kiss your optics goodbye. If one gets tossed your way, turn around quick.
Watch out for M63s

SIGINT

Heads up, Snake. Looks like some of those guys are equipped with M63s.

SIGINT

The M63 is an American-made light machine gun. It's got more firepower than you might think. It can punch through a wall too so watch out.
Watch out for M37s

SIGINT

You said some of them are using shotguns?

SIGINT

Those shotguns are M37s. They're an American model designed for field combat.

SIGINT

Not all that dangerous from a distance, but at close range, they'll tear you to shreds. Be careful.
Watch out for Scorpions

SIGINT

Looks like some of them are using Scorpions.

SIGINT

The Scorpion is a Czechoslovakian submachine gun.

SIGINT

They don't have the stopping power of a rifle, but they're easier to handle, and lethal at a medium range. If you eat more than a couple of rounds it's not gonna be pretty.

SIGINT

Don't fool around.
Watch out for grenades

SIGINT

Snake, watch out for those grenades they're tossin'.

SIGINT

You'll be injured pretty bad if you get caught in the blast. You could get burned, too. If somebody throws a grenade at you, get away from it and hit the deck.
Ocelot Unit battle – rifles
(1)

SIGINT

Those rifles the Ocelots are using aren't AK-47s, are they?
(2)

SNAKE

No. They kind of look like AKMs, but they're different.

SIGINT

Different how?

SNAKE

They've got steel hand guards and vertical-type foregrips. And the muzzle suppressor is bigger.

SIGINT

A carbine version of the AKM, huh.

SIGINT

Hungary has a unique modified version of the AKM called the AMD-63. I heard something before about them making a prototype carbine version of that.

SIGINT

My guess is they probably imported some of those prototypes.
(3)

SIGINT

If they're using a carbine version of the AMD-63 like I'm thinkin', then they could be a serious threat. Those things handle better than AK-47s, especially at close range.

SIGINT

And don't forget the Ocelots are elites. They're going to be better shots than normal Spetsnaz, and you're that much more likely to get seriously hurt. Keep your eyes open.
Section 4
Meeting EVA – Rendezvous with EVA at Mountaintop Ruins
Having driven off Ocelot and parted ways with EVA, Snake heads north to rescue Sokolov, making his way through the jungle alone. Along the way, he gets a call from EVA.
After Ocelot Unit Battle EVA Call
Radio Call 1

EVA

Snake, are you there?

SNAKE

EVA?

EVA

Did you miss me?

SNAKE

Did you make it without any trouble?

EVA

No one saw me.

SNAKE

So you're back with Volgin?

EVA

In a matter of speaking...

SNAKE

What about The Boss?

EVA

Yeah, she's here too.

SNAKE

Better be careful.

EVA

Thanks, I will. The Boss and I get along pretty well though. I guess we traitors have a lot in common.

SNAKE

Why would anyone want to defect? Betraying your country like that... I... I just don't get it. (He's also talking about The Boss.)

EVA

Are you talking about The Boss?

SNAKE

Why'd you do it? Weren't you born and raised in America?

EVA

Yes. In a small rural town. I never even knew there were other countries, other cultures, other ways of thinking. Until I went to work for the NSA... Then, one day, I'd found I'd lost faith in the things I'd been taking for granted.

SNAKE

What did you see? What was it that made you want to change sides?

EVA

You wouldn't believe me if I told you.

SNAKE

Try me.

EVA

I saw the universe. (She and The Boss are ahead of the times.)

SNAKE

The universe?

EVA

Not the actual universe. The universe as the intelligence community sees it. I realized that the gravity in this universe was holding me back. That's all... People and countries are both changed by their environment. And by the times.

SNAKE

That sounds like what The Boss was saying.

EVA

There's a world of difference between this country and America. But it's only a difference of position. A difference of perspective. Coming here made me realize something. Half of what I'd been told was a complete and utter lie... the other half was a conveniently constructed lie.

SNAKE

Where's the truth, then?

EVA

It's hidden in the lies.

SNAKE

Are you lying, too? (Foreshadowing.)

EVA

Who knows? I've been trained to make even the most severe falsehood sound like the honest truth. Weren't you?

SNAKE

No, I... believe because I have to. Even if it is a lie...

SNAKE

... That's part of my mission.

EVA

I'll have to remember that. If you need me, give me a call on the radio. My frequency is 142.52. See ya.
Snake makes it to the heliport. To get to the crevice, he heads through the forest north of the heliport.
Prior to Ocelot Battle
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (crevice - afternoon - change view button unavailable)
Snake plows through the dense forest.
He comes to an open flatland with good visibility. There are rifts in the ground everywhere. Beneath it is an underground cave. Ocelot blocks Snake's path to the mountains visible in the distance. There is a large crevice in the ground which separates Snake and Ocelot. This prevents Snake from advancing.
The truth is, when The Boss CQCed Snake earlier, she planted a transmitter on him. It's thanks to this transmitter that the Cobra Unit can get the drop on him (Ocelot and the Cobras use its signal to ambush Snake).
This encounter has the feel of a Western. The wind blows, vegetation sways. Even tumbleweeds blowing by would be fine. After Snake moves forward, Ocelot challenges him.

OCELOT

Ah, you're here at last. Looks like The Boss' info (transmitter) was right.
Ocelot begins by drawing a revolver with his right hand, doing tricks, then pointing it at Snake.

OCELOT

Twice now you've made me taste bitter defeat.
Ocelot cocks his jaw, indicating behind Snake. The Ocelot Unit emerges, blocking the way behind him (the entrance to this area). They're standing guard, creating an arena for Snake and Ocelot to have a one-on-one. The unit also point their AKs at Snake. Rank-and-file GRU soldiers watch for any Cobras, making sure they don't interfere and can't get past.
Editor's Note: In the release version, Ocelot's signal was changed to his imitation of an ocelot's meow. Also, their positions are such that members of the Ocelot Unit keep an eye on Snake, while the GRU grunts watch the entrance to the forest.

OCELOT

I hate to disappoint the Cobras, but you're mine now.

OCELOT

All of you, leave us!
The Ocelot Unit lowers their weapons.

OCELOT

It's just you and me. No one to get in our way.

OCELOT

Ocelots are proud creatures. They prefer to hunt alone.
With his left hand, Ocelot draws another revolver and spins it.
He spins his other revolver with his right hand simultaneously, then does tricks with both of them.
He ends by pointing both barrels at Snake.

OCELOT

12 shots... This time, I've got 12 shots.
Snake is perplexed by all this (he doesn't draw his gun).
Ocelot returns his revolvers to their holsters with some final flourishes. He's starting to become quite familiar with these guns. The Ocelot we know is starting to shine.
Once again, the wind blows, vegetation sways. Tumbleweeds blowing by would be fine.
Even the jammed cartridge hanging from Ocelot's neck moves in the wind.
Ocelot relaxes the fingers of both hands. His men watch attentively.

OCELOT

Okay... Draw!
Their battle begins. Snake gradually wears Ocelot down, but just as he's about to finish things, a swarm of hornets shows up.
Hornets Interrupt Battle
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button unavailable)

OCELOT

Damn it! He (The Pain) found us!!
The hornets attack! They form a dark cloud, covering the sky and enveloping the area completely. It's as dark as night. The Ocelot Unit panics. We don't show The Pain here, not yet. The hornets attack the Ocelot Unit.
Snake crouches down to help himself withstand the hornets' attack.
Ocelot is having none of it!

OCELOT

*grunts and groans as he keeps the hornets off him*
Ocelot spins his guns to keep them off him.
The hornets come after Snake.
The player is about to fight The Pain, and this scene serves to show how fearsome he is.
The hornets swarm a soldier. They're able to get in the tiny gaps between his uniform and his skin. His body (his uniform) swells from the inside.

OCELOT UNIT SOLDIER 1

*dying screams*
Unable to take it anymore, he pulls off his balaclava! His face is hideously swollen from all the hornet stings. He collapses to the ground and convulses! Bullet bees fly out from his mouth, his nostrils, his eye sockets.
The soldier's long scream gradually changes into the buzzing of the hornets (a morphing type of crossfade).
Other soldiers scream in terror and flee.

OCELOT UNIT SOLDIER 2-4

*running away screaming*
The area is now thrown into total darkness. Visibility has been reduced to zero.

OCELOT

You were lucky. We'll meet again! (from MGS11)
Ocelot takes off. Snake does a blind run through the darkness.
He falls feet first into the enormous crevice.

SNAKE

*yells*
Attacked by the hornets during his duel with Ocelot, Snake drops into a cave. He navigates it, soon coming to a subterranean lake. The blue sky peeks in through an opening in the ceiling.
The Pain Appears
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button unavailable)
Snakes hears the familiar buzzing of the hornet swarm. He stops.

SNAKE

!
The swarm descends from the ceiling dome, turning the surface of the lake pitch black.
Snake is on the second "floor" of the cave. Is he able to escape the hornets? (Note: will need to look into where he could go.) The hornets converge on an elevated platform type of island in the center of the lake. When the lake clears, scores of dead fish come floating to the surface. The hornets' venom has killed every last one of them.
Editor's Note: In the release version, Snake jumps into the water once the hornets come after him. Also, there is no shot of fish being killed.
On the island, the living cloud takes the shape of a man.
The first of the Cobras' would-be assassins—The Pain—finally makes his entrance.

THE PAIN

I've caught you at last.
With the hornets absorbed into his body, The Pain's form is revealed. Hornet camouflage. There are small holes (vents) in his camo fatigues that his hornets crawl in and out of.

THE PAIN

We are the sons of The Boss... I am The Pain... I will guide you to a world of anguish beyond your imagination... (Foreshadowing about the sons of Big Boss.)
Caption: Hornet Soldier - The Pain (Gregg Berger)
The Pain moves like a bizarre supervillain and speaks bombastically.

THE PAIN

Let's get started!
It is a tough battle, but Snake defeats The Pain.
The Pain Dies
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button unavailable)

THE PAIN

The pain... the pain... the pain!
The Pain dies.
He then explodes in a massive blast.
Having defeated The Pain and made his way out of the cave, Snake comes upon a large mangrove forest with water up to his knees. He wades through it, soon coming to a base with a pier.
Outside Mangrove Base
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (mangrove base 1 - afternoon - change view button available)
Snake enters the area in front of the base. The sun has already set.
Up ahead, Snake sees the entrance to the base. He studies it through his binoculars while treading water. If the player enters First Person View, they can see Sokolov. Volgin, EVA, Ocelot, and a soldier are also present. The soldier is marching Sokolov away.
Volgin gestures an order to the soldier.
From here on, we're not watching the scene as Snake through his binoculars. We switch to a cinematic (objective) POV. The soldier tries to move Sokolov inside the base, but he puts up a struggle.

SOKOLOV

Oof!

SOKOLOV

Get your hands off me!

SOKOLOV

I'm not going anywhere!
Tatyana (EVA) is in front of Volgin. She is shaken by what is happening to Sokolov, and looks ready to go running over to him.
