Volgin tires of Sokolov's continued resistance.

VOLGIN

Really now. How many times must I tell you?
In an innocent fashion he places his hand on the shoulder of EVA, still in front of him.
EVA turns around to look at Volgin (she's completely defenseless).
Suddenly, Volgin delivers an electric shock to her. Sparks fly!

EVA

*screams*
EVA collapses to the ground like she's just been shot. Her glasses fall off her face and drop to the concrete. We get a glimpse of the EVA we know from before.

SOKOLOV

Tanya! (Pet name for Tatyana, which is what EVA is calling herself.)

EVA

*groans as she endures the pain*
Sokolov tries to run over to EVA, but the soldier grabs him in a full nelson.
Volgin ignores the groans of EVA and addresses Sokolov.

VOLGIN

Each time you resist, your lover will suffer the consequences. Is that clear?

SOKOLOV

Volgin...!! (You bastard!)
Sokolov continues to struggle despite being restrained.

SOKOLOV

Damn you!
EVA is still on the ground. Volgin grabs her by the scruff of her neck with his left hand and lifts her up like an animal. He holds his right hand in front of EVA's face. Sparks shoot out from his palm. Volgin lightly touches her, administering a small electric shock.

EVA

*screams*
The current flows into EVA's body. Runs appear in her stockings.
EVA is somehow able to suppress the pain.
Volgin shoots Sokolov a threatening look.
Sokolov stops resisting.
Volgin removes his right hand from EVA. She goes limp from exhaustion.
With great satisfaction, Volgin releases EVA from his left hand, and she collapses to the ground. She's just barely able to find her glasses that dropped earlier.
The soldier grabs Sokolov's arm and walks him back inside the base.
Ocelot stops Sokolov.

OCELOT

Hold it right there, traitor.
Sokolov turns around and looks at Ocelot.
He pulls back, expecting he'll be killed.

OCELOT

Let's find out just how lucky you are.
Ocelot tries his own brand of Russian roulette.
He takes out a revolver, puts a round in it, and spins the cylinder.

OCELOT

Watch closely!

OCELOT

One of these three guns has a single bullet in it. I'm going to pull the trigger six times in a row. Are you ready?
He throws the revolver in his hand into the air, then draws two more revolvers from their holsters and juggles the three of them, like a street performer.
EVA is still out of it after being electrocuted. Her skirt got pulled up, and her thighs are showing. Volgin looks at EVA and grins. EVA pulls her skirt back down. When she fell to the ground her skirt got torn and pulled up, so she pulls it down. (In later scenes, the rips have been repaired.)
Editor's Note: This sequence was cut from the release version.
Ocelot pulls the trigger on a revolver each time he catches one in his right hand.
Six tries, all empty.

SOKOLOV

*terrified scream*

SOKOLOV

*terrified scream*

SOKOLOV

*terrified scream*

SOKOLOV

*terrified scream*

SOKOLOV

*terrified scream*

SOKOLOV

*terrified scream*
Terrified, Sokolov drops to the ground and wets himself.

OCELOT

Looks like your luck hasn't run out yet...

SOKOLOV

*falls to the ground and wets himself*
Ocelot has a gun in each hand.
From out of nowhere, The Boss appears, walks up to him, and grabs the third revolver from the air.

OCELOT

!
Still staring at Ocelot, she pulls the trigger on the revolver, which she is holding sideways. A bullet strikes the water!

OCELOT

!!
The Boss knew that the round would be in that revolver! She speaks calmly.

THE BOSS

There's no such thing as luck on the battlefield.

OCELOT

...
Volgin is impressed with The Boss' skill. He laughs.

VOLGIN

*laughs*
Volgin gives the soldier a cue, and Sokolov is taken away into the building.

THE BOSS

You'd better stay in line from now on. (Referring to what happened at the crevice.)
The Boss shows the revolver to Ocelot.

THE BOSS

The Cobras will take care of him (Snake).
She takes the revolver apart and returns the pieces to Ocelot.
The Boss stands face to face with Ocelot (mother and son).
Ocelot walks off in anger (he heads inside the base).
This leaves only Volgin, The Boss, and EVA.

VOLGIN

Has the CIA dog been disposed of yet?

THE BOSS

... The Pain is dead.

VOLGIN

What!?
The loss of one of the Cobras enrages Volgin.
He places cartridges between his fingers.
He strikes the wall with Bullet Punches!
This leaves two large holes in the wall.

VOLGIN

He may be a child, but he's definitely one of yours!
Smoke rises from Volgin's fists.
He opens his hands, discarding the shell casings.

VOLGIN

I fear Khrushchev may have a hand in this. We have no time to lose. You must eliminate him before the final test.
The Boss answers without turning to face Volgin. Her eyes are on Snake in the water. She can see him clearly.

THE BOSS

Don't worry.

THE BOSS

They'll be able to handle it.
A man of over 100 is rolled out in a wheelchair.
He is asleep. The wheelchair seemingly moved by itself.
In fact, The Fear pushed it out, but his stealth camouflage renders him invisible.
The wheelchair stops. We see a flash of The Fear's body for but a moment.

THE BOSS

I'm leaving him to you, The Fear.
The Fear deactivates his stealth camouflage and runs through the mangrove forest.
His eerie voice echoes among the trees.

THE FEAR

*eerie utterance*
Volgin studies The End, who remains motionless.

VOLGIN

The old man is always sleeping. Is he all right?

THE BOSS

The End is saving what life he has left in him for battle. Normally, he's dead. But he'll wake up when the time is right.
A clap of thunder.

THE BOSS

And when he does... it will be The End for the boy.
Suddenly, it begins to rain.
Volgin hates the rain, so this annoys him to no end. He lets out an annoyed grunt.

VOLGIN

*frustrated grunt*
He speaks to EVA.

VOLGIN

Sokolov isn't worth your love. You can entertain me until the rain stops.
Volgin enters the base.
EVA staggers in after him.

VOLGIN

Kuwabara... Kuwabara...
The Boss is the only one left. She looks across the mangroves.

THE BOSS

The Sorrow? Is that you?
If the player looks in First Person View, they can see The Sorrow standing there through the binoculars.
The rain lets up. The Boss walks away, leaving The End by himself.
The End is the only one there for a brief while. The old man is still asleep.
Editor's Note: The player can actually use their sniper rifle to eliminate The End here. If they do so, they will no longer face him in Sokrovenno. Members of the Ocelot Unit will patrol the area instead.
Snake passes through the mangrove base, then arrives at the lab where Sokolov is supposedly being held. He changes into the scientist disguise he got from EVA and infiltrates the facility, making it to its innermost area. After finding out which room Sokolov is in, he quietly slips inside.
Meeting Granin
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (Granin - night - change view button available)
Snake enters the room. It's quite a mess. Sokolov's research equipment, materials, etc., have been removed from their places of storage.
Snake scans the room. He sees the back of a man (Granin) sitting in a swivel chair behind a desk.
He also sees Granin's feet planted on a table. He's got on a pair of expensive-looking leather shoes, polished to a shine. He clicks his feet together. They sparkle with every kick (emphasizing the shoes, in which EVA planted a transmitter).
Snake approaches, thinking the man to be Sokolov, until Granin suddenly spins around and faces him. He's holding a hip flask full of vodka.

GRANIN

If you're looking for Sokolov, he's not here anymore.

SNAKE

*realizes the man isn't Sokolov* !
Snake reflexively goes to take out his gun.
Granin responds to this with disgust.

GRANIN

Put that thing away. You'll spoil my drink. So, you're the intruder everyone's talking about. Typical capitalist dog - no manners.
Granin takes a deep slug of vodka.

SNAKE

And who are you?
Granin removes his mouth from the flask.

GRANIN

*peevish* You mean you've never heard of me? And you call yourself an agent.

GRANIN

Very well, then.
Granin gets up out of the chair.

GRANIN

*self-importantly* I am Aleksandr Leonovitch Granin. A man of some importance, if I do say so myself.
Caption: Granin (Jim Ward)

GRANIN

I am the foremost weapons scientist in the Soviet Union, and the head of the glorious Granin Design Bureau.
Granin puffs out his chest. It bears the Order of Lenin.

GRANIN

This is the Order of Lenin. It is an honor of the greatest magnitude, given along with the title of "hero of socialism" to only the finest workers. It was awarded to me in recognition of my brilliant contributions to society.

GRANIN

Since the Great Patriotic War, I have created countless weapons in the service of our great communist society. It was thanks to me that we were able to stamp out the Nazi scum.
Granin gestures with his eyes to a model and materials belonging to a ballistic missile system.

GRANIN

It was I who created the basic design for the mobile ballistic missile system you know and fear as SS-1C.
After finishing his breathless spiel, Granin takes another swig of vodka.

SNAKE

You're crocked, aren't you?
Granin removes his mouth from the flask. He didn't manage to swallow all the vodka—some runs down his face onto his neck and chest.

GRANIN

I am merely drowning my sorrow. Because of him, I've got nothing to do but sit here and drink this crap.

SNAKE

Him?

GRANIN

Sokolov! It's him you're looking for, isn't it?

GRANIN

Because of him, I have been stripped of my authority. My research has come to nothing. Look!
Granin takes documents out of the desk and shows them to Snake one after the other. Since the cutscene is focused on Snake, we normally only see the back of the papers, but if the player presses the First Person View button, they can see blueprints for Metal Gear-like bipedal machines (the original MSX Metal Gear, RAY, etc.). Maybe there are also photos of outlandish designs that failed bipedal testing in spectacular fashion?

GRANIN

It is a revolutionary mobile nuclear missile system... a bipedal tank...

SNAKE

A bipedal tank?

GRANIN

Yes, a walking tank - a robot!
Inside the room is a model of RAY2 and a model (illustration) of Jehuty3, etc. There are also photos or models of space rockets. These can be seen if the player pans over in First Person View. There's even a model or drawing of REX2.

GRANIN

Are you familiar with the theory of the missing link between apes and humans?

GRANIN

Well, this technology will be the missing link between infantry and artillery. A kind of metal gear, if you will. And this magnificent metal gear will mark a revolutionary step forward in weapons development!

SNAKE

Metal Gear...

GRANIN

But I won't be used so easily. No, no crying myself to sleep. For you see, I'm going to send these documents to my friend in the United States.
Granin shows Snake a photo (newspaper article) of an American friend. The article is about a "Dr. Emmerich." The player can see it if they go into First Person View.

SNAKE

What!?

GRANIN

These bastards will live to regret this. And when they themselves become the targets of my creation, they will know my true greatness!

GRANIN

Yes, Sokolov's pathetic Shagohod pales in comparison to my work! What are you going to do with a rocket engine on a tank?

SNAKE

About Sokolov...

GRANIN

*not listening* A tank does not need a rocket! It needs something else... Look at these! *gestures to his feet*

SNAKE

*looks at them* Nice shoes...

GRANIN

No!!
Granin smacks his leg and starts walking slowly.

GRANIN

Legs!! Legs that allow it to go anywhere!! Just as when humans learned to walk upright! THAT is the real revolution in weaponry! Don't you agree!?

SNAKE

...

GRANIN

But the fools in charge chose Sokolov.

SNAKE

And where is Sokolov?

GRANIN

*not listening* My project has been terminated. The Philosophers' Legacy has been handed over to him.

SNAKE

What the hell are you talking about?
Meeting Granin
Movie Cutscene 1
(Shinkawa Theater)
Treasures hidden away by the Nazis, like paintings, gold bullion, and other historical inheritances. Footage shot during the Second World War.
Volgin's father... and Volgin killing him.
Editor's Note: This sequence wasn't used. In the release version, paper materials and an illustration of Volgin's father appear instead.

GRANIN

The Philosophers' Legacy. Haven't you heard of the Philosophers? The Colonel has inherited their immense legacy. Volgin's father was in charge of the Philosophers' money laundering activities. In the confusion of the war, he somehow ended up with their treasure. And Volgin inherited that treasure illegally.

GRANIN

We never need to worry about the military budget. The development costs at our facility are all paid out of the Colonel's deep pockets. The weapons born here will be the genes for creating an entirely new form of warfare! The funding for my research came out of that legacy... CAME out of it.

GRANIN

Now, my money, my men - all have been diverted to the Shagohod project. Tomorrow, they will be conducting the final test. While Sokolov is making the final preparations in the weapons factory at Volgin's main base, the great fortress of Groznyj Grad, here I am playing host to an enemy spy and drinking myself into a stupor.

SNAKE

That's where they moved Sokolov?

GRANIN

Yes.

SNAKE

And the Shagohod is there, too?

GRANIN

Of course.
Meeting Granin
3D Cutscene 2
3D cutscene (Granin - night - change view button available)
Snake is about to leave.

GRANIN

Hey!

GRANIN

... You're not thinking of going to Groznyj Grad?
Granin talks to Snake's back as he walks out.

GRANIN

Are you mad? It's an impenetrable fortress!

SNAKE

I'm sure it is.

GRANIN

You'll be killed!

SNAKE

I'll take my chances.

GRANIN

Wait!
Snake turns around.

SNAKE

*irritated* What?

GRANIN

Listen to me, you fool! I want to help you!

SNAKE

*suspicious* Help me?

GRANIN

*shrugs shoulders* To thank you for your compliment.

SNAKE

What compliment?
Granin shows Snake his shoes.

GRANIN

My shoes. Tatyana gave them to me. I wanted to thank you for complimenting me on them.
The shoes seem out of place for a man like Granin, who doesn't concern himself with appearances. (They have a transmitter in them.)

GRANIN

I'll tell you how to get into the fortress... In return, I ask only that you get that idiot out of there and destroy the Shagohod.

SNAKE

...
Granin takes Snake's silence as acceptance of this deal.

GRANIN

There is an underground tunnel that runs around the perimeter of the fortress. You should be able to use it to sneak into the base. Head for the mountains. The entrance to the tunnel is located there.
He takes out a key.
Granin walks up to Snake as he speaks.

GRANIN

Take this.
He gives Snake the key. Snake accepts it.
Meeting Granin
3D Cutscene 3
3D cutscene (change view button unavailable)
Video of the locked door in the mangrove base.

GRANIN

You passed through a warehouse on your way here, didn't you?

SNAKE

Yeah.

GRANIN

There should have been a locked door inside of it. Do you remember it?

SNAKE

...

GRANIN

This key... will open that door.

GRANIN

Beyond that door lies a vast jungle. You can climb up into the mountains from the far end of the jungle.

GRANIN

Go back to the warehouse. Use the key to open the locked door and head for the mountains. Got it?
Meeting Granin
3D Cutscene 4
3D cutscene (Granin - night - change view button available)
We're back in Granin's room.

SNAKE

Why are you helping me?

GRANIN

Unlike Sokolov, the thought of defecting has never once crossed my mind.

GRANIN

I love... my country. I love this land.

GRANIN

I cannot even imagine living anywhere else.
Granin looks down at the medals on his chest.

GRANIN

I wish to remain a hero... of the great motherland. I cannot bear the thought of being hounded into a corner and left to waste away...
Outside the window, it's now light out.

GRANIN

It is already dawn. You must hurry. I will remain here and nurse my troubles for a little longer.
Snake heads for the door.
Just as he gets there, Granin raises his flask of vodka in a toast wishing Snake success.

GRANIN

To capitalism!
Snake leaves.
Snake departs the lab. To make it to the mountains, he heads back to the mangrove base, but before he can get there, he is ambushed in the jungle.
The Fear Appears
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (trap jungle - afternoon - change view button available)
Snake navigates the jungle, when all of a sudden, a bolt from a blowgun pierces his thigh!

SNAKE

*groans*
Snake falls to his knees. He looks in the direction the bolt came from.
Against the trees and mist, he sees the stealth camouflage outline of a figure moving from tree to tree like the wind.
Snake tracks the figure as he falls to the ground and attempts to pull out the bolt.
The sharp pain is too much for Snake.

SNAKE

*groans*
The presence travels to the main area in front of Snake.
The bolt Snake was shot with is dipped in an anesthetic (poison). His consciousness starts to fade.
A man (a figure) with long arms and legs drops down without a sound. He moves like a spider.
The man materializes as he descends to the ground. He's holding his blowgun (called William Tell).
We get a quick peek at his long tongue (which he uses for picking up items). The tip is forked.

THE FEAR

I am The Fear...
Caption: Spider Soldier - The Fear (Michael Bell)

THE FEAR

That bolt is coated in the venom of the Brazilian Wandering Spider. Soon a most exquisite pain will engulf your entire body. Your limbs will be paralyzed, your lungs cease to draw breath, eventually your heart will stop beating.
The Brazilian wandering spider is the most venomous species of spider in the world. Para-Medic will give the player more details.
Snake looks worried. The controller starts to vibrate in time with his convulsions, so all other rumble features will be disabled for this part of the game.

THE FEAR

Ah, but what fun would that be? Not a fitting death at all.
The Fear puts William Tell away.
The Snake shakes his head to try to keep it together.

SNAKE

Grr... *fiercely encouraging himself*

THE FEAR

The Boss' apprentice... I will give you fear such as you've never experienced before. Come into my web.
The Fear dislocates the joints in his arms and legs (turning them into reverse joints) and skitters along the ground.

THE FEAR

It is time... for you to feel the fear!
He then slinks up a tree like a spider! His movements are decidedly unhuman.
After a fierce battle, Snake defeats The Fear.
The Fear Dies
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (trap jungle - afternoon - change view button available)
The Fear swings down from the air. Wires, wrapped around surrounding trees, extend from his body. They become taught, suspending The Fear's body in midair. He resembles a spider that has returned to its nest.

THE FEAR

The fear! The fear!! I see it!! The fear!
The Fear lets out his parting words in a mighty shout as he explodes, leaving no trace of him behind! His bolts shoot out, lodging themselves into every nook of the area (trees and the ground)!
Having eliminated The Fear, Snake heads straight for the mountains. He uses the key he got from Granin to open the locked door. Another vast jungle extends before him. He then gets a call from EVA.
Entering Moss Jungle
Radio Call 1

EVA

Snake, are you there?

SNAKE

EVA? Where are you?

EVA

In the fortress - in Groznyj Grad. Dr. Sokolov is here, too.

SNAKE

Is he all right?

EVA

He's fine. Right now he's busy putting the finishing touches on the Shagohod.

SNAKE

Good. That means they haven't killed him...

EVA

Not yet, anyway. But you better hurry. They've already finished the Phase 2 tests.

EVA

Once the final preparations are complete, they'll have no more use for him.

EVA

The Colonel won't have any qualms about killing him if he thinks the CIA is closing in.

SNAKE

EVA, you can't let Sokolov out of your sight.

EVA

I know. Snake, do you know where Groznyj Grad is?

SNAKE

Granin told me that I should be able to get there from the mountains to the north through an underground tunnel...

EVA

Granin told you?

SNAKE

Yeah. He even gave me the key to the warehouse.

EVA

Why?

SNAKE

Because he was drunk, I guess.

EVA

You've got to be kidding me.

SNAKE

Hell if I know.

EVA

Snake, there's one problem with that route.

SNAKE

What problem?

EVA

The mountain entrance to the underground tunnel that leads to the fortress is sealed. You need a key to get in.

SNAKE

A key... What about the key Granin gave me?

EVA

That key won't work.

EVA

But don't worry. I'll figure something out.
Radio Miniscreen: Video of the ruins.

EVA

I have an idea. There are some ruins at the top of the mountains. Meet me there.

SNAKE

The top of the mountains. Got it.
*If The End is still alive

EVA

Wait. There's something else I've got to tell you.

SNAKE

Now what?

EVA

I heard that one of the Cobras is waiting for you in the jungle at the foot of the mountains. He's a legendary sniper called The End.

SNAKE

... Yeah, I've seen him before. That ridiculously old guy, right?

EVA

Don't underestimate him. He's known as the father of modern sniping.

SNAKE

Is he alone? No spotter?

EVA

None. He's all by himself. Apparently, he doesn't need a spotter.

SNAKE

You can't be serious.

EVA

The entire forest is on his side...

SNAKE

The forest...

EVA

Stay alert.

SNAKE

Yeah. I'd hate to have it be the end for me.
-->The End Appears 3D Cutscene 1
*If The End is dead

EVA

Wait. There's something else I've got to tell you.

SNAKE

What's that?

EVA

I heard that the Ocelots have set up an ambush for you in the jungle at the foot of the mountains. Apparently, they've even got snipers positioned there.

SNAKE

An ambush...

EVA

Watch yourself.
-->Meeting EVA in the Mountains 3D Cutscene 1
Snake advances through the thick jungle to get to the mountains. He soon enters the forest where ancient sniper The End is waiting to ambush him.
The End Appears
3D Cutscene 1
Snake sets foot into The End's forest.
In the middle of the dense, mysterious woodland, he stops, sensing some unusual presence, and looks around.
If the player enters First Person View, they see a flash of The End's location?

SNAKE

*sensing bloodlust*
The first hint appears in this cutscene. The player has to use the surrounding visuals to imagine where The End is hiding. If they press the First Person View Button at this point, the game switches to camera POV. Or, they can pan the camera to a certain degree. Panning the camera gives them a good idea of the forest's layout. They'll imagine that he's probably on an area of high ground.
Editor's Note: In the release version, the camera flies from Snake's location to where The End lies in wait.
The End is asleep in his sniping position. He's wearing a ghillie suit, enabling him to blend into the forest completely. The player shouldn't notice him at all at first. His face is glued to the ground, resting on his left side. We hear the faint sound of his snoring.

THE END

*faint snore*
Insects and a snake crawl on The End's body and face, but still, he doesn't move a muscle. Emma's parrot (the same bird Emma keeps as a pet in MGS2) perches on the old man's shoulder. He senses Snake approaching. The End stops snoring and opens his eyes. In languid fashion, he brings the scope of his rifle to his right eye. It bulges out of its socket, almost like it's about to pop out. He moves the fingers in his hands a little, loosening up his muscles.
Over The End's shoulder, we see Snake looking around off in the distance.
The End mutters to the spirits of the forest. Initially, his voice is so feeble it sounds as though he could expire at any moment.

THE END

I beg of you, grant me the strength to take this final prey. Let me linger in this world just a little longer.
The End closes his eyes as if saying a silent prayer. The old man's body is then bathed in sunlight filtering through the trees. The light restores his energy. The moss on his body becomes a more vibrant green too. He opens his eyes again and mutters some more.

THE END

I have already slept enough for one lifetime... enough for an eternity.

THE END

You have my thanks.
When he speaks, his dentures slip out of his mouth, making it harder for him to talk. His face is covered with age spots, pockmarks, and deep wrinkles, but they start to disappear. The old man regains some of his youthfulness before our eyes.

THE END

I have to thank you... for waking me.

THE END

If you (Snake) hadn't shown up, my sleep... would have been eternal.
As he becomes younger, his voice becomes louder and stronger.
Emma's parrot flies off elsewhere in the forest. If the player captures it, it will reveal the old man's location. He gets up with vigor. His frame now presents the image of a muscular youth.

THE END

Do you hear me, Snake? I am The End! I am here to send you to your ultimate fate! You'll make a fine quarry for my final hunt!
Caption: Ancient Sniper - The End (Grant Albrecht)
The old man brings his eye to the scope. It pops out.
He remains absolutely still.
Snake hears his voice. He looks up at the forest. The trees laugh, mocking him.
The woodland returns to silence.
Snake ducks behind a tree and uses his radio.
The End Appears
Radio Call 1

SNAKE

EVA, I found that sniper you were talking about.

EVA

That's The End. He's a legend, known as the "Father of Sniping."

SNAKE

I've got experience sniping in urban (MGS1) and marine (MGS2) environments...

EVA

What about the forest?

SNAKE

Never.

EVA

I see... Well, that forest is divided into three areas: a river, a plateau, and a clearing... He should be lying in wait for you in one of those places.

SNAKE

Sounds like this may take awhile.

EVA

It'll be a test of endurance. Be careful, though. From what I've heard, The End has an almost supernatural knack for camouflaging himself.

SNAKE

So whoever moves first, loses... This guy's over a hundred years old, though, so I should have the advantage in terms of stamina.

EVA

I wouldn't be so sure if I were you.

SNAKE

Why's that?

EVA

I've heard that his body is photosynthetic, like a plant.

SNAKE

What is he, some kind of monster?

EVA

On top of that, he can speak to the forest too.

SNAKE

So in other words, he knows it inside out?

EVA

Uh huh. But he doesn't know you. I'm sure you can beat him.

SNAKE

Don't worry. I intend to...
*If 2 weeks of real time pass-->Outcome 1: The End Dies of Old Age Cutscene
*If player saves and quits in same area that The End is in-->Outcome 2: Snake Dies During Break Cutscene
*If Snake is shot with a tranquilizer round and loses consciousness-->Outcome 3: Snake Tranquilizer Round Sleep Cutscene
*If player defeats The End-->Outcome 4: The End Dies Cutscene
[Outcome 1]
After the battle with The End starts, if the player saves, quits, and doesn't resume for 2 weeks of real time, The End will die of old age, and the player will come upon his body.
The End Dies of Old Age
3D Cutscene 1
Snake crouch walks, carefully making his way through the forest.
He spots The End in his sniping posture.
Snake slowly approaches him from behind.

SNAKE

Drop your weapon.
The End doesn't answer. He doesn't move an inch.
Snake cautiously moves closer.

SNAKE

Drop your weapon!
The End still doesn't budge.
Snake gets right up to him and touches his shoulder. The instant he does so, The End topples to the ground face forward.
Snake carefully turns his body over.
We see the face of The End, dead from old age, a look of disappointment still on his face.
Snake contacts the Major.
The End Dies of Old Age
Radio Call 1

SNAKE

Major, I found The End. He's dead.

ZERO

What the hell happened?

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe... it was from old age.

ZERO

You mean he kicked the bucket in the middle of a battle?

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe...

ZERO

Well, Snake, the victory is yours.

SNAKE

... No, I don't think so.

ZERO

Wha do you mean?

SNAKE

It was his dying wish to fight me. But I disappointed him...

ZERO

Snake, listen to yourself. This is a mission. It's not a game; it's not a sport. You think you're competing for the gold at Tokyo or something?

SNAKE

... I guess you're right...

ZERO

Just focus on completing the mission.

SNAKE

... Yes, sir.
The End Dies of Old Age
3D Cutscene 2
When the call is over, Snake walks away from The End's body.
As Snake he does so, The End's body explodes in a massive blast (just like the other Cobras).
[Outcome 2]
During the battle with The End, if the player saves and quits the game and a certain amount of time passes, The End will shoot them immediately after they load back into the game—regardless of whether or not they were in the same area as The End when they quit. After the cutscene showing The End shooting Snake plays, the next time the player loads the game, they have to retry from Granin's lab.
Create a cutscene for each of the three areas The End battle takes place in, or move player to a particular area?
Editor's Note: In the release version, this cutscene takes place in a fixed area.
The End Battle - Take a Break & Die
3D Cutscene 1
Snake is lying against a tree with his eyes shut.
Small creatures (like butterflies and snakes) move around in the space near him. The atmosphere is very tranquil and peaceful. We hold on this for a moment.
Suddenly, Snakes eyes open, and he goes to get up.
An instant later, a gunshot. Snake falls.
The camera flies over to where The End was in hiding.
We see The End, in his sniping posture. Gunpowder smoke rises from the barrel of his gun.
He pulls his eye back from his scope and mutters.

THE END

You disappoint me, young Snake...

THE END

The moment you close your eyes on the battlefield is the moment you never open them again.

THE END

That's why I don't sleep here...
The End comes over to where Snake lies on the ground. He looks down at him.
He carries Snake on his shoulders and starts walking.
Snake wakes up in a cell in Granin's lab.
[Outcome 3]
During an intense battle with The End, Snake is struck by one of his tranquilizer rounds and loses consciousness.
The End Battle - Shot by a Tranquilizer
3D Cutscene 1
Snake lies on the ground after passing out from the tranquilizer round.
The End stands beside him.

THE END

Reckless boy... You don't deserve to meet your fate just yet.
He carries Snake on his shoulders and starts walking.
Snake wakes up in a cell in Granin's lab.
[Outcome 4]
After a hard-fought battle, Snake at last emerges victorious in the sniper duel with The End.
The End Dies
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button unavailable)
Cutscene in which The End dies. Camera moves to him.
The End lies on the ground, holding his sniper rifle in his hands. He whispers to the spirits of the forest.

THE END

Spirits of the forest... I thank you. The Boss... would be proud of you... The time has come... for a younger generation to rise...
The old man's essence disappears, as though his body were deflating.

THE END

I've been wandering for more than a century, and now my journey comes to a close. What a splendid way... to end it all...
His ghillie suit withers and turns to autumn colors.

THE END

I have no regrets. I can return to the forest at last...
The End's dentures shoot out of his mouth. He then explodes in a massive blast, the folds of his ghillie suit dancing like falling leaves.
Birds (insects?) scatter from the trees all at once.
When the pieces of The End's ghillie suit have disappeared, vitality returns to the forest.
Fish swim upstream. Birds and other sounds of the woodland can be heard.
The residents of the forest weep as they mourn The End's passing.
The vines that were blocking the exit from the forest recede in a matter of seconds. (The player can pass through here from this point on.)
Having triumphed over The End and made it through the jungle, Snake begins his ascent up the mountains.
After reaching the summit of the tallest peak, he heads inside some ruins to meet up with EVA.
Meeting EVA at Mountaintop
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button available)
Snake enters the ruins.
He nears noises. He heads over, and ends up walking in on EVA changing.
She speaks calmly, and makes no effort to cover herself up.

EVA

Well, that was quick.
Snake studies her back. It's covered with scars from torture. Burns and cuts. Some look pretty old too. Volgin interrogated her (and he has various kinks).
EVA changes into her bike suit. We see how she looks as EVA, her hair still up and her glasses still on. She puts her coat away in a hurry, and hides her military boots too. She lets down her bangs with her hands. Emphasis on the close-up of her bangs, her military coat, her boots, and her glasses. The boots have an interesting feature—her bike's shift pedal has etched an "E" into the instep of the left boot.
Editor's Note: In the release version, EVA is more or less done changing, but her hiding of the boots is emphasized.
EVA looks quite tired. Playing the double roles of Tatyana the mistress and EVA leaves her almost no time for sleep.

SNAKE

You look like you could use some rest.

EVA

I'll be fine. It's just that playing these two roles hasn't left me much time to sleep.

SNAKE

Where'd you get those cuts?

EVA

The Colonel...

SNAKE

He found out!?

EVA

If he knew, I'd be dead already... No, this is his "hobby." He's a sadist. He gets pleasure out of making people suffer. He's scum... (and an asshole)
Snake gently touches one of the scars with his fingertips.

EVA

*laughs* Does it look that strange to you?

SNAKE

No, I'm the same way... scars all over.
EVA turns to Snake and places a hand on his fatigues.

EVA

Can I see?

SNAKE

No.
Snake pulls back and changes the subject.
He points at one of EVA's old scars.

SNAKE

Where'd you get this one?

EVA

I got it after defecting to the Soviet Union.

SNAKE

I don't think so. It's older than that. Code breaking is a desk job. Where'd you get this kind of scar?
EVA, realizing Snake has doubts about her fake background, tries to deflect.

EVA

You really want to know?

SNAKE

...

EVA

Well, too bad.

SNAKE

*look of dissatisfaction* ...

EVA

A girl's got to have some secrets, you know.

EVA

But enough about that. You've got to get going. The Phase 2 trial of the Shagohod is about to start. And it looks like someone might be coming to spoil the party.

SNAKE

Khrushchev?

EVA

His forces are on their way here. The colonel is gathering his troops together to meet them. If we don't get a move on, the security will be even tighter than it is now...
EVA gives Snake the key to the underground tunnel that leads inside the gate.

EVA

You'll need this key. It unlocks the door to the underground tunnel. Once you're in there, you can follow the tunnel to get inside Groznyj Grad.
*If player hasn't acquired the Night Vision Goggles yet
EVA also gives Snake a pair of Night Vision Goggles.

EVA

Better take these, too. They should come in handy.
Depending on the difficulty, she'll give Snake food (instant noodles) too.

EVA

And take this, too.

SNAKE

What is it?

EVA

The food of the future. A well-balanced meal for the space age.
Snake takes the food (instant noodles).

EVA

It's good to eat some real food once in a while. I'll bet if I kissed you, you'd taste like a wild beast.
Meeting EVA at Mountaintop
3D Cutscene 2
This cutscene takes place inside the base.
It shows the situation in the base, the location where Sokolov is being held, how to get there, the runway, the Shagohod, and its hangar.

SNAKE

Do you know where exactly in Groznyj Grad Sokolov is located?

EVA

He's in the heart of the fortress, the weapons lab.

EVA

The weapons lab is divided into three wings.

EVA

There's the east wing, which houses the research facilities.

EVA

Then there's the main wing, where the weapons are assembled. That's where the Shagohod is.

EVA

Finally, there's the west wing, which is connected via a passageway to the main building. That's where Sokolov is. To get in, you'll have to enter the main wing from the east wing. Then, go through the passageway on the second floor of the main wing...

SNAKE

The west wing of the weapons lab. Got it.

EVA

There's just one problem.

SNAKE

Not again...

EVA

The west wing is protected by the highest level of security. You need to be colonel class to get in.

SNAKE

Colonel class?

EVA

Here, look at this picture.
EVA shows Snake a photo of Volgin and Major Raikov side by side.
The photo (an illustration) is shown full-screen without any load time.
They're both smiling. We don't see this since it's happening out of frame, but Volgin has his hand on Raikov's crotch.

EVA

Major Ivan Raidenovitch Raikov. Pretend you're him.

SNAKE

How do I do that?
Fade out-->return to base cutscene without any load time.
Raikov walks through the hangar (research wing). Soldiers salute.

EVA

Steal his clothes! You look similar from behind, so they won't know the difference. Your face might be a problem, so you'll just have to figure something out.

EVA

He should be somewhere in the east wing.
Game loads back to the room Snake and EVA are in.
Meeting EVA at Mountaintop
3D Cutscene 3
Camera is back in the ruins.

SNAKE

All right. But how am I supposed to escape once I get Sokolov out of there? Command said you're supposed to have something ready for me.

EVA

And I do. There's a lake 30 miles north of here. I hid a WIG there.

SNAKE

A WIG?

EVA

It's a state-of-the-art ground effect vehicle.

SNAKE

A ground effect vehicle? I can't fly one of those!

EVA

That's okay. I happen to be an excellent pilot.

SNAKE

Taking off from a lake is trickier than it looks. It's not like riding a motorcycle. You've got to be more delicate...

EVA

Of course I will. You've seen how good I am with the bike, right?

SNAKE

...
Snake looks at EVA's boots. Her heavy foot with the clutch has etched an "E" into the instep of her left boot. Snake's seen how she handles a bike, and it doesn't inspire confidence.

SNAKE

Right... You handle the escape, then. I'll head for Groznyj Grad.

EVA

Wait a minute. There's something I wanted to ask you.

SNAKE

What?

EVA

What's the story between you and The Boss?

SNAKE

She was like a mother... and my master.

EVA

And your lover?

SNAKE

... It went deeper than that.

EVA

Deeper?

SNAKE

Half of me belongs to The Boss.

EVA

Do you love her?

SNAKE

No, nothing like that.

EVA

Do you hate her?

SNAKE

Does it have to be one or the other - love or hate?

EVA

Between a man and a woman? You bet.

SNAKE

For ten years, we lived and died together. You couldn't possibly understand.

EVA

And you think you can kill her now?
The thought of this makes Snake depressed.

EVA

That's your mission, isn't it? Assassinating The Boss.
Neither of them says anything for about 30 seconds. Long take.

EVA

Snake, is there anyone you like? Someone special? (A line Meryl says in MGS1.)

SNAKE

I've never been interested in other people's lives...

EVA

You were interested in The Boss.

SNAKE

She was different.

EVA

Really. How do you feel about me?

SNAKE

I should be asking you the same question.

EVA

Me? I can fall in love - if it's part of the mission. Even with you...
EVA unzips her coveralls all the way.
She comes in for a kiss.
Snake doesn't reject it, but he doesn't entirely accept it either.
This irritates EVA.

EVA

Snake?

EVA

*breathing as she engages in a one-sided kissing*

EVA

What's wrong?
Sound of shooting in the distance? (It's Volgin's fists.) It echoes like a shot in the mountains.
Snake and EVA go to the summit to see what's going on in the base.
Meeting EVA at Mountaintop
3D Cutscene 4
EVA's bike she used to get here is parked at the summit. This high ground offers an unobstructed view of the entire fortress.

EVA

See you 'round, Snake. Take care of yourself.

SNAKE

What about you?

EVA

I've got to hurry back and play my... other part.

SNAKE

Are you going to be OK?

EVA

Not sure... they're not stupid, and they know there's a spy. There's no way you could have gotten this far all by yourself.
EVA gets on her motorcycle and descends the steep slopes of the mountains.
She glides down, maintaining her balance as though she were riding a mountain bike.
But she's left behind her military boots (which she's using for her disguise) in the ruins.

SNAKE

*goes to call out to her*
However, EVA is already out of sight.
Editor's Note: This sequence isn't in the release version. EVA still forgets her boots, but Snake doesn't seem to notice this.
Meeting EVA at Mountaintop
3D Cutscene 5
Daytime. Snake goes over to the edge of the cliff and studies the base through his binoculars.
Binoculars POV.
Snake looks at EVA going down the slope on her bike, then pans over to the base.
The front gate is impregnable, with guards everywhere, not to mention rows of tanks, armored vehicles, military trucks, etc.
Group after group of tanks have gathered from the main road. Snake looks beyond the main entrance. He sees a runway with a WIG parked on it. He can also see the Shagohod's hangar (shaped like kamboko), the design building, etc. Soldiers, scientists, armored vehicles, jeeps, and motorcycles move about the vast base, which is divided by fences.
Editor's Note: In the release version, these images, including that of the WIG, were cut. Only two rows of tanks are seen.
Hearing more gunfire, Snake looks back at the front of the base. In front of the main gate, a man is punching a metal drum repeatedly.
Cinematic POV.
With every Bullet Punch, a loud gunshot booms, and the drum shakes violently. Smoke rises from the man's fists. The drum is full of holes. Blood runs out from underneath it.
The man delivers another Bullet Punch!

VOLGIN

*yells*
Volgin sends the drum flying, and out pops the body of Granin, who is scarcely recognizable.
Ocelot makes his entrance.

OCELOT

Colonel, did he talk?

VOLGIN

No, he died before I could get it out of him.

OCELOT

He wasn't the spy, then?
Volgin grabs one of Granin's shoes and twists at its heel.
It rotates out, revealing a transmitter inside.

VOLGIN

Look at this.

OCELOT

A transmitter?

VOLGIN

Exactly. Planted to keep someone informed of his location.
Volgin destroys the transmitter with an electrical arc. It smokes.

OCELOT

But... does this mean Granin was the spy?

VOLGIN

Perhaps he was being used by someone else.

OCELOT

Perhaps? This man was our comrade!

VOLGIN

Comrade or not, he is of no use to us now.

OCELOT

I don't approve of your methods!

VOLGIN

I don't need your approval. I'm in command here.

OCELOT

... and that nuclear shell...

VOLGIN

Still feeling sore about that, are you? What are you gonna do, report it to the authorities?
Ocelot sours.

VOLGIN

This is war, Major. A Cold War, fought with information and espionage.

VOLGIN

We must root out spies wherever they hide.

VOLGIN

It is kill or be killed.

VOLGIN

Potential threats must be weeded out.

VOLGIN

Your feelings are a menace to the unity of our organization.

VOLGIN

Someone is guiding the enemy's hand.

VOLGIN

A single man can only accomplish so much.

VOLGIN

Make no mistake, there is a spy among us.

OCELOT

But casting suspicion on our own comrades... (He's a spy for the Khrushchev faction.)

VOLGIN

The C3 explosives have been stolen.
These will be planted in the hangar and on the bridge. EVA stole them.

OCELOT

You think it was the American?

VOLGIN

No, he could not have reached this fortress yet.

OCELOT

Then who?
The Boss makes her entrance.

THE BOSS

I'd be careful about suspecting your own men.

VOLGIN

Boss?
EVA returns in a hurry.

OCELOT

Where have you been?
Ocelot has suspicions about her.
Over EVA's shoulder, we see The Boss address Volgin.

THE BOSS

The Fear and The End have fallen.
She tosses one of The Fear's bow guns (Little Joe) to the ground.
Ocelot picks it up.

VOLGIN

Damn it!
Volgin inflicts another Bullet Punch on the nearby metal drum! It contorts even further, and smoke rises from it!

VOLGIN

CIA dog!

VOLGIN

That leaves only The Fury... How can the legendary Cobras be beaten so easily...?

OCELOT

*spellbound, inadvertently letting his true feelings out* He's good...
Ocelot spins Little Joe with his right hand.
Volgin glares at him.

VOLGIN

Fallen for him?
The Boss approaches her white horse.

THE BOSS

Don't worry. I'll take care of him.
She gently pats her horse's neck, grabs the reins, and gets on
Volgin nods and speaks.

VOLGIN

What is he after? It must be more than just Sokolov.
From horseback, The Boss looks up at the cliff (up at Snake) as she answers.

THE BOSS

America is out to destroy the Shagohod and get its hands on your inheritance... the Philosophers' Legacy.
Volgin recoils.

VOLGIN

Impossible! The Legacy... it...
A clap of thunder!

THE BOSS

And they're out to kill me as well... Colonel, tighten the security on this place. He's coming here — I'm sure of it!
The Boss rears her horse. It lets out a big neigh.

THE BOSS

I'm going to get the Davy Crockett!
The Boss races off on her Andalusian.
Back to binoculars POV.
Snake follows The Boss with his binoculars. The Sorrow is riding on the back of her horse.
Cinematic POV.
Volgin looks up at the sky. He's worried about rain.
He walks away, leaving EVA behind.
Ocelot, looking bored, makes for a nearby building.
But just as he is about to walk past EVA from behind, he stops.

OCELOT

Mm?
He sniffs. An anxious EVA takes a step back.

OCELOT

*sniffs*

OCELOT

Perfume? (He's smelled it somewhere before.)
Ocelot approaches EVA and studies her up and down. He spins Little Joe in his right hand.

OCELOT

Hmm... (He can't remember where.)
EVA is still wearing the high-laced boots she uses for riding her motorcycle. She didn't have time to change.
Or maybe she's still wearing her goggles around her neck; that would be fine.
Ocelot points the tip of the bolt loaded into Little Joe right at the side of EVA's neck.

OCELOT

Nice boots. Make sure you polish them up properly.
The letter "E" has been etched by the shift pedal into the instep of EVA's left bike boot? It’s caused by either the rough way she rides, or the particular way she changes gears.
Ocelot departs, much to EVA's relief.
Back to binoculars POV.
EVA heads back inside the base too.
Footnotes
1There is a scene in MGS1 where Ocelot utters the same parting shot.
2REX and RAY are both names for Metal Gears. REX appears in MGS1, RAY in MGS2.
3A mecha that appears "Zone of the Enders: The 2nd Runner."
Radio Conversations
•Major
Prior to Reaching Relay Station
After Ocelot Unit battle - head for the crevice

ZERO

It looks like you've got rid of all of the Ocelots.

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

Now, proceed with the rescue of Sokolov. According to EVA, you should start by going to the crevice to the north and...

SNAKE

Can we trust her?

ZERO

What's that?

SNAKE

EVA is with the KGB, isn't she? Can I really believe what she says? How do I know she won't double cross me?

ZERO

There are no guarantees in espionage, Snake. Only calculated guesses.

ZERO

At this point in time, the KGB stands nothing to gain by stabbing us in the back.

SNAKE

So you're saying I can trust her?

ZERO

I'm saying the chance that she'll betray you is low.

SNAKE

...

ZERO

Of course, we checked the route she gave you against our own data.

ZERO

It looks like a pretty solid infiltration route. It makes good use of weak spots in the enemy's defenses. You shouldn't have any problems.

ZERO

Follow the route EVA showed you and proceed with the mission.

SNAKE

Roger.
After Ocelot Unit battle - head for the crevice (2)

ZERO

First, enter the cave through the crevice. EVA said it was to the north. So head that way.
The jungle's dangerous at night

ZERO

EVA was right when she said that operating in an unknown jungle at night is extremely dangerous.

ZERO

In my former outfit, the SAS, we'd always be sure to set up camp before sunset and wait until daybreak before setting out again.

ZERO

Being able to stay in that abandoned factory made things a lot easier for you. You ought to be thanking EVA.
Adam and Eve

SNAKE

Major, what's this temptation EVA was talking about?

ZERO

In the Old Testament of the Bible, Eve was seduced by a snake into tasting the fruit of knowledge.

ZERO

By eating the forbidden fruit, Adam and Eve disobeyed God's command and were cast out from the Garden of Eden.

ZERO

Thus, it was the snake who led mankind into original sin.

SNAKE

Come to think of it, I did break a rib in the Virtuous Mission. Maybe that's where EVA came from.

ZERO

But the one who tempted Adam into eating the forbidden fruit was Eve.

ZERO

You may be working together, but she's still a KGB operative. Don't let your guard down.

SNAKE

I don't intend to.
Crocodile-infested bottomless swamp
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, be careful of that swamp.
(2)

SNAKE

What's dangerous about it?

MAJOR TOM

It's a bottomless swamp.

SNAKE

A bottomless swamp?

MAJOR TOM

Yes. The mud in that swamp is highly viscous. It will stick to your body like tar. It will be impossible for you to swim.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

If you get swallowed by the bottomless swamp, you won't be able to escape on your own.

MAJOR TOM

Once you sink down to about head-level you'll be trapped for good. Make sure you get out before that happens.
(4)

SNAKE

So, I have to make sure I don't sink too far. Got it.

MAJOR TOM

Snake, wait.

SNAKE

There's more (to look out for)?

MAJOR TOM

Yes.

SNAKE

What?

MAJOR TOM

Crocodiles.
(5)

SNAKE

Crocodiles?

MAJOR TOM

Yes.

SNAKE

Crocodiles? Like the reptile...

MAJOR TOM

That's correct. More accurately, they're Indian Gavials.

SNAKE

What are crocs doing deep in this forest?

MAJOR TOM

You'll have to ask Para-Medic about that one. Para-Medic?

PARA-MEDIC

Yes.
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

The Indian Gavial is a crocodile that originally lived in freshwater regions in India and Nepal.

SNAKE

Why are Indian crocodiles way out here?

PARA-MEDIC

They're captive crocodiles that were brought here for research purposes, but escaped and became wild again.

PARA-MEDIC

Indian Gavials are large creatures - adult males grow to over six meters in length.
(7)

PARA-MEDIC

You'll never catch one alive. Even if you use the tranquilizer gun.
(8) *before eating

SNAKE

Got it. So, how do they...

PARA-MEDIC

Taste? Yes, I did look into that. You know what they always say - tastes like chicken!

SNAKE

Sounds delicious.
(9) *after eating

SNAKE

I tried the meat - it was great!

PARA-MEDIC

Well, good for you.
(10)

PARA-MEDIC

But be careful when capturing an Indian Gavial. Normally, they're cowardly creatures, but the ones in the forest there are belligerent. Apparently they attack humans.

SNAKE

What do you mean?

PARA-MEDIC

They weren't the direct subject of any serious research, but some think they may have become violent as a side-effect of the atomic research that was conducted nearby.
Watch out for crocs

ZERO

Snake, you'll be helpless if a crocodile attacks you in the water.

ZERO

You can't see behind you when you're swimming. So if you're in a crocodile-infested swamp, keep an eye on your six.

ZERO

Also, by using your sensors, you should be able to detect crocodiles before they get too close.
Watch out with swamps

ZERO

That swamp seems pretty deep. It's probably deep enough to dive underwater and swim around.
-->Major Zero Radio Conversation: Swimming explanation (2)
Barbed wire - traps
(1)
*If player calls after getting caught in trap

ZERO

Snake, that area appears to be rigged with quite a few traps.

SNAKE

Tell me about it.

ZERO

The best way to avoid danger is to get some inside information.

SNAKE

Inside information?
(2)

ZERO

EVA is a KGB spy placed in the ranks of GRU. She probably knows a lot about what's going on. You might try asking her.
(3)

ZERO

EVA's frequency is 142.52.
(4)

ZERO

Another good way to get inside info is to capture and interrogate one of their sentries.
Electric fences
(1)

ZERO

Snake, be careful. That barbed wire is electrified, and you'll get a shock if you touch it.
(2)
*After getting intel from EVA

ZERO

Didn't EVA say that the barbed wire doesn't receive proper maintenance?
(3)

ZERO

Look carefully at the bottom of the barbed wire. There might be a gap somewhere.

ZERO

If you find an opening, crawl through it flat on the ground.
Barbed wire area - landmines
(1)

ZERO

That area is reportedly planted with Claymore mines.

ZERO

Claymores pack quite a punch. Don't risk heavy injury. Be careful.
(2)

ZERO

Claymores are not completely buried in the ground. If you look closely enough, you can tell where they've been hidden.
(3)

ZERO

You can also pick up Claymore mines by crawling over them. It'll be useful if you recover a few of the enemy's traps.
Barbed wire area - drop down from a tree

ZERO

Snake, look at that tree. See how the branches extend out to the other side of the barbed wire?

ZERO

I'll bet you could climb the tree, move from branch to branch, and drop down on the other side.
•EVA
Prior to Reaching Relay Station
Yakushima Jungle B (Chyornyj Prud)
(1)

EVA

That area is known as Chyornyj Prud. The name means something like "the black shore" in Russian.

EVA

It got its name from the deep swamp that covers the area.
(2)

EVA

The crocodiles in that swamp are extremely vicious.

EVA

Apparently, they've already chewed up a bunch of soldiers out on patrol. Now no one even dares to go near the swamp.

EVA

They said that most of the soldiers who were killed were attacked from behind while they were in the water. You be careful out there.
(3)

EVA

The crevice that leads to the cave is still a ways to the north. Keep heading that way.
Head for the crevice
(1)

EVA

The lab where Sokolov is being held is located in a mountain range known as Graniny Gorki.
(2)

EVA

First, head for the crevice, Bolshaya Past. Go north and you'll come to a relay station.
(3)

EVA

Pass north through the relay station and you'll reach the crevice. Go down through the crevice and you'll find yourself in a cave known as Chyornaya Peschera.
(4)

EVA

Once you pass through the cave, you'll come out in Ponizovje - an aqueduct that's overgrown with mangrove.
(5)

EVA

Follow the aqueduct to the north and you should arrive at a warehouse.
(6)

EVA

Pass north through the warehouse and you'll emerge in the southern part of Graniny Gorki, just south of the lab.
(7)

EVA

Start out by heading north.
Swamp - traps
*Call comes in after getting caught in trap
(1)

EVA

Snake, be careful. I might not have told you this yet, but that swamp is rigged with traps.
(2)

SNAKE

Tell me about it. (He's already gotten caught in one.)

EVA

So you know already?

SNAKE

Yeah.

EVA

Well, then you're all set. (Doesn't realize what he's getting at.)
(3)

EVA

The traps in that area are set to go off when a rope stretched along the ground is disturbed.

EVA

Keep a close eye on the ground and make sure you don't trip over a rope.
(4)

EVA

I mean, far be it for me to call you an idiot who can't avoid even the simplest of traps. But you know.

SNAKE

*disheartened* Rrgh...

EVA

What's the matter?

SNAKE

Nothing... never mind...

EVA

???
Dremuchij
*Player has to backtrack considerably for this to occur
(1)

EVA

That forest is known as Dremuchij. It means "the untouched forest" in Russian.

EVA

The name says it all - Dremuchij is a pristine jungle at the far edge of Tselinoyarsk, untouched by human hands.

EVA

The forest is so dense that large units can't penetrate it, making it a natural defense. That's why Sokolov's research facility and Groznyj Grad were built here.
(2)

EVA

... But more to the point, what are you doing all the way out there? You're not thinking of abandoning the mission are you? Get back to the north.
Dolinovodno
*Player has to backtrack considerably for this to occur
(1)

EVA

That area is called Dolinovodno. The name means "forest of the canyon."

EVA

It probably got that name from the chasm that divides the jungle in two.

EVA

The rope bridge at the center was hastily constructed to enable them to patrol Dremuchij.
(2)

EVA

Speaking of which, what are you doing all the way back there? Get back to the north, now.
Rassvet

EVA

That area is known as Rassvet. It means "dawn" in Russian.

EVA

The area got that name when the factory was first constructed.

EVA

But the factory ended up being closed down, and Tselinoyarsk was reborn as a secret research center and military fortress.

EVA

The crevice that leads to the cave is still a ways to the north. Keep heading that way.
Crevice (Bolshaya Past)

EVA

Good, you made it to Bolshaya Past.

EVA

The name Bolshaya Past means something close to "the great cavity."

EVA

It probably got that name from the crevice to the north.

EVA

There's a fortified area in the southern part of Bolshaya Past that's strung with barbed wire. To the north of that is a relay station that serves as both a depot for materials shipments and a communication facility.

EVA

The crevice leading to the cave is located to the north of the relay station. Head north.
Barbed wire - go north

EVA

The crevice that leads to the cave is to the north of your current location. Keep heading north.
Electrified barbed wire
(1)

EVA

Snake, the barbed wire in that area has a high-voltage electric current running through it.
(2)

EVA

You'll get electrocuted if you touch that barbed wire. So don't.
(3)

SNAKE

Electrified barbed wire, huh. Looks like I'll have to find another way around...

EVA

That won't be necessary.

SNAKE

It won't?

EVA

Nope.

EVA

Electrified barbed wire is a formidable barrier, but it's a pain in the neck to maintain.

EVA

Apparently it's always breaking down because wild animals keep running into it. But the word is they don't have enough personnel to fix it.
(4)

EVA

If you look closely at the bottom of the barbed wire, you should be able to spot a hole somewhere. Try crawling your way through there.
Barbed wire area - watch out for dogs

EVA

Snake, sorry if I forgot to tell you, but they've got attack dogs prowling that area. If they find you, you'll be in for a rough time.

EVA

Attack dogs are trained for fighting, and you won't be able to shake them off so easily. If they bark at you, it'll alert nearby patrols to your presence.

EVA

Be careful not to get spotted by those dogs.
Barbed wire area - clappers
(1)

EVA

Snake, that area is rigged with clappers.
(2)

SNAKE

Clappers?
(3)

EVA

That's right. Didn't I tell you already?

SNAKE

No.

EVA

Oh. It must have slipped my mind.

SNAKE

...
(4)

EVA

Clappers are a type of alarm system. It's set up so that when a rope stretched along the ground is disturbed, it makes a noise.

EVA

When a clapper goes off, the enemy will go into Alert Phase, and any nearby patrols will come and start sweeping the area.

EVA

Keep a close eye on the ground and try not to trip any ropes.
Stolen from a safe
(1)

SNAKE

EVA, about the .45 and the Mk22 you showed me...

EVA

Yeah?

SNAKE

You said you got them from a vault full of Western weapons, right?

EVA

That I did.
(2)

SNAKE

How? A vault full of secret Western technology should be under strict surveillance.

EVA

You really want to know?

SNAKE

Yeah.

EVA

Really?

SNAKE

Yes.

EVA

Well, I'm not telling anyway.

SNAKE

Why not?

EVA

It'd be a waste of time.

SNAKE

A waste of time?

EVA

Even if I explained how I did it, you'd never be able to do it yourself. (She used the power of being a woman.)

SNAKE

What does that mean?

EVA

Exactly what it sounds like.
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Relay Station
Carving a CQC grip
(1)

SIGINT

Hey Snake, remember back at the abandoned factory when you whittled the grip of that .45 down?

SNAKE

Yeah.

SIGINT

I've never heard of a customization like that before. Why the grip?

SNAKE

To fit it with a knife.

SIGINT

A knife? You're gonna keep the knife and the gun both at the ready?

SNAKE

That's the idea.

SIGINT

Why would you want to do that?

SNAKE

Sometimes a knife works better in close proximity encounters.

SNAKE

So I equip both at the same time. That way I can switch back and forth in an instant.

SIGINT

Bad ass... So that's that...

SNAKE

... CQC.
EVA's bike

SIGINT

You know that army motorcycle that EVA was riding? That's a replica of a German model.

SNAKE

A replica?

SIGINT

After World War II, the Soviets confiscated an entire assembly line from a German motorcycle factory - machines and all.

SNAKE

And then they took it back with them and started producing replicas?

SIGINT

Exactly. Originally, that motorcycle was designed to be used with a sidecar attached.

SIGINT

That means it's got enough power to drag a 200-plus pound sidecar around.

SNAKE

So that's how she could pull off all those crazy stunts. (Remembers EVA's acrobatic driving.)

SIGINT

Mm-hmm. Of course, it takes a lot of skill to be able to control that much power. That EVA chick is something else.
EVA's Mauser

SIGINT

Snake, you said EVA said her Mauser was a Type 17, right?

SNAKE

Yeah. What about it?

SIGINT

That model was produced in the 1920's in a weapons lab in the Shanxi Province in China.

SIGINT

The cartridge part sticks out lower than the original to accommodate .45 caliber rounds. The barrel and chamber are a little bit thicker, too.

SIGINT

But most telling of all, it's got Chinese characters engraved on both sides of the frame, like you saw.

SIGINT

And that firing stance EVA was talking about where you hold the gun horizontally - that's a trademark of the Chinese.

SIGINT

The gun is held horizontally, with the index finger resting along the frame and the middle finger on the trigger, as though pointing at a person with a finger.

SIGINT

Just like you were saying, when you're firing in full-auto mode, the muzzle-jump effect gives you a horizontal strafing motion.

SIGINT

They say it's especially deadly in indoor and close range mop-up actions. The Japanese called it "Bandit Shooting" and used to dread it.

SIGINT

Makes you wonder where she learned to shoot like that.
Claymore mines
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, it looks like there are Claymore mines planted all over that area.
(2)

SIGINT

Claymores are a new type of anti-personnel mine produced in America.

SIGINT

The ones you see there must have either been stolen or recovered from a battlefield in Southeast Asia.

SIGINT

And what's more, our Russian friends seem to have modified these Claymores with a special type of sensor.

SIGINT

If you get anywhere near them, BANG! - you're toast... Watch your step.
(3)

SIGINT

Claymores can be picked up by crawling over them. If you come across a minefield, try crawling through it.
Clapper traps
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, watch yourself. That area has been rigged with clappers.
(2)

SIGINT

A clapper is a kind of warning device used to detect intruders.

SIGINT

It's made of a rope stretched close to the ground with empty cans attached to it. When the rope is tripped, the cans rattle around and make a loud noise.

SIGINT

That'll probably put the enemy into Caution Phase. They'll come looking for you where the rope was tripped.

SIGINT

If you think an area's been rigged with a clapper, watch your step. If you do spot a rope, back up. Find a way around.

SIGINT

If that's too much of a pain, try rollin' over it.

SIGINT

And if, by any chance, you do happen to set off a clapper, you'd better split before the enemy gets there.
(3)

SIGINT

Of course, clappers are already pretty outdated. In the 21st century, they'll all be replaced by infrared sensors. (The trap item in previous MGS games that corresponds to the clappers is the infrared sensors.)

SNAKE

Infrared?

SIGINT

Yeah. Instead of a rope, it's an invisible beam of light that sets off an alarm when you interrupt it.

SNAKE

But there's no way to avoid something like that.

SIGINT

Nah. Every time someone comes up with a new trap, someone else comes up with a way to get around it.

SIGINT

And it's usually a lot less high-tech than the trap itself. (In MGS, the player can use cigarette smoke to see the infrared beams.)

SIGINT

After all, the best technology is worthless unless you know how to use it.
•Major
Prior to Reaching Crevice
Head north
(1)

ZERO

Good, you've reached the relay station. But stay alert. That station is an enemy strong point. The security is bound to be tight.
(2)

SNAKE

But there's no other way to get to the crevice if I don't make it through.

ZERO

Exactly.
(3)

ZERO

The crevice leading to the cave is in the north of that area. Find a way to slip past the enemy and head north.
Gun emplacements
(1)

ZERO

There's a gun emplacement installed over there.

ZERO

A gun emplacement is a grave threat in the enemy's hands, but a valuable weapon if you can occupy it.
(2)

ZERO

Stand next to a gun emplacement and press the Action Button to operate it.

ZERO

Press the Weapon Button to fire. You can use the Aim Button to zoom in on a target. Be aware, though, that the gun's ammo supply is limited.

ZERO

To move away from a gun emplacement, press the Action Button once again.
Hind explanation
(1)
*Outgoing call when near Hind parked at heliport, first time

SNAKE

Major.

ZERO

What is it?

SNAKE

That attack chopper is parked on the heliport.

ZERO

The one from before?

SNAKE

Yeah. The one that was took away the Shagohod during the Virtuous Mission.
(2)

ZERO

Perhaps it's an armed variation of the Mi-8 Hip?

SNAKE

No. Some of it looks the same, but the overall shape is different. It's got stub wings, and the cockpit canopy looks like an angular greenhouse.

SIGINT

No kidding. Then it must be some kind of new model.

SIGINT

I've heard stories recently that the Soviets are developing a "flying infantry combat vehicle." That's got to be it.

SNAKE

A flying infantry combat vehicle?

SIGINT

Yeah. A transport chopper with troop carrying capabilities.

SIGINT

Think of it as a attack-transport chopper version of France's AMX-VCI or the Soviet BMP.

SIGINT

They must be doing field tests on the initial prototype.

SNAKE

A next-generation chopper that's a little smaller than the Hip... Maybe we should call it a Hind.

SIGINT

Hmm, not bad. It's cool with me.

ZERO

Then it's settled. We'll refer to that new-type helicopter as a Hind from now on.
(3)

ZERO

The Hind you see parked at the heliport must not be ready to fly. You don't need to worry about it taking off.

ZERO

If you're going to destroy it, now might be your chance.
•EVA
Prior to Reaching Crevice
Heliport - the crevice is to the north

EVA

The crevice leading to the cave is to the north of that base. Keep heading north.
Heliport - armory and provisions storehouse
(1)

EVA

Snake, there's a provisions storehouse in the center of that area, and an armory to the northeast.

EVA

By destroying them, you should be able to cut off supplies to the enemy in that area.
(2)
*If player doesn't have an AK

EVA

I heard they've got AKs stored in the armory. You might want to check it out.
Heliport - Hind
*After seeing Hind parked at the heliport
(1)

SNAKE

EVA...

EVA

Hmm?

SNAKE

There's an attack helicopter docked at the heliport.

EVA

Oh.

EVA

It's an attack chopper currently being developed at Groznyj Grad. They're using it as a patrol craft while they conduct tests... Didn't I tell you?

SNAKE

... Uh, no.
(2)

EVA

The helicopter docked there is probably in for maintenance right now, so you won't have to worry about it taking off. If you're thinking of destroying it, now's your chance.
(3)

SNAKE

Sounds like a plan. But how?

EVA

Huh?

SNAKE

There's no way I'm going to punch through that armor with an assault rifle. Isn't there a weapon somewhere that can do some real damage?

EVA

You'll just have to figure that out yourself. (She hasn't really thought about it before.)
Heliport - Hind - escape craft

SNAKE

EVA, is that attack chopper the escape route you were talking about?

EVA

No, that thing doesn't have enough range for us to escape in.

SNAKE

So what are we going to use?

EVA

Something you've never been in before.

SNAKE

Something I've never been in?

EVA

That's right. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised. (She's secured a state-of-the-art, wing-in-ground-effect aircraft.)
Communications equipment

EVA

Snake, that base also serves as a radio relay station. If you destroy the communications equipment, that should disable radio contact to the enemy HQ.
Letting Ocelot go

EVA

Tell me something, Snake. Why did you let Ocelot get away?

SNAKE

I thought I told you already.

EVA

Because he's still a kid?

SNAKE

Yeah.

EVA

Pretty lame excuse if you ask me.

SNAKE

You think so?

EVA

Yeah, I do.

SNAKE

... Maybe you're right. (He himself doesn't really know yet why he saved him.)
The Ocelot Unit

SNAKE

EVA, what kind of unit are those Ocelots I fought a little while ago?

EVA

The Ocelot Unit is an elite group composed of soldiers hand-picked from among the ranks of Spetsnaz, the special forces wing of GRU.

EVA

They've undergone even more rigorous training than regular Spetsnaz. Their skill with weapons is the stuff of legends.

EVA

You'll find they're much better shots than the rest of GRU. Watch yourself.
Where are you, EVA?

SNAKE

EVA, where are you now?

EVA

I told you, didn't I? I'm right near the Colonel.

SNAKE

Pretty weak answer if you ask me.

EVA

I suppose you're right.

SNAKE

EVA...

EVA

Snake, I'm under orders to cooperate with you, but that doesn't mean I have to tell you everything I know.

EVA

I would assume the same applies to you, too.

SNAKE

...
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Crevice
Gun emplacements
(1)

SIGINT

Those gun emplacements are DShKs, a large-caliber machine gun officially adopted by the Soviet army in 1939.

SIGINT

The name "DShK" comes from the initials of the two creators - Degtyarev and Shpag in - plus the Russian word for large caliber.

SIGINT

They saw a lot of action in World War II. The Russians used them as anti-aircraft and anti-armor guns for position defense, vehicle turrets, and infantry support.

SIGINT

The combined weight of the gun and the emplacements is almost 350 pounds. So you can forget about picking one up and taking it with you.

SIGINT

The gun is gas-powered and capable of spitting out 550 rounds a minute on a belt-feed system.

SIGINT

Which is bad news for you when the enemy's using it.

SIGINT

Hide behind something and lob a grenade at it, or attack it from outside the emplacement's firing angle. Either way, it's not a good idea to rush at it head on.

SIGINT

Or, you might try using a smoke grenade to put up a smoke screen that'll cover your approach.
(2)

SIGINT

If you manage to get close to a gun emplacement, you can take it over by pressing the Action Button.

SIGINT

The Weapon Button controls the trigger. Beware, though - the ammo supply is limited.

SIGINT

To move away from a gun emplacement, just press the Action Button again. Use it when you need the upper hand.
Hind
*Outgoing call when near Hind parked at heliport, first time

SNAKE

Sigint.

SIGINT

What's up?

SNAKE

The chopper we were talking about is parked at the heliport.

SIGINT

The one that was hauling the Shagohod in the Virtuous Mission?

SNAKE

Yeah.
-->Major Zero Radio Conversation: Hind explanation (2)
•Major
Ocelot Battle
Ocelot battle - basics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, the only way to proceed is to fight. You have to defeat Ocelot.

ZERO

You can't jump over that crevice. And hand-to-hand combat is out of the question. You'll have to shoot it out with him.
(2)

ZERO

Take cover behind something and wait for an opening, then attack him in First Person View.
Attack when he's reloading

ZERO

Ocelot is using a revolver. Revolvers take a long time to reload when they run out of bullets.

ZERO

When he stops to reload, that's your chance to attack.
Ocelot battle - ricochets

ZERO

Ocelot can use ricochet shots to attack!? Then you won't be safe anywhere, not even behind an obstacle.

ZERO

Don't stay in one spot for too long, or you'll make yourself an easy target. Stay alert!
Ocelot battle - crevice

ZERO

Snake, you won't survive a fall into that crevice. Make sure you don't fall into it while rolling by mistake.
Ocelot battle - higher ground

ZERO

Even if Ocelot hides in a blind spot, you can still shoot him from up in the trees. If he hides from you, climb a tree and attack him from there.
Ocelot battle - a duel

ZERO

I think what Ocelot really wants is a showdown with you. As long as you keep your gun holstered, he'll probably do the same.

ZERO

This will be a quick-draw contest. You'd better have sharp reflexes. Watch Ocelot in First Person View. When you see an opening, quickly draw your gun and shoot him!
•EVA
Ocelot Battle
Ocelot battle - general
(1)

EVA

Ocelot is a force to be reckoned with. Don't even think about running away. The only way to proceed with the mission is to defeat him.
(2)

EVA

They say that Ocelot can hit targets hiding behind obstacles by using ricochet shots. Rocks and trees won't protect you.

EVA

If you stay too long in the same spot, you'll only be making yourself an easy target. Don't stand still - keep moving!
Ocelot battle - the Ocelot Unit
(1)

EVA

All the exits are being blocked by members of the Ocelot Unit. They're fiercely loyal to Ocelot.

EVA

Even if Ocelot ordered them not to get involved, they might just step in to back him up if he gets in trouble.
(2)

EVA

If you get attacked by one of the Ocelots, use a grenade or something to fight back!
Ocelot battle - Ocelot's hat

EVA

I'm not sure why, but Ocelot seems to have a thing for his cap.

EVA

You might be able to get him to let down his guard by shooting it off his head.
•Para-Medic
Ocelot Battle
Ocelot battle - hornet's nest
*If player hasn't heard information on hornet's nests before
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

It looks like there's a hornets' nest up there. If it falls down, you'll be attacked by the hornets inside.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

If you get attacked by hornets, swing your survival knife around or use a smoke grenade to drive them off. Wearing white-colored clothing can also be effective.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

You could also try throwing the hornets' nest or using a white phosphorus grenade.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

There's a hornets' nest over by Ocelot, too. If it drops on him, it might just create an opening. Try shooting it down!
Ocelot battle - serious injuries

PARA-MEDIC

Ocelot's pistol uses really powerful bullets. And he's a crack shot, too, so if he hits you you'll probably be severely wounded.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get seriously wounded, go into the Survival Viewer right away and treat it with "CURE." Got it?
Ocelot battle - Pain hornets

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

What's wrong? Are you hurt!?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

Then what?

SNAKE

These hornets won't go away.

PARA-MEDIC

The hornets?

SNAKE

Yeah. They've been flying around over my head in a figure-eight pattern and won't go away. Any idea why?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, hornets use the figure-eight dance to signal that they've found food...

SNAKE

Food?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. Like flowers or nectar...

SNAKE

What does it mean?

PARA-MEDIC

I don't know. But at least they're not attacking you, right? I think it's best to just leave them alone.

PARA-MEDIC

You've got bigger things to worry about - like Ocelot.

SNAKE

Good point.

PARA-MEDIC

You can beat him, Snake.

SNAKE

Who said I couldn't?
•Sigint
Ocelot Battle
Ocelot battle - SAA
(1)

SIGINT

That guy is using a Single Action Army. It's a six-shot, .45-caliber revolver.

SIGINT

It uses .45 Long Colts. While it's the same caliber, it's more powerful than your .45.

SIGINT

The only drawback is that because it's a revolver, it's a pain in the ass to reload.

SIGINT

Ocelot will be open to attack while he's reloading. Use that window to unload on him.
Ocelot battle - SAA (2)

SIGINT

Ocelot has two single action army revolvers. That gives him 12 bullets in all. Keep a close eye on his remaining rounds. When he stops to reload, open fire!
•Major
While Exploring Cave
Directly after falling in

ZERO

Snake, are you OK? Snake!!

SNAKE

Major...

ZERO

*relieved* Snake...

PARA-MEDIC

Are you all right? You're not hurt?

SNAKE

No. That was a hell of a drop, but I'm fine... Looks like there's no way back up though.

ZERO

I see... Well, anyway, it's good to hear you're not injured.

ZERO

Slipping and falling may not have been part of the plan, but getting into that cave was. Proceed further into the cave.
Proceed through the cave
(1)

ZERO

The cave seems to be structured like a maze, but there's an exit somewhere. Find a way out of the cave and head for the aqueduct.
(2)
*If player doesn't have the Torch and they're not using the Cigar

SNAKE

All right. But it might take me a while to get through this cave.

ZERO

Are you hurt?

SNAKE

No.

ZERO

Is it the enemy? Did they set a trap for you?

SNAKE

Not that, either.

ZERO

Then what is it?

SNAKE

It's dark in here.

ZERO

Dark?

SNAKE

Yeah. There's no light anywhere. I should have brought a flashlight with me...

ZERO

So what you're saying is that it's going to take you a while because you don't have a flashlight?

SNAKE

Right.

ZERO

Snake, if you don't have a flashlight, you should be looking for a substitute.

ZERO

I tell you, American soldiers these days rely too much on ready-made equipment.

SNAKE

*hushed voice* Here we go again...

ZERO

What was that?

SNAKE

Nothing.

ZERO

American soldiers rely too much on ready-made equipment. And not only that, they can't seem to grasp that one piece of equipment can have multiple functions.

ZERO

Back when I was in the SAS, we never had that problem. We were trained to use every piece of equipment in as many ways as possible.

ZERO

If you don't have a flashlight, look for something else. You need to develop flexible innovative thinking if you want to...

ZERO

Hey, are you listening to me?

SNAKE

Yeah, of course I am. (He isn't listening.)
(3)

ZERO

First, take a look at what you're carrying with you now. Don't you have anything that can provide you with some light?
(4)

ZERO

I know you have your cigars. You should at least be able to see the ground in front of you if you use a cigar. Try lighting one up.
Cave - what were those hornets?

ZERO

Snake, those hornets that attacked you while you were fighting Ocelot...

SNAKE

I know. They look familiar - like the ones I saw during the Virtuous Mission.

ZERO

So it was one of the Cobras?

SNAKE

That's what Ocelot was saying, too.

ZERO

... Keep your guard up.

SNAKE

I will.
•EVA
While Exploring Cave
Directly after Ocelot battle - cave
(1)

EVA

Snake, are you all right?

SNAKE

Yeah... just barely. What the hell were all those hornets...

EVA

Most likely that was The Pain, one of the Cobras.

SNAKE

I figured as much... Are they tracking me?

EVA

I don't know. The Cobras only take orders from The Boss.

EVA

Not even Volgin knows what they're really up to. So I don't know anything about them either.

SNAKE

No kidding...

EVA

I'll try and dig up as much as I can about them. You just focus on moving ahead.
(2)

EVA

Go to the end of the cave and you'll come out in an aqueduct overgrown with mangroves. This leads to the Ponizovje swamp.
(3)

EVA

And Snake... be careful. That cave...

SNAKE

... is pitch dark inside. (EVA didn't tell him about this, but he's in the cave, so he knows it's true.)

EVA

Good, I did remember to tell you, then.

SNAKE

...
(4)

EVA

If it's completely dark and you need a light, try using a torch.
(5)

EVA

I heard there's some emergency torches stored somewhere in that cave.
(6)

SNAKE

Torches. Got it. So where are they?

EVA

Huh?

SNAKE

Where are the torches?

EVA

How should I know? Go find them yourself.
Cave (Chyornaya Peschera)

EVA

That cave is known as Chyornaya Peschera.

EVA

In Russian, Chyornaya Peschera means "the black cave from which cold wind blows."

EVA

It's a magma cavern formed millions of years ago, back when Tselinoyarsk was the site of volcanic activity.

EVA

The structure of the cave is pretty complex, but you should be able to find the aqueduct if you keep moving inward. Head toward the interior of the cave.
•Major
The Pain Battle
