The Pain battle - basics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, as long as The Pain is using his hornets to protect his body, you won't be able to damage him with gun attacks.

ZERO

You'll need to use a grenade to get rid of the hornet swarm first.

ZERO

Go into First Person View and throw a grenade at him!
(2)

ZERO

The shotgun should work as well.
(3)

ZERO

Get rid of those hornets protecting him and then attack him with a gun!
The Pain battle - hornet restraints

ZERO

Snake, if The Pain's hornets stick to you, you won't be able to move freely.

ZERO

If hornets start to stick to you, take care of them before they prevent you from moving altogether. Either jump into the water, or wave your survival knife around to drive them away.

ZERO

If you become unable to move, wiggle the left analog stick and press the buttons rapidly to shake them off before you get shot. Understood?
The Pain battle - honey attack
(1)

ZERO

Snake, you've got alarm pheromones all over your clothes.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

When The Pain hits you with alarm pheromones, the hornets' attacks will become more aggressive. They'll assault you more often, so be careful.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get covered in the alarm pheromones, you should go into the Survival Viewer and change your clothes immediately.
The Pain battle - normal ways to repel hornet attacks

ZERO

The Pain seems to be directing swarms of hornets to attack you.

PARA-MEDIC

Be careful. If you're attacked by a swarm of hornets, your LIFE will steadily decrease.
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Hornet attacks – normal ways to repel
The Pain battle - bullet bees
(1) *If Snake has a hornet in his body

ZERO

Snake, bullet bees are digging into your body!
(2) *If Snake doesn't have a hornet in his body

ZERO

Snake, watch out for those bullet bees he shoots!
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: The Pain battle – bullet bees
The Pain battle - fighting in the water
(1)

ZERO

Snake, not even The Pain's special hornets can pursue you into the water. And the grenades he throws will only be half as deadly underwater.

ZERO

If you sense danger, escape by diving into the water.
(2)

ZERO

To dive underwater, press the Crawl Button while you're swimming on the surface.
(3)

ZERO

To move forward underwater, press either the CQC Button or the Crawl Button. Use the left analog stick to control your direction.

ZERO

In a pinch, you can press the Action Button to quickly rise to the surface.

ZERO

Also, handguns and rifles can be fired underwater. You can use these to attack targets above the surface as well.
The Pain battle - sentry hornets

ZERO

The Pain can utilize the hornets under his control to seek out his enemies. Being spotted by the hornets is the same as being spotted by him.

ZERO

Keep an eye out for hornets above you when you emerge from underwater!
•EVA
The Pain Battle
The Pain battle - fighting in the water

EVA

Not even The Pain's special breed of hornets will be able to follow you underwater.

EVA

You're a good swimmer, right? If you're being harassed by any hornets, dive into the water!
The Pain battle - general

EVA

The Pain has the power to control swarms of hornets at will.

EVA

Watch out for his hornet-based attacks!
•Para-Medic
The Pain Battle
Hornet attacks - normal ways to repel

PARA-MEDIC

When the hornets come to attack you, you can cause the swarm to scatter by shooting at it with your gun.

PARA-MEDIC

Also, the hornets can't follow you into the water, so you can get away by diving into the water.

PARA-MEDIC

Hornets are also vulnerable to fire and smoke.

PARA-MEDIC

You can keep them away from you by using a smoke grenade.

PARA-MEDIC

Swinging a torch around using the CQC Button should also work.
The Pain battle - hornet's nest

PARA-MEDIC

You might be able to trap some of the hornets by throwing a hornets' nest at them.

PARA-MEDIC

If you succeed, it should reduce the number of hornets The Pain has at his disposal. It might even make the nest taste better.

PARA-MEDIC

Try it out!
Bullet bees

PARA-MEDIC

"Bullet bees" are the name The Pain gives to the special hornets he raises inside his own body.

PARA-MEDIC

If they get into your body, your wounds will become worse and worse until you get rid of them.

PARA-MEDIC

And if you're afflicted by bullet bees, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and use "CURE" to dig them out with your knife.

PARA-MEDIC

Once the bullet bees are out, don't forget to apply styptic and disinfectant to the wound!
The Pain battle - darkness attack
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you won't be able to see a thing with a swarm of hornets covering your head.

PARA-MEDIC

The hornets can't follow you into the water. If you find your vision being blocked by a swarm of hornets, dive into the water!
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You could also try driving them away with the smoke from your cigar.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Waving your torch around with the CQC button should also work.
The Pain battle - repel with white clothing

PARA-MEDIC

Hornets are known to display extremely aggressive behavior in response to the color black.

PARA-MEDIC

So don't wear black clothing. Instead, try wearing white clothing. It should reduce the severity of the hornets' attacks.
The Pain battle - repel with Bug Juice

PARA-MEDIC

Using insecticidal bug juice on yourself should make the hornets' attacks less severe. Try it out.
•Sigint
The Pain Battle
The Pain battle - general

SIGINT

The Pain is said to possess the power to control his hornets at will. Watch out for insect-based attacks, especially his so-called "bullet bees."
The Pain battle - gun

SIGINT

The Pain doesn't just use hornets. He's got guns and grenades in his arsenal, too.

SIGINT

Be especially careful about those grenades.
The Pain battle - Tommy gun
(1)
*If The Pain isn't using the Tommy gun

SIGINT

You say he's using a Tommy gun?
(2)
*If The Pain is using the Tommy gun

SIGINT

He's got a Tommy gun.
(3)

SIGINT

The Thompson submachine gun, or Tommy gun, is a sub machine gun that saw a lot of action in World War II.

SIGINT

That thing can spit out 700 .45ACP rounds in a minute's time.

SIGINT

Its sturdiness and reliability made it popular during the Korean War, and it's still the weapon of choice for a lot of special forces units.

SIGINT

Sure, it's a little bit old-fashioned, but it still packs a nasty punch.
The Pain battle - copy attack

SIGINT

The Pain can supposedly use his hornets to create a copy of himself and confuse the enemy.

SIGINT

If he does that, try and figure out which one is real and attack it.

SIGINT

When he copies himself, the hornets that normally protect him will be used to create the double. That means you'll be able to damage him with a gun.

SIGINT

But be warned. If you screw up and shoot the double, or you take too long to shoot, you'll get hit with a counterattack.
The Pain battle - bullet bees

SIGINT

Snake, watch out for those bullet bees.

SIGINT

"Bullet bee" is the pet name The Pain gave to a special type of hornet that he keeps inside his body.

SIGINT

When The Pain gives the order, they fly at their target like bullets, burrow into his body, and eat away at his insides until he's dead.

SIGINT

If you get hit by a bullet bee, go into the Survival Viewer right away and heal yourself on the "CURE" screen.

SIGINT

That being said, despite the name, a bullet bee is really just a type of hornet. They can't follow you into the water. If The Pain launches any at you, dive under the water.
•Major
Prior to Reaching Mangrove Aqueduct
After The Pain - leave the cave
(1)

ZERO

I heard you defeated The Pain.

SNAKE

Yeah. It wasn't easy.

SNAKE

And there's still three more of them left.

ZERO

Four.

SNAKE

?

ZERO

There are still four more Cobras left - including their leader, The Boss.

SNAKE

... I'm aware of that...

ZERO

Good.
(2)

ZERO

The exit from the cave should be toward the back. Proceed through the cave and find the exit to the swamp aqueduct.
Bizarre supervillain explosion
*Right after the first explosion only
(1)
*If player calls after The Pain's explosion

SNAKE

Major, why did The Pain explode like that...?
(2)
*If player calls after another Cobra's explosion

SNAKE

Major, why do they keep exploding...?
(3)

ZERO

It's part of their legend.

SNAKE

Legend?

ZERO

The legend of the Cobra Unit. I'll let Sigint explain. Sigint?

SIGINT

Yeah, that. That's a microbomb.

SNAKE

A microbomb?

SIGINT

Yup. During World War II, the Cobra Unit was used for the nastiest kinds of wet works, the kind that could never be let out into the open.

SIGINT

Their missions were so top secret that not only were they forbidden to be taken prisoner, they couldn't even leave their corpse behind.

SIGINT

Because of this, or so the legend goes, they carried a microbomb with them on their missions in case they needed to commit suicide.

SIGINT

I always thought it was just a rumor... I never expected it'd turn out to be true.

SNAKE

...

SIGINT

But why would they be carrying bombs this time around? It's not like they're in hostile territory.

SNAKE

... Maybe they're ready to die.

SIGINT

Ready to die?

SNAKE

Yeah... They've got no unit to go back to. Not even a country.

SIGINT

So they've got no place to die except the battlefield, huh.

SNAKE

Yeah, no turning back for them... I wonder if The Boss feels the same...
•EVA
Prior to Reaching Mangrove Aqueduct
After The Pain - leave the cave
(1)

EVA

Snake, you beat The Pain!

SNAKE

Not without a tough fight.

EVA

How did it feel to fight one of The Boss' comrades?

SNAKE

What are you getting at?

EVA

I just want to know what it's like to have fought a member of the legendary Cobra Unit, that's all.

SNAKE

What you want to know is if I can really face The Boss, is that right?

EVA

Well, that, too.

SNAKE

Don't waste your time worrying about me. I'll get the mission done.

EVA

I certainly hope so.

SNAKE

So the exit of the cave is up ahead?

EVA

Right.
(2)

EVA

But watch out.

EVA

A patrol heard The Pain's explosion and is already on their way. Be careful.

*If player hasn't acquired Shotgun

EVA

That reminds me. I've heard they keep a shotgun stored in that part of the cave. Why don't you go look for it?
Near cave exit - Dragunov location

EVA

I heard a report that they've transported a sniper rifle to the western part of Ponizovje, the aqueduct at the other end of the cave.

EVA

When you get to the aqueduct, you might want to head over that way and check it out.
Near cave exit - flying platform warning
(1)

EVA

Pass through that area to the north and you'll reach the aqueduct.

EVA

But be careful - the aqueduct is patrolled by flying platforms.
(2)

SNAKE

Flying platforms?

EVA

Soldiers hovering in the air.

SNAKE

I've heard stories, but...

EVA

They've already been implemented over here. It goes to show that America isn't number one in everything.
•Major
Prior to Reaching Mangrove Base
Head north

ZERO

I see you've found your way to the aqueduct. If you follow it to the north, you'll come to a warehouse used for transporting supplies.

ZERO

Pass through the warehouse and you'll come out into a forest. The lab where Sokolov is being held is directly to the north of that forest, so head north.
Aqueduct

ZERO

Snake, the water in that aqueduct comes up to your waist. Naturally, you won't be able to walk as fast as usual.

ZERO

But you can jump into the water with a roll or press the Crawl Button to go underwater and swim your way through.
-->Major Zero Radio Conversation: Swimming explanation (3)
Flying platforms
(1)
*After hearing about the flying platforms from EVA

ZERO

EVA mentioned that that area was guarded by flying platforms.
(2)
*After encountering a flying platform

ZERO

That area seems to be guarded by flying platforms.
-->Sigint Radio Conversation: Flying platforms (2)
(3)

ZERO

Be careful. They can see a great distance from up there.

ZERO

If a flying platform starts to draw near, you'd do well to dive underwater and hide until it passes.
Flares at night

ZERO

Snake, the enemies in that area will use flares against you.

ZERO

When you're near the light from a flare, your Camo Index will go down.

ZERO

If the enemy fires a flare at you, you'd best dive underwater and hide.
Mortars

ZERO

If you're spotted by the enemy in that area, they'll call in for mortar support from afar.

ZERO

Mortar fire is nothing to trifle with. If the enemy calls in for mortar support, get out of the area immediately. Is that clear?
Mangrove SVD

ZERO

Snake, EVA mentioned something about a sniper rifle in the western part of Ponizovje.

ZERO

A sniper rifle would certainly be a valuable asset to your mission. Swing by the western area and acquire that sniper rifle.
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Mangrove Base
Flying platforms
(1)

SIGINT

You say they have flying platforms out there?
(2)

SIGINT

Flying platforms are a type of personal VTOL aircraft.

SNAKE

They were working on those in America, too, weren't they?

SIGINT

Yeah, back in the 50's.

SIGINT

They were supposedly going to be used for scouting and patrol missions as well as to spot for artillery units and transport troops into rough territory.

SIGINT

They even got an initial prototype off the ground in 1955.

SIGINT

But the thing wasn't fast enough, and there were problems with getting it to stop and turn in mid-air. So they ended up scrapping the project.

SIGINT

The ones you see there were built by the Soviets after they got their hands on the American design plans.

SIGINT

The American model used a pair of contra-rotating rotors to generate lift. But those Soviet models seem to be using jet engines instead.

SIGINT

They must have kept going with their research after the U.S. abandoned its own project. Now they've finally overtaken us. You gotta give them credit for sticking with it.
(3)

SIGINT

If you get spotted by an enemy riding a flying platform, they'll go into Alert Phase.

SIGINT

The flying platforms themselves don't seem to be armed, but the pilots are carrying Scorpion submachine guns and grenades.

SIGINT

The recoil on the Scorpion is low enough so that they should be able to fire one-handed in full-auto mode. That gives them some serious firepower.
Flying platforms - searchlight
(1)

SIGINT

The flying platforms have a searchlight attached to the front.

SIGINT

If you knock it out, that should handicap its scouting ability.
(2)

SIGINT

And in some cases, it might even have to go back to base for repairs.
Flying platforms - armor

SIGINT

The armor plating on the body of a flying platform is bound to be pretty thick. I don't think you're gonna be able to penetrate it with a handgun or an assault rifle.

SIGINT

When you're up against a flying platform, try and aim for either the pilot or the engine on the underbelly.
Flying platforms - flames

SIGINT

Those flying platforms are propelled by jet engines.

SIGINT

You'll be scorched if you get caught under those things, so be careful.
•Major
Prior to Reaching The Fear's Forest
Rescue Sokolov on the double
(1)

SNAKE

Major, Sokolov's been hauled off.

ZERO

Yes. They probably caught him trying to escape from the lab...

ZERO

Didn't Volgin say they still needed to perform the final test?

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

Then Sokolov must have been taken back to the lab. Get to the lab and get Sokolov the hell out of there.
(2)

ZERO

Pass through that warehouse and you'll come out south of the lab.

ZERO

Make your way inside the warehouse. Watch out for enemy sentries.
Who is Tanya?

SNAKE

Major, do you know anything about this Tanya?

ZERO

No.

SNAKE

Nothing?

ZERO

Not a thing.

SNAKE

Why not? You must have checked up on Sokolov when he defected two years ago. If he had a lover...

ZERO

Make no mistake, we conducted a thorough investigation, but there was nothing about him having a mistress.

SNAKE

Maybe you didn't notice.

ZERO

That's impossible.

SNAKE

Then he must have become involved with her after he was taken back to Russia.

ZERO

I wonder...

SNAKE

What is it, Major? Something wrong?

ZERO

I don't think Sokolov would take a lover.

SNAKE

Why not?

ZERO

I still remember him two years ago.

ZERO

After we got him across the border, the first words he spoke from his hospital bed after he regained consciousness were, "Are my wife and daughter safe?"

ZERO

And right up until the time he was taken back to Russia, he kept begging me over and over to take care of his family, almost as if he was delirious.

ZERO

Sokolov is a man who loves his family. Betraying his wife is something he'd...

SNAKE

Major.

ZERO

What is it?

SNAKE

People change. (He thinks The Boss changed and betrayed her country.)

ZERO

... Maybe you're right. (Remembering how The Boss changed.)

SNAKE

Yeah, maybe...
Warehouse - eliminated The End
*If the player snipes The End outside the warehouse, they won't get to fight him later. This conversation is for those players who might feel a little sad about this.

ZERO

Snake, did you kill another one of the Cobras?

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

I'm pretty sure it was The End. Good work. Now you won't have to deal with him later.

SNAKE

I guess so...

ZERO

What's wrong?

SNAKE

It's nothing.

ZERO

Surely you're not going to tell me you wanted to test your skills against a legendary sniper that even The Boss respected.

SNAKE

... (He hit the nail on the head.)

ZERO

Snake, this isn't a contest or sport. This is war. The only thing you should be thinking about is carrying out your mission.

SNAKE

Yeah... I know.
You can shoot through piers

ZERO

The assault rifle can punch through materials like wooden boards. That means you can fire on enemies standing on top of the pier from underneath. Keep that in mind.
Warehouse - water gate

ZERO

That device is a water gate. Normally, it'd be open to allow supply shipments to pass through, but it looks like it's closed right now. I don't think there's any way for you to open it.
How to get out of the water
(1)

ZERO

Snake, get out of the water and infiltrate the warehouse.
(2)

ZERO

To get out of the water, move next to the place from which you want to emerge. Then, while you're treading water, press the Action Button.
Warehouse interior - continue on

ZERO

Good, you've infiltrated the warehouse. Pass through it and you'll come out south of the lab where Sokolov is being held.

ZERO

The exit should be on the north side of the top floor. Climb up the stairs and pass through the warehouse to the north.
Warehouse - gate won't open
(1)

ZERO

Snake, that gate appears to be locked from the inside. There's no way for you to open it.
(2)

ZERO

The passage on the east side of the warehouse should take you inside. Try sneaking in from the east.
Warehouse locked door
(1)

SNAKE

Major, this door...

ZERO

It won't open?

SNAKE

No.

ZERO

It's probably locked.

SNAKE

That's what I thought, but there's no keyhole...

SIGINT

I'll bet it's locked by a punch card security system.

SNAKE

Punch card?

SIGINT

Yep. Instead of a regular key, it uses a card with holes punched in it.

SIGINT

You're gonna have to get yourself a card key if you want to get it open.
(2)

ZERO

Snake, you need a special kind of key to open that door.

ZERO

Right now, your top mission priority is to rescue Sokolov. Head for the lab to the north.
•Major
Prior to Reaching Lab
The lab is just to the north

ZERO

Snake, the lab where Sokolov is being held is to the north of that forest. Keep on heading north.
The Fear's Forest - traps
(1)

ZERO

Snake, watch out. It seems that forest is rigged with a number of traps.
(2)
*If player has already gotten caught in one

SNAKE

Yeah, I noticed...
(3)

ZERO

Most of the traps seem to be triggered by tripping a rope stretched across the ground.

ZERO

Don't just run around like a fool. Keep an eye on the ground and watch where you step.

ZERO

Some ropes may be placed so that they're hidden in the vegetation. Be extra careful when you're cutting through the underbrush.
(4)

ZERO

If you use the directional buttons to move around stalking, you should be able to spot the traps before you step on them. Use stalking to move safely through suspicious-looking areas.
Scientist caught in a trap
*Conversation that takes place in front of the body of a scientist who was killed by a trap

SNAKE

Major, I found a (dead body)...

ZERO

I know. It's probably a scientist who fled from the lab.

ZERO

I'd wager that the traps in those woods are set up more to deal with would-be escapees than to keep intruders out.
How to escape snares
(1)
*Incoming call if player gets caught in a snare and hangs upside down for a bit

ZERO

Snake, have you been caught in a snare trap?

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

If you don't get down from there soon, the enemy might spot you.

SNAKE

I know that.

ZERO

Then why don't you get yourself down?

SNAKE

How am I supposed to do that!?

ZERO

It should be obvious.
(2)

ZERO

If you get caught in a snare trap, press the Action Button. That will allow you to cut the rope.

ZERO

Hurry and free yourself before the enemy comes around.
Trap triggered by rope
(1)

ZERO

Snake, look at your feet!

SNAKE

There's a rope stretched along the ground...

ZERO

That was a close call.

SNAKE

Yeah, thanks.
(2)

ZERO

The traps are set up to go off whenever a rope is disturbed.

ZERO

You might want to try cutting the ropes beforehand by shooting them from a distance.
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Lab
Trap area
(1)

SIGINT

There seem to be traps planted throughout that area. And they look a little... primitive...
(2)

SNAKE

Yeah. But this is their territory. Why would they need this many traps here?

SIGINT

Maybe it's part of some kind of tactical research.

SNAKE

Tactical research?

SIGINT

Yeah. As I'm sure you know, the Soviet Union is leading a worldwide revolution among Communist forces all over the globe.

SIGINT

But a lot of the countries involved don't have the necessary funds and industrial technology. So they need tactics that are both effective and economical.

SNAKE

That's what they're researching?

SIGINT

Yeah. And traps are one of the best ways to do that. I'll bet that place is one of their testing grounds.
(3)

SIGINT

Clappers, arrows, pendulums - all of these traps are set off by applying force to a rope. Don't touch the ropes, and you'll be fine.

SIGINT

Use rolling to get over them, or just crawl under them. Either way ought to work.
(4)

SIGINT

If you do set off a trap and an arrow or a spiked pendulum comes flying your way, you can still dodge it by immediately diving out of the way.
(5)

SIGINT

Pit traps and snares are camouflaged into the ground to make them harder to detect.

SIGINT

But if you look carefully enough, you can see them through the disguise. Try stalking to proceed with extra caution.

SIGINT

In any case, if you think there might be traps lying around, keep a close eye on the ground and stay alert.
•Major
Prior to Penetrating Lab
Find a way past the wall
(1)

ZERO

So there's a high wall around the perimeter of the lab... Climbing over it probably isn't an option.

ZERO

But there must be an entrance somewhere. Keep your eyes open.
(2)

ZERO

The best source of information about a facility is the people going in and out of it. Try interrogating one of the enemies about the entrance.
(3)

ZERO

To interrogate an enemy, grab him from behind using CQC and press the left analog stick to put your knife to his throat.

(1)

ZERO

Snake, the enemy appears to be using that door to enter and exit the lab.

That door appears to be locked from the inside. You won't be able to open it from the outside.

ZERO

But there must be some way to use the door to sneak inside.
(6)

SNAKE

And what do you propose?

ZERO

Well, I... (He can't think of anything.)

PARA-MEDIC

How about if you stand in front of the door and perform a ritual dance?

SNAKE

PARA-MEDIC

That's what they do in Japan when they find a door that won't open.

SNAKE

PARA-MEDIC

Of course.

ZERO

She certainly seems to know a lot about Japan.

PARA-MEDIC

Then YOU think of something.

ZERO

•Major
Prior to Meeting Granin
Lab - disguise yourself
(1)

ZERO

Good, you've infiltrated the lab. The security on the inside is very tight. You'll find it difficult to look for Sokolov unless you're disguised as a scientist.

ZERO

Use the clothes that EVA gave you to disguise yourself as a scientist.
(2)

ZERO

To disguise yourself as a scientist, go into the Survival Viewer and select "SCIENTIST" from the "UNIFORM" option on the "CAMOUFLAGE" screen.

ZERO

Just remember to remove your face paint.

ZERO

To remove your face paint, choose "NO PAINT" from the "FACE" option of the "CAMOUFLAGE" screen.
•Major
Prior to The Fear Battle
Return to the warehouse
(1)

SNAKE

Major, Sokolov's already been moved to the fortress.

ZERO

But that's only what Granin told you, right? He may have been giving you false info...

SNAKE

No, he wasn't lying.

ZERO

How can you be so sure?

SNAKE

Gut feeling.

ZERO

... Good enough for me.
(2)

ZERO

According to Granin, you should be able to get to the mountains through a passage located deep in the jungle beyond the warehouse.
(3)

SNAKE

Right. Then if I climb the mountains, there'll be an underground tunnel leading to Groznyj Grad near the summit.
(4)

ZERO

Start out by going back to the warehouse. Use the key you got from Granin to open the door and proceed into the jungle.

ZERO

You remember where the door is, don't you? It's directly north of the door you went in when you came from the aqueduct.
•Sigint
Prior to The Fear Battle
Bipedal tanks

SNAKE

Sigint, Granin said something about putting legs on a tank. Do you know what he was talking about?

SIGINT

If you ask me, it's got to be a joke.

SIGINT

Not only is making a tank walk on two legs a technical nightmare, but there's no point in making a walking tank to begin with.

SIGINT

Putting legs on a tank would raise its clearance, increasing its frontal projection area. It'd also be less stable.

SIGINT

Suppose the legs help the tank travel on bad roads... I don't see the logic in that. Isn't that what treads are for?

SIGINT

I mean, anybody who'd seriously consider making a thing like that has got to be a wacko.

SIGINT

... Come to think of it, there was a guy in the States who wrote a paper on that subject.

SIGINT

What was his name... Emerson? Heinrich?... Something like that; I don't really remember. (He's referring the father of MGS1 and MGS2's Hal Emmerich.)

SIGINT

Course, no one took that seriously.
Rockets on a tank?

SNAKE

Sigint, Granin was saying that Sokolov's research project was a tank fitted with rockets...

SIGINT

Uh huh.

SNAKE

Do you have any idea what he meant?

SIGINT

... Sorry. Beats me.

SNAKE

Hmm...

SIGINT

I wonder if it's supposed to increase the tank's mobility... or maybe give the tank short-range missile launching capability...

SIGINT

But you're sure it has something to do with Phase 2 of the Shagohod, right?

SNAKE

Yeah.

SIGINT

Khrushchev traded Cuba just to get this thing finished, and Volgin blew up a Soviet research facility to get his hands on it.

SIGINT

Whatever it is, it's gotta be big.
After talking to Granin - the Philosophers' Legacy

SNAKE

Sigint, do you know anything about that "Philosopher's Legacy" Granin was talking about?

SIGINT

Not a clue. Never even heard of something like that until now.

SNAKE

Right...

SIGINT

One thing's for sure, though. Volgin's got a huge amount of money stashed away somewhere.

SIGINT

"Philosopher's Legacy" huh... Maybe it is real...
The Order of Lenin

SIGINT

That Order of Lenin that Granin was talkin' about is the most prestigious award in the Soviet Union.

SIGINT

It's given to individuals, organizations, and cities for outstanding achievements in warfare, science, industry, the arts, and various other fields.

SIGINT

You could say it's the highest honor the East has to give.
The SS-1C

SIGINT

You say Granin was involved in the development of the SS-1C?

SIGINT

The SS-1C is the Soviets' newest short-range tactical ballistic missile.

SIGINT

Based on what Western intel has been able to gather, it's capable of being launched from a mobile platform.

SNAKE

A mobile platform?

SIGINT

Yeah. It's a transport vehicle that functions as an erector and a launcher. It can travel on roads then erect and launch a missile from any location.

SIGINT

Of course, in addition to conventional explosives, the missiles could also be fitted with chemical or even nuclear warheads.

SNAKE

A nuclear missile that can be launched from any location...

SIGINT

I'll bet it wasn't the missile itself that Granin helped develop. More likely it was the mobile platform.

SIGINT

From what I've heard, the SS-1C is set for actual deployment as early as next year. That's bound to send a chill down NATO's spine.
•Major
The Fear Battle
The Fear battle - incoming call after poison bolt
*Right after start of battle, if player doesn't treat poison bolt from cutscene
(1)

ZERO

Snake, are you all right!?
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You've been shot with a poison bolt! The poison is spreading throughout your body!

PARA-MEDIC

Your LIFE is going to keep decreasing unless you do something about it! Hurry and neutralize the poison!

PARA-MEDIC

Go into the Survival Viewer and use "CURE" to give yourself a serum injection!
(3)
*If player doesn't have Serum

SNAKE

But I don't have any serum...

PARA-MEDIC

The rabbits in that area have poison-resistant properties. Capture a rabbit and use it to get serum!
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The serum will neutralize the poison, but don't forget to treat the bolt wound itself as well.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

To treat a bolt wound, you'll need your knife, a styptic, and a disinfectant. Use your knife to dig out the bolt, and then apply styptic and disinfectant to the wound.

PARA-MEDIC

Follow those steps and the wound should heal right up.
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

Now start the treatment. Hurry!!
The Fear battle - basics

ZERO

The Fear is using something called stealth camouflage to conceal himself.

ZERO

But you should be able to spot him if you look closely in First Person View. Watch for rustling grass, falling leaves, anything that will betray his presence.

ZERO

Find him and shoot him in First Person View.
The Fear battle - bolt attacks

ZERO

You can knock down The Fear's bolts with your gun or knife. If you can't dodge a bolt, go into First Person View and shoot it down.
The Fear battle - poison bolts
(1)

ZERO

Snake, watch out for The Fear's poison bolts.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

If you're hit with a poison bolt, the poison will enter your bloodstream. Unless you neutralize it with serum, your LIFE will just keep diminishing.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

You will suffer convulsions, preventing you from moving silently and inhibiting use of your Anti-Personnel Sensor.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you're hit by a poison bolt, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and use "CURE" to give yourself a serum injection.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

You can get serum by capturing the rabbits that live in that area.
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

After you neutralize the poison with the serum, don't forget to treat the wound itself, too.
The Fear battle - stamina

ZERO

The Fear's stealth camouflage apparently drains his stamina rather quickly.

ZERO

Once he's used up his stamina, he'll have no choice but to go looking for food.

ZERO

That's your chance. Throw one of your food items to set a trap for him.

ZERO

Plant a Claymore or some TNT and lure him into it, or lure him into one of his own traps.

ZERO

Giving him poisoned or rotten food may also work well.

ZERO

Used properly, your food can be a weapon.
The Fear battle - traps

ZERO

Snake, be careful. Those woods are riddled with traps. Watch your step as you go along. And look out for areas of bottomless swamp!

ZERO

Even if you don't trigger a trap, The Fear can still use it to attack you by setting it off himself.

ZERO

Be careful about standing too close to traps.

ZERO

On the other hand, you might be able to use his own traps against him.

ZERO

For example, you could place some food next to a trap and lure him over to it. Use your head!
•Para-Medic
The Fear Battle
The Fear battle - Brazilian wandering spider

PARA-MEDIC

The Fear coats his poison bolts with venom from the Brazilian wandering spider.

PARA-MEDIC

The Brazilian wandering spider is said to have the deadliest venom of any spider in the world.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a potent neurotoxin, so if you get hit by one of The Fear's poison bolts, go to "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and inject yourself with serum immediately before it kills you!
The Fear battle - antibody rabbits

PARA-MEDIC

The rabbits in that area have antibodies that protect them against the venom of the Brazilian wandering spider.

PARA-MEDIC

They probably built up an immunity from The Fear using them to test his poison bolts.

PARA-MEDIC

Catching one of those rabbits will give you some serum. If you run out of serum, go catch a rabbit!
•Sigint
The Fear Battle
The Fear battle - stealth camouflage
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, The Fear is supposed to be wearing some kind of stealth camo.

SIGINT

I don't know how it works exactly, but it seems to refract the light around it somehow to hide the person who's wearing it.

SIGINT

This is the best camouflage I've ever seen. It's going to be tough to figure out where he is.

SIGINT

But that doesn't mean he doesn't have a weak point.
(2)

SIGINT

Apparently, wearing stealth camo really drains your stamina. When he's out of stamina, the camo will stop working. Don't miss your opportunity.
The Fear battle - stealth camouflage (2)
(1)

SIGINT

Just because he's wearing stealth camo doesn't mean he's not there. You can still figure out his location by using your sensors.

SIGINT

Make use of your motion detector and active sonar.
(2)
*If player has the Thermal Goggles

SIGINT

The thermal goggles should help you out, too.
The Fear battle - weapons

SIGINT

The Fear uses two kinds of crossbows the Little Joe and the William Tell.

SIGINT

The Little Joe is designed for proximity combat. It's not that powerful, but the reload time is short.

SIGINT

The William Tell, on the other hand, is used for long-range combat. It takes a while to reload, but it's got loads of stopping power. Be careful.
The Fear battle - special bolts

SIGINT

In addition to regular crossbow bolts, The Fear uses a variety of special bolts, like poison bolts and giant bolts. I've even heard he uses bolts with grenades attached to them.

SIGINT

If you get hit by any of these, you're gonna take some serious damage. Watch out!

ZERO

That's a big forest so ask EVA for information

Phase 2 testing is complete

SNAKE

•EVA
Prior to Reaching Sokrovenno
Moss jungle south (Svyatogornjy)
(1)

EVA

The name of that forest is Svyatogornyj. In Russian, It means something like "the sacred mountain path."

EVA

The name comes from an old folk tale about mountain spirits who pass through there on their way to Sokrovenno, the forest to the north.
(2)

EVA

Head north and you'll come to Sokrovenno.

EVA

The tunnel that leads to the mountains is in the northern area of Sokrovenno.

EVA

I'll meet you in the ruins at the top of the mountains. I'll give you the key to the tunnel leading to Groznyj Grad when you get there.

EVA

Remember, go north.

SNAKE

SNAKE

EVA

Yeah.

Just be careful.

EVA

Mangroves (Ponizovje)
*If player has returned to mangrove forest
(1)

EVA

That aqueduct is known as Ponizovje. It means "the land down the river."

EVA

As you can see, it's overgrown with mangrove. Usually, they'd have boats going up and down transporting materials.

EVA

But right now the place is on high alert, so the boats have stopped running.

EVA

But enough about that...

Yakushima Jungle C (Graniny Gorki)

Moss jungle - what have you been doing?

SNAKE

EVA.

EVA

What?

SNAKE

I couldn't get a hold of you for a while there. What were you doing?

EVA

What do you think I was doing?

SNAKE

That's what I'm asking you.

EVA

Why are you asking me that?

SNAKE

Because I want to know, that's why.

EVA

Want to know what?

SNAKE

... Will you stop answering my questions with questions?

EVA

Are you mad?

SNAKE

*angry* ...

EVA

See ya.
Moss jungle 1 - provisions storehouse and armory

EVA

Now all you have to do is follow the tunnel north to the mountains of Krasnogorje.

EVA

But you might want to swing around east first. There's a provisions storehouse there.
Svyatogornyj East - cottage

SNAKE

EVA.

EVA

Hmm?

SNAKE

There's a house here in the middle of the woods.

EVA

So there is.

SNAKE

It looks like a cottage, but what is it...?

EVA

It really was a cottage once. It was originally the dacha of a high-ranking official.

EVA

Now it's being used as a relay station.

EVA

There should be a supply of ammo and rations.

EVA

But watch out - there's supposed to be a unit posted in there.
Tatyana?

SNAKE

EVA.

EVA

Yes?

SNAKE

Who is that Tatyana?

EVA

Taken a liking to her, have we? She's a cutie.

SNAKE

*not playing along* Who is she?

EVA

I don't know that much about her, but from what I can tell, she seems to be Sokolov's lover...

SNAKE

Can you find out a little more?

EVA

Snake, she already has a man.

SNAKE

EVA...

EVA

All right. Just give me a minute.
Tatyana follow-up

EVA

Snake, I found out what I could about your Tanya.

EVA

Just as I thought, she's apparently Sokolov's lover. When Sokolov was taken away from his research facility, she was taken along with him.

SNAKE

So she's (his lover's) been with him since he was at the research facility...?

EVA

That's what it looks like.

SNAKE

Are you sure about that?

EVA

Yes. Why?

SNAKE

The major said Sokolov wasn't the kind of guy who'd take a lover...

EVA

Maybe he was lonely, being away from his family for so long.

EVA

And whatever else he is, Sokolov's still a man. It's only natural he'd be attracted to her.

SNAKE

Only natural?

EVA

She's irresistible. Gorgeous, in a girl-next-door kind of way. Nice proportions, too.

SNAKE

...

EVA

Sounds like your type, huh?

SNAKE

EVA...

EVA

Gotta go.
•Major
The End Battle
The End battle - basics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, The End is a veteran sniper. He's hiding somewhere in those woods waiting for you to appear.

ZERO

If he sees you, he'll shoot without hesitation.

ZERO

Make your way through the forest, hiding along the way, and watch out for signs of The End. Anticipate his movements and come up on his side or get behind him for a chance to attack.
(2)

ZERO

Be careful. The End uses a special kind of tranquilizer round.
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Tranquilizer rounds
(3)

ZERO

If you run out of stamina, it's all over. Make sure you keep your stamina up by hunting for food on a regular basis.

ZERO

This battle will be a long, grueling sniper duel.

ZERO

But don't let your guard down, not even for a single moment!
The End battle - locate him
(1)

ZERO

The End is a renowned sniper, but he's also an expert in camouflage.

ZERO

He's lying low somewhere in those woods and waiting for his chance.

ZERO

You'll only get yourself shot if you run around like a fool. Use your camouflage to blend in, take cover behind rocks and trees, and find where he's hiding.

ZERO

Make use of your binoculars. Keep a close eye out for the flash from his scope.
(2)

ZERO

You can also try using the thermal goggles.
The End battle - tranquilizer round incoming call

ZERO

You've been shot by The End!?

SNAKE

Yeah...
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Tranquilizer rounds (2)
The End battle - tracking

ZERO

If you reach the spot where you think The End is hiding and he's not there anymore, don't give up.

ZERO

Take a close look at the ground. He may have left footprints behind. You can use those to determine which way he went.

ZERO

Anticipate his movements and get behind him.
The End battle - snare incoming call

ZERO

Snake, you've been caught in a snare trap? You're going to get yourself shot if you stay up there!

ZERO

Use the Action Button to cut the rope and escape from the trap. Hurry before he finds you!
The End battle - spotting the enemy

ZERO

The binoculars and First Person View will prove useful in detecting the enemy's presence.

ZERO

You should also be making use of your motion detector, active sonar, and Anti-Personnel Sensor.

ZERO

You might also try using the directional microphone.
The End battle - the map

ZERO

The best locations for sniping are determined naturally by the terrain.

ZERO

The End may use the same location multiple times. Memorize the spots he chooses for sniping, and sneak up behind him.

ZERO

You can tell which locations The End has used for sniping by looking at the "MAP" in the Survival Viewer.

ZERO

Anticipate where he'll be sniping from and approach him from the side or rear.
The End battle - the exit's blocked by vines

ZERO

Snake, that's the entrance to the shaft... but those vines appear to have sealed it off.

ZERO

You won't be able to enter the shaft until you defeat The End. Finish him off first!
The End battle - after cutscene in which a tranquilizer round knocked Snake unconscious
(1)

ZERO

Snake, it appears you were knocked out by The End's tranquilizer rounds.

SNAKE

Yeah... but why didn't he kill me?

ZERO

I don't know. But I expect he's still in Sokrovenno.
(2)

ZERO

Until you defeat The End, you won't be able to reach the mountains.

ZERO

Snake, go back to Sokrovenno. And this time, finish him!
•EVA
The End Battle
Moss jungle north (Sokrovenno)
(1)

EVA

The forest you're in now is known as Sokrovenno. The name means "the most holy woods."

EVA

It's been venerated since ancient times as the sacred home of the spirits of the forest.

EVA

It's the largest and deepest forest in the region, and is divided into three areas: south, west, and north. Try not to get lost, OK?

EVA

There's an armory in the southern area. If you need some extra ammo, you might want to pay it a visit.
(2)
*While fighting The End

EVA

Until you defeat The End, I don't think you'll be able to pass through the forest. You'll have to beat him.
(3)
*While fighting the Ocelot Unit

EVA

Be careful. I've heard the Ocelots are lying in wait for you in the forest.

EVA

The entrance to the tunnel is in the northeastern part of the northern area. Try to make it there in one piece.
The End battle - photosynthesis

EVA

I know it's hard to believe, but The End is apparently capable of photosynthesis.

EVA

He's probably got an edge over you in terms of stamina. You should start hunting for plants and animals and prepare for a battle of attrition.
The exit's blocked by vines

EVA

Until you defeat The End, those vines probably aren't going to go away. To get into the tunnel, you'll have to fight and beat him.
The End battle - return to the forest
*If the player is knocked unconsciousness by one of The End's tranquilizer rounds, they wake up in a cell in Granin's lab

EVA

The End should still be waiting for you in that forest, Sokrovenno. Until you defeat him, you won't be able to proceed with your mission.

EVA

Go back to Sokrovenno. Defeat The End.
•Para-Medic
The End Battle
The End battle - food

PARA-MEDIC

If you run out of stamina, you won't be able to resist the effects of The End's tranquilizer rounds, and you'll end up falling asleep.

PARA-MEDIC

Hunt for food on a regular basis to keep your stamina level up.

PARA-MEDIC

If you start to run out of food or ammunition, you should think about leaving the woods and coming back later.

PARA-MEDIC

In any case, always keep an eye on your stamina gauge. You'll thank me later.
The End battle - watch out for venomous snakes and spiders
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, it looks like there are a lot of venomous snakes and spiders inhabiting that area. Be careful not to disturb them.

PARA-MEDIC

Go to "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and use a serum injection if you get bitten.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

The rabbits in that area have poison-resistant properties. If you run out of serum, catch a rabbit to get more!
Tranquilizer rounds

PARA-MEDIC

If he shoots you with one of those tranquilizer rounds, you'll start to lose stamina fast. When your stamina gauge reaches zero, you'll pass out.

PARA-MEDIC

If you're hit by a tranquilizer round, go into the Survival Viewer right away and treat the wound. Use your knife to dig out the needle.
Tranquilizer rounds (2)

PARA-MEDIC

If you're hit by one of The End's tranquilizer rounds, the tranquilizer needle will stay stuck in your body.

PARA-MEDIC

Until you remove the needle, you'll keep losing stamina rapidly. When your stamina reaches zero, you'll lose consciousness. You've got to dig that needle out!

PARA-MEDIC

To get the needle out, go to "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and use your knife.

PARA-MEDIC

You'd better take care of it before you pass out. Now, get to it!
The End battle - rain
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

It's started to rain, huh.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You burn a lot more stamina than normal when it's raining. Be sure to eat on a regular basis to keep up your stamina.
•Sigint
The End Battle
The End battle - the map

SIGINT

Sokrovenno Forest is a big place. It's times like this that the "MAP" function in the Survival Viewer can be your best friend.

SIGINT

Not only does it show you the terrain and the places you've been, but you can also use it to figure out which locations The End has chosen for his sniping positions.

SIGINT

Learn the terrain and try to catch The End off guard from behind.
The End battle - thermal

SIGINT

Hey, you've got thermal goggles, don't you? Use those and it should make it easier to find The End, even when he's camouflaged.

SIGINT

A word of warning, though — I've heard that when he's meshing with the forest, his body temperature drops so that it's just barely above the outside air temperature.

SIGINT

He's probably going to be harder to find than your average grunt.
•Major
Sokrovenno Ocelot Unit Battle
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - basics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, be careful. Aren't the Ocelots supposed to be setting an ambush for you in those woods?

SNAKE

Yeah. And I hear they've got snipers, too.
(2)

ZERO

The Ocelots are an elite unit handpicked from the ranks of GRU. You won't find them so easy to deal with.

ZERO

Use your camouflage to avoid being seen. Proceed with caution.
(3)

ZERO

Your primary objective is to climb the mountains and rendezvous with EVA. There's no need to face the Ocelots in battle.

ZERO

The shaft leading to the mountains is located in the northeast part of the northern area of the woods. Keep an eye out for ambushes and head northeast.
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - watch out for ambushes

ZERO

Snake, be on the lookout for ambushes by the Ocelots. They may be hiding in the bushes and similar places. Make sure you're fully camouflaged and proceed with caution.
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - watch out for ambushes (2)

ZERO

The binoculars and First Person View will prove useful in detecting the enemy's presence.

ZERO

You should also be making use of your motion detector, active sonar, and Anti-Personnel Sensor.

ZERO

You might also try using the directional microphone.
(3)

ZERO

The thermal goggles should also be effective.
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - don't get spotted

ZERO

Snake, if you make noise the enemy will notice you. If they call in support and surround you, you'll be in trouble.

ZERO

When you're near enemies, use stalking to slip by.

ZERO

Use suppressed weapons, CQC, and holdups to silently subdue them one by one.
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - take them all out
(1) *If eliminating them all is required

ZERO

Snake, you won't be able to enter the tunnel without eliminating the Ocelots first. You have to take them all out!
(2)

ZERO

Snake, there's still Ocelots out there. You need to eliminate them!
•EVA
Sokrovenno Ocelot Unit Battle
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - basics

EVA

The Ocelots are an elite unit hand-picked from the ranks of Spetsnaz, GRU's special forces.

EVA

So naturally their fighting skills are second to none. They're crack shots, and if they hit you, you'll likely be seriously wounded.

EVA

Avoid taking them head on. If they manage to surround you in large numbers, you're finished.

EVA

Use your camouflage to conceal yourself from them and keep moving!
•Para-Medic
Sokrovenno Ocelot Unit Battle
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - snipers

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, those snipers will be aiming right for your vital spots. They're precise, and you're likely to be seriously wounded if you get hit.

PARA-MEDIC

Use your camouflage to sneak past them without being seen!
•Sigint
Sokrovenno Ocelot Unit Battle
The End's forest Ocelot Unit battle - basics

SIGINT

Snake, watch out for ambushes by the Ocelots. Use your motion detector and active sonar to help you get ahead.

•Major
Prior to Reaching Mountaintop Ruins
Climb
(1)

ZERO

ZERO

There's an underground tunnel near the top. You can use it to sneak into Groznyj Grad.

ZERO

SNAKE

Yeah. She's supposed to bring me the key.
(2)

ZERO

(3)
*If player is at foot or slope of mountain

ZERO

The summit is still further up the mountain. Keep heading up towards the summit.
(4)
*If player is at summit

ZERO

The summit is just up ahead. Proceed to the ruins at the top of the mountain. EVA should be waiting for you there.
Mountain Hind
(1)

SNAKE

Major, that attack chopper is here...

ZERO

The one from the heliport?

SNAKE

Yeah.
-->Major Zero Radio Conversation: Hind explanation (2)
(2)

ZERO

If the enemies in that area catch sight of you, they'll call in for support from the Hind.

ZERO

The Hind's armor is impenetrable to normal fire such as rifle bullets.

ZERO

But if you take over one of the anti-aircraft guns placed throughout the mountains, you should be able to take it on.

ZERO

What else could you use against a Hind... I suppose a rocket launcher might do the trick...
The door won't open
(1)

ZERO

That's the entrance to the underground tunnel EVA was talking about.

ZERO

Can you open it?
(2)
*If player already tried to open door

SNAKE

It's no good.
-->(5)
(3)
*If player hasn't yet tried to open door

SNAKE

I'll give it a try.
-->(4), after exiting radio screen once
(4)

SNAKE

Major, EVA was right. I can't get the door open.

ZERO

I see.
(5)

ZERO

It looks like EVA was right - the door to the underground tunnel won't open without a key.

ZERO

Rendezvous with EVA and get the key from her. Head for the ruins at the summit.
Mountains - stamina will go down quicker

ZERO

Snake, Para-Medic has something to tell you.
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Stamina in the mountains
Mountains - EVA won't show up if there's any sign of danger

ZERO

Snake, EVA is a KGB spy placed in GRU. She can't be seen by the enemy making direct contact with you.

ZERO

If you're being pursued by the enemy, don't expect EVA to come out to meet you.

ZERO

Make sure it's Normal Phase before you attempt to make contact with EVA.
Mountains - the door won't open during Alert Phase
(1)

SNAKE

Major, I made it to the ruins, but the door won't open.

ZERO

EVA must have bolted it from the inside.

SNAKE

Why would she do that?

ZERO

Think about it for a minute.

SNAKE

*thinks* ...

SNAKE

...Oh, that. (He thinks it's because of sexual harassment the player probably committed, like staring at her breasts.)

ZERO

Make sense now?

SNAKE

Yeah. But she wouldn't bolt the door just because...

ZERO

Because of what?

SNAKE

I mean, why would she be so mad at me? I was just taking a little...

ZERO

Snake, what the hell are you talking about? She obviously doesn't want the enemy to see her meeting with you!

SNAKE

Oh...

ZERO

You've got a one-track mind...
(2)

ZERO

Right now you've got to lose the enemy. After you've returned to Normal Phase, you can go back to the ruins and try to open the door. Is that clear?
(3)

SNAKE

Yeah...

PARA-MEDIC

... What in the world did you do?
•EVA
Prior to Reaching Mountaintop Ruins
Climb the mountain
(1)

EVA

You made it to the mountains.
(2)

EVA

Those mountains are known as Krasnogorje. The name means "the red mountain ridge" in Russian.

EVA

The entire range has been fortified to act as a defense for the great fortress of Groznyj Grad.

EVA

The area near the top has been dug with bunkers and trenches, and there are anti-aircraft gun emplacements everywhere.

EVA

It's literally an impenetrable wall. Proceed with caution.

EVA

Oh, there's a provisions storehouse in the hillside area, and there's an armory at the summit.
(3)

EVA

I'll meet you in the ruins at the top of the mountains.
(4)
*If player is at foot of mountain

EVA

The summit is still a ways up. Keep going forward.
(5)
*If player is at slope of mountain

EVA

The summit is still a ways up. Keep climbing.
(6)
*If player is at summit

EVA

See those ruins at the summit? I'll be waiting for you there.
Mountain Hind
(1)

EVA

Stay alert. Volgin has sent out attack choppers to stop you.
(2)

EVA

You saw them at the heliport, didn't you? They're probably already patrolling the area.
(3)

EVA

If you get spotted by the enemy, you'll be dealing with that thing.
(4)
*If player doesn't have RPG

SNAKE

Just my luck. I don't have any weapons that'll work against them...
(5)
*If player doesn't have RPG

EVA

There should be an RPG-7 in a bunker in the hillside.
(6)
*If player doesn't have RPG

SNAKE

A portable rocket launcher, huh. That should be enough to swat bothersome flies.
(7)
*If player has RPG

SNAKE

Don't worry. I found an RPG-7. That should be enough to swat down a few flies.
(8)
*If player has RPG (second and subsequent times)

EVA

But if you had an RPG-7, you could shoot them down.
(9)

EVA

You could also try using an anti-aircraft gun.

EVA

You can take over an anti-aircraft gun by pressing the Action Button when you're near it.
Mountains - bringing a present

SNAKE

EVA, how are things on your end? Are you going to be able to make it?

EVA

I'm fine. I managed to slip out OK, though. I did run into a few snags.

SNAKE

Is there a problem?

EVA

I took a little detour on my way here.

SNAKE

Detour?

EVA

Yeah. I thought since you went to all this trouble to meet me, I should give you a present.

SNAKE

A present? What is it?

EVA

You really want to know?

SNAKE

Yeah.

EVA

It's a secret.

SNAKE

...

EVA

You'll find out when you get here.
Mountains - provisions storehouse

EVA

You must be worn out from all that mountain climbing. There's a provisions storehouse at the back of the hillside area. Why don't you go stock up on rations?
Mountains - underground tunnel
(1)

SNAKE

EVA, this door won't open...

EVA

Of course it won't.

SNAKE

Why not?

EVA

Why? Because it's the door to that underground tunnel I was telling you about, silly. Don't you listen to people when they're talking?

SNAKE

...
(2)

EVA

You won't be able to open that door without the key.

EVA

I've got that key. I'll give it to you when we meet up. The rendezvous point is the ruins at the top of the mountains. Hurry!
•Para-Medic
Prior to Reaching Mountaintop Ruins
Stamina in the mountains
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, the altitude in those mountains is pretty high. That means the oxygen concentration in the air is lower than normal.

PARA-MEDIC

When there's less oxygen in the air, naturally you'll be breathing less oxygen as well, and the oxygen content of your blood will go down.

PARA-MEDIC

In other words, you run the risk of becoming hypoxic. Hypoxia is a very serious condition. In the worst cases, it can lead to pulmonary and cerebral edema.

PARA-MEDIC

I don't think you need to worry right now, but all the same, be careful.

SNAKE

So... what do I need to be careful about?

PARA-MEDIC

In high-altitude areas, you will tire quicker than normal.

SNAKE

Okay.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, climbing uphill takes a lot of stamina as it is. But on top of that, the air up there is thinner than normal.

PARA-MEDIC

You're burning through stamina a lot faster now than ever before.

PARA-MEDIC

Keep an eye on your stamina gauge. Be sure to eat something to restore your stamina before you run out.
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Mountaintop Ruins
Mountain Hind
*After seeing the Hind in the mountains, first time

SNAKE

Sigint, the chopper we were talking about is flying around...

SIGINT

The one at the heliport?

SNAKE

Yeah.
-->Major Zero Radio Conversation: Hind explanation (2)
Anti-aircraft cannons
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, you see that anti-aircraft gun?
(2)

SIGINT

That's a ZU-23, a light towable anti-aircraft gun that the Soviets started producing in 1957.

SIGINT

It was designed for deployment in airborne units and motorized rifle divisions without their own self-propelled anti-air guns.

SIGINT

It's got two 23 mm air-cooled automatic cannons with a firing rate of 800 rounds per minute.

SIGINT

They usually take a six-man crew to operate, but you ought to be able to handle one by yourself.

SIGINT

In addition to shooting at low-flying aircraft, you can also use them as machine guns to target light-armored land vehicles. I imagine they'd be more than a match for that new attack chopper of theirs, too.
(3)

SIGINT

You can take over an anti-aircraft gun the same way you take over a gun emplacement — stand next to it and press the Action Button.

SIGINT

Use the Weapon Button to fire. Press the Aim Button to focus in on a target. Just remember that they've got limited ammo.

SIGINT

Also, don't forget, you can't move around while you're using an emplacement. If the enemy's getting too close for comfort, press the Action Button to ditch it, pronto.
Mountain Hind
(1)

SIGINT

The Hind is armed with a 12.7 mm machine gun on the nose and rocket pods and anti-tank missiles on the stub wing hard points...

SIGINT

Normally, you'd be crazy to try and fight it on foot. If it starts attacking with the machine gun or the rockets, take cover behind something as fast as you can.

SIGINT

As for the missiles, you should be able to knock out their guidance system by using a chaff grenade to block the radio signal.
(2)

SIGINT

Your assault rifle won't penetrate the Hind's armor.
(3)
*If player has RPG

SIGINT

Try the RPG-7.
(4)
*If player doesn't have RPG

SIGINT

If you don't use a rocket launcher or something with similar firepower you won't be able to take it down.
(5)
*If player has heard EVA Radio Conversation: Mountain Hind

SIGINT

EVA said there was an RPG-7 in those mountains, right? With an RPG-7, you might stand a chance against the Hind. Go find it.
(6)

SIGINT

If you can take over one of the anti-aircraft guns in the mountains, you'll be more than a match for that Hind.
Mountain Hind (4) - infantry drops

SIGINT

The Hind is a transport-attack chopper that can carry personnel. It might drop some troops on you. Don't get caught off guard.
Mountain Hind (5) - snipe the pilot

SIGINT

The Hind is protected by heavy armor, but a rifle bullet might be able to penetrate through the cockpit canopy. Try using the SVD.
Section 5
After Rendezvous with EVA at Mountaintop Ruins – Prior to Rendezvous with EVA Behind Waterfall
Using the key he got from EVA, Snake opens the door halfway up the mountain and proceeds through the underground tunnel, which is like a sewer system of sorts.
The Fury Appears
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button available)
The Fury makes his entrance. He's been waiting for Snake in an open space of the man-made tunnel. It's dark. The player can't see him without his flames illuminating him.
He walks into the scene spitting flames and lighting up the room.
The light from the fire reveals the silhouette of an astronaut in a jet-black spacesuit. The flames reflect off of his somewhat large faceplate. On his helmet are the letters "CCCP1." Bats inhabiting the space screech. With every jet of flame that is unleashed, they and other rodents all scatter at once. The columns of fire touch the ceiling. The charred remains of bats that had taken roost there drop to the ground. Black ash falls onto Snake's body. Any bats, rodents, etc., that The Fury burns do not turn into items.

THE FURY

I am The Fury! The flames of my rage will incinerate you!
Caption: Flame Soldier - The Fury (Richard Doyle)

THE FURY

I came back from space.

THE FURY

As I returned (into the atmosphere), I had one vision—the world set ablaze.

THE FURY

And do you know what I saw there?

THE FURY

Fury. A great and terrible fury at being alive.

THE FURY

Now—you're going to feel the scorching heat of that horrible blackness!
Like The Boss, The Fury has also been to space, but an accident during re-entry burned one third of his body. He can no longer even feel pain.
The Fury wants Snake to experience the same fire.
But in the end, Snake is the victor.
The Fury Dies
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button available)
The Fury staggers through the open space. His body is burning, the flames reaching all the way to the ceiling. He stops in the middle of the area.

THE FURY

Boss... this is the end of the Cobras...

THE FURY

You've got to live on... You're the only one left...

THE FURY

I'm off... to join The Sorrow...
The Fury removes his helmet.
The flames travel along the surface of his spacesuit and invade it through the large opening around the suit's neck.

THE FURY

Behold the flames of fury!

THE FURY

The fires of Hell will purge me clean!
The flames go back to where they came—inside his body. They have reversed course.
The man's face contorts as he is burned alive from the inside.
He walks while on fire.

THE FURY

I can see it! Mission control, do you read me?
The rockets on The Fury's back fire, lifting him toward the ceiling.

THE FURY

I'm coming home!!
He has a flashback to when he re-entered the atmosphere.
The Fury flies up to the ceiling.

THE FURY

I see the earth...
He crashes into it, exploding in a massive blast!
The ceiling starts to cave in. Snake runs for the exit.
Flames in the form of a dragon (its head has a human face, probably The Fury's) race through the tunnel. The door Snake took to get here is destroyed in an explosion. Fallen rock prevents Snake from returning to the mountains.
Having defeated The Fury, Snake presses on to the innermost part of the tunnel, where he finds a ladder that takes him up to the fortress.
Infiltrating Fortress
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button available)
Snake climbs the ladder and opens the manhole cover.
It's now night, and snow flurries are falling, intentionally reminiscent of MGS1. Searchlights travel back and forth across the ground. The snow is even piling up ever so slightly.
We can see Snake's breath. He's emerged in front (to the side) of a massive fortress. There are tanks, military trucks, etc., parked. Though the fortress is quite big, it's sectioned off by fences, so the area the player can move around in isn't that big. Here the player can see the entire scale of this giant installation.
Snake is taken aback by how big it is, and by its armaments (tanks). The player can press the First Person View Button to see what Snake sees, giving them a hint as to where Snake will be heading.
He silently climbs out through the manhole and puts the cover back on.
Snake infiltrates the east wing of the design building, where he locates Major Raikov. He takes him out in order to disguise himself as him.
Raikov's face is the spitting image of MGS2's Raiden.
Locking Raikov Away
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button available)
Snake takes off Raikov's clothes and places the now naked Raiden into a locker.
If the player goes into first person mode, they can see his (pixelated) crotch.
Editor's Note: Although the player cannot choose to go into first person mode, the cutscene camera has a first person shot that does show Raikov's (unpixelated) crotch.
Snake closes the locker.
Snake puts on Raikov's uniform and the disguise mask, passes through the main wing of the design lab, down a corridor, and infiltrates the west wing, making it to the room where Sokolov is behind held.
Sokolov Reunion
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button available)
The door closes.
Snake takes off the Raiden mask.
Outside the room where Sokolov is imprisoned. Snake is about to go in, until he hears Sokolov speaking with EVA (disguised as Tatyana). He quickly hides.
Snake peeks through the door. Sokolov hands EVA (in her mistress disguise) a microfilm. EVA (Tatyana) takes it.

SOKOLOV

Here it is.

EVA

You can count on me.
Sokolov put all development data on the Shagohod onto this microfilm.

EVA

What about the Philosophers' Legacy?

SOKOLOV

I don't know anything about that...
EVA, in a very deliberate manner, takes out a tube of lipstick and points it at Sokolov suggestively.

SOKOLOV

What are you (...that's the the Kiss of Death)...! Are you trying to kill me?

EVA

*exasperated* What's the matter?
EVA removes the cap.

SOKOLOV

I know nothing. I swear it! No one but the Colonel knows of the Legacy!

EVA

I see...

SOKOLOV

No, don't...!
EVA puts lipstick on her lips, again in a very deliberate manner (using Sokolov's glasses as a mirror?). It was just an ordinary tube of lipstick.
Sokolov is relieved.

SOKOLOV

*sighs in relief*
The disguised EVA walks toward the door. Snake hides, managing to avoid her. The player is temporarily unable to reach EVA on the radio from this point.
EVA walks out the double doors.
Snake heads in the room.

SOKOLOV

Who's there!?
At first, Sokolov is alarmed, but once he sees it's Snake he calms down.

SOKOLOV

You're the man from the CIA...

SNAKE

What are you doing here? I told you before, didn't I? I'm going to get you out of here.

SOKOLOV

Hmph... a man of honor, just like your commander... But I'm afraid you're too late.

SNAKE

Too late?

SOKOLOV

...

SNAKE

Don't tell me... the Shagohod's...?

SOKOLOV

Exactly. The final preparations for Phase 2 are complete.

SNAKE

... Sokolov, what exactly is Phase 2?

SOKOLOV

To put it in technical terms, it's a composite range extension system for medium-range ballistic missiles.
Sokolov Reunion
3D Cutscene 2
Phase 2 test 3D cutscene.
An impressive look at the Shagohod in action. Fire spits out of its rocket engines as it blasts down the runway-->it fires a missile-->deploys its parachutes and raises its flaps as it comes to a stop, kicking up a big cloud of dust and shooting sparks everywhere. The ballistic missile flies off.

SOKOLOV

The Shagohod was originally designed as a tank that could launch nuclear missiles from any type of terrain. There was just one problem we couldn't figure out how to solve...

SOKOLOV

The ICBMs we have today are simply too big for the Shagohod to carry. But the military would not hear of it. They demanded a weapon that could launch a nuclear missile directly into the American homeland. That is when I came up with the idea for Phase 2.

SNAKE

But there's no way you could load an ICBM on to the Shagohod. So how'd you do it?

SOKOLOV

By accelerating the Shagohod itself.

SNAKE

Accelerating it?

SOKOLOV

In Phase 2, a rocket booster unit is attached to the frame of the Shagohod.

SOKOLOV

The unit incorporates the same technology used in the Vostok rocket that sent Major Gagarin into space. Using this booster, the Shagohod can achieve a land speed of over 300 miles (500 kilometers) per hour.

SNAKE

That monster can go more than 300 miles (500 kilometers) per hour...?

SOKOLOV

Yes. And from this state of accelerated motion, it launches a nuclear missile.

SNAKE

So the Shagohod acts like the first stage of a rocket.

SOKOLOV

Yes, precisely. The range of the missile launchedby the Shagohod thus increases from 2,500 miles (4,000 kilometers) to 6,000 miles (10,000 kilometers).

SNAKE

6,000 miles (10,000 kilometers)... That's enough to strike anywhere in the United States...

SOKOLOV

Not only that, with the Shagohod, there is no need to construct giant silos like the ones used to house ICBMs. All you need is a runway about 3 miles (4.8 kilometers) in length, or its equivalent, and you can launch a thermo nuclear strike against any location in the United States from anywhere in the Soviet Union.

SOKOLOV

It cannot be detected by spy planes or satellites. It's a mobile fortress, capable of deploying in secret and launching its payload at any time...

SNAKE

A weapon from hell...
Sokolov Reunion
3D Cutscene 3
The Shagohod resting in its hangar.

SOKOLOV

A completed prototype now sits in the hangar. At present, it is the only one of its kind.

SOKOLOV

But Volgin is planning to mass-produce them based on that prototype.

SNAKE

And deploy them all over the Soviet Union?

SOKOLOV

Yes. And that's not the end of it. He's going to ship them to Eastern Europe, to Asia... to all the countries of the Eastern bloc. Even worse, he intends to use the Shagohod as bait to foment armed uprisings among dictators, ethnic insurgents, and revolutionary groups throughout the Third World.

SOKOLOV

His funds are nearly limitless. He could start mass production tomorrow if he wanted.

SOKOLOV

The reason that tensions between East and West have settled into a Cold War is because each side fears the other's power. "Deterrence" - the idea of using threats to keep one's enemy in check - is the perfect word to sum up this state of affairs. But, the Shagohod goes far beyond the level of "threat." It will render the concept of "deterrence" utterly meaningless.

SOKOLOV

If such a weapon is unleashed on the world, it will not be long before all nations are engulfed in conflict. The Cold War will end and the entire planet will be consumed by the fires of war. Volgin and the Shagohod will beat the center of it all.
Sokolov Reunion
3D Cutscene 4

SOKOLOV

So you see, it is already too late.

SNAKE

No. It's not too late.

SOKOLOV

What do you mean?

SNAKE

We've still got a chance. All we have to do is destroy the prototype and the whole facility before they can mass-produce it.

SOKOLOV

But...

SNAKE

Just tell me what I need to do to destroy this place.

SOKOLOV

... All right... The liquid fuel used in the rocket engine is stored in a tank. If you can blow it up somehow...

SOKOLOV

Some C3 ought to be enough to blow the entire hangar to smithereens.

SNAKE

*with an anachronistic feeling* C3?... You mean that cutting-edgeplastic explosive?

SOKOLOV

It can be molded into any shape. The bomb of the future.

SNAKE

Where can I get it?

SOKOLOV

There was some in the armory here, but it's gone now.

SOKOLOV

It was stolen by the female spy who was here a minute ago.

SNAKE

EVA?

SOKOLOV

No, that's not her name. Her name is Tatyana (Tanya).

SOKOLOV

She made her way in here by becoming Volgin's lover.

SNAKE

I thought she was your lover.

SOKOLOV

Mine? Oh, no. She is Volgin's lover.

SOKOLOV

This is my lover...
Sokolov shows Snake a photo. Thinking of his family, Sokolov beams.
First Person View Button option.
Sokolov shows his family photo. Player can see it if they press the First Person View Button.

SNAKE

Who are they?

SOKOLOV

My wife and daughter. They're in America.

SNAKE

Now I remember. Your family is in the custody of the CIA.
Sokolov puts away the photo.

SNAKE

How long has Tatyana (EVA) been here?

SOKOLOV

Only a few weeks.

SNAKE

A few days before the Virtuous Mission, then.

SOKOLOV

She said that Khrushchev sent her.

SNAKE

What did you just give her?

SOKOLOV

All of the experimental data for the Shagohod.
EVA has been duping Sokolov. Her plan is to take all the technical and test data on the Shagohod back to China.

SOKOLOV

Please, it is essential that you destroy the Shagohod.

SNAKE

I will. But first I've got to get you to safety.

SOKOLOV

No... I'm not going.

SNAKE

My mission is to rescue you!

SOKOLOV

Leave me.

SNAKE

Sokolov!
If the player presses the First Person View Button and looks around the room during the conversation with Sokolov, they'll see a cell door frequency written on a table or something or other. If they remember this, they'll have an easy escape from the jail sequence later on.

SOKOLOV

Khrushchev has abandoned me.

SOKOLOV

I cannot return to my country. I would most certainly be sent to the gulags.

SNAKE

What about the U.S.?

SOKOLOV

Yes, I once thought of that.

SOKOLOV

My family is waiting for me there.

SOKOLOV

But even if I fled to the United States...

SOKOLOV

I would once again find myself creating weapons of mass murder.

SOKOLOV

In the end it doesn't matter where I go...

SOKOLOV

I am still a weapons scientist.

SOKOLOV

To be honest with you, I am tired...

SOKOLOV

Every day, I help create things that should never be used - things that should never have existed in the first place.

SOKOLOV

Every day, without sleep...

SOKOLOV

Without a word of praise from others.

SOKOLOV

And my creations do not even benefit mankind.

SOKOLOV

They are merely the tools of politicians.
Sokolov Reunion
Movie Cutscene 1
(real footage)
Video of space development.

SOKOLOV

All I wanted to do was build space rockets...

SOKOLOV

But it was not to be. The space race between America and Russia became the prey of politicians.

SOKOLOV

The space race and the arms race are one and the same.

SOKOLOV

Missiles, rockets... What's the difference?

SOKOLOV

Scientists are always being used. (Said like Otacon would have said it.)

SOKOLOV

Please, watch over my family.
Sokolov Reunion
3D Cutscene 5
Beyond the door, we hear the sound of the outer double doors opening and closing.
Snake puts the disguise mask back on in order to pass as Major Raikov again.
The door opens, and in walks Volgin.

VOLGIN

Major, what are you doing here? I've been waiting for you in my room! (Volgin is playing dumb.)
Volgin has in fact been waiting for Raikov in his room for some time alone.
Snake salutes the Colonel.
Volgin sneers and walks up to Snake.
Out of the blue, Volgin grabs his crotch (a reference to MGS2). It's a different size. Snake pulls back.

VOLGIN

Who are you!?
Snake doesn't answer.

VOLGIN

Don't play dumb with me.

VOLGIN

If you think you can fool me, you are sorely mistaken.
Sokolov feigns ignorance.

VOLGIN

I know the Major better than anyone else...
Volgin and Major Ivan are lovers.

VOLGIN

I come here looking for Tatyana, and what should I find...

VOLGIN

... but a greasy freebooter!
Volgin draws his sidearm and thrusts it at Snake.
Suddenly, he points it at Sokolov and fires.
Volgin puts a bullet in each knee.

SOKOLOV

*screams*
Sokolov is still alive.
He'll be tortured in the upcoming torture event.
Volgin points the gun back at Snake.
Snake immediately forces Volgin's face to the ground with CQC.

VOLGIN

*groans*
Just as Snake points Volgin's gun at him, The Boss shows up.
The Boss closes the distance on Snake in an instant, as though she has an accelerator on her back, and goes to throw Snake with CQC and little effort. It turns into a battle of CQC vs CQC. Snake and The Boss use the other's moves on them.

SNAKE

*fighting grunts, several variations*

THE BOSS

*fighting grunts, several variations*

THE BOSS

What is this fairy disguise? It's gonna rub off on you.

THE BOSS

And then you'll lose sight of who you really are!
The Boss rips off Snake's disguise mask.
Volgin gets up. He picks up his gun and is about to shoot Snake.

THE BOSS

Stay out of this!
The Boss grabs Volgin's gun with CQC. Snake is momentarily distracted.
The Boss throws Snake a final time. With no delay, she finishes him off (stuns him).

SNAKE

*groans, stunned*
Snake has been defeated by The Boss once again.

VOLGIN

I see why they call you The Boss...

VOLGIN

What was that, some kind of judo? (He's a Japanophile.)

THE BOSS

No, it's called CQC... a basic form of close-quarters combat.

THE BOSS

He and I developed it together.
Snake is still conscious.

VOLGIN

Splendid!... I will take it from here.

THE BOSS

Are you going to kill him?

VOLGIN

Of course. But first...
Volgin clenches a fist. Electricity arcs from it.

VOLGIN

I will make him pay for hurting Ivan!
He grabs Snake by the face and strikes him with electric punches in the stomach, the liver, the kidneys, and so on.
Volgin's Hundred Crack Fist buzzes with power. Snake is quickly battered.
Snake throws up blood!
With all the pain, he can't help but scream.

VOLGIN

*yells with each hit*

SNAKE

*screams with each hit*
Volgin enjoys the screams. More and more Hundred Crack Fists follow!

VOLGIN

*more yells as he rains blows on Snake*

SNAKE

*more screams as he takes these blows*
The Boss looks away, then leaves the room.
The sounds of Snake being beaten echo from inside it.
Ocelot is standing outside the door. He looks bitter.
The Boss and Ocelot's eyes meet.
Ocelot breaks eye contact. The Boss leaves.
Editor's Note: In the release version, The Boss doesn't look Ocelot in the eye. She walks away with her head turned from him.
Volgin's assault continues.
Snake loses consciousness. Fade out.
Torture First Person Game 1
First person game (Torture Room - first person control available)
Snake wakes up in a torture room.
Snake hangs from the ceiling like a piece of meat, both his wrists tied with rope above his head. His feet are just barely touching the floor.
He's naked from the waist up, wounded all over.
There's a plastic bag around his head. He can't breathe properly. Every time he tries to do so, the bag clings to his mouth.
This is a method of torture that was often used in former Soviet states in Eastern Europe.
The bag covers the player's view in first person, so they can't see very well.
If the player moves the stick, Snake's head moves but the player still can't see.
Every time Snake breathes, the bag clings to his mouth.
The player can't open the Survival Viewer or the radio. They can open the weapon and item windows, but they're empty.
Next to the blinded Snake, Sokolov is being tortured. (Since Snake is blind, he can only hear the sounds of this.)

VOLGIN

Tell me!!

EVA

Stop it!
Sokolov is hit. He screams.

SOKOLOV

*screams*

VOLGIN

Who have you been talking to!?

EVA

He doesn't know what you're talking about!
Sokolov is hit again, and screams.

SOKOLOV

*screams*

VOLGIN

You'd better start talking!!

EVA

Please, stop this!
Sokolov is hit another time, and screams.

SOKOLOV

*screams*

VOLGIN

Who is Khrushchev's lapdog?

EVA

How can you do this to him?
Sokolov is hit once more, but there is no scream.

VOLGIN

I know you gave the data to someone!!

EVA

He'd never do a thing like that!

EVA

You monster...
The sounds pan as we hear Sokolov being picked up, thrown at something (a table or something), hitting it, and the object breaking.
Sokolov is hit again, but like before there is no scream.
Sokolov is hit again.

VOLGIN

... I guess he's dead.
Sokolov is hit again. No scream.
Another hit. A period of quiet.

EVA

*repulsed by the sheer brutality*

VOLGIN

Now, then... *voice approaches Snake's direction* I hope you'll prove more entertaining than he was.

VOLGIN

But first, let's take a look at your body, shall we?
Survival Viewer
Before beginning Snake's interrogation, Volgin thoroughly inspects his body.
The screen changes to the Survival Viewer's x-ray mode. Snake's x-ray body spins around (this is Volgin inspecting him).
Editor's Note: In the release version, the game doesn't enter the Survival Viewer's x-ray mode. The player simply hears Volgin's comments while Snake's vision remains obscured.
*If player has sustained many injuries up to this point

VOLGIN

You're a tough one, my friend. A lesser man would be dead by now.

VOLGIN

*chuckles* This ought to be interesting...
*If player has sustained an average number of injuries

VOLGIN

You've certainly seen your share of battles.

VOLGIN

*chuckles* Consider yourself lucky. I am about to show you what hell is really like...
*If player has sustained few injuries

VOLGIN

What a beautiful body you have. Like a newborn baby...

VOLGIN

*chuckles* But not for long...
Of course, the game will remember the injuries Snake sustains during Volgin's torture, and the player can check them anytime.

VOLGIN

Well then, let's get started...
