Volgin begins the interrogation. After each question, he hits Snake.
Snake never says a word.

VOLGIN

What is your target?

VOLGIN

Is it the Shagohod!?

VOLGIN

Or Sokolov!?

VOLGIN

Or maybe it's the Legacy!?

VOLGIN

Answer me! Who is helping you?

VOLGIN

Who let you in here?

VOLGIN

You're a tough one. But even you must have your limits.

VOLGIN

And I am a patient man.
Torture
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button available)
Volgin throws water on Snake. Ocelot is in the room, watching Volgin go to work from some distance away.
Snake still has the plastic bag around his head. We can't see his expressions.

VOLGIN

Here is where the fun really begins!

VOLGIN

My body carries an electric charge of 10 million volts.

VOLGIN

Let's see how you like this!
Volgin sends more electricity into Snake's body! Snake shakes.

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
It pains Ocelot to see this, but at the same time, he can't help but be taken with the Colonel's shock torture method.

VOLGIN

Now, answer me! How much does the CIA know?

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*

VOLGIN

They're after my Legacy, aren't they!?

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Volgin continues the shock torture.

VOLGIN

Your real target is the Philosophers' Legacy, isn't it!?

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Ocelot looks away. He grasps the jammed cartridge that hangs from his neck.
Snake soils himself from all the electricity.

VOLGIN

Yes, yes! Let yourself go! That is what I want to see!
Suddenly, The Boss enters the room.
She and Ocelot meets eyes again.
The Boss has come to put a stop to this. EVA (as Tatyana) follows behind her. When EVA sees what is going on, she is frozen with horror.

THE BOSS

It's no use. He's not going to talk.
Snake reacts to The Boss' voice.

THE BOSS

He's been trained not to break.

THE BOSS

Trained by me.
But Volgin ignores The Boss' words and electrocutes Snake again!

VOLGIN

Admit it! You're after the location of the Legacy!

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Volgin begins to lose all self-control.

VOLGIN

The secret fund established by the three Great Powers during the two World Wars! That's what you're looking for, isn't it!?

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Another electric punch from Volgin.

VOLGIN

One hundred billion dollars, divided up and hidden all over the world!

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Another electric punch.

VOLGIN

And you're looking for a record ofwhere all that money is hidden, right!?

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
And another.

VOLGIN

No matter. The Philosophers' Legacy is safely in my possession, in the underground vault of Groznyj Grad. You will never lay a finger on it!

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Volgin lets slip the whereabouts of the ledger for the fortune the Patriots have secretly amassed.
The Boss heard this. So did EVA, and a look of joy momentarily appears on her face.
They exchange glances.
Another electric shock from Volgin! With that, a charred object drops from Snake's body.

SNAKE

*screams from the electricity*
Volgin picks up the piece of metal between his fingers.

VOLGIN

What's this? A transmitter...
He shows the transmitter to Ocelot and The Boss.

VOLGIN

Who is responsible for this?

THE BOSS

I am...
The Boss steps forward.

THE BOSS

I planted it on him to keep track of his movements.
Volgin throws what's left of the transmitter. Ocelot grabs it out of the air.
He gets the idea to plant the transmitter back on Snake.

VOLGIN

Why?

THE BOSS

So the Cobras could ambush him.

VOLGIN

If they knew where he was going to be, they (the Cobras) wouldn't have gotten themselves slaughtered.
Volgin distrusts The Boss somewhat.

VOLGIN

It pains me to do this, Boss, but under the circumstances...

VOLGIN

I'm afraid I must ask you to show me some proof that you and he were not in collusion.

THE BOSS

You don't trust me, is that it?

VOLGIN

Not that...
Volgin gets flustered.

VOLGIN

But he is your apprentice.

THE BOSS

What do you want me to do?

VOLGIN

Let's see... Cut out his eyes!
The Boss shoots Volgin a look.

VOLGIN

I don't like those blue eyes of his.

VOLGIN

There is nothing more important to a soldier than his eyes.

VOLGIN

You made him a soldier... and now you will unmake him.

VOLGIN

Yes... it will make for a touching display.
The Boss doesn't budge.

VOLGIN

He's all yours.

VOLGIN

Do it!
The Boss hesitates. She looks at EVA. EVA shakes her head.

VOLGIN

Ruin him, just as he did the Cobras! (He killed them all.)
Volgin's words make up The Boss' mind.
She pulls out her CQC knife and slowly approaches.
EVA turns her face away.

EVA

! (She can't bear to watch.)
Ocelot looks on with a smile. He grabs EVA and forces her to watch.

EVA

*grunts*
EVA shakes him off.
With the tip of her knife, The Boss cuts out the area of the plastic bag around Snake's eyes, exposing them.
Editor's Note: In the release version, she pulls the bag off completely.
The Boss moves in on Snake's eyes. She looks sad.

SNAKE

*disordered breathing from the fear*
The tip of the knife closes in on one of Snake's eyeballs.
Volgin sneers.

EVA

Stop!
EVA steps in front of Snake.
The Boss lowers her knife.

VOLGIN

What is it, Tanya?

EVA

He's suffered enough!

OCELOT

Well, well... (Just as I thought.)
Ocelot walks up to EVA. He seems confident he's figured out who the spy is.

OCELOT

Why are you protecting him?
He sniffs.

OCELOT

*sniffs* That smell...
Suddenly, Ocelot pulls EVA toward him.

OCELOT

Tatyana! You're the spy!

EVA

What are you talking about?
He brings his nose to her neck and smells it to confirm his suspicion.

OCELOT

*sniffs* I know that smell...
Ocelot then grabs one of EVA's breasts to check it.
EVA slaps Ocelot's face with an open hand!

EVA

Stop it!
He wanted to compare her breasts with the biker's.
But he still has no conclusive proof.

VOLGIN

Taken a fancy to her, eh, Ocelot?

OCELOT

No, I have no interest in this woman.
Ocelot takes out one of his revolvers and loads a live round.

OCELOT

I want to test her.
He closes the cylinder and spins it.

OCELOT

I'll let this be the judge.

VOLGIN

Do as you like.
Ocelot puts one round in one revolver and spins the cylinder.
He grabs EVA by the arm and pushes her out front.
Suspecting EVA to be the spy, Ocelot is going to play Russian roulette with her in front of Snake. He starts juggling his three revolvers.

OCELOT

Here we go!
First shot! Empty.

EVA

!
Second shot! Empty.

EVA

!
Third shot! Empty.

EVA

!
Both of Snake's hands are tied. (He's hanging from the ceiling.)
Snake bumps into Ocelot to save EVA. A revolver fires.
There's a muzzle flash right in front of Snake's right eye!
The eye is obliterated.
Snake cries out.

SNAKE

*shrieks* !!

EVA

*screams*
EVA covers her face.
The Boss grabs the revolver out of the air.
She'll give this to Snake later. Now Ocelot is down to two revolvers.

THE BOSS

There. Satisfied now?
The Boss gets right up in Ocelot's face when she says this.

VOLGIN

Well, that was refreshing. Come... we're going to my room!
Volgin leaves the torture room. EVA is in tears.

EVA

*sobbing*
Ocelot goes up to Snake's back and strikes him with his fist. (He's imbedding the transmitter into his body.)
Snake groans from more pain.

OCELOT

*grunts from inflicting the blow*

SNAKE

*groans*

OCELOT

So you survived the Colonel's torture, eh?

OCELOT

Watching this has made me realize something... (Torture's) it's really not that bad.

OCELOT

It's the ultimate form of expression.
Ocelot heads for the door.
He passes EVA on the way.

OCELOT

You got lucky this time, Tatyana.
The Boss loads one round (a fake death pill) into the revolver.
She points the gun at Snake's forehead.
She then redirects it from his head to the side of his torso (a spot where there are no organs) and pulls the trigger!

SNAKE

*screams*
The "bullet" (the fake death pill) strikes Snake and doesn't pass through.
The Boss sticks the empty revolver on Snake's hip (between his belt and his body).
She looks hard at Snake.
The player can see The Boss' mouth by pressing the First Person View Button. Snake only has one eye now, so from this point on his field of vision is narrower.
They lock eyes. The Boss has something she wants to tell him.
She mouths the door frequency code.

THE BOSS

Run!
If the player goes into First Person View, they can see The Sorrow behind The Boss.
He's friendly toward Snake. In first person, the player can see him shaking his head slightly.
He's holding a note with the frequency written on it.
"144.75"
Only players who are pressing the First Person View Button here will be able to open the door. Escape Method 1.
The Boss leaves. Only EVA remains. She stops her pretend crying.
EVA whispers into Snake's ear.

EVA

I've prepared an escape route for us. Go out and head west. Pass underneath the connecting passageway and go north. You'll find an open manhole there.

SNAKE

You're...
Soldiers enter.

EVA

Quiet. Go through the manhole down into the sewers. The door at the north end of the sewers is unlocked - you can use it to get outside the fortress. I've got your equipment. We'll meet up later.

SNAKE

EVA...

EVA

But I can't get too close to your cell. You'll have to figure a way out of there yourself...
The soldiers approach.

EVA

I'll be in touch.
Snake's right eye has been obliterated. He loses consciousness.
He's then taken away to his cell.
All the electric shocks from Volgin have fully charged Snake's batteries.
However, he has none of his equipment.
After Volgin's torture, Snake is imprisoned in the cell.
*If the player keeps throwing back the food they are given, or if they capture food in their cell and keep giving it to the guard, the guard will like Snake. -->Cell Guard Conversation 3D Cutscene 1
Cell Guard Conversation
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (night - change view button available)
A soldier approaches Snake's cell. Relaxing his guard, he talks to Snake.

GUARD

Hey, you're not such a bad guy after all. I... I guess not all Americans are dogs.
Snake approaches the bars.

SNAKE

You mean it?

GUARD

Yeah.
The guard looks around before continuing in a hushed voice.

GUARD

You know, before the war started I used to live in America. I even had a wife and a kid...

SNAKE

You must be pretty lonely.

GUARD

Yeah, I am pretty lonely... REALLY lonely.

SNAKE

What's your kid's name?

GUARD

Johnny.

SNAKE

Johnny... nice ring to it.
This makes the guard happy.

GUARD

Really? You like it?... Well, if you say so, I'll believe you.

GUARD

Actually, my name is Johnny, too. All the first-born sons in my family are called Johnny. My dad's a Johnny, and my son's son will probably be a Johnny, too.

SNAKE

A whole clan of Johnnies.
The guard takes out a framed photo (there's a mirror on the back). It's a picture of a toddler.
If the player presses the First Person View Button here, they can see the frequency to the cell door.
The man gets emotional, and starts to cry a little.

GUARD

Why do we have a Cold War, anyway... Our two countries used to be such good friends.

SNAKE

Yeah, I hear ya.

GUARD

I just want to see my family again...

SNAKE

Must be rough.

GUARD

Yeah... not as rough as you have it though.
The guard takes out Snake's cigarettes from his breast pocket.

GUARD

Here.

GUARD

I filched them from your equipment when the Colonel wasn't looking.
Snake takes the cigarette guns. If the player doesn't receive them here, they'll be in their equipment they get back from EVA.

GUARD

It's the least I can do...
Snake figures it can't hurt to ask and makes a request.

SNAKE

Don't suppose you could let me out of here?
The guard snaps back to reality.

GUARD

Huh? I can't do that. *voices become harsh* Hey, don't you go getting any funny ideas. If you try to escape, I'll have to shoot you.

GUARD

I've said too much.

GUARD

I gotta go.
The guard returns to his previous position.
Snake busts out of the cell and drops down into the sewers through the manhole EVA opened.
He then gets a call from her.
Radio Screen - After Reaching Sewers
Radio Call 1
(mandatory incoming call)

EVA

Snake? You're already in the sewers...?

SNAKE

EVA? Yeah, I just got down here.

EVA

...

SNAKE

I'm coming to meet you now. The door at the north end is open, right?

EVA

Uh, Snake...

SNAKE

Let me guess - there's a problem.

EVA

Yeah.

SNAKE

What is it this time?

EVA

The Colonel found out you escaped.

SNAKE

He did, huh. Figured as much. (As expected.)

EVA

Yeah, and now all of Groznyj Grad is on red alert.

SNAKE

Just my luck. But once I'm out of the fortress...

EVA

You can't get out.

SNAKE

I can't?

EVA

When the fortress went on red alert, they sealed off the sewers.

SNAKE

You've got to be kidding me.

EVA

I'm serious. And that means the escape route I laid out...

SNAKE

... is sealed off too.

EVA

Right. And they just sent a unit out looking for you.

SNAKE

Down here?

EVA

Uh huh. They'll be there any minute now. You've got to get out quick!

SNAKE

But isn't the exit sealed off?

EVA

You should be able to get out by heading straight north. Book it Snake! If they find you, you're dead!
Enemy search teams hunt Snake through the sewers.
Despite the soldiers and hounds after him, he keeps running north, and eventually comes to the exit.
Waterfall Dive
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button available)
Snake runs to escape. Dogs and soldiers are after him. He comes to the exit from the sewers. The sun has risen. It's bright out. But then, the sewers suddenly come to an end. Snake stops. He looks down. It's about a 20-meter drop. There's a waterfall close by. It's a dead end. Snake turns around. The Ocelot Unit has planted itself not too far away. The dogs also remain still, though they bark at him.
Snake takes another look down to the waterfall basin below. It's quite a drop.
The dogs, soldiers, and Ocelot Unit close in.
Ocelot takes out his revolver as he comes running at Snake.
Editor's Note: In the release version, Ocelot's appearance is more static. He simply emerges from behind the Ocelot Unit.

OCELOT

I've been waiting for this!

OCELOT

Nobody interfere!
Ocelot rips off the jammed cartridge necklace.
He loads the cartridge into the cylinder and spins it, then cocks the hammer.

OCELOT

This is where it ends...
He aims the revolver.
He pulls the trigger!
Click! It's empty.
Snake decides to jump.

SNAKE

*yells after deciding to jump and doing it* !

OCELOT

Snake! (Don't!)
It's a yell of heartbreak from Ocelot. He doesn't want to lose Snake.
He pulls the trigger again!
Click! Empty again.
Snake is swallowed up by the basin. He sticks his head above the surface and catches a breath.

SNAKE

*gasps for air after he sticks his head back above water*
Snake is carried away underwater by the rapids.
Ocelot looks down at the waterfall basin.
Ocelot points the revolver's sight at Snake as he travels down the river.
He's about to continue firing, but seeing Snake disappear under the rapids, he lowers his gun.
There's a click as he pops the cylinder out and looks at the jammed cartridge. It was going to fire with the next pull of the trigger.
He holsters his gun (with some gunplay), looking happy.

OCELOT

Don't die on me yet...
Ocelot mutters the above before walking away.
Snake drowns as he's tossed about by the current.
He doesn't know which way is up and which way is down.
Snake sinks to the bottom of the river.
He jumped into the waterfall, only to be swallowed up by the river.
When Snake regains consciousness, it's night, and he's standing in a mangrove forest engulfed by flames. Though fascinated by this unfathomable sight, Snake presses on through the fire.
The Sorrow Appears
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (Fiery night - change view button available)
It starts to rain. The heavier the rain gets, the more the flames disappear. Eventually, they're all gone. Sensing a presence, Snake stops. He's naked from the waist up.
Streaks of passing rain get more intense.
A figure (The Sorrow) emerges from the rain. All the heavy rain bouncing off of him has made him visible. He isn't walking with his feet, though. He's floating above the riverbed.
Editor's Note: In the release version, The Sorrow rises up from the river.
The Sorrow approaches Snake. Snake aims his revolver at him (even though it's out of bullets).
There's a flash of lightning, and a face appears within the hood. It's The Sorrow, whose face we've seen many a time in cutscenes.

SNAKE

Are you one of the Cobras?

THE SORROW

Sad... so sad...
The man mutters, but his lips don't move.

THE SORROW

A host of sorrows...

THE SORROW

And you are one of them...
The man doesn't answer. He just lowers his hood.
He has a pallid face and is wearing glasses. He has the look of death. He also seems to be carrying some sort of pain. His hair is slicked back, clinging to his head from the rain. He looks like something that just crawled out the ocean.

THE SORROW

I am The Sorrow. Like you, I, too, am filled with sadness.
Caption: Spirit Soldier - The Sorrow (David Thomas)

THE SORROW

This world is one of sadness...

THE SORROW

Battle brings death. Death brings sorrow. The living... may not hear them. Their voices... may fall upon deaf ears. But make no mistake... the dead... are not silent.

THE SORROW

Now you will know the sorrow of those whose lives you have ended.
A red tear drips from the man's eye. One of the lenses of his glasses breaks.
Snake can get a game over from The Sorrow's attacks. But if the player looks closely, they'll see it's no ordinary game over. It's a near-death game over. Snake uses the revival pill that was put in his molar and attempts to return to the world of the living.
The Sorrow Battle End
3D Cutscene 1
3D cutscene (afternoon - change view button available)
Snake is drowning at the bottom of the river. The Sorrow grabs him and lifts his body up.
We hear The Sorrow's voice.

THE SORROW

Boss, you have to shoot me!

THE BOSS

I can't!

THE SORROW

Shoot me!!

THE BOSS

...

THE SORROW

*tenderly* You want to finish your mission, don't you? Then... you'll have to shoot me.
Sound of The Boss aiming her gun.

THE SORROW

The spirit of the warrior... will always be with you.

THE SORROW

Don't be sad... we'll meet again someday.
A gunshot.
Shot of the scene when The Sorrow died. It's raining.
The instant we hear the gunshot, that sight appears on-screen as a still image.
Editor's Note: In the release version, a close-up of The Sorrow's face (3D) appears instead.
One of the lenses of The Sorrow's glasses breaks again (it cracks). A bloody tear.
Snake has regained consciousness. He swims to the surface.
He sticks his head above water and gasps for air!

SNAKE

*gasping for air*
Snake is carried away by the river and washes up on the riverbank. He has a coughing fit.

SNAKE

*coughs up water*
If the player looks at the riverbank in First Person View, they can see The Sorrow waving.
Snake is in a stunning forest teeming with life. Brilliant butterflies fly around.
The murmuring of the stream, sunlight filtering through the trees, all the signs of the forest.
Having made it back from the other side, Snake is deeply moved!
Snake somehow makes it to his feet. Then, a radio call comes in!
The Sorrow Battle End
Radio Call 1

ZERO

Snake, are you all right? That was a close call!

SNAKE

What the hell happened to me?

ZERO

You were halfway drowned at the bottom of the river. Almost crossed over to the other side...

SNAKE

Other side... So that really was...

ZERO

Something on your mind, Snake?

SNAKE

Major, was there a man in the Cobra Unit called The Sorrow?

ZERO

Yes, I've heard of him. He was an uncanny soldier who fought alongside The Boss.

SNAKE

What kind of man was he?

ZERO

The Sorrow was a man with, well... special powers. He had ESP, which was the subject of extensive research in the Soviet Union at the time. He was especially gifted as a medium.

SNAKE

A medium?

ZERO

Someone who can communicate with the spirit world, and evoke the spirits of the dead.

ZERO

In other words, he could talk to ghosts. They say he could find out what was going on in a battle by talking to dead soldiers.

SNAKE

... What about him and The Boss... What was the story between them?

ZERO

I don't know the details... Why don't we ask Sigint?
The radio screen changes, as does the frequency.

SIGINT

Yo. I finished checking up on this Sorrow guy a while ago. Thought you guys already knew, though.

SNAKE

Knew what?

SIGINT

That he's dead. He's been dead for two years now.

SNAKE

He died two years ago...?

SIGINT

At Tselinoyarsk... you know, those cliffs you were at.

SIGINT

And The Boss is the one who did him in.

SNAKE

The Boss?

SIGINT

Yup. Two years ago, The Boss was sent by the CIA on a secret mission to Tselinoyarsk. That's when she met The Sorrow, who'd gone back to the Soviet Union after the Cobras broke up at the end of the war. Except this time they were enemies.

SNAKE

... And then what?

SIGINT

The Boss killed The Sorrow herself and accomplished her mission. At least, that's what the records say.
The Sorrow's remains lie beneath the rope bridge from the start of the game.
It's located in the game area, but placed at a point where the player cannot approach them.

SNAKE

*dumbfounded* ... So he was never there in the first place... He just couldn't let go of The Boss...

SIGINT

You OK, Snake?

SNAKE

Yeah, I'm fine. It looks like it's not time for me to die yet.

SIGINT

I sure hope not. Otherwise the whole mission is shot. We're counting on you, pal.

SNAKE

Roger that.
Snake changes the radio frequency and makes a call.

SNAKE

EVA?

EVA

Snake!? You didn't call... I was worried! Are you all right?

SNAKE

Yeah. I took a pretty freaky detour.

EVA

What are you talking about?

SNAKE

Nothing, forget it. Let's just say I'm back.

EVA

Good. But how did you escape from the sewers?

SNAKE

I jumped into the river.

EVA

From all the way up there? You're out of control.

SNAKE

Yeah. I got carried away by the current and almost drowned.

EVA

Great! That's perfect!

SNAKE

*objecting* What do you mean, that's perfect?

EVA

I mean if you ended up in the river, then I know a good spot nearby. Let's meet up there.

SNAKE

Where is it?
Radio Miniscreen: Video of the waterfall.

EVA

Keep going upstream until you get to a waterfall.

SNAKE

A waterfall, huh.

EVA

Right. Behind that waterfall, there's a cave. We'll meet in there.

SNAKE

The cave behind the waterfall upstream. Got it.

EVA

See you there.
Footnotes
1Acronym for the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (the Soviet Union) when written in Russian notation.
Radio Conversations
•Major
Prior to Reaching Tunnel
Back of ruins

ZERO

It looks like you can get a nice panoramic view of Groznyj Grad from there. Perhaps you should scout it out now while you can.

ZERO

Just don't do anything too conspicuous. Remember that the attack chopper is still on patrol.
After meeting EVA - go to underground tunnel
(1)

ZERO

You've got the key from EVA. Now use it to enter the underground tunnel. The great fortress of Groznyj Grad is at the end of that tunnel.
(2)

ZERO

The door to the underground tunnel is near the center of that area, a little to the east. Get over there fast.
(3)

ZERO

The door to the underground tunnel is in the summit area. Hurry.
After mountains - Tatyana

SNAKE

Major, I saw that Tatyana woman again.

ZERO

Hmm. We've been analyzing our data, but so far we've been unable to find anyone matching that description.

ZERO

Maybe her posting was so obscure that we simply overlooked it...

SNAKE

Or maybe she's such a VIP that all the data on her has been classified.

ZERO

That's a possibility. But I'd be tempted to go with the first explanation. We'll keep going over the data.

SNAKE

Thanks.
After meeting EVA - player doesn't go to tunnel
(1)

ZERO

Snake, hold on.

SNAKE

What?

ZERO

Do you know where you're supposed to be going?

SNAKE

Of course I do.

ZERO

Tell me, then.

SNAKE

The tunnel to Groznyj Grad.

ZERO

And do you know where the entrance to that tunnel is?

SNAKE

Yeah... (He doesn't know.)

ZERO

Where is it?

SNAKE

It's... over there.

ZERO

Over where?

SNAKE

No, I mean, it's over here.

ZERO

...

SNAKE

... Or was it over that way?

ZERO

*sighs* ...
(2)
*If player went to wrong location

ZERO

The entrance to the underground tunnel leading to Groznyj Grad is near the center of the summit area. Sokolov is in grave danger. Get a move on.
(3)
*If player went to wrong location

SNAKE

*murmuring* ... So it was over there...
Underground tunnel - before The Fury

ZERO

Follow that tunnel to the north and you'll come out inside Groznyj Grad. Keep going north.
•Para-Medic
Prior to Reaching Tunnel
The Boss' horse

PARA-MEDIC

The horse The Boss was riding sounds like an Andalusian.

PARA-MEDIC

Andalusians are from the region of Andalusia in Spain.

PARA-MEDIC

They're renowned for their beauty, their gentle nature, and their physical prowess.

SNAKE

Hmm...

PARA-MEDIC

Just so you know, you can't eat them.

SNAKE

Hey, I didn't say anything.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, but you were going to.

SNAKE

I was?

PARA-MEDIC

Yes.

PARA-MEDIC

Don't even think about eating a horse. Got it?

SNAKE

*muttering to himself* Guess I'll have to mark it off the list.

PARA-MEDIC

What did you say!?

SNAKE

I'm just kidding.

PARA-MEDIC

...
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Tunnel
Granin's spy shoes (1)

SIGINT

You say Granin's shoes were rigged with a transmitter?

SIGINT

That sounds like something the KGB's been working on lately. It's exactly like you described - a miniature transmitter that's small enough to put in a shoe.

SNAKE

Granin said he got the shoes from a woman called Tatyana... You think she's a KGB spy?

SIGINT

Could be. Or maybe it's some kind of ploy to throw suspicion on her.

SNAKE

*pondering* ...

SIGINT

Anyway, it's your job to find out.

SNAKE

... Good point.
The WIG
*After EVA says she's prepared a wing-in-ground-effect aircraft as their means to escape

SNAKE

Sigint.

SIGINT

Yo.

SNAKE

EVA said she set up a ground effect vehicle for us to make our escape.

SIGINT

So I heard.

SIGINT

The ground effect vehicle - or WIG - is something like a cross between an airplane and a boat. It uses ground effect to fly.

SIGINT

Ground effect basically means that when the craft skims the surface of the ground, the air between the ground and the wing is compressed, which gives the wing an extra boost.

SIGINT

From what Western intelligence agencies have been able to gather, the Russians are pretty serious about developing these WIGs. Apparently they're planning on using them for anti-submarine patrols.

SIGINT

I guess I can see why. The WIG's long cruising range and high-speed capabilities make it a good choice for that kind of mission.

SIGINT

EVA must have gotten her hands on one of the first prototypes while it was being field tested as a transport craft.

SIGINT

The WIG has a top speed of over 400 miles per hour. And its range is pretty good, too.

SIGINT

Not that speed is going to help you if you've got a supersonic fighter jet on your tail, but if you hug the surface and stay off the radar, you should have no problems getting away.
•Major
The Fury Battle
The Fury battle - basics
(1)

ZERO

The Fury is equipped with a powerful flamethrower. Whatever you do, don't attack him from the front.

ZERO

Get behind him and attack him from there.
(2)

ZERO

You'll never get anywhere fumbling around in the dark. You need to be able to see first.

ZERO

Use the night-vision goggles.
(3)

ZERO

You could also try using a torch or a cigar.
The Fury battle - flying

ZERO

Watch out for The Fury's flying attacks. Even if he's far away from you, he can close in on you in an instant.

ZERO

But he should be vulnerable for an instant when he takes off and when he lands. That's your chance!
The Fury battle - flame attacks
(1)

ZERO

The Fury's flamethrower is immensely powerful. Do not under any circumstances try to approach him from the front.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, watch out for The Fury's flame attacks.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Those flames are incredibly intense. If you get blasted at close range, it's likely to result in a severe burn.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get burned, go into the Survival Viewer right away and use "CURE" to treat it!
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If your body catches on fire, you can put it out by rolling around repeatedly.

PARA-MEDIC

You can also go into the Survival Viewer and change out of the burning clothes.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

As long as you put out the flames right away, you shouldn't get burned.
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

So if you catch on fire, take care of it immediately!
•Para-Medic
The Fury Battle
The Fury battle - the heat

PARA-MEDIC

The tunnel looks like it's getting pretty hot. That's what happens when you use such a powerful flamethrower in an enclosed space.

PARA-MEDIC

In that kind of heat, you'll lose stamina more quickly than normal. Be sure to eat something to replenish your stamina before you get too exhausted to fight.
•Sigint
The Fury Battle
The Fury battle - flamethrower
(1)

SIGINT

That's not an ordinary flamethrower The Fury's using.

SIGINT

Normally, flamethrowers use a mixture of napalm and gasoline for fuel. But from what I hear, that guy is using liquid rocket fuel.

SIGINT

I'm guessing it's probably a mixture of UDHM - unsymmetrical dimethyl hydrazine - and NTO - nitrogen tetroxide.

SIGINT

I'm sure you've seen how potent that stuff is.
(2)

SIGINT

The Fury's flamethrower is one hell of a weapon. Any frontal attack you make is just gonna get swatted down by the flames. You've got to circle around him and attack from behind or from the side.
The Fury battle - the darkness
(1)

SIGINT

You can't fight if you can't see in front of your face. You need to be able to rely on your vision.

SIGINT

You can try the night-vision goggles, but keep an eye on the batteries.

SIGINT

Don't look straight at The Fury's flames when you're wearing the night-vision goggles, though, or you'll be blinded by the afterimage for a while.

SIGINT

If he fires the flamethrower, either look away or take off the goggles.
(2)

SIGINT

If the batteries in the night-vision goggles are used up, you can use a cigar or a torch for light.

SIGINT

But if you try and get close to him with the light on, he'll know you're there. Keep that in mind.
The Fury battle - prior to breaching fireproof suit
(1)

SIGINT

The Fury is wearing a special flameproof outfit made from a spacesuit.

SIGINT

If it's tough enough to stand up to those flames he's belching out, grenades and white phosphorus grenades aren't even going to make a dent.

SIGINT

Of course, if you manage to tear through that suit, then it's a different story.
(2)

SIGINT

If you use a knife and engage him at close range, you should be able to rip right through that flameproof suit of his.

SIGINT

To get close enough to use your knife, try stalking up from behind him.

SIGINT

But you've got more to worry about than not making noise. Any light you're carrying, like a cigar or a torch, will give you away.

SIGINT

So when you're creepin' up on him, unequip your cigar or torch.
The Fury battle - after breaching fireproof suit
(1)

SIGINT

You broke through The Fury's flameproof suit!?

SIGINT

Now grenades and white phosphorus should work on him.
(2)

SIGINT

You can also try blowing up a drum when he's standing next to it.
(3)

SIGINT

Check out the ceiling. See that gas pipe?

SIGINT

If you shoot it, it'll burst into flames.

SIGINT

Now that The Fury's suit is torn you should be able to hurt him with it, so go for it!
•Major
Prior to Reaching Groznyj Grad
After The Fury - continue on
(1)

ZERO

You defeated The Fury, huh?

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

That only leaves (The Boss)...

SNAKE

I haven't forgotten.

ZERO

Good.

ZERO

But your first priority is to get Sokolov out of the fortress.

SNAKE

Right.
(2)

ZERO

The ladder at the end of that underground tunnel should take you up into Groznyj Grad.

ZERO

Once the Shagohod is completed, there's no telling how long they'll let Sokolov live. You've got to hurry.
After The Fury - you can't go back
*At the door that got blocked off after The Fury exploded

ZERO

The other side of that door is blocked by rubble as a result of The Fury's explosion.

ZERO

You won't be able to open it. Forget about it and continue your mission.
•Major
Prior to Infiltrating Weapons Lab
Infiltrating fortress - at first
(1)

ZERO

Good, you've finally made it inside Groznyj Grad.

SNAKE

Finally.

ZERO

Stay alert. This is the enemy's main base. The security here is on a scale you haven't encountered yet.

SNAKE

No kidding.

ZERO

Your objective is the weapons lab. It's the giant building in the center of the fortress. Sokolov is in the west wing of that building.
(2)

ZERO

To get into the area where Sokolov is imprisoned, you'll need to find Major Raikov, steal his clothes, and disguise yourself as him.

ZERO

Raikov is supposed to be in the east wing of the weapons lab.
(3)

ZERO

Start out by sneaking into the east wing of the weapons lab. Then, neutralize Raikov, and take his clothes.
(4)
*If player is in southeast area

ZERO

The weapons lab is to the north of the area you're in now. Head north.
(5)
*If player is in northeast area

ZERO

The weapons lab is located in the center of the area you're in now. Head for the east wing of the weapons lab.
(6)
*If player is in northwest area

ZERO

The weapons lab is to the east of the area you're in now. Head east.
(7)
*If player is in southwest area

ZERO

The weapons lab is to the northeast of the area you're in now. Head northeast.
•EVA
Prior to Infiltrating Weapons Lab
After infiltrating fortress - can reach EVA again
*After parting ways with EVA at the summit, player is temporarily unable to reach her. The following occurs if player tried contacting her several times during this period

SNAKE

EVA?

EVA

Snake?

SNAKE

You're all right...

EVA

Were you worried about me?

SNAKE

Yeah, I can't continue my mission without your help.

EVA

I'm touched by your honesty...

EVA

Don't concern yourself with me. I'm doing just fine. But...

SNAKE

What?

EVA

Thanks anyway.

SNAKE

Sure.

EVA

OK, back to the mission.
(2)

EVA

The security in the west wing where Sokolov is being held is extremely tight.

EVA

The only ones who are cleared to enter the west wing are those with colonel-class authorization.

EVA

One of those people is Major Raikov. To get into the west wing, you could disguise yourself as Raikov.

EVA

First, you'll have to take Raikov out and steal his uniform. He's in the east wing of the weapons lab in the center of Groznyj Grad.
(3)
*If player is in southeast area

EVA

The east wing is north of your current location. Head north.
(4)
*If player is in southwest area

EVA

The east wing is northeast of your current location. Head northeast.
(5)
*If player is in northwest area

EVA

The east wing is east of your current location. Head east.
(6)
*If player is in northeast area

EVA

You're in the vicinity of the east wing. Proceed to infiltrate.
(7)

SNAKE

All right. But why?

EVA

Huh?

SNAKE

Why do I have to steal Raikov's clothes from him? What about that scientist outfit... (You got that for me.)

EVA

That's not going to work this time around. Raikov's uniform is a special type that only he wears. You'll have to get it directly from him.

EVA

Normally I'm pretty good at getting men to take off their clothes, but it won't work on him. (Raikov is gay.)

SNAKE

?

EVA

You, on the other hand, might have a better chance with him.

SNAKE

What's that supposed to mean?

EVA

What indeed.

EVA

Anyway, the only way to get Raikov's uniform is to take him out and steal it yourself. He's somewhere in the east wing.
Fortress - truck
*If player gets into back of truck in a cardboard box with "To (destination)" written on it, the truck will go there

EVA

Those trucks you see there are used to transport materials in and out of Groznyj Grad.

EVA

I've seen them loading the trucks full of cardboard boxes and shipping them off all over the place.

EVA

Groznyj Grad is a gigantic fortress, so they've got to be pretty busy.

EVA

Some of the men have even complained to me that they've got too much work to do to check the contents of every single box that comes through.
Fortress - searchlights

EVA

The security in Groznyj Grad is tight. Watch out for the searchlights in particular.

EVA

If you get caught square in one of the lights, no matter how good your camouflage is, they'll spot you.

EVA

Make sure you stay out of those circles of light.
Colonel class

SNAKE

EVA, about this Major Raikov...

EVA

Yes?

SNAKE

You said he had "colonel-class" authorization, right?

EVA

Right.

SNAKE

But his rank is major. So how can he have "colonel-class" authorization?

EVA

Raikov is treated as an officer of equal rank with Colonel Volgin.

SNAKE

Treated as the same rank?

EVA

Yeah.

SNAKE

Even though he's a major?

EVA

Right.

SNAKE

Why?

EVA

You don't know?

SNAKE

No.

EVA

Even after seeing that photo? (The photo of Raikov and Volgin looking very friendly. In fact they are lovers.)

SNAKE

Nope.

EVA

Has anyone ever told you you're a bit slow?

SNAKE

What are you talking about?

EVA

I'll leave you to think about it.

SNAKE

Wait a minute...

EVA

Gotta go.
If player hasn't eaten the Instant Noodles

EVA

By the way, Snake...

SNAKE

What?

EVA

Why aren't you eating it?

SNAKE

Eh? What are you talking about?

EVA

The instant noodles. Why aren't you eating them?

SNAKE

Do I have to?

EVA

Of course you do.

SNAKE

Why?

EVA

Because it's a present from me.

SNAKE

...

EVA

You probably didn't know, but instant noodles are really popular among the troops here at Groznyj Grad.

EVA

It was really hard to get my hands on some. And I even managed to get three whole packages of it...

SNAKE

Three? But you only gave me two...

EVA

Ah... (Aw crap!)

EVA

Anyway, that's not the point. The point is - you'd better eat it. Or else. (She secured three, but she couldn't fight the temptation to eat one of them on her way to meeting up with Snake.)
Granin's death

SNAKE

EVA, what happened to Granin?

EVA

Dead... killed by the Colonel.

EVA

They know there's a spy.

SNAKE

And Granin was a hunting casuality?

EVA

Yeah. Volgin doesn't hold back in his interrogations. I don't think he even cares about the answers.

EVA

It just seems like he calls it that while he enjoys beating the hell out of his "suspect."

EVA

Just violence for violence sake.

SNAKE

Granin was a guy who loved his country and pledged his loyalty.

EVA

There was no reason he had to die, but Volgin doesn't need reasons.

EVA

Once he loses it, there's no stopping him; he's an animal.

SNAKE

Does he suspect you?

EVA

I'm not sure, but it feels like I'm next in the hot seat. After seeing Granin, I don't think he would let me off easy if he did find out.

SNAKE

Be careful.

EVA

You too.
The sheer size of the fortress

EVA

The name Groznyj Grad means "the terrible fortress."

EVA

And that's exactly what it is - an impregnable monster of a fortress built using Colonel Volgin's enormous fortune.

EVA

In the center of the fortress is a weapons lab that acts as the nerve center of the place. In the southeast there's a prison, in the northwest there's an armory, and in the northeast there's a provisions storehouse.

EVA

The weapons lab in the center is where Granin, Sokolov, and their fellow scientists carry out their high-tech weapons research.

EVA

The flying platform and attack chopper you saw are two of their accomplishments.

EVA

And now they're about to finish the work on the Shagohod.

EVA

They call it "the terrible fortress" for a reason.
•Sigint
Prior to Infiltrating Weapons Lab
Trucks in the fortress
*If player is near one of the trucks parked in the fortress
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, that's an MAZ-535, a Soviet-built 8-axle tractor truck.
(2)

SIGINT

During World War II, most of the heavy transport trucks the Soviets used were supplied by the U.S.

SIGINT

But apparently their performance wasn't quite up to the standards of the Soviet military.

SIGINT

The problem only got worse after the war, as the size of the Soviet Strategical Rocket Forces grew larger.

SIGINT

The Soviets realized they needed a heavy transport truck with excellent cross-country capability to haul their ballistic missiles.

SIGINT

So in 1954, they started work on a new truck design over at the SKB-MAZ design bureau in Minsk, Belarus.

SIGINT

And what they came up with was the MAZ-535 you see there.

SIGINT

There are a lot of variations on the MAZ-535... What do the headlights look like on that one?

SNAKE

It's got two of them.

SIGINT

Then it must be one of the later production models. The early ones were equipped with infrared lamps.
(3)

SIGINT

They look like they're used for cargo transport. But you're not into auto-theft, are you? Just leave it alone and keep going.
Armored vehicles in the fortress
(1)

SIGINT

The armored vehicle you see there is a BTR-152.
(2)

SIGINT

The BTR-152 is an armored personnel carrier that was first developed in 1948.

SIGINT

The design was based on the ZIL-151, a medium-size six-axle truck.

SIGINT

It was supposedly created primarily for use in motorized rifle divisions.

SIGINT

Besides the standard two-man crew, it can carry up to 17 fully armed personnel in its personnel transport chamber.
(3)

SIGINT

But stealing an armored transport and driving it around isn't part of the mission, bro. Just leave it alone and keep going.
Tanks in the fortress
*If player is near one of the tanks parked in the fortress
(1)

SIGINT

Hey, those tanks look like Object 279s.
(2)

SNAKE

Object 279s?

SIGINT

Yup.

SIGINT

We don't have a lot of details yet, but apparently they're a kind of heavy tank designed to operate in situations involving the use of tactical nuclear weapons.

SIGINT

They're distinguished by two sets of double treads and a disk-shaped shield, which keep it from flipping over in a nuclear blast.

SIGINT

Basically, the four treads widen the traction area and increase friction with the ground, while the disk-shaped shield deflects the blast above and below the vehicle.

SIGINT

The tank is armed with a 130 mm cannon. It's also got a 1000 horsepower diesel engine, which gives it a decent top speed.

SIGINT

As far as we knew, it hadn't been formally adopted because of the high cost of production... but it looks like we were wrong.
(3)

SIGINT

Anyway, those don't seem to be ready for deployment yet. You don't need to worry about them going anywhere. Just keep moving.
•Major
Prior to Meeting Raikov
Find Raikov
(1)

ZERO

Good, you've infiltrated the east wing. Raikov should be somewhere in that building. Take him down and steal his clothes!
(2)
*If player isn't disguised as a scientist

ZERO

But you can't simply wander around the enemy's home base looking like that.

ZERO

For now, disguise yourself as a scientist while you look for Raikov.

ZERO

Raikov is somewhere within the east wing. Find him and dispatch him!
Find Raikov - after locating him

ZERO

Snake, have you found Raikov?

SNAKE

Yeah. But he got away...

ZERO

What!?

SNAKE

Sorry, Major. I'll get...

ZERO

Stop your blathering and go take him out already!

SNAKE

OK... But...

ZERO

What are you waiting for? Get going!

SNAKE

Major, why are you so pissed off all of a sudden? You have something against this guy?

ZERO

No... just, every time I think of that face, it makes me furious. Doesn't it make you?

SNAKE

... (Not really...)

ZERO

Just get moving! Knock him out and steal his clothes!
•EVA
Prior to Meeting Raikov
Look for Raikov
(1)

EVA

You made it into the east wing. Good. Raikov is somewhere in that building.

EVA

You know what he looks like, don't you? When you find him, steal his uniform.
(2) *If player isn't disguised as a scientist

EVA

But if you go in dressed like that, the enemy will spot you long before you find Raikov. Disguise yourself as a scientist.
East wing - scientists
(1)

EVA

There are scientists in the east wing. Almost all of them were taken here against their will, like Sokolov.

EVA

If they see you, they probably won't attack you, but they can still get you in trouble by yelling for help or pressing the alarm switches on the walls.

EVA

So you should be watching out for scientists as well as enemy grunts.
(2)

EVA

Even if you disguise yourself as a scientist, the real scientists will know you're not one of their own if they get a good look at your face.

EVA

So make sure the real scientists can't see your face while you're in your scientist disguise.

EVA

And don't do anything funny, like crawling or rolling around.
(3)

EVA

If a scientist gets suspicious about your disguise, just turn your face away and pretend nothing's wrong. That should work most of the time.
East wing - enemy soldiers while disguised as a scientist

EVA

There are enemy soldiers patrolling the east wing as well.

EVA

Even if you disguise yourself as a scientist, they'll know something's up if you crawl, roll, punch, or stay pressed up against the wall for a long time.

EVA

If an enemy gets suspicious and starts coming your way, just stay still and keep your mouth shut. That ought to fool them.
Raikov tactics
(1)

EVA

Raikov is making the rounds inside the east wing. If you see him, take him out before he has a chance to get away.
(2)
*If player has obtained cigarette knockout gas gun

EVA

Try using the cigarette-shaped sleep gas gun.
(3)
*If player has obtained knockout handkerchief

EVA

The knock-out handkerchief might also come in handy.
(4)

EVA

Raikov always carries a Makarov with him. Make sure you don't get shot.
Raikov tactics - location

EVA

If enemy soldiers or scientists see you take down Raikov, you'll be in for it. Make sure to get Raikov someplace out of sight.

EVA

Someplace like the locker room on the southwest side of the second floor, maybe?
Raikov tactics - food
(1)
Hint that player can give him rotten food and ambush him in the toilet

EVA

Raikov is famous for being a glutton. I've heard he'll even stop and pick up food that's lying on the floor.

EVA

But for such a pig, he's got a weak stomach, and is always running for the toilet after eating that stuff.
(2)

EVA

Why don't you try giving Raikov something rotten to eat and then waiting for him in the bathroom?
The WIG

SNAKE

EVA, about the escape plan...

EVA

Yeah, we're getting out on a WIG.

SNAKE

The ground effect vehicle.

EVA

Right. Here they call it an Ekranoplan.

SNAKE

The Soviet Union has already finished testing one of those?

EVA

No, this is just the prototype given to GRU.

EVA

It was designed to search out and destroy American submarines. That's why it has a long range, and a decent speed of 470 mph (720 kmph).

EVA

It's far beyond the Be-1 developed three years ago.

EVA

The problem for us is that the one here doesn't have any weapons onboard. If we're tailed, our only choice is to try and shake them.

SNAKE

I'll leave that to you.

EVA

Sorry if I won't have the time to play stewardess for you.
Impression of Raikov

SNAKE

EVA, what kind of guy is Raikov?

EVA

He's Volgin's precious pet.

SNAKE

Anything else?

EVA

He's got a handsome face.

SNAKE

Is that what you really think?

EVA

No, I'm just being objective. I'm not interested in people who aren't interested in me.

SNAKE

I was hoping to get some useful info for becoming him.

EVA

*looks like she doesn't even want to think about it* He seems mild-mannered, but the kind of guy who would sit in his room and admire his bug collection.

SNAKE

That still doesn't help me much. Anything more?

EVA

I really don't know, Snake. Can't you just observe him and copy him yourself?

SNAKE

Why are you so evasive about this? (Why do you seem to dislike him so much?)

EVA

*sighs* ... People like me don't even exist in his little world.

SNAKE

I see...

EVA

Okay then....

SNAKE

Did he dump you?

EVA

"I see" huh? You don't get it at all!

EVA

No, not THAT. I'm just not good with his type.

SNAKE

But...

EVA

If this conversation goes on any longer, I'm going to send my fist through this radio into your head! Figure him out yourself. Later!

SNAKE

?
Frequency door
*Incoming call when player is near door that opens with a radio frequency
(1)

EVA

Snake, that door can't be opened by normal means. Apparently, it operates by responding to a specific radio frequency.
(2)

EVA

If you want to know the "key" frequency... why don't you try asking someone nearby?
(3)

EVA

The door will open with frequency 140.30...
(4)

EVA

The door will open with frequency 145.86...
(5)

EVA

The door will open with frequency 148.13...
•Para-Medic
Prior to Meeting Raikov
After getting rotten food hint from EVA
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

We know that Major Raikov is a glutton. Maybe you could use that to your advantage.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Why not give him something rotten to eat and then lay an ambush for him in the toilets?
•Sigint
Prior to Meeting Raikov
Before hearing about frequency door
(1)

SIGINT

That door sounds like it's got a pretty fancy electronic lock on it.

SNAKE

Yeah. It doesn't have a keyhole or a slit to insert a card. How's it supposed to work...?

SIGINT

Couldn't tell you.
(2)

SIGINT

All I know is that you can't open it by any normal means. Why don't you ask EVA and see if she knows?
After hearing about frequency door
*After contacting EVA and being told door will open with a specific frequency
(1)

SNAKE

Sigint, this door is...

SIGINT

I heard.
(2)

SIGINT

The door seems to be set up to open in response to a radio signal on a specific frequency.

SIGINT

Hey, you've got a device that transmits radio signals on different frequencies. Maybe you could use that to open it.
(3)

SIGINT

But the "key" frequency is probably going to be different for each door.

SIGINT

If you need to know which one... why don't you try capturing a scientist or a grunt around there and asking them?
•Major
Prior to Reaching Locker Room
After eliminating Raikov but prior to stealing his uniform
(1)

ZERO

Good, you've taken care of Raikov. Now to take those clothes he's wearing.
(2)

ZERO

But don't take his clothes off there, out in the open. It's far too conspicuous.

ZERO

Also, once you've disguised yourself as Raikov, you'll need to find someplace to hide the real Raikov's body.
(3)
*If player hasn't heard about locker room from EVA

ZERO

There must a place where you can take Raikov's clothes and hide his body. Drag Raikov's body over there.

ZERO

EVA might know a suitable location. Try asking her.
(4)
*After hearing about locker room from EVA

ZERO

Drag Raikov's body into the locker room. The locker room is on the southwest side of the second floor.
(5)
*If Raikov is knocked out or put to sleep

ZERO

Be careful not to wake Raikov up while you're dragging him. And make sure you're not seen by enemy soldiers or scientists.
(6)
*If Raikov is killed

ZERO

If Raikov's corpse is found, you'll no longer be able to disguise yourself as him. Whatever you do, don't let them find the body. Is that clear?
You're just going to leave the body there?
*Mandatory incoming call if player moves to another area while carrying Raikov's body

ZERO

Snake, where are you going?

ZERO

Are you planning to just leave Raikov's corpse there? If anyone discovers his body, you won't be able to diguise yourself as him anymore.

ZERO

You won't be able to get into the west wing either, and your mission will fail.

ZERO

Hurry up and get back to Raikov's body.
•EVA
Prior to Reaching Locker Room
Raikov - after eliminating him, take him to the locker room
(1)

EVA

You took care of Raikov? Good. Now drag him to the locker room.

EVA

There shouldn't be anyone in there. You won't need to worry about anyone seeing you take his clothes, and you can hide his body, too.

EVA

The locker room is on the southwest side of the second floor. Hurry and take him there!
(2)

EVA

If someone discovers Raikov's dead body, you won't be able to disguise yourself as him anymore. That means you won't be able to sneak into the west wing, either. And if that happens, you failed your mission.

EVA

Take Raikov's body somewhere where you're sure it won't be found. OK?
•Major
Prior to Completing Raikov Disguise
Raikov disguise
(1)

ZERO

I see you've got Raikov's clothes from him. Disguise yourself as Raikov and infiltrate the west wing, where Sokolov is being held.
(2)

ZERO

Select "OFFICER" from "UNIFORM" on the "CAMOUFLAGE" screen to change into Raikov's uniform.
(3)

ZERO

However, that won't be enough to pass as Raikov.
(4)

ZERO

To really become Raikov, you'll need to make your face look like his as well as your clothes.
(5)

ZERO

As for how to do that... Well, I'll let you think about it.
Raikov disguise - face is the same
(1)

SNAKE

Major, I disguised myself as Raikov.

ZERO

...

SNAKE

What? ...No good?

ZERO

No.
(2)

ZERO

Snake, you can't pass yourself off as Raikov simply by wearing his clothes. You need to make your face look like his as well.
(3)

ZERO

There must be a way to make your face look like Raikov's. Think, Snake.
Put him back in the locker
*Mandatory incoming call if player takes Raikov out of the locker and moves to another area

ZERO

Snake, wait! Are you just going to leave Raikov's body lying outside of the locker?

ZERO

If someone finds the real Raikov, you won't be able to get away with disguising yourself as him, and you won't be able to get into the west wing either. In other words, mission failed.

ZERO

Go back and put him in the locker. Hurry!
•EVA
Prior to Completing Raikov Disguise
Disguise yourself
*If player has obtained Raikov's uniform but hasn't yet put it on

EVA

Snake, what are you doing?

EVA

You got Raikov's clothes didn't you? Hurry up and change into them!

EVA

If you fail your mission, you'll be taking me down with you. Get it together!
Raikov disguise - he'll be out for a while

EVA

Don't worry about Raikov. No one will find him in the locker for a while.

EVA

But when they do find him, your disguise will be useless. You won't be able to get into the west wing, and your mission will be a failure.

EVA

So whatever you do, don't open the locker with Raikov in it. All right?
Raikov disguise - face is the same

SNAKE

EVA, I disguised myself as Raikov.

EVA

...

SNAKE

What's wrong?

EVA

Something's not quite right.

SNAKE

Not right?

EVA

Mmm.

SNAKE

What? What is it?

EVA

Hmm... I got it! Your face is all wrong!!

SNAKE

Say what now!?

EVA

I mean, your face isn't his.

SNAKE

Well, I would hope not.

EVA

You need to do something about that.

SNAKE

Do what?

EVA

*deflects since she hadn't considered this herself* You're a smart guy. You figure it out.
Raikov disguise - face is the same (2)

EVA

In order to sneak into the west wing, you need to "become" Raikov. That means more than just wearing his clothes. Your face has to match his, too. There must be a way to do that.
•Major
Prior to Meeting Sokolov
Raikov disguise complete
(1)

ZERO

Ah, your Raikov disguise has turned out nicely.
(2)

SNAKE

Yeah. Not even his own mother could tell the difference.

ZERO

Indeed. You're starting to irritate me already.

SNAKE

Why? This look should make me more popular.

ZERO

I wouldn't bet on it... But whatever.
(3)

ZERO

Now that you're indistinguishable from the real Raikov, you'll be able to get into the west wing, to which only Volgin and Raikov have access.
(4)

ZERO

Head for the west wing of the weapons lab. That's where Sokolov is being held.
(5)

ZERO

Enter the main wing from the second floor of the east wing. Pass west through the main wing and you'll come to a connecting passageway. The west wing is at the other end of that passageway.

ZERO

Infiltrate the west wing and rescue Sokolov.
Saluting while disguised as Raikov

ZERO

While you're disguised as Raikov, you can press the Action Button to perform a salute.

ZERO

If you want, why don't you try saluting some of the soldiers and scientists?
Raikov disguise advice (2)

ZERO

Now that you're the spitting image of Raikov, no one will have cause to suspect you.

ZERO

But if someone finds Raikov hidden in the locker, your disguise will become useless. If that happens, your mission will end in failure. Whatever you do, don't open the locker. Is that clear?
Raikov disguise advice (3)

ZERO

As long as you're disguised as Raikov, you'll be able to go anywhere in the fortress and no one will suspect a thing.

ZERO

Now may be a good time to do a little exploring around the place.
Checkpoint outside west wing
(1)

ZERO

Snake, that passageway leads to the west wing where Sokolov is being held captive.

ZERO

But the only ones who can open the door to the west wing are those sentries there.

ZERO

The only way to get into the west wing is to disguise yourself as Raikov and get the sentries to open the door for you.
(2)
*If player isn't disguised

ZERO

Quickly, change into your Raikov disguise.
(3)
*If player is disguised

ZERO

You should be able to fool them with that disguise. Pretend you're Raikov and get them to open the door.
(4)
*If player hasn't obtained disguise

ZERO

You'll need to get Raikov's clothes from him first. Go back to the east wing and take him down.
Outside west wing door - player took out enemy soldiers

ZERO

Snake, those sentries are the only ones who can open the door. You won't be able to get into the west wing if you knock them all out.

ZERO

You'll just have to go some place else and wait for new sentries to be posted.
Raikov's name

ZERO

What a strange coincidence, though.

SNAKE

Coincidence?

ZERO

Well, Raikov's full name is Ivan Raidenovitch Raikov.

SNAKE

And?

ZERO

Ivan is the Russian equivalent of John. And a common nickname for John is Jack.

SNAKE

... (Snake's real name is Jack.)

ZERO

You know, in Russian folklore, the youngest son in a family often receives the shabbiest treatment, but is actually cleverer than his brothers and has the happiest ending of all. That son is usually named Ivan.

SNAKE

I don't have any brothers.

ZERO

Really? I could have sworn you had several.
(Snake's cells will later be used to create three clones (brothers): Solid, Liquid, and Solidus, who appear in MGS1 and 2. Also a reference to the fact that there a lot of entries in the MGS series.)

SNAKE

???
While looking at cell door frequency
*If player is looking at frequency that will open cell

SNAKE

Major, I've found some numbers that might be important.

ZERO

Hmm... I wonder what they mean? Sigint, any ideas?

SIGINT

Afraid not.

ZERO

I see. Well, they may still prove useful, so be sure to make note of them.

SNAKE

Got it.
•EVA
Prior to Meeting Sokolov
Raikov disguise - disguise complete
(1)

EVA

OK, your Raikov disguise is complete. Now they won't stop you no matter what you do.
(2)

SNAKE

Even if I punch someone in the face? (Saying it as a joke.)

EVA

Right.

SNAKE

Really?

EVA

Really.

SNAKE

Why?

EVA

Raikov's just that kind of guy.

SNAKE

...
(3)

EVA

Once you're disguised as Raikov, you can get into the west wing where Sokolov is being held.

EVA

To get to the entrance to the west wing, pass west through the main wing of the weapons lab and go through the connecting passageway.
(4)
*If player is in west wing corridor

EVA

Head straight down that connecting passageway.
(5)
*If player is in main wing

EVA

The door to the connecting passageway is to the west. Head that way.
(6)
*If player is in east wing

EVA

You can get into the main wing of the weapons lab from the southwest side of the second floor. Head for the main wing.
(7)
*If player is somewhere else

EVA

Once you're ready, go back to the east wing. Enter the main wing from the second floor of the east wing and pass through it to get to the west wing.
Raikov disguise - special item

EVA

While you're disguised as Raikov, you can go anywhere you want and no one will stop you.

EVA

So now might be a good time to go and collect some items.

EVA

For instance, I heard there's a rare goody on the east side of the second floor of the east wing. (The Sneaking Suit is there.)
In front of door to hangar

EVA

Snake, that door leads to the hangar. It's where they're making adjustments to the Shagohod.

EVA

But you can't open it unless you have the key.

EVA

I'll get the key for you soon enough, but in the meantime you should rescue Sokolov first. Head for the west wing.
West wing corridor
(1)

EVA

You're in the connecting passageway of the weapons lab. That passageway leads to the west wing, where Sokolov is being held.

EVA

As you can see, they've got guards posted there full-time. Those guards are the only ones who can open the door to the west wing.

EVA

The only way to get in is to pretend you're Raikov and get them to open the door for you.
(2)
*If player is disguised

EVA

Just keep going and have them open the door for you.
(3)
*If player has disguise but hasn't put it on

EVA

OK, hurry and change into your Raikov disguise.
(4)
*If player doesn't have disguise

EVA

Go back to the east wing and find Raikov. The only way to sneak into the west wing is by wearing his clothes. Steal Raikov's clothes from him.
Saluting in the west wing corridor
(1)

EVA

To get them to open the door, just give them a signal.
(2)

EVA

You can press the Action Button to perform a salute. That's the signal.
•Para-Medic
Prior to Meeting Sokolov
Thoughts on Raikov disguise

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, I... Ah!

SNAKE

?

PARA-MEDIC

H... hello there.

SNAKE

Para-Medic, it's me.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake? Oh, it's you. For a minute there, I thought you were someone else...

SNAKE

Why are you so nervous? You've seen this mask before, right?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, but it looks so cool...

SNAKE

Huh?

PARA-MEDIC

Cool. You know? Kind of like a Venusian.

SNAKE

A Venusian...?

PARA-MEDIC

I mean, not the crab kind... the other kind. (There's a science fiction movie involving a crab-like creature.)

SNAKE

Para-Medic, do you really think a guy you've never seen before would suddenly call you on this frequency?

PARA-MEDIC

I know, it sounds ridiculous. But still...

PARA-MEDIC

What if it was a being from another planet? You can't rule out that possibility.

SNAKE

...
•Major

Snake!

SNAKE

ZERO

SNAKE

That's good enough...

SNAKE

ZERO

Well, you've still got your radio and medical items with you.

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

Yeah, well, I'm not finished with him yet, either. (He wants to pay him back.)

SNAKE

SNAKE

SNAKE

ZERO

First, you've got to escape from that cell. There must be a way. Don't give up.

ZERO

•EVA
Prior to Breaking Out of Cell
After torture - eye
(1)

EVA

Snake, I wanted to ask you something...

SNAKE

What?

EVA

In the torture room, why did you protect me when Ocelot was about to fire?

SNAKE

Because I knew that the chamber wasn't empty and you'd be dead if he pulled the trigger.

EVA

But your eye...

SNAKE

I was tied up and it happened so fast - it was the best I could do. I feel a little strange, but it won't interfere with the mission.

EVA

What about me?

SNAKE

?

EVA

Did you only save me because I was important for completing your mission?

SNAKE

What other reason would there be?

EVA

And when the mission is over?

SNAKE

Right now, it's just the mission.

EVA

The "mission" you used to love? (Referring to The Boss)

SNAKE

That's not what I mean.
Torture room - general purpose

EVA

I'm trying to dig up as much as I can on that cell. Just sit tight.
Torture room - general purpose (2)

EVA

Snake, there's got to be a way out of there. Don't give up!
Breaking out - you won't be killed

EVA

Snake, I've got some good news.

SNAKE

What is it?

EVA

Volgin isn't planning to kill you, at least not for the time being.

SNAKE

Why?

EVA

I think he wants to make you suffer some more.

SNAKE

*a little sarcastically* That's a relief.

EVA

Yeah. This means you'll have more of an opportunity to escape...

SNAKE

I was being sarcastic.

EVA

Anyway, Volgin has given orders that you're to be kept alive.

SNAKE

So the guard will bring me food and medical supplies, huh?

EVA

Exactly. If anything happens to you, he'll be executed by Volgin.

EVA

*realizing Snake might be able to use this to trick the guard* ... Hmm. This could be useful.
Breaking out - door
(1)

EVA

Snake, the door to that cell is the kind that opens in response to a specific radio frequency.
(2)

SNAKE

A specific radio frequency?

EVA

Right. You should be able to open it by using your radio to send a signal on the "key" frequency.

SNAKE

Sounds good. Do you know the frequency?

EVA

I'll try and find out. Give me a minute.
Breaking out - door follow-up

SNAKE

EVA, did you find out the frequency I need to open the door?

EVA

Sorry, Snake. I tried everything I could, but the security is just too tight...

SNAKE

Great...
Breaking out - ultimate resolution

EVA

Snake, I found out the frequency that opens the door! It's 144.75. Stand in front of the door and SEND a message on frequency 144.75!
Breaking out - the guard
(1)

EVA

Snake, I found some info on the guard.
(2)

EVA

That guard is notorious for being hungry all the time.

EVA

He's even been caught and flogged for sneaking into the mess hall at night and eating scraps.
(3)

EVA

Maybe you could win him over by sharing your food.
(4)

EVA

Oh, and I heard that he's particularly sympathetic to American prisoners for some reason.
(5)

SNAKE

Why?

EVA

Not really sure.
(6)
*After hearing that the guard, Johnny, has an American wife and that his son is in America

SNAKE

Can't blame the guy.

EVA

?

SNAKE

Nothing. Don't worry about it.
Breaking out - throw up
(1)

EVA

That guard is under orders from Volgin to keep you alive.

EVA

If anything happens to you, Volgin will have him executed. So he'll be keeping a close eye on your condition.

EVA

If you pretend to be sick or something, I'll bet he'd come rushing over to your side.
(2)

SNAKE

Pretending to be sick?

EVA

Yeah. There's lots of ways. Think about it.
(3)
*After an interval

EVA

For instance, if the guard sees you throwing up, I bet he'll open the door and come to see what's wrong.
Breaking out - the guard will attack

EVA

Snake, the door is open! Take out the guard and get out of there!
Breaking out - the door is open

EVA

Snake, the door is open. Hurry and get out of there!
•Para-Medic
Prior to Breaking Out of Cell
Blind in one eye
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, your right eye...

SNAKE

Umm...

PARA-MEDIC

The cornea and the lens are severely damaged, and the eyeball is ruptured. So...

SNAKE

So I can't heal it even in the Survival Viewer.

PARA-MEDIC

I'm afraid not...

PARA-MEDIC

I'm sorry, Snake. I wish there was something I could do...

SNAKE

Don't worry about it. I can still fight.

PARA-MEDIC

(I figured you'd say that.) I don't doubt you. But don't do anything crazy, OK?
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

From here on, it's going to be difficult to see out of your right eye. Attacking in First Person View will feel a little different from before. Be careful.
Breaking out - food
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

You need to build up your stamina before trying to escape. Without your stamina, you won't have the strength to punch and kick.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Be sure to eat whatever food the guard brings you.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Take a look around the cell. You might be able to find some edible plants or animals.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

In any case, you've got to eat something to restore your stamina. That's an order!
Breaking out - sleep

PARA-MEDIC

Sleep is another good way to replenish your LIFE and stamina.

PARA-MEDIC

Save the game and take a break. When you load the game from your saved data the next time, you'll recover strength based on how long you've rested.
Breaking out - throw up
(1)
After hearing from EVA about how if Snake acts sick, he might be able to trick the guard

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

Hmm?

SNAKE

How do I make myself throw up?

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

I need to throw up.

PARA-MEDIC

*weirded out* Wh-what do you need to throw up?

SNAKE

Anything's fine. I just need to vomit.

PARA-MEDIC

*wonders if he's lost his mind* What in the...?

SNAKE

EVA said I might be able to get the guard to open the door if I pretend to be sick.

PARA-MEDIC

*relieved he hasn't gone insane* Ohhh.

SNAKE

What did you think it was?

PARA-MEDIC

*deflecting, since she can't bring herself to tell him she'd thought he lost his mind* Uh, nothing. Heh heh.

SNAKE

?
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

I think letting the guard see you throw up is a good idea.

PARA-MEDIC

You can eat something poisonous to give yourself food poisoning. That'll make you throw up after a while.

PARA-MEDIC

Or you can use the Survival Viewer to make yourself dizzy.

PARA-MEDIC

In the Survival Viewer, press the Viewer Button to enter Viewer Mode.

PARA-MEDIC

Then use the right analog stick to spin your body around. Do that long enough and you'll start to get dizzy.

PARA-MEDIC

When you're dizzy enough, you'll throw up the moment you exit the Survival Viewer.

PARA-MEDIC

Try it out.
Breaking out - the guard has opened the door

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, now's your chance! Take out the guard and get out of there!
Breaking out - the door is open

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, the door is open. Hurry and get out of there!
•Sigint
Prior to Breaking Out of Cell
Breaking out - door

SIGINT

Snake, the door of the cell is set up to open when it receives a radio signal on a certain frequency.

SIGINT

If you only knew the frequency, you could use your radio to open the door...
•After Nightmare
*If the player saves while in the cell, then loads the game using this data, they will be thrust into an entirely different, very violent game. It will come to an end automatically after about 3 minutes, following which the normal game will resume from inside the cell as though nothing had happened.
This conversation occurs if the player uses the radio after the above has taken place.
Major - after nightmare

ZERO

Snake, what happened?

SNAKE

... Major, what year is this?

ZERO

Beg your pardon?

SNAKE

... Where am I?

ZERO

It's 1964. You're in a cell in Groznyj Grad. What did they do Snake, make you drink an entire keg of vodka?

SNAKE

No...

ZERO

You know, I hear they've got 98-proof vodka in the East. Back in England, we don't call stuff like that "fine spirit."

ZERO

We call it sulfuric acid.

ZERO

Imagine, if you will, your internal organs being slowly eaten away as smoke pours out of your mouth. Really, Snake, you shouldn't be touching that...

SNAKE

"Was it a dream...?"

ZERO

A dream? Well, how nice. And here I thought I sat up all night worrying about you for nothing.

SNAKE

It was almost real... I was holding this sword in my hand...

ZERO

Snake, are you OK? You're not going loony on me, are you?

SNAKE

Not at all. I'll make it back no matter how much of that sulfuric acid they make me drink.

ZERO

Good show! I'm sure you'll find a way out of there.

SNAKE

Yeah. Dream a little dream of your own while you wait for word from me.
EVA - after nightmare

EVA

Snake?

SNAKE

EVA, do they drug the prisoners here with hallucinogens?

EVA

I don't think that's their style. Why?

SNAKE

I had a pretty bad dream.

EVA

*stunned* A dream?

SNAKE

This monster that I'd never seen before was comin' at me with a knife... And I wasn't me... I was something else.

EVA

That doesn't surprise me. You're in a mild state of shock from all the pain and exhaustion you're going through.

SNAKE

Ah...

EVA

Maybe one day, you'll learn to stop hiding yourself.

SNAKE

What do you mean?

EVA

I know how you feel, Snake. I'm a spy, too. You don't realize it, but the fake you is eating away at the real you.

EVA

The person you're pretending to be is becoming the person you are.

EVA

And the real you is screaming out from somewhere deep inside.

EVA

That's what you saw in your dream.

SNAKE

... Maybe so.

EVA

I'd sing you a lullaby or something, but... unfortunately, I don't know any. (She sounds disappointed in herself.)

EVA

So pick your favorite song, and I'll sing it for you in your head.

SNAKE

Any song?

EVA

And you can have as many encores as you want.

SNAKE

Sounds fun.

EVA

It's a deal, then. I'm sure you'll find a way to escape. Good luck.

SNAKE

Thanks.
Para-Medic - after nightmare

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, what happened?

SNAKE

... What do you think?

PARA-MEDIC

Are you not feeling well?

SNAKE

... No, I'm feeling fine. I had the most amazing dream thanks to you.

PARA-MEDIC

Ah! You didn't really dream about Drac...

SNAKE

DON'T say it! The last thing I need is a double feature.

SNAKE

It was surreal. I was being attacked by a horde of weird, human-like monsters. What's wrong with me...?

PARA-MEDIC

It must be a form of persecution complex. Probably triggered by extreme stress. The external stimulus of the room is...

SNAKE

I've got a different theory. I think it was caused by your pillow talk.

PARA-MEDIC

But I didn't...!

PARA-MEDIC

*sighs* I'm sorry, Snake. I didn't know you were that sensitive to it. I mean, who'd have thought Drac...

SNAKE

! ("Alert" sound effect)

PARA-MEDIC

... Sorry! That just slipped out, I swear!

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Come on, Snake, don't be mad at me!

SNAKE

All right. I forgive you.

PARA-MEDIC

Really?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

Good, I'm glad. Snake, there must be a way out of there. Don't get discouraged - you'll find it.

SNAKE

I intend to.
•Major
Prior to Reaching Sewers
Advice after breaking out
*Incoming call when player breaks out of cell
(1)

ZERO

Did you manage to escape?

SNAKE

Yeah, I'm out.
(2)

ZERO

Be careful. In your present state, you're practically naked. You don't have a single decent weapon, and you'll never survive in a battle.
(3)

ZERO

Take some time and pull yourself together. EVA says she's recovered your equipment, so rendezvous with her as soon as possible to get your gear back.
(4)

ZERO

Use the escape route EVA set up for you. Go down into the sewers through the manhole in the northwest section of Groznyj Grad.
(5)

ZERO

Start out by exiting the holding cells and heading northwest.
(6) *If player is in southeast area

ZERO

The manhole is in the northwest section of the fortress. Head northwest.
(7) *If player is in south area

ZERO

The manhole is in the northwest section of the fortress. Head north.
Sokolov's death

SNAKE

Major, I'm sorry... Sokolov, I couldn't (save him)...

ZERO

Don't say it.

SNAKE

...

ZERO

You weren't able to rescue him. But that doesn't mean your mission has failed yet.

ZERO

EVA said they've completed Phase 2. There's no time left. You must destroy the Shagohod at all costs.

ZERO

... That will be our final tribute to him.

SNAKE

Right.
After breaking out - watch your stamina

ZERO

Snake, you're really going to feel the cold with no clothes on.

PARA-MEDIC

The Major's right. You'll burn stamina a lot faster when you're naked. Be sure to eat regularly.
You can't blend in while naked

ZERO

Snake, now that all your clothing has been taken from you, you won't be able to camouflage yourself.

ZERO

Remember the basics of a sneaking mission. Stay out of the enemy's line of sight and proceed from one hiding spot to the next. Use caution.
While escaping - do not engage in combat
(1)

ZERO

Snake, have you found any weapons?
(2)
*If player doesn't have ammo

SNAKE

No...

ZERO

That's too bad...
(3)
*If player has SAA ammo

SNAKE

I've only got a few Single Action Army rounds.

ZERO

Those aren't going to do you much good.
(4)
*Other

SNAKE

I've got a fork.

ZERO

You call that a weapon...?
(5)

ZERO

Without a decent weapon, attacking the enemy head on is suicide.

ZERO

Until you get your gear back, your main focus should be staying out of sight.

ZERO

If by chance the enemy does see you, don't try to fight. Just run away. Got it?
You can't perform CQC while naked

ZERO

Snake, now that you've lost even your CQC knife, you won't be able to use CQC. You won't be able to grab or throw enemies, either.

ZERO

You can still throw punches by pressing the CQC Button and launch combos by pressing it several times in a row. That'll have to do for now.
After discovering transmitter
(1)

ZERO

Snake, you say you've discovered a transmitter?

SNAKE

Yeah. It was buried in a wound. I think Ocelot did it.
(2) *Before breaking out

SNAKE

He must be expecting me to get out of here...

ZERO

Then you mustn't disappoint him.

SNAKE

All right.
(3) *After breaking out

SNAKE

He must have been expecting me to escape from that cell...

ZERO

And you didn't disappoint him.

SNAKE

Of course not...
•EVA
Prior to Reaching Sewers
After breaking out - manhole location
(1)

EVA

Without weapons or equipment, you're not going to be able to continue your mission.

EVA

I've got all of your belongings with me. Let's meet up outside the fortress.
(2)

EVA

There's an open manhole in the northwestern section of the fortress. You can use it to get down into the sewers and make your way out of Groznyj Grad.

EVA

To get to the manhole, go under the passageway leading to the west wing and head north.
(3)

EVA

It won't be long before Volgin and his men notice you're gone. Get to the manhole before they find you.
Confiscated equipment
*If player had obtained a specific magazine before torture event

SNAKE

EVA, you didn't... lose any of my equipment, did you?

EVA

Why, don't you trust me?

SNAKE

It's not that. It's just...

EVA

Don't fret. I haven't thrown anything away. Not even that fine piece of literature (the magazine)...

SNAKE

!!

EVA

Honestly, in the middle of a mission...

SNAKE

I... That's...

EVA

I know. Geez. All you had to do was tell me and I would have helped you out.

SNAKE

*thinking she meant something naughty* What!?

EVA

Distracting the enemy...

SNAKE

Oh...
•Para-Medic
Prior to Reaching Sewers
After breaking out - watch your stamina while naked
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, do you have any clothes?

SNAKE

Not yet.

PARA-MEDIC

So you're still naked?

SNAKE

Yeah.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

When you don't have any clothes on, your body loses heat quickly. That makes you burn stamina a lot faster. Make sure you keep eating.
(3)
Hint that player can reduce stamina consumption by using the cardboard box

PARA-MEDIC

It doesn't need to be clothes. Anything you have that can cover you up should help you conserve stamina...
After breaking out - run

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, without any decent weapons, you'll just get yourself injured in a fight.

PARA-MEDIC

You don't have enough medical items, either. Forget about fighting and just run. Okay?
•Major

ZERO

I heard.
(2)

ZERO

For now, you've got no choice but to do as EVA says and head north. Enemy search parties are already headed your way. Don't just stand there. Run!
You can't return from sewers
*Incoming call if player tries to climb back up ladder

ZERO

Snake, EVA said the sewers have been sealed off. If you go up the ladder, I'm afraid all you'd find is the enemy waiting for you.

ZERO

Do as EVA says and run to the north! The enemy is bound to have sent a search party after you. Hurry!
Sewers - dogs

ZERO

The enemy appears to have released attack dogs into the sewers. Without any decent weapons, it's too dangerous to take those dogs on.

ZERO

Stay away from the dogs and keep heading north. That's an order!
Sewers - after the enemy shows up
(1)

ZERO

Snake, the enemy has sent attack dogs after you.
(2)
*If player doesn't have a weapon

ZERO

Without weapons, you won't be able to put up a fight.
(3)

ZERO

Don't even think about fighting - just run! Go north!

That's the escape route EVA was talking about. Can you get it open?

I'll try.
