The machine gun on that thing is deadly. But you can force him to break off his attack by firing the RPG-7 at the body of the Shagohod.

SIGINT

If he starts strafing you with the machine gun, pump a rocket into the Shagohod before you get turned into Swiss cheese.
Both Shagohod battles - big machine gun

SIGINT

The armor on that thing is rock solid, but you can compromise it if you hit it with a rocket to the inside.

SIGINT

Every time he uses the heavy machine gun, the armor cover opens up. Aim for that opening!
Shagohod battle - drills

SIGINT

When he rams into you with that drill, he's got a lot of weight behind him. It does serious damage.

SIGINT

If the Shagohod tries to ram you, shoot it with the RPG-7 to trip it up!
Both Shagohod battles - missiles

SIGINT

The Shagohod's guided missiles seem to be using an infrared detection system.

SIGINT

If you throw a white phosphorus grenade and create a heat concentration, the missile should be fooled into going that way.
•Major
Colonel Volgin Battle (2nd)
Shagohod battle 2 - basics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, it looks like Volgin is using his own electricity to power the Shagohod now.

ZERO

Attacking the Shagohod itself at this point will have little effect. You need to aim for Volgin himself!
(2)

ZERO

If you attack Volgin from the front, he'll simply deflect the bullet with his electromagnetic field. Target him from the back and sides!
Shagohod battle 2 - aim for its "feet"

ZERO

You should be able to slow the Shagohod's movement by attacking its base. Aim for the base and immobilize it!
Shagohod battle 2 - gun emplacements

ZERO

There's a gun emplacement and an anti-aircraft cannon over there. They should deal a fair bit of damage to him as well. But stay there too long, and you make yourself an easy target.

ZERO

If the Shagohod draws too close, get away from the emplacement immediately.
Shagohod battle 2 - EVA

ZERO

Snake, pay attention to EVA's LIFE as well. If she dies, you won't be able to complete your mission.

ZERO

Don't let EVA get caught in the crossfire by mistake, or there'll be hell to pay!
•Sigint
Colonel Volgin Battle (2nd)
Shagohod battle 2 - Volgin

SIGINT

Don't try to shoot at Volgin from the front. He'll just deflect it with that electromagnetic field of his.

SIGINT

Get around behind or to the side of the Shagohod and shoot at Volgin from there!
Section 7
After End of Colonel Volgin Battle – Prior to Ending
Snake and EVA have defeated the Shagohod and Volgin. They jump back onto the bike and sidecar and race off to the lake where their escape aircraft and The Boss are waiting, but enemy teams are after them. The bike goes hurtling through the jungle as Snake and EVA get into intense firefights with their pursuers. Eventually, though, they look back and discover no sign of them.
Bike Topples Over
3D Cutscene 1
(Jungle (Yakushima) -afternoon - change view button available)
Once the player has gotten away a certain distance, they see no more pursuers behind them.
Snake is looking behind him. He's checking to make sure there is no one else coming after them.

SNAKE

Looks like they finally gave up.
Snake wanted to give EVA some good news. But EVA looks soured.

EVA

Don't start celebrating yet.

EVA

We're leaking fuel...
The gas gauge needle drops fast.
Snake checks the gas tank. A bullet struck it, and gas is leaking out from the hole it made.

SNAKE

Damn it!

SNAKE

The tank's shot up.
EVA tilts her head to try to look back down at the tank.
But there's a large fallen tree in the road up ahead!! And beyond it, a cliff!

SNAKE

Crap!
EVA tries to steer to avoid it, but she doesn't manage it in time!
The bike crashes right into the tree!

EVA

*screams*

SNAKE

*screams*
The bike does a big bounce, throwing EVA and Snake off it.
They fall to the bottom of the precipice!
Snake slams into a tree! He's hurt pretty bad.

SNAKE

*screams*
The bike rolls around, then catches fire and explodes!
Snake crawls over to EVA to see if she's okay.

SNAKE

EVA!
He calls out to her within the black smoke.

EVA

I'm over here...

SNAKE

*breathes as he crawls along the ground*
Snake crawls ahead, relying on EVA's feeble voice as a guide. She's sitting on the ground, slumped back against a big tree.
One of the tree's branches has pierced her side from behind, skewering her. She can't move.
Snake approaches EVA.

EVA

Snake, how's it look?
Pretty bad.

SNAKE

... Pretty bad.
EVA lets out a chuckle.

EVA

Not a sensitive bone in your body...
EVA throws up blood.

SNAKE

EVA...

EVA

What about you, Snake?
Snake is seriously wounded himself, but he doesn't tell her this.

SNAKE

I'm fine.

EVA

That's good to hear...
Snake looks around. The sheer cliff is behind them. He can't see any enemies having caught up with them.
But the black smoke will be the perfect sign to draw them here.
Snake and EVA look at the black smoke.

SNAKE

We have to get away from here. EVA, let's go.

EVA

Leave me.

SNAKE

EVA!

EVA

The Boss is waiting for you. You have to go.

EVA

Give me a gun...

SNAKE

No! We're getting out of here!

EVA

We're still far away from the lake. I'll never make it.

SNAKE

I can't believe this.

EVA

Huh?

SNAKE

I never thought I'd see you act this weak.

EVA

What do you mean?

SNAKE

Listen to me, EVA. We're doing this together.

EVA

No, you (go on alone)...

SNAKE

EVA, I need you.
EVA looks hard at Snake.

EVA

Say that one more time.

SNAKE

I need you.

SNAKE

I can't fly the WIG by myself.
EVA laughs so much her body shakes. She laughs harder and harder.
The harder she laughs, the more it hurts.
But then she gets serious.

EVA

All right, then. I guess I'd better help you out.
EVA yells as she pushes herself off of the tree.

EVA

*yells and groans as she pushes herself off of the tree*
She throws up blood again, then wipes it away from her mouth.

EVA

*vomits blood*

EVA

You're lucky to have me...
EVA puts all her strength into standing up, but immediately she collapses.

EVA

Ugh.
She falls into Snake's arms. She's still conscious.
Mandatory incoming call.
Bike Topples Over
Radio Call 1
(mandatory incoming call)
It's Para-Medic. She's calling to inform Snake and EVA how seriously they're injured.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake! Can you hear me?

SNAKE

Para-Medic!? Thank God. EVA's been seriously hurt!

PARA-MEDIC

So have you!

SNAKE

*not listening* Luckily, I think her organs are all intact, but...

PARA-MEDIC

Calm down, Snake.

SNAKE

Calm down...?
Snake finally realizes he's been shaking with worry.

PARA-MEDIC

You'll both be fine as long as you get the proper emergency treatment.

PARA-MEDIC

But you're the only one who can do this. Understand? So you've got to calm down.

SNAKE

Right. OK...

PARA-MEDIC

OK. Now, let's open up the Survival Viewer and treat the injury. Do you have supplies with you?

SNAKE

I'm running kind of short.

PARA-MEDIC

Then, by switching the Survival Viewer over to EVA you can treat her wounds, too. Now get to work.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, and Snake... I'm pretty sure you know this already, but if you don't have enough supplies for the both of you, your wounds come first.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Do you get my meaning, Snake?

PARA-MEDIC

You've still got a mission to complete. (Kill The Boss.)

SNAKE

Yeah. I know what I have to do.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake?

SNAKE

Like this.
Game forcibly enters Survival Viewer.
In CURE, Snake can treat both himself and EVA. Once this is done, they're both able to walk again.
Bike Topples Over
3D Cutscene 2
(Jungle (Yakushima) - afternoon - change view button available)
Snake helps EVA to her feet.

SNAKE

Can you walk?

EVA

Yeah, I think so...
Snake and EVA proceed. EVA is without a weapon.

SNAKE

Here.

SNAKE

It's different from the Mauser. When you're using a two-hand grip, you have to be careful where you put your hands or your fingers will get burned by the exhaust gas from the cylinder gap.
Snake gives EVA the revolver he got from The Boss.
EVA takes it.
Back to game.
Snake and EVA push on through the jungle for the lake where their escape aircraft and The Boss are waiting. Enemy pursuers are persistent, but they finally shake off the last of them. They clear the jungle and reach the lake.
Prior to The Boss Battle
3D Cutscene 1
(Lake - clear skies - change view button available)
Snake and EVA emerge from the jungle. The rain has stopped. The clouds pass, revealing a blue sky.
This reinvigorates EVA. She starts running.

EVA

Come on, Snake!
Snake runs after her. A beautiful lake stretches out before them. The sun returns, as does a brilliant blue sky.
Snake and EVA run over to the lake. EVA smiles.

EVA

We made it...

SNAKE

We made it...

EVA

Over there!
EVA points to the other side of the lake. The WIG that EVA secured is moored on the water.
The GRU uses this lake for takeoffs and landings when doing transport flights.
From out of nowhere, Snake senses a presence and looks behind him (in the direction of the flower field, though we don't see it).
EVA's smile disappears. She looks at Snake.

EVA

It's The Boss, isn't it?

SNAKE

*still looking in the other direction* ...

EVA

I'll go get the WIG ready to take off.

SNAKE

Right.

EVA

I'll leave you two alone. But come back in one piece, OK?
EVA looks hard at Snake, a blank expression on her face.
She heads for the pier.
EVA stops and shouts back at Snake.

EVA

Promise me!
Snake turns around to face the flower field and starts walking.
He pushes his way through grass at the edge of the lake.
After continuing on a little more, he comes to a field full of flowers (poppies?).
The field is packed with pure white flowers, about knee-height, blooming profusely. Snake steps into the field.
Then, from behind him is a thunderous roar.

SNAKE

!
He looks back. Way off in the distance, where the fortress was, he sees a mushroom cloud from a nuclear detonation.
Then the shockwave arrives!! Snake braces himself as it hits him.

SNAKE

*endures the shockwave*
Flowers of the field are kicked up into the air all at once. From here on, they fall from the sky like dancing snowflakes. Snake looks up at the sky.

THE BOSS

Life's end... Isn't it beautiful?
He hears The Boss' voice. She's talking about herself as well.

THE BOSS

It's almost tragic...
Snake turns around. The Boss is standing in the flower field.
If the player looks in First Person View, they can see The Sorrow next to her, his hood down.
The Boss looks up a little and breathes in through her nose. (She's smelling the falling flowers.)

THE BOSS

*smells*

THE BOSS

When life ends, it gives off a final, lingering aroma (energy)...

THE BOSS

Light is but a farewell gift from the darkness to those on their way to die.
The Boss has on her cloak. The scattered petals fall everywhere.

THE BOSS

I've been waiting, Snake... for a long time.

THE BOSS

Waiting for your birth, your growth... and the finality of today...

SNAKE

Boss...
Snake asks The Boss a question, but this question is also directed at himself.

SNAKE

Why are you doing this?

THE BOSS

Why?

THE BOSS

To make the world one again.
The Boss begins to talk about outer space and her ideals.

THE BOSS

The world used to be whole. But with the end of the Second World War, the Philosophers began to fight amongst themselves, and the world was torn apart.

THE BOSS

The Cobras, my comrades, who trained and fought alongside me, were torn apart as well. The foibles of politics and the march of time can turn friends into enemies just as easily as the wind changes.

THE BOSS

Ridiculous, isn't it? Yesterday's ally becomes today's opposition. And this Cold War? Think back... When I was leading the Cobras, America and Russia were fighting together.

THE BOSS

Now consider whether America and Russia will still be enemies in the 21st century. Somehow, I doubt it. Enemies change along with the times, the flow of the ages. And we soldiers are forced to play along...

THE BOSS

I didn't raise you and shape you into the man you are today just so we could face each other in battle. A soldier's skills aren't meant to be used to hurt friends.

THE BOSS

So then what is an enemy? Is there such a thing as an absolute, timeless enemy? There is no such thing, and never has been. And the reason is that our enemies are human beings like us. They can only be our enemies in relative terms.

THE BOSS

The world must be made whole again. The Philosophers must be reunited. I will devote my skills to that purpose. And with the Colonel's money (the Philosophers' Legacy), I will achieve that end. Just as I once created the Cobras.

THE BOSS

*thinking of how her child was taken by the Philosophers* They are my family. I may no longer be able to bear children, but I still have a family. (Same sentiment Solidus expresses in MGS2.)
Prior to The Boss Battle
Movie Cutscene 1
(real footage)
Footage of Nevada nuke testing.
The Boss took part in the atomic test that occurred on November 1, 1951 in the Nevada desert, where she was exposed to significant amounts of radiation and developed leukemia as a result. (As of 1964, when the game takes place, she doesn't have long to live.)

THE BOSS

It was November 1st, 1951. I was in the Nevada desert participating in atomic testing.

THE BOSS

The name "Nevada" is derived from Spanish... "covered in snow... white as snow."

THE BOSS

And snow is exactly what I saw in that Nevada desert.

THE BOSS

It froze my blood white.

THE BOSS

Snake... you were an atomic test subject, weren't you? On Bikini Atoll.

THE BOSS

That's part of the reason I was drawn to you. You and I are alike.

THE BOSS

We're both slowly being eaten away by the karma of others.

THE BOSS

We'll never have the chance to die peacefully of old age.

THE BOSS

We have no tomorrow.

THE BOSS

But we can still have hope for the future.
Footage of space development.

THE BOSS

In 1960, I saw a vision of the ideal future... from space.

THE BOSS

Three years earlier, the Soviet Union had succeeded in launching Sputnik, the first manmade satellite in history, into orbit. This came as a huge shock to the United States. In response, America threw everything it had into its own manned spaceflight project, the Mercury program.

THE BOSS

Even as the Soviets seemed poised to send their first man into space, America was still experimenting with chimpanzees in rockets. The government wanted human data. So they secretly decided to send a human being into space... I was the one they chose.

THE BOSS

At the time, they didn't have the technology to block out cosmic rays, and whoever they sent up would inevitably be exposed to heavy radiation. That's why they chose me. After all, I'd already been irradiated once. Of course, you won't find any of this in the history books.

THE BOSS

I could see the planet (Earth) as it appeared from space.

THE BOSS

That's when it finally hit me. Space exploration is nothing but another game in the power struggle between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R. Politics, economics, the arms race - they're all just arenas for meaningless competition. I'm sure you can see that. But the Earth itself has no boundaries. No East, no West, no Cold War.

THE BOSS

And the irony of it is, the United States and the Soviet Union are spending billions on their space programs and the missile race only to arrive at the same conclusion.

THE BOSS

In the 21st century, everyone will be able to see that we are all just inhabitants of a little celestial body called Earth.

THE BOSS

A world without communism or capitalism... that is the world I wanted to see.

THE BOSS

But reality continued to betray me.
Footage of the Bay of Pigs Invasion.

THE BOSS

In 1961, I was sent to Cuba... to Bahía de Cochinos.

THE BOSS

It was part of a CIA-sponsored invasion under the guise of taking Cuban exiles back to their country.

THE BOSS

But the U.S. government betrayed them. Our weak-kneed President held back their air support. Defenseless, the exiles were annihilated by the Cuban army. All I could do was watch in silence.

THE BOSS

I was set up by the very country I'd sacrificed so much for, by the very government I'd dedicated my life to defending.

THE BOSS

I was driven from the surface world, and I went underground.
Prior to The Boss Battle
Movie Cutscene 2
(Shinkawa Theater)
Scene where The Boss has to face The Sorrow.

THE BOSS

Then, two years ago, I faced The Sorrow - my old comrade - in battle. He was my friend. But one of us had to die. I was left with no choice. The Sorrow gave his life for me. There is no enmity between us. One must live, and one must die. That was the mission.

THE BOSS

The ones who gave me that mission were the Philosophers...
Prior to The Boss Battle
Movie Cutscene 3
(Shinkawa Theater)

THE BOSS

Early in the twentieth century, the true holders of power in the United States, the Republic of China, and the newly-formed Soviet Union gathered together in a secret meeting that would later be known as the Wisemen's Committee. The secret pact they formed there marked the beginning of the Philosophers.

THE BOSS

But the last of the original members died in the 1930's. After that, the organization began to run out of control, and the Wisemen's Committee degenerated into a mere shell of its former self.

THE BOSS

The Philosophers of today have no sense of good or evil. Their influence extends to countries and organizations involved in every aspect of every war. They have become war itself.

THE BOSS

That's how they operate. The sacrifices of war cause a shift in the times. This shift leads to renewed conflict and in turn triggers the next war. Like a nuclear chain reaction, each conflict sparks countless others, forming an endless spiral that will continue on for eternity.

THE BOSS

... Do you understand what I'm saying, "Snake"? By consuming me, and you (Snake Eater), the Philosophers intend to keep that cycle going forever.

THE BOSS

It was my father who explained all of this to me. He was one of them. You see, I am the last remaining child of the Philosophers.

THE BOSS

But after he revealed the truth, my father was killed by that same shapeless, formless organization.

THE BOSS

And my father isn't the only thing the Philosophers have taken from me.

THE BOSS

In June of 1944, the Cobras and I took part in the landing at Normandy. We'd been given a top-secret mission to locate and destroy enemy V2 rocket installations.

THE BOSS

I was pregnant at the time. The Sorrow was the father... I gave birth on the field of battle. A beautiful baby boy... But my child was snatched away from me... by the Philosophers.
Field Prior to The Boss Battle
3D Cutscene 2

THE BOSS

Look at this scar.
The Boss removes her cloak. It floats in the air.
She reveals the undergarment to her Sneaking Suit—a tank top (open from the chest to the abdomen).
Can we show her scar?
Editor's Note: In the release version, The Boss doesn't wear an undergarment. She opens her Sneaking Suit and reveals her scar.
The scar wriggles under her skin, like a snake.
The scar extends up from her abdomen to her chest. It crawls through her body like a snake.

THE BOSS

This is proof that I was once a mother.

THE BOSS

I gave up my body and my child for my country.

THE BOSS

There is nothing left inside me now.

THE BOSS

Nothing at all. No hatred, not even regret.

THE BOSS

And yet sometimes, at night, I can still feel the pain creeping up inside me.

THE BOSS

Slithering through my body, like a snake...
The Boss looks at peace.
She speaks to Snake sounding satisfied. An exaltation after having talked so much. The adrenaline is starting to thin. She returns to herself. She sighs.

THE BOSS

*sighs*

THE BOSS

I've never talked this much about myself before.

THE BOSS

Thanks... Thanks for listening to me.

THE BOSS

I feel... content. Snake...
A tear runs down The Boss' cheek. Her face is serious again. She takes out her radio and mutters into it.

THE BOSS

Commence the operation.
The Boss puts the radio away.

THE BOSS

I raised you.

THE BOSS

I loved you. I've given you weapons, taught you techniques, endowed you with knowledge.

THE BOSS

There is nothing more for me to give you.

THE BOSS

All that's left for you to take is my life.

THE BOSS

... by your own hand.

THE BOSS

One must die, and one must live.

THE BOSS

No victory, no defeat.

THE BOSS

The survivor will carry on the fight.

THE BOSS

It is our (a warrior's) destiny...

THE BOSS

The one who survives will inherit the title of Boss.

THE BOSS

And the one who inherits the title of Boss will face an existence of endless battle.
The Boss wears a blue Sneaking Suit like the one Solid Snake wears in MGS1. It stands out considerably among all the white (flesh-colored) petals.
She has two Patriot Pistols (machine guns). Each drum holds 100 rounds, but she has infinite ammo. For a gun with this kind of muzzle, shooting glasses (eyepatch or sunglasses type) are a necessity. The Boss wears the glasses to hide her tears.
Editor's Note: In the release version, The Boss' Sneaking Suit is white. This helps her blend into the flower field. Also, she only has one gun, and she isn't wearing glasses either.

THE BOSS

I'll give you 10 minutes.

THE BOSS

In 10 minutes, MiGs will come and bomb the hell out of this place.

THE BOSS

If you can beat me in less than 10 minutes, you'll be able to escape in time.

THE BOSS

Let's make this the greatest 10 minutes of our lives, Jack.

SNAKE

Boss!

THE BOSS

You're a soldier!

THE BOSS

Finish your mission!

THE BOSS

Prove your loyalty!

SNAKE

*makes up his mind* ...

THE BOSS

Face me!
*If player can't beat her within 10 minutes-->Outcome 1
*If player beats her within 10 minutes-->Outcome 2
[Outcome 1]
If after the set amount of time the player hasn't beaten The Boss, true to her word, the MiG bombers arrive and bomb the flower field, resulting in game over.
The Boss Battle Time Up
3D Cutscene 1
Snake and The Boss are going at it hard. Then, the sounds of approaching jets flying low.
The Boss lowers her weapon and looks to the sky.
The roar gets closer.

THE BOSS

This is the end...
From beyond the trees, two MiGs suddenly appear.
The MiGs do a fast ascent as they drop napalm.
Snake eyes The Boss.
The field of flowers is engulfed by a huge explosion and blast flames.
Fade to white-->game over
[Outcome 2]
After a fierce encounter, Snake finally defeats The Boss.
The Boss Battle End
3D Cutscene 1
(Lake - clear skies - change view button available)
The Boss falls to her knees.
The front of her tank top is open. The petals and The Boss' body are the same color?
She's taken off the outer part of her Sneaking Suit.
Her scar runs from her abdomen up to her chest. It wriggles around in her body like a snake, and blood is coming out of it too.
Editor's Note: In the release version, The Boss opens her Sneaking Suit, revealing her scar, but it doesn't bleed.
Snake approaches The Boss. The petals are still falling. They start to cover her body, piling up fast. They don't fall out on the water. Underneath all the petals, she looks like a snake breathing heavily.
She gives Snake her Patriot (no ammo) and the microfilm.
This is the real microfilm. EVA got the fake.

THE BOSS

Take this... Keep it safe...

THE BOSS

It's our only hope (to save my country)...
The player can use the Patriot on future playthroughs.
She's still alive, though barely.

SNAKE

A Patriot... Why are you giving me this?
The Boss doesn't answer. The name of the gun is her answer.

THE BOSS

Jack.

THE BOSS

Or should I say... Snake...

THE BOSS

You're a wonderful man...
The Boss asks Snake to kill her. But not because it's part of her mission.

THE BOSS

Kill me...

THE BOSS

Kill me now...
Snake's and The Boss' eyes lock.

THE BOSS

Do it...
Snake raises the weapon.
The Boss looks relieved. Now she is at peace.

THE BOSS

There's only room for one Boss.

THE BOSS

And one Snake...
Snake aims his gun.
Wide shot. Nothing happens for about 20 seconds.
Once the player presses the button, the next cutscene plays.
The Boss Battle End
3D Cutscene 1.5
Snake fires! The shot echoes.
The flower petals turn red.
On the lake, the WIG's engine starts up.
EVA senses something (The Boss' death).

EVA

?
The petals that had fallen now rise up into the sky, like the same motion in reverse.
Snake doesn't move.
He has killed his teacher, his mother, his lover, The Boss.
Later, as Big Boss, he will be killed by his own clone, Solid Snake.
The red petals dance in the air. Snake hears a neigh. The Boss' white horse has showed up.
On its back (tied around its saddle) is the Davy Crockett launcher.
This is evidence that that nuclear explosion earlier was The Boss firing a nuke from here.
Editor's Note: In the release version, The Boss is carrying the launcher when she walks into the flower field.
The horse approaches The Boss' body. It lets out another neigh, mourning the death of its owner.
If the player goes into First Person View, they can see the spirits of The Boss and The Sorrow standing next to each other, looking on from behind her body.
The Sorrow has no bloody tear.
They are both now resting in peace. Snake looks at The Boss' body again. The petals that had piled up on her rise into the air. The snake scar that was like a straitjacket around her begins to move, crawling out of her body and disappearing into the grass. The scar is gone from her body. Her face is peaceful. The blood has disappeared as well.
The petals that had risen dance in the air. One of them lands on Snake's palm.
Snake grips it tight.
The Boss Battle End
3D Cutscene 2
Takeoff preparations are complete.
Snake climbs into the WIG's cargo area.
EVA talks to Snake from the cockpit.

EVA

Ready to go, Snake?
Snake doesn't answer.
He's staring at the red petal in his hand.

EVA

Are you OK?
The WIG starts its takeoff.

EVA

Snake?

SNAKE

Yeah...
The petal gets carried out of Snake's hand by the wind.
The sunlight hits it, turning it white.
With EVA at the helm, the WIG begins to lift off the water.
It slowly proceeds!
Snake feels relieved.

SNAKE

*sigh of relief*

EVA

I told you you could trust me. (I can fly this.)
He removes his backpack from his hip and drops it to the floor.
Sound of a bullet ricocheting off the aircraft!
The aircraft drops, touching the water! Then it rolls!
The movement from this causes Snake's backpack to fall out the plane.
In fact, it didn't fall into the lake, but is caught on the exterior of the WIG. This becomes clear in a later shot.
Snake is now without a weapon.
Editor's Note: In the release version, Ocelot drops the backpack into the lake after boarding the WIG. It doesn't get caught on the aircraft either.
Then, we hear the voice of Ocelot.

OCELOT

Snake!!

OCELOT

We're not done yet!
Snake looks out the cargo area. He's eye to eye with a flying platform!

SNAKE

Ocelot!
Ocelot is controlling it. He jumps onto the plane.
Having lost its pilot, the flying platform collides with the WIG.

EVA

*screams*

SNAKE

*screams*
It put a dent in the WIG. Something shorts out!
The plane does a big drop following the impact.
It touches the water another time, then lifts off again!
The flying platform crashes, then disappears beneath the waves, causing a big splash!
Snake and Ocelot roll around the cargo area in a struggle.

SNAKE

*breathing as he struggles*

OCELOT

*breathing as he struggles*
EVA's in the cockpit. She looks back and gets a surprise!

EVA

*surprised*
She's able to raise the nose of the WIG. A warning sound goes off!

EVA

We're too heavy!
Instruments are screaming!
Back in the cargo area, Snake and Ocelot grapple. They each try to drop the other into the lake.

SNAKE

*breathing as he struggles*

OCELOT

*breathing as he struggles*
Ocelot slams Snake's head against the edge of the cargo area!

OCELOT

*yells*

SNAKE

*screams*

EVA

Not good!
They face each other.
The aircraft stabilizes, but it still doesn't climb. It continues to skim the water.
In the distance, EVA can see the end of the lake.
Snake throws Ocelot using CQC. They use joint lock type CQC moves on each other.

SNAKE

*yells*

OCELOT

*yells*

SNAKE

*grunt of frustration*
Ocelot uses the CQC techniques he's learned through observation.

OCELOT

I've picked up a few new moves!!
Snake and Ocelot stand face to face again.
Snake is unarmed. He's in trouble.
Ocelot draws his revolver. (His last one.)
A smile appears across his face.

OCELOT

It doesn't feel right to shoot an unarmed man... but I'll get over it.
EVA looks around but there isn't a weapon anywhere.
Then Snake remembers the revolver he gave EVA.

SNAKE

EVA!!
EVA throws the revolver. High-speed camera!
Snake catches it and they both pull the trigger.
Click!
Click!
A beat of silence.
The two stare each other down, neither one moving.
EVA is trying her best to get the plane to climb!

EVA

*still pulling back on the control column with all her might*
Ocelot calmly makes a confession.

OCELOT

What do you say to one last showdown?
He points to the jammed cartridge hanging from his neck.
Snake assents.

SNAKE

Yeah... all right.
Ocelot loads the cartridge into his revolver.
He shuffles the guns.
We don't see Ocelot's hands in the cutscene, but the player will know which gun the cartridge is in if they watch in First Person View.
Snake and Ocelot put some distance between themselves.
A duel. Feeling chivalrous, Ocelot asks Snake his name.

OCELOT

What's your name?

SNAKE

Snake.

OCELOT

No, not that name.

OCELOT

You're not a snake, and I'm not an ocelot. We're men, with names...

OCELOT

My name is Adamska. What's yours?

SNAKE

John.

OCELOT

Very well, John... Plain name, but I won't forget it.

OCELOT

C'mon!
Prior to Roulette
3D Cutscene 1
Snake and Ocelot pick up their revolvers and each takes five steps back.
They turn and point their guns at one another.
The game enters a forced First Person View. Snake and Ocelot pull the triggers on their revolvers.
*If player picked up correct gun but didn't fire-->Outcome 1
*If player picked up correct gun but missed-->Outcome 2
*If player picked up correct gun and shot on target-->Outcome 3
*If player picked up incorrect gun-->Outcome 4
[Outcome 1]
Snake picks up the correct gun.
But before Snake shoots, the hammer on Ocelot's revolver clicks six times.
Roulette - Ocelot Lost
3D Cutscene 1
Ocelot pulls the trigger six times. Each time, there's a click as the hammer strikes.
Ocelot realizes his gun doesn't have the round in it.

OCELOT

It looks like your luck has beat mine again.

OCELOT

But why didn't you pull the trigger?
Ocelot smiles, one that's pure (one of friendship).

OCELOT

... Ah, well.
[Outcome 2]
Snake picks up the correct gun.
His revolver fires.
But the gun wasn't pointed at Ocelot.
Roulette - Snake Won & Missed
3D Cutscene 1
Snake missed. He drops the gun halfway, looking regretful.

OCELOT

It looks like my luck has finally changed.
[Outcome 3]
Snake picks up the correct gun.
His revolver fires.
Snake hits Ocelot on target, however...
Roulette - Snake Won & Aimed True
3D Cutscene 1
Snake shoots. Gunsmoke rises from the barrel.
But Ocelot is unharmed.
He raises both hands and smiles.

OCELOT

It's a blank. That was fun.
Ocelot smiles, one that's pure (one of friendship).
[Outcome 4]
Ocelot picks up the correct gun.
His revolver fires.
Snake prepares to die, however...
Roulette - Ocelot Won
3D Cutscene 1
Ocelot shoots!
But Snake is unharmed.
Ocelot raises both hands and smiles.

OCELOT

It's a blank. That was fun.
[Common to All Outcomes]

OCELOT

Till we meet again, John!
Ocelot leaps from the cargo bay onto the waves.
Snake studies the water from the edge of the cargo area.
We also see the backpack, caught on the edge of the aircraft, fluttering.
Ocelot is washed backwards and disappears from view.
Ending
3D Cutscene 1
(Lake – clear skies – change view button available)
EVA shouts, almost sounding like a scream!

EVA

Snake!
Snake races up to the cockpit.
Up ahead, the edge of the lake approaches. If they don't climb, they'll crash right into it.

EVA

Give me a hand!
Snake jumps in the co-pilot's seat and places his hands on top of EVA's, who's holding the control column.

EVA

Pull!
They both pull back on the column as hard as they can.

SNAKE

*pulls back on control column*

EVA

*pulls back on control column*
But the WIG, with its massive size, doesn't respond to this so readily.

EVA

C'mon, pull up!!
They continue to pull!

SNAKE

*pulls back even more*

EVA

*pulls back even more*
At last the aircraft climbs.
Snake and EVA are relieved. They circle the lake. They can see the flower field.

SNAKE

*relieved*

EVA

*relieved*
The plane is flying without issue now. The danger is over.
Snake and EVA's hands are still touching.
They stay like this a moment, then Snake pulls his hands away after realizing.
They laugh.

SNAKE

*laughs*

EVA

*laughs*
Their laughter grows.

EVA

We made it...

SNAKE

Yeah, we sure did...
The WIG flies high above the flower field that now serves as The Boss' final resting place.
Her Andalusian horse is still beside her.
All of a sudden, an alarm goes off!
Snake and EVA look outside the window!

EVA

!

SNAKE

!
Soviet fighters—two MiG-21s (Fishbeds)—do steep turns and approach!
Snake and EVA can spot them from the cockpit.

EVA

Oh no! MiGs!
The MiGs pull up to either side of the WIG.

EVA

There's no way out!
Both can be seen right next to the cockpit.
The WIG is boxed in.
In one of the MiG cockpits, we see a pilot (helmeted). He gestures a big "Descend!" with his hand.
Editor's Note: In the release version, one of the MiGs flies in front of the WIG and communicates the same message by rolling.

EVA

What are we going to do?
EVA asks Snake.

SNAKE

We've come too far to let them stop us now.
Snake shakes his head.
The two MiG-21s on both sides of the aircraft do steep turns and pull away.

SNAKE

Those things have got to be armed.
Snake checks the gauges.

EVA

It's no use! There's no way we can out maneuver them!
The MiGs reappear behind the WIG.

EVA

They're going to shoot us down!
A despondent EVA hangs her head.

EVA

We were so close...
The MiG-21 pilots prepare to fire.

PILOT

Weapons systems on.

PILOT

Locked on target.

PILOT

I got tone.
A sensor emits a tone indicating that the heat-seeking missiles have caught a heat source.
Snake places his hand on the control column again.
EVA lifts her head.

SNAKE

You were great, EVA.

EVA

Huh?

SNAKE

Thanks.
EVA grips Snake's hand back—tightly.
They prepare to be shot down.
The MiGs are locked on to the WIG.
Then, a radio message comes in to the MiG-21 cockpits.

RADIO

Volk-19, this is Control. Stand by for a direct order from the Chairman.

RADIO

Volk-19, return to base immediately!
The pilot doesn't understand.

RADIO

Do you read me?

RADIO

This is a direct order from Comrade Khrushchev!

RADIO

Return to base immediately!
The two MiGs gesture to one another.

RADIO

Volk-19! Do you copy?

PILOT

Understood. Aborting mission. RTB.
The MiGs do steep turns and fly away!

EVA

Look! The MiGs are turning back!
EVA is overjoyed.

EVA

*shouts for joy*
Both the MiG-21s withdraw.
A call come in to Snake's radio.
He answers it.
Ending
Radio Call 1
(mandatory incoming call)

ZERO

Well done, Snake!

SNAKE

The MiGs disengaged...

ZERO

Most likely under orders from Khrushchev.

SNAKE

Was this his way of helping us?

ZERO

Who knows? Maybe he didn't want things to get messier than they already are. Or maybe he just wanted us to owe him one...

ZERO

The important thing is, you made it out alive. As long as Khrushchev is with us, I don't think they'll be coming after you. It should be smooth sailing all the way to Alaska. I'm sending someone out to Galena Base (the base from MGS1) to meet you.

SNAKE

To meet me?

ZERO

The DCI and The President himself are waiting at Langley.

ZERO

Don't keep them waiting.
The WIG flies off into the big blue sky, leaving vapor trails behind it.
Radio Conversations
•Major
Prior to Bike Crash
Bike (2) - go to the lake

ZERO

Snake, you've got to make it to the lake! Leave the driving to EVA like before. And stay vigilant. The enemy is still in pursuit!
Bike (2) - shoot fallen trees

ZERO

Snake, you must shoot the fallen logs and branches that block your path. Follow EVA's instructions!
Bike (2) - flying platforms

ZERO

Watch out for the flying platforms, too. You can't afford to have them shooting at you from the air. Don't let them get too close, or else!
Bike (2) - you're almost there

ZERO

Snake, the engine seems to have caught on fire.

SNAKE

We're almost out of fuel, too.

SNAKE

But it only needs to get us to the lake. Just a little further.

ZERO

Hang in there.
Bike (2) - The Boss is at the lake

ZERO

Snake, you've got to make it to the lake somehow. She's (The Boss is)... waiting for you.

SNAKE

I know.
•Para-Medic
Prior to Bike Crash
Bike after Shagohod battle

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you're almost to the lake. Hold on just a little longer!
•Sigint
Prior to Bike Crash
Bike - get away

SIGINT

Snake don't let the enemy catch up to you! Use First Person View to pick 'em off!!
•Major
Prior to Reaching Lake
With EVA - basics
*Incoming call after finishing treatment
(1)

ZERO

Snake, are you all right!?

SNAKE

I've been better.

PARA-MEDIC

What about EVA?

SNAKE

I healed her up. She can manage.

PARA-MEDIC

Good...
(2)

ZERO

Snake, stay on your toes. The enemy hasn't given up coming after you yet. They should be there any minute now.

ZERO

If you go southeast from there, you'll come to a road leading to the lake. Take EVA with you and head southeast.
(3)

ZERO

Snake, you'll take the lead and break through the enemy's line of defense.

ZERO

EVA will ordinarily be following behind you. If you lie on your belly, she'll lie down as well. If you slip and fall off a cliff, she'll follow right behind.

ZERO

You can call out to EVA by pressing the Action Button.

ZERO

Head to the lake along with EVA.
With EVA - hurry

ZERO

Snake, what do you think you're doing? The enemy search party will be there any minute. Head to the southeast, quickly!
With EVA - too far away
(1)

ZERO

Snake, where's EVA? You're too far away from her. Go back and get her immediately.
(2)

ZERO

She should be to your east.
(3)

ZERO

She should be to your west.
(4)

ZERO

She should be to your south.
(5)

ZERO

She should be to your north.
With EVA - if the enemy catches up

ZERO

Snake, if the enemy catches up to you, stop where you are and fight them off. However, there's no need to defeat them all.

ZERO

As soon as you've beaten them back, continue on toward the lake.
With EVA - hide

ZERO

If you find a hollow tree or clump of bushes, you can hide there until the enemy passes you by.
With EVA - destructible bridge

ZERO

You should be able to stall your pursuers if you block the way with that fallen tree.

ZERO

You can take it down with a Grenade or TNT.
With EVA - watch out for ambushes

ZERO

The enemy may try to get ahead and ambush you. Keep a constant watch on your surroundings. Use your sensors to stay aware of their locale.
With EVA - tree cavities

ZERO

That looks like a hollow tree. If you hide in there, the enemy might just pass you by without noticing.

ZERO

When EVA is hiding in the hollow tree, you can get her to come out by pressing yourself against the tree and pushing the CQC Button to knock.
With EVA - southern area

ZERO

Snake, the lake is in the northeast of that area. You're almost there. Head to the northeast, and don't forget EVA.
With EVA - start of southern area

ZERO

Snake, you can't return to the west from there. Head to the northeast!
With EVA - cliff at the end

ZERO

Snake, the lake is just over that cliff. EVA should be able to climb it if you help her. Keep her close to you.
With EVA - cliff at the end - during Alert Phase

ZERO

Snake, you're never going to make it up that cliff with the enemy attacking you. Take care of the enemy first. Then climb.
With EVA - The Boss is at the lake

ZERO

Snake, The Boss is waiting for you at the lake.

SNAKE

I know.

ZERO

That's all I can tell you.

ZERO

Finish the mission, Snake.

SNAKE

...

SNAKE

... Yeah.
Tormenting EVA
*While EVA lurches after being shot

ZERO

Snake!! What the hell are you doing to EVA!?

SIGINT

What the hell, man...!!

PARA-MEDIC

I can't believe you!!

ZERO

Of all the...! I can see now I chose the wrong man for this mission.
With EVA - EVA's in trouble

ZERO

Snake, what are you doing!? EVA is in danger! Hurry and save her!!
•Para-Medic
Prior to Reaching Lake
Don't leave EVA alone

PARA-MEDIC

You've given her treatment, but EVA is still badly injured. Don't stray too far from her side.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get too far apart, she might just sit down and refuse to move.

PARA-MEDIC

Make sure EVA stays with you on you way to the lake.
With EVA - LIFE recovery

PARA-MEDIC

You and EVA are both exhausted. You need to take it easy.

PARA-MEDIC

If you find a good place to hide, like tree hollows or bushes, lie low and let your LIFE recover. Got it?
With EVA - capture food

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, your escape is going to be a test of endurance. If you find edible plants or animals, be sure to catch enough for EVA to eat, too.
With EVA - EVA's seriously wounded

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, EVA's badly injured! Hurry and treat her injuries!!
With EVA - EVA's stamina

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, don't forget about EVA's stamina. She'll collapse from exhaustion if she runs out.

PARA-MEDIC

If EVA's stamina starts to run low, go into the Survival Viewer and give her something to eat.

PARA-MEDIC

To give her some food to eat, select a food item from "FOOD" and press the Enter Button, then select "EVA."

PARA-MEDIC

But don't give her anything rotten or poisonous!
With EVA - EVA's stamina has run out

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, EVA's all out of stamina! Quick, give her something to eat!
With EVA - treatment

PARA-MEDIC

You can treat EVA's wounds by selecting "EVA" from the "CURE" screen in the Survival Viewer.

PARA-MEDIC

If she gets injured, see to her right away. Got it?
With EVA - rain

PARA-MEDIC

I see it's started to rain. You burn through stamina a lot faster when it's raining. It'll also reduce your visual range and make it more difficult to sense where the enemy is. Be careful.
With EVA - just a little further

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, the lake is just up ahead! You can make it!!
•Sigint
Prior to Reaching Lake
With EVA - basics

SIGINT

Snake, you're almost to the lake. You can make it, man!
With EVA - stun and smoke
(1)

SIGINT

You don't have to beat all the guys that are after you. The only thing you need to worry about is getting away in one piece.
(2)

SIGINT

Smoke grenades and stun grenades might not cause any damage, but they're pretty good at slowing people down.
With EVA - traps

SIGINT

Snake, you and EVA are both in real bad shape. I wouldn't be thinking about taking the enemy on in an all-out fight if I were you.

SIGINT

It's time to start laying some traps. Set up a trap the right way and you can stop the enemy in his tracks. And that'll buy you some time.

SIGINT

Use TNT and Claymores to give them a hard time.
•Major
The Boss Battle
The Boss battle - basics
(1)

ZERO

Snake, it's time to complete your final mission.

ZERO

This is where you fulfill your loyalty to your country - and perhaps to her as well.

ZERO

You must defeat The Boss!
(2)

ZERO

The firepower of that Patriot pistol The Boss is using is beyond compare. In a straight shoot-out, you'd lose every time.

ZERO

Your first concern should be to hide yourself while using camouflage.

ZERO

Maneuver towards The Boss' blind side, wait for an opening, and attack her with a gun or CQC.
The Boss battle - avoid attacking head-on

ZERO

Watch out for The Boss' Patriot pistol. Any attack you make is going to be futile in the face of such overwhelming firepower.

ZERO

Attack her from the back or side. Use your camouflage to sneak into her blind spot!
The Boss battle - Intrusion

ZERO

You can also crawl through the flowers in Intrusion View. Use this technique to maneuver discreetly into The Boss' blind spot.

ZERO

In First Person View, you can press the Left and Right Step Buttons simultaneously to prop yourself up.

ZERO

That way, you can keep track of The Boss' position as you move.

ZERO

The motion detector and active sonar will also prove useful.

ZERO

Sneak behind The Boss so that she remains unaware of your position.
The Boss battle - CQC

ZERO

In a proximity encounter, The Boss will obviously try to use CQC on you.

ZERO

By pressing the CQC Button at the very moment The Boss launches a CQC strike, you can parry the attack.

ZERO

If you're successful, you can maneuver around to her side. That's your chance to use CQC on her.

ZERO

But if you fail, not only will she throw you, but she'll disassemble your weapon as well.

ZERO

Watch The Boss' movements carefully. Timing is everything!
The Boss battle - time limit

ZERO

The Boss has ordered MiGs to launch an air strike. If you don't finish the battle within 10 minutes, you'll both be blown to bits.

ZERO

You must defeat The Boss before the MiGs get there!
The Boss battle - time's running out

ZERO

Hurry, Snake! You're running out of time!

ZERO

I won't allow you to die with her! Finish her off, now, Snake!
•Para-Medic
The Boss Battle
The Boss battle - throw things

PARA-MEDIC

The Boss is human just like you and me. If she gets distracted, she's sure to leave herself open to attack.

PARA-MEDIC

Try throwing a magazine or a captured animal and see what happens!
The Boss battle - the flowers

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, it's all over if you lose sight of The Boss. Don't let those falling flower petals confuse you!
•Sigint
The Boss Battle
The Boss battle - the Patriot
(1)

SIGINT

That gun The Boss is using is a one-of-a-kind sidearm she had made especially for her. They call it the "Patriot."
(2)

SIGINT

Basically, they took the Army's experimental XM16E1, cut the barrel short, and took off the stock.

SIGINT

It handles like a handgun, but it's got the stopping power of a rifle. Because the barrel is cut so short, it's got some nasty recoil though.

SIGINT

I can't believe she's using it with one hand! Now I see why she's the leader of the Cobras and a legendary hero.
(3)

SIGINT

As long as The Boss is firing that Patriot at you, frontal attacks are going to be useless. Get around to her back or side and attack her from there. Move!
The Boss battle - CQC field strips

SIGINT

If The Boss gets you with a CQC attack, there's a chance she'll disassemble whatever weapon you've got equipped at the time.

SIGINT

The disassembled weapon will turn into Item Boxes and scatter around the area. Try and recover them right away.
The Boss battle - stun and smoke

SIGINT

One tactic you might want to try is blinding her with a stun grenade or a smoke grenade.

SIGINT

While she's lost sight of you, move around to her side or back and attack her!
The Boss battle - determine her position

SIGINT

Snake, move through the flower field so The Boss can't see you, and try to get behind her.

SIGINT

Use the active sonar or the motion detector to figure out her position.

SIGINT

But keep an eye on the batteries!
The Boss battle - the MiGs
(1)

SIGINT

So The Boss called in the MiGs?
(2)

SIGINT

The MiGs The Boss called in are probably MiG-21s, a Soviet front line fighter.

SIGINT

They can be equipped with rocket pods and bombs for air-to-ground attacks.
(3)

SIGINT

If the MiGs dump napalm on you, you can kiss your ass goodbye. You gotta beat The Boss before that happens!
The Boss battle - there's no time

SIGINT

Snake! You're running out of time! Hurry and finish her off!
•Major
Russian Roulette Battle
Roulette battle - pick up a gun!

ZERO

Snake, pick up one of the Item Boxes on the floor.

ZERO

One of them contains a loaded revolver.

ZERO

My bet's on you, Snake! Pick up the gun!!
•Para-Medic
Russian Roulette Battle
Roulette battle - pick up a gun from the floor

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, pick up the gun already! Trust your instincts!
•Sigint
Russian Roulette Battle
Roulette battle - pick up a gun!

SIGINT

It's too late to back out now, Snake! Pick up the gun!
Section 8
Ending
Ending
3D Cutscene 3
(Cottage - night - change view button available)
A cottage or cabin somewhere in America. There's a fireplace in the room.
There's no bed. This is the living room, not the bedroom.
The fire is burning. Snake and EVA raise two glasses in front of it.
They have their clothes on. The floor is carpeted. They're on the floor, facing each other.

SNAKE

So what are you going to do now? Go back to the KGB?

EVA

What do you want me to do?

SNAKE

Did you ever think about coming back to America?

EVA

I can't go back. I've left America behind me.

SNAKE

But you saved this country.

EVA

I didn't do it alone...

SNAKE

And I still owe you a dinner (at a sushi bar).
EVA has a gulp of wine.

EVA

*gulps down wine*

EVA

Is that part of your mission, too?

EVA

Or is it an order?
EVA places her wine glass on the floor.

EVA

Or is it an invitation?
She then takes Snake's glass and places it on the floor too.

EVA

Mmm... or a proposal? (Rose's line from MGS2.)
EVA closes in on Snake.

SNAKE

...
Snake's mood has been lifted. He accepts EVA's advances.

EVA

I don't take orders from anyone now.
They're all over each other.
They make love in front of the fire. Deep kisses.

SNAKE

*breathing as they make love*

EVA

*breathing as they make love*
They knock the wine glasses over, but neither one cares.
Snake gets a radio call from Zero. EVA grabs it and throws it into the fire, then the two fall into each other.
The fire continues to burn.
Zoom in on fire and fade out, like a classic 1960s love scene.
Ending
3D Cutscene 4
Snake sleeps on the floor, naked from the waist up. He wakes up.
EVA is nowhere to be seen. The glasses they knocked over have been placed on the table. The fire is out.
EVA disposed of all of her possessions, and any evidence that could be traced back to her, in the fire. This includes the mysterious communications equipment she used before.
Snake walks up to the table.
On it is a simple farewell letter. There's also a tape recorder and a photo.
The photo is of Snake, the one taken behind the waterfall. On the back is an imprint from her lips and one word written in lipstick: "Goodbye." EVA's monologue begins.

EVA

Scholars tell us that the first spy in history was the snake in the Book of Genesis.

EVA

In that story, it was Eve who was tempted by the snake in the garden of Eden.

EVA

But this time around, it was I (EVA) who tempted the snake and got away with the forbidden fruit of knowledge (the Legacy).

EVA

Forgive me, Snake.
Next to the letter is an open-reel tape. Snake picks it up.
He puts it in a playback device that can play it (early days for this in the 60s) and turns it on.
The reels start to turn.
EVA's voice comes through. The quality is not good. The audio burbles.
EVA recorded this while Snake was still asleep.

EVA

Good morning, Snake.

EVA

I hope you slept well...

EVA

First of all, I have to apologize.
Ending
3D Cutscene 42
Flashback: EVA looks down on Snake as he sleeps.

EVA

I wasn't sent by Khrushchev.

EVA

I'm not a KGB spy, and I never worked for the NSA (National Security Agency).
Ending
3D Cutscene 44
Snake bites off the end of a cigar and lights it using a cigar match.

EVA

I am an agent of the People's Republic of China... for the General HQ Second Department of the People's Liberation Army...

EVA

It was all a lie. I tricked you... and I'm sorry.
EVA is outside the cottage.
She loads belongings onto a bike.
She isn't wearing a helmet.
Snake loses himself in thought as he smokes.

EVA

The Philosophers still exist (are still alive) in China, too.

EVA

You see, my mission was to find out where Volgin was hiding the Philosophers' Legacy and steal it...

EVA

So I infiltrated his base as a KGB spy.
Snake exhales blue tobacco smoke.

EVA

The two NSA (National Security Agency) code breakers who defected in 1960...

EVA

... were actually both men.
Ending
Movie 2
Flashback: Snake remembers how EVA couldn't answer the password question "Who are the Patriots?"

EVA

The real ADAM never showed up at the meeting place...

EVA

... saving me the trouble of having to eliminate him.

EVA

I sneaked in by pretending I was EVA...
Ocelot is in fact ADAM.

EVA

And you and Sokolov and Volgin... you all believed me.

EVA

The Philosophers' Legacy was originally held in common between the U. S., Soviet Union, and China.
Ending
3D Cutscene 46
Cutbacks between Snake and the open-reel tape, and EVA.

EVA

We couldn't let the Russians and the Americans take it all for themselves.

EVA

The Chinese government had its eye on the Legacy, too.
EVA takes out the microfilm (the fake one, whose color is different) from her pocket and gazes at it.

EVA

I got the film containing the Legacy.
She takes out the other microfilm (the one she got from Sokolov).

EVA

And also the nuclear missile launch data from the Shagohod. (Which she got from Sokolov.)

EVA

Five years ago, the Soviet Union stopped supplying us with nuclear weapons technology. Since then, China's "Liangdan yixing" -hydrogen bomb and space rocket projects -have fallen behind.
Following this, China would test fire an IRBM in 1964. In October 1966, it test fired an IRBM with a nuclear warhead in it. China's successful ICBM test fire came in 1979. It launched its first artificial satellite in April 1970. Its first hydrogen bomb test was in June 1967.
Cutbacks between Snake and the open-reel tape, and EVA.
EVA applies lipstick.

EVA

But with this data, our country will be able to develop its own nukes.

EVA

We'll create a deterrent force to rival those of the U.S. and Soviet Union.
EVA kisses the back of the photo, leaving her lipstick on it. She places the photo on the table and is about to leave. Before doing so, she looks around the room, appearing sorry to be going. Snake is asleep in the bed.

EVA

Everything has gone according to plan... thanks to your help.

EVA

I, too, am one of the Philosophers.
EVA gets on her bike and starts the engine.

EVA

I am an agent of the Philosophers, a graduate of one of their "charm schools."

EVA

I was raised in a joint U.S.-Soviet-Chinese facility to become a sleeper agent.
Cutbacks between Snake and the open-reel tape, and EVA.

EVA

Back then, they were collecting (abducting) children from all over the world.

EVA

As a result, I'm indistinguishable from a native-born American.
Snake takes out the real microfilm.

EVA

So it didn't surprise me when you and Volgin couldn't tell the difference.

EVA

But... she knew right from the beginning...

EVA

She knew because before the war, she was at one of the Philosophers' schools, too - as an instructor.
EVA sits on the bike, her long, blond hair blowing in the wind.
EVA stares behind her. She thinks of Snake.

EVA

The Boss was the only one I couldn't fool.

EVA

She was the only one who knew I was a fake.

EVA

She told me everything.
Ending
Movie 3
Flashback: Right before the first battle with Volgin, when The Boss takes EVA away.

EVA

Why did she open her heart to me like that?

EVA

At the time, I couldn't understand it.

EVA

But now I think I do.

EVA

Snake... she wanted you to know the truth.

EVA

She chose me to tell you.

EVA

That's why she saved my life.
Ending
3D Cutscene 48
Flashback: EVA looks at Snake as he sleeps. EVA is contacting China, reporting on a successful mission. The communication ends.

EVA

I've lied to you so many times. But not this time.

EVA

My orders from the government were to obtain the Legacy...

EVA

...and to eliminate everyone who knew the truth about what happened.

EVA

In other words, I'm supposed to kill you.
EVA temporarily points a gun at Snake.

EVA

But I can't do it.

EVA

Not because we loved each other.

EVA

And not because you saved my life.

EVA

But because I made a promise to The Boss...

EVA

And I intend to keep it.
Ending
3D Cutscene 49
The reels are running. There's only a little bit of tape left. EVA throws the mysterious communication device into the fire.

EVA

I just wanted you to know.
EVA puts on a pair of sunglasses and takes off!

EVA

And... you have to live.
Smoke comes out of the machine as it's destroyed right in front of Snake.
Ending
3D Cutscene 5 (MC)
Snake is wearing his full dress (military) uniform.
Harry Gregson-Williams's Patriot track will start playing from around here.
EVA's voice continues, the monologue extending into the next scene.

EVA

Snake, listen to me.

EVA

She didn't betray the United States.

EVA

No... far from it. She was a hero who died for her country.

EVA

She carried out her mission knowing full well what was going to happen.

EVA

Self-sacrifice... because that was her duty.
This cutscene is Snake's decoration scene. Snake is in his full dress uniform. Tom wears a stylish suit. Sigint and Para-Medic are also present.
Snake receives his decoration. The official FOX insignia is on the wall.
The CIA director, the President, the Secretary of Defense, and other national security officials are there.
EVA's monologue continues over the ceremony.
The President and the others applaud. The CIA director and others smile. FOX personnel look proud. Snake has a blank look on his face.
EVA's monologue plays over background voices.
Snake receives his decoration from the CIA director. This is the director's office. The insignia of special forces unit FOX, now officially recognized by the CIA, is hanging on the wall. Next to Snake, Zero looks proud.
Editor's Note: In the release version, the President gives Snake the decoration.

THE PRESIDENT

You are above even The Boss...

THE PRESIDENT

I hereby award you the title of Big Boss.

THE PRESIDENT

You are a true patriot. (The Boss is the true patriot, and this outcome leads to the creation of MGS2's the Patriots.)
After receiving the decoration, Snake walks out.
A high-ranking military official with the Defense Department whispers into the CIA director's ear.

DOD OFFICIAL

You know, we could use an infiltration unit like FOX in the army...

DOD OFFICIAL

Someone like him to handle our top-secret sneaking missions for us...

DOD OFFICIAL

A man who combines the qualities of a soldier and an agent...

EVA

The Boss' defection was a ruse set up by the U.S. government.

EVA

It was all a big drama staged by Washington so they could get their hands on the Philosophers' Legacy.

EVA

And The Boss was the star of the show.

EVA

They planned it so that they could get the Legacy that Colonel Volgin inherited...

EVA

... and destroy the Shagohod at the same time.

EVA

Only a legendary hero like The Boss could have earned Volgin's trust.

EVA

Finding out where the Philosophers' Legacy was hidden was to be her greatest mission.

EVA

Everything was going according to plan...
Ending
Movie 10
Flashback: The nuclear explosion scene from the prologue.

EVA

But then something happened (during the Virtuous Mission) that no one could have predicted.

EVA

Colonel Volgin fired an American-made nuclear warhead at Sokolov's research facility.

EVA

Khrushchev demanded that the U.S. government provide proof that it wasn't involved...

EVA

They couldn't just abort the operation to steal the Legacy.

EVA

So the operation itself was greatly expanded and revised.

EVA

The authorities in Washington knew that in order to prove its innocence, they'd have to get rid of The Boss...

EVA

... and that one of their own would have to do the job.

EVA

The public couldn't be allowed to find out about it... not ever.

EVA

This, they concluded, would be the best way to keep the whole thing under wraps.
Flashback: Scene where The Boss shows up.

EVA

The Boss wouldn't be allowed to come back home alive.

EVA

And she wouldn't be allowed to kill herself.

EVA

Her life would be ended by her most beloved disciple (son)...

EVA

That was the way the government wanted it.

EVA

That was the mission she was given.

EVA

And she had no choice but to carry it out... Her death at your hands...

EVA

... was a duty she had to fulfill.

EVA

Out of duty, she turned her back on her own comrades...

EVA

A lesser woman would have been crushed by such a burden...
Ending
3D Cutscene 52
Snake makes his way through a potter's field. This is a cemetery for countless war dead. In one corner of it is this potter's field.
No one else is here. It has a very rustic feel.
The Boss' grave is in a potter's field.
EVA's voice continues to play over this. Like the end of MGS1.

EVA

The taint of disgrace will follow her to her grave.

EVA

Future generations will revile her...

EVA

In America, as a despicable traitor with no sense of honor...

EVA

And in Russia, as a monster who unleashed a nuclear catastrophe...
EVA's voice is trembling slightly.

EVA

She will go down in official history as a war criminal.

EVA

And no one will ever understand her...

EVA

That... was her final mission.

EVA

And, like a true soldier, she saw it through to the end.

EVA

But I think she wanted you, of all people, to know the truth.

EVA

She wanted to live on... in your memory.

EVA

Not as a solider, but as a woman.

EVA

But... she was forbidden to tell you herself.

EVA

And that's why she told me...
Snake lays the same flower from the flower field on the gravestone. He also places the Patriot pistol there.
Snake salutes! There's a tear in his eye. If the player goes into First Person View, they can see it.
They can also see the name of the cemetery.
Snake cries in front of The Boss' grave.
EVA's voice is already quivering.

EVA

Snake, history will never know what she did.

EVA

No one will ever learn the truth.

EVA

Her story... her debriefing... will endure only in your heart.

EVA

Everything she did...
EVA is crying. Her comments are ironic, given previous MGS themes of genes, memes, etc.

EVA

... she did for her country.

EVA

She sacrificed her life and her honor for her native land.

EVA

She was a real hero.

EVA

She was a true patriot.
Snake salutes The Boss from the bottom of his heart, as he will forever do.
Still wearing his military hat and his eyepatch, Big Boss cries.
Timeline scroll on a black background. The music continues.
Timeline scrolls.
October 15, 1964
Khrushchev is ousted from power. Brezhnev becomes the First Secretary of the Communist Party, with Kosygin as Premier.
October 16, 1964
China conducts its first successful nuclear test in the Takia Makan desert.
1965
Sigint joins ARPA.
He takes part in the development of the ARPAnet, which would go online in 1969.
1966
The U.S. government conducts a study on emergency medical treatment.
The Department of Transportation lays the groundwork for the creation of the EMT system.
1968
Eva disappears without a trace in Hanoi.
1970
Para-Medic establishes the nation's first paramedic system in Seattle, Washington.
1970
Major Zero disbands FOX.
1970
The United States accumulates the remainder of the Legacy. The US branch of "Philosophers" changes its name to the "Patriots."
1971
Carrying on the traditions of Major Zero and his FOX unit, Big Boss establishes FOXHOUND.
1972
The "Les Enfants Terribles" project.
The sons of Big Boss are born.
Ending end roll.
Staff credits appear. First cast, then staff.
The background music here is Star Sailor's "A Way to Fall." The Japanese version of the game will have a Japanese translation of the lyrics.
After the end roll, "METAL GEAR SOLID 3: SNAKE EATER" is displayed.
Ending
Phone Calls
"METAL GEAR SOLID 3: SNAKE EATER" + black background.
A phone conversation.
Both America's and the Soviet Union's intentions become clear through these respective phone calls. Each plays out over a black background, and we see how two particular sets of interests are intertwined. In both calls. The voice we hear is Ocelot's.
Phone call (the Soviet side).
Ocelot speaks with the KGB director.

OCELOT

Yes. Groznyj Grad and the Granin research facility have both been wiped out without a trace... I understand, sir. But they were necessary sacrifices...

OCELOT

Yes, the CIA has taken care of The Boss themselves…

OCELOT

I believe the White House (America) will be satisfied.

OCELOT

Khrushchev is finished.

OCELOT

Your time has finally arrived...

OCELOT

... Yes. The American President is relying on us to keep a lid on the whole affair. We've got him by the balls. It should make a valuable trump card in future negotiations. (They've suppressed the truth about what happened. They can take advantage of this in future diplomatic relations.)

OCELOT

I'll keep the KGB informed...
Ocelot hangs up and places his next call. This time he's calling the CIA director.
Phone call (the American side).
Ocelot speaks with the CIA director.
Ocelot has actually been a triple-crossing spy working directly for the CIA director (the Philosophers).

OCELOT

Yes, it's me.

OCELOT

The Boss has accomplished her mission.

OCELOT

The Philosophers' Legacy is now safely with us... in America's hands...

OCELOT

With this money... yes, the Philosophers can finally be revived.

OCELOT

The film we handed to the Chinese was a fake...

OCELOT

Peking must be in an uproar right about now.

OCELOT

... I'm afraid so. Only half of the money has made it back to the United States...

OCELOT

The KGB must still have part of the Legacy...

OCELOT

Yes, the weapon has been reduced to ashes...

OCELOT

That's right.

OCELOT

Groznyj Grad has been obliterated by the Davy Crockett we brought in as well...

OCELOT

Yes, that was The Boss' work, too...

OCELOT

Speaking of which, I've obtained something from Granin that you might find interesting. It's a revolutionary new nuclear attack system. Perhaps it might just come in handy some day...

OCELOT

... Yes. We have John - I mean, Snake - to thank for that. Khrushchev (the military) believed it as well... Yes, they bought our story. I don't think they'll be making a fuss.

OCELOT

The secondary alert has been lifted as well.

OCELOT

And the Soviets (the KGB) still haven't discovered my true identity.

OCELOT

They have no idea that I've been triple-crossing them...

OCELOT

I will continue my activities as a contact (spy) for the new government.

OCELOT

... Yes, it appears that no one knew that I was ADAM.

OCELOT

Of course. I'm always at the CIA's disposal...
Show player's results.
Radio Conversations
•Controls Explanations
Virtuous Mission Only
Capturing food
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, in order to maintain your stamina, you'll have to feed yourself.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

The idea behind this mission is procure-on-site. This goes for food, as well.

SNAKE

Procure-on-site...

MAJOR TOM

That's right.

SNAKE

But don't you think I should've at least brought a few rations?

MAJOR TOM

Americans have a terrible habit of taking everything with them. Nowadays, nobody can get anything done without a lot of fancy equipment. It wasn't like that in SAS, I'll tell you that.

MAJOR TOM

And with FOX, we're running things my way.

SNAKE

*a little discontented* Roger that sir.

MAJOR TOM

You're not convinced, are you? Well think of it this way - the stuff you'll find out there tastes a lot better than army rations anyway.

SNAKE

Hope you're right.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

You'll be procuring food by capturing local plants and animals. Para-Medic has information on the flora and fauna available in the mission area.

MAJOR TOM

Ask her if you have any questions about the plants and animals you find.
Survival Viewer

MAJOR TOM

Snake, use the Survival Viewer to pick your camouflage, treat wounds, and eat food.

MAJOR TOM

Ask The Boss or Para-Medic about the details.
-->If player hasn't contacted them before
Go to: Para-Medic's frequency, The Boss' frequency
•Controls Explanations
CQC controls
(1)

ZERO

Snake, let's go over the controls for CQC one more time.

ZERO

Press the CQC Button once to throw a punch. Press it repeatedly to launch a combo attack.

ZERO

CQC doesn't really start to shine, however, until you grab an enemy.

ZERO

Press and hold the CQC Button to extend your right hand and grab the enemy.

ZERO

Move the left analog stick at the same time and you can knock the enemy to the ground.

ZERO

If you don't move the left analog stick, you can get behind the enemy and hold him prisoner.
(2)

ZERO

When you're holding an enemy from behind, he'll be almost completely helpless. From there, there are a number of things you can do.

ZERO

By pressing the CQC Button again firmly, you can slit his throat using your knife.

ZERO

By moving the left analog stick along with the CQC Button, you can knock him to the ground.

ZERO

You can also choke the enemy by tapping the CQC Button rapidly. You can either render him unconscious or kill him outright - it's up to you.

ZERO

If you keep the CQC Button pressed, you can use the left analog stick to move around with the enemy in your grip.

ZERO

You can also press the Weapon Button to use the weapon you have equipped.

ZERO

The enemy will be hesitant to attack as long as you're using one of their comrades as a human shield. Use that moment of hesitation to attack in First Person View.

ZERO

By pressing in and holding the left analog stick, you can interrogate the enemy. You might be surprised at the things you can learn.

ZERO

But stay alert. While the enemy is nearly helpless in your grasp, if you give him a chance, he'll turn the tables on you.
(3)

ZERO

You can only grab an enemy using CQC when you're using a weapon that will allow you to reach out with your right hand, such as the survival knife, a handgun, or your bare hands.

ZERO

You can't grab the enemy when using weapons that take both hands to use, such as assault rifles, or that prevent you from controlling the enemy with your right hand, like hand grenades.

ZERO

In short, you can't use CQC when equipped with assault rifles or hand grenades.

ZERO

You can tell whether a weapon is compatible with CQC or not by looking at its icon.
Standing, crouching, and crawling

MAJOR TOM

Snake, be careful. The way to change between standing, crouching, and crawling has changed slightly from the methods learned in training.

MAJOR TOM

When standing, press the Crawl Button briefly to crouch, and press and hold to take a crawling position.

MAJOR TOM

Since by crouching you take a lower position, it has a higher Camo Index than standing.

MAJOR TOM

And the added stability of crouching lessens the effect of gun recoil. If you try shooting while crouching, you'll notice your shots will bunch together more consistently than when standing.

MAJOR TOM

Press the Crawl Button while crouching to stand up, and move the left analog stick to crawl in a direction.

MAJOR TOM

When crawling, your Camo Index becomes extremely high, and your firing of guns becomes even more stable than while crouching.

MAJOR TOM

You can move the left analog stick while on your stomach to crawl in a particular direction.

MAJOR TOM

When you are crawling, use small movements of the left analog stick to crawl silently at the expense of speed.

MAJOR TOM

However, be warned that crawling consumes more stamina than simply walking.

MAJOR TOM

Press and hold the Crawl Button while in crawl position to stand up. Press the Crawl Button briefly to switch to crouch position.

MAJOR TOM

Don't forget - if you want to stand up quickly from a crawling position, press and hold the Crawl Button.
Walking

MAJOR TOM

Snake, I don't recommend running around wildly. You need to determine when it is best to run, and when it is best just to walk.

MAJOR TOM

Move the left analog stick slightly to walk.

MAJOR TOM

You won't move very fast, but it consumes little stamina, and enemies are less likely to detect you.

MAJOR TOM

When you are near enemies or when you need to conserve stamina, those are good times to walk.
Footprints

ZERO

Snake, if you step in any water or mud, your feet will get wet.

ZERO

If you walk like that, you'll leave footprints behind, and the enemy may follow them straight to you.

ZERO

Try to avoid walking through any water or mud as much as possible.

ZERO

However, if your feet do get wet, just crawl to avoid leaving any footprints behind. When you don't want anybody following your trail, make sure to crawl.
Camouflage lowers enemy accuracy

ZERO

Snake, making it harder for the enemy to spot you isn't the only advantage to maintaining a high Camo Index.

ZERO

The harder you are to distinguish from your surroundings, the harder you are to hit. In other words, the enemy's shots will miss more often.

ZERO

Do everything you can to keep your Camo Index high at all times.
Hide bodies
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, I recommend against leaving the bodies of your victims lying around.

MAJOR TOM

If the enemy spots a fallen comrade, they will realize that they have been infiltrated, and strengthen their guard.

MAJOR TOM

When you kill an enemy, hide the body in the grass or at some other location where it won't be spotted.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

Stand near a fallen enemy and press the Weapon Button with no weapon equipped to grab the body.

MAJOR TOM

Hold the Weapon Button and move to drag the body. Release the Weapon Button to put the body down.
Vaulting

MAJOR TOM

You can climb up onto waist-high objects by pressing the Action Button.

MAJOR TOM

Climbing can get you to locations that can't be accessed by walking, and it may help you reach items that can't be found normally.

MAJOR TOM

Don't forget to try climbing things.
Knocking on walls

MAJOR TOM

Press the CQC Button when you are up against a wall to knock on the wall and make a sound.

MAJOR TOM

Creating sounds can attract the attention of enemies.

MAJOR TOM

There are many ways to use sound to your advantage. Use it to lure an enemy in the wrong direction, then use that opportunity to slip by. Or, lure an enemy near you, then ambush the enemy from behind.

MAJOR TOM

Use it to your utmost advantage.
Corner View

MAJOR TOM

Snake, when you stand up against a tree or put your back against the wall near a corner, the camera lowers and gives you a view of behind. This is the Corner View.

MAJOR TOM

This allows you to keep track of what's occurring behind you when hiding in protected areas.

MAJOR TOM

Also, there are a variety of actions possible while hiding, including using the Left and Right Step Buttons to peek, and the Weapon Button to take jumpout shots.

MAJOR TOM

Learning how to take advantage of the Corner View is the first step toward mission success. Use it to your utmost advantage.
Moving the camera with the right stick in Corner View

MAJOR TOM

Move the right analog stick with the Corner View on to shift the camera in that direction.

MAJOR TOM

This won't give you the same wide angle as peeking with the Left and Right Step Buttons, but it is safer since it will keep you from exposing your body too much.

MAJOR TOM

You'll do well to get accustomed to it.
Peeking

MAJOR TOM

In the Corner View, press the Left Step Button or the Right Step Button to stick yourself out from a protected area and look over your shoulder.

MAJOR TOM

We'll call this action peeking.

MAJOR TOM

Peeking is effective for observation, since it gives you a wider range of vision than the normal Corner View.

MAJOR TOM

However, since it involves revealing part of your body, you put yourself at risk of being spotted by the enemy.
Jump-out shots

MAJOR TOM

If you have a gun equipped during the Corner View, press the Weapon Button to jump out and take a jumpout shot.

MAJOR TOM

With the jumpout shot technique, you can stay protected from enemy fire behind an obstruction, and launch a burst attack when the time is right.

MAJOR TOM

This is a crucial technique for firefights. Use it well.
Lowering a handgun

MAJOR TOM

When you press the Weapon Button with the handgun, you aim, and when you release it, you fire.

MAJOR TOM

If, after aiming, you wish to withdraw your aim without firing, release the Weapon Button slowly.

MAJOR TOM

You'll just have to practice until you get the hang of it. I've heard a lot of cases where fresh recruits accidentally fired on enemies during a holdup.

MAJOR TOM

If you train yourself now, you won't be liable to misfire when the pressure's on. If you're unsure of yourself, you should practice.
Lowering a rifle

MAJOR TOM

The assault rifle works a little differently from the handgun. Press the Weapon Button lightly to aim, and press the Weapon Button fully to fire.

MAJOR TOM

If you want to lower the weapon without firing, such as during a holdup, just release the Weapon Button without fully pressing it.

MAJOR TOM

Be careful not to fire the weapon the moment you aim.
Headshots

MAJOR TOM

Snake, the damage that an enemy takes from your gun depends on where you hit him.

MAJOR TOM

If you hit an arm or leg, one shot won't be enough to finish him.

MAJOR TOM

If you want to take an enemy out in one shot, you have to use a First Person View attack and get a solid shot to the head.
Tranquilizer gun effects

MAJOR TOM

Snake, the Mk22 is a tranquilizer gun. Use it to put enemies to sleep without harming them.

MAJOR TOM

The speed with which the tranquilizer takes effect depends on the point of impact on the enemy.

MAJOR TOM

If a target is hit on the arm or leg, the tranquilizer won't take effect immediately. But a target hit on the head will drop like a fly.

MAJOR TOM

If you want to take an enemy out in a flash, aim for the head.
Item boxes

MAJOR TOM

Snake, if you find an item box, use First Person View to take a good look and find out what's inside.

MAJOR TOM

Sometimes it's dangerous to blindly go after an item.

MAJOR TOM

That's why you should check first to make sure the item in the item box is worth the trouble. If you can't get a good look, you can use your binoculars.
Throwing distance

MAJOR TOM

The distance that you throw grenades and other throwable weapons is determined by how hard you press the Weapon Button.

MAJOR TOM

A light press of the Weapon Button will toss the weapon nearby, while a hard press of the button will hurl it farther. Adjust the strength of the button press as appropriate.

MAJOR TOM

You can also throw in First Person View. With this view, you can throw more accurately at specific targets. Use it as necessary.
Throwing food

MAJOR TOM

Equip food as a weapon and press the Weapon Button to throw the food.

MAJOR TOM

If you throw a live animal near an enemy, you may be able to distract him.

MAJOR TOM

If an enemy is really hungry, he may pounce at the prospect of food.

MAJOR TOM

You have minimal gear on this mission and have to make the most use out of anything you can procure on the ground.
The right stick camera

MAJOR TOM

Move the right analog stick in a direction during Overhead View to look in that direction.

MAJOR TOM

Move the right analog stick left to see what's nearby on screen left, move right for screen right, up to see what's further ahead, and down to see what's nearby.

MAJOR TOM

If you press the right analog stick while the right analog stick is pointed in a direction, you can lock the camera on that position.

MAJOR TOM

For example, if you're heading north, move the right analog stick up and press the right analog stick to lock the camera, allowing you to observe things in the direction of movement.

MAJOR TOM

Then, if you later spot an enemy patrol to the east, lock the camera to the right so you can hide while observing the threat.

MAJOR TOM

Use of this technique can be greatly advantageous to your mission. Make sure to get the most out of it.
Hanging

MAJOR TOM

Press the Action Button when you are on top of a branch or in front of a railing to hang down from that spot.

MAJOR TOM

This action is called hanging.

MAJOR TOM

Sometimes it is advantageous to move while hanging rather than walking on the surface.

MAJOR TOM

Also, by hanging, you can hide by staying out of the sight of your enemies.
Hanging (2)

MAJOR TOM

While hanging, use the left analog stick, Left Step Button, and Right Step Button to move left and right.

MAJOR TOM
