When you want to climb back up from your hanging position, press the Action Button once more. If you want to drop down, press the Crawl Button.
Hanging (3)

MAJOR TOM

You can't keep hanging forever. Once you run out of grip strength, you'll fall.

MAJOR TOM

Check your grip strength with the Grip Gauge. When you hang, a blue gauge appears above the Stamina Gauge. This is the Grip Gauge.

MAJOR TOM

It indicates the status of your grip. When hanging, the Grip Gauge drops.

MAJOR TOM

When the Grip Gauge expires, you will fall. So you must climb back up before that happens.

MAJOR TOM

The length of the Grip Gauge depends upon your stamina. If you need to hang for a long period, you'll have to revive your stamina first.
Hanging (4)

MAJOR TOM

If there's something to grab onto during a fall, press the Action Button when you pass in front of it.

MAJOR TOM

If you get the timing right, you'll be able to grab and hang onto that area.

MAJOR TOM

With this technique, you can reach locations that are inaccessible by other means.

MAJOR TOM

You may even find some rare items this way. Observe your geographic surroundings, and try to find spots that you could grab during a fall.
Hanging (5)

MAJOR TOM

Press the Crawl Button while hanging to drop straight down.

MAJOR TOM

You can knock an enemy instantly unconscious with this technique if you land on top of him.

MAJOR TOM

When you're in a tree, try aiming for an enemy passing beneath.
Holdups
(1)

MAJOR TOM

If you approach an enemy undetected, you can render him defenseless by jutting a gun into his body from behind.

MAJOR TOM

This is called a holdup.

MAJOR TOM

However, even after rendering an enemy defenseless, if he notices you put your weapon away or start to walk away, he will attack. So, be careful.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

When you hold an enemy up, sometimes he will give you an item.

MAJOR TOM

Conducting a holdup presents risks, but it is a useful technique when you are running low on ammunition or medical items.

MAJOR TOM

After you have received an item from a hold up, you might try holding the enemy up again. He might give up a more precious, hidden item.
Fixed direction movement

MAJOR TOM

With an equipped weapon in Overhead View, press and hold the Aim Button to lock your line of fire while moving in any given direction.

MAJOR TOM

Use this for charges or retreats, or any other time that you want to concentrate fire in one direction while moving.
Stepping left and right in First Person View
(1)

MAJOR TOM

In First Person View, use the Right Step Button to take one step right, and the Left Step Button to take a step left.

MAJOR TOM

Use it to attack while hiding behind barriers and to step out of hidden spots to scout.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

During First Person View, press the Left and Right Step Buttons at the same time to stretch up slightly from that position.

MAJOR TOM

It's useful when you are hiding behind barriers and scouting or in a shoot-out.
Intrusion

MAJOR TOM

When you creep inside of a small space, the Overhead View switches to the Intrusion View.

MAJOR TOM

Movement during the Intrusion View is a bit different from movement during the Overhead View.

MAJOR TOM

Use up on the left analog stick to advance, down to go backwards, and left and right to rotate. Use directional button left and right to shift left and right.

MAJOR TOM

With large movements of the left analog stick, you move faster, but create sound. Nearby enemies might notice you.

MAJOR TOM

With slight movements of the left analog stick, you can move without making a sound, but at the expense of speed.

MAJOR TOM

Use both types of movement in appropriate situations.
Fast and slow crawling

MAJOR TOM

The degree to which you move the left analog stick not only changes your walking speed, but changes your speed when crawling and for instrusion movement.

MAJOR TOM

With large movements of the left analog stick, you can move faster, but you'll make noise and give yourself away to nearby enemies.

MAJOR TOM

With slight movements of the left analog stick, you can move in silence.

MAJOR TOM

It sacrifices speed, but it's the best choice for the times when creating noise presents significant risk.
Doors
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, do you see the door there?

SNAKE

Yeah. It's a swinging door.

MAJOR TOM

Opening a swinging door is a bit different from opening the doors that you got used to during training.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

To open doors, generally you can just move the left analog stick and move towards the door. This way you use your body to push the door open.

MAJOR TOM

To open a door without creating any noise, move the left analog stick slightly.

MAJOR TOM

So, when you're concerned about alerting enemies on the inside of a room of your presence, open the door slowly and slip right in.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

If you use large motions of the left analog stick and run towards a door, you will burst through it.

MAJOR TOM

The sound of the door opening will surely be heard by your enemies, but it allows for a fast entrance.

MAJOR TOM

When you want to jump right in and take care of business, running is the way to do it.
(4)

MAJOR TOM

Stand in front of a door in First Person View and use the Left and Right Step Buttons against the door. This will gradually open the door and allow you to glimpse inside.

MAJOR TOM

Use this technique when you want to check what's happening on the other side.
Knife interrogations

MAJOR TOM

After you have grabbed an enemy from behind with CQC, you can interrogate him by pressing the left analog stick. This is an opportunity to gain intelligence.

MAJOR TOM

Some of your enemies have valuable information, so give the technique a try, and see what you can learn.
Rolling

MAJOR TOM

Press the Crawl Button during a run to commence a roll.

MAJOR TOM

For a brief interval you will perform a jump which can be used to knock down enemies.

MAJOR TOM

In contrast to the training you've done so far, you can use rolling to jump waist-high objects.

MAJOR TOM

However, remember that rolling consumes more stamina than standard running.
Throw from cover

ZERO

By equipping grenades and pressing the Weapon Button in corner view mode, you can throw a grenade while hiding behind a barrier.

ZERO

This technique should come in handy during a firefight. Use it well.
Swimming explanation
(1)

ZERO

Snake, I see you're in the water.
(2)

ZERO

Press the Crawl Button when you're swimming on the surface to dive underwater.
(3)

ZERO

The controls when you're underwater are quite different from when you're on land.

ZERO

The left analog stick controls the direction you're facing. Press up, down, left, or right to turn in that direction.

ZERO

Press the CQC Button or the Crawl Button to move forward. Each button press will move you one stroke forward. Press the button repeatedly to swim faster. You can also press the Action Button to surface in an emergency.
(4)

ZERO

While you're swimming, you can use the right analog stick to look in a different direction without changing the direction you're going.
(5)

ZERO

Unlike what you've experienced in training, you will be able to fire handguns and assault rifles underwater. Keep that in mind.
O2 gauge
(1)

ZERO

While underwater, pay attention to your O2 Gauge.
(2)

ZERO

The O2 Gauge is displayed whenever you hold your breath. It indicates how long you can continue to hold your breath.

ZERO

The O2 Gauge will decrease over time while you're holding your breath.

ZERO

When the O2 Gauge is depleted, your LIFE will begin to decrease.

ZERO

To replenish your O2 Gauge, you need fresh air. Make sure to take a breath before you asphyxiate.
(3)

ZERO

The length of your O2 Gauge is affected by how much stamina you have at the time.

ZERO

If you anticipate operating for a long time underwater, you'll have to eat something beforehand to replenish your stamina.
Other radio features
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, press the left analog stick down on the Radio Screen to open the Memory Window.

MAJOR TOM

In the Memory Window, select a person to contact and press the Enter Button. This saves you the time of adjusting the frequency.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

The battlefield airwaves are littered with various transmissions. You can find a real catch if you fiddle around enough. (These are hidden frequencies to help the player regain stamina or listen to special music.)
•Calls Involving The Boss
*The Boss' lines will play (without any prior dialogue from Major Zero) if the player calls her. If the player has heard dialogue once by calling either party, this will count for the other party, and the conversation will drop down the lists of playback priority and probability. After the Virtuous Mission, the conversations will no longer have any dialogue from The Boss, but apart from a few, the Major Zero Conversations will still occur
Head north without getting spotted
*After entering an area with enemy soldiers
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, that region is inside the enemy's area of control.

SNAKE

I know. Time for the real deal.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

The enemy is running regular patrols. You don't know when or where you might run into them.

MAJOR TOM

Use camouflage prudently, and proceed with caution.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Camouflage yourself (2)
Face paint

MAJOR TOM

Snake, camouflage uniforms alone are not enough. You'll need to put on face paint as well.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: If player isn't using face paint (2)
Camouflage and stances

MAJOR TOM

Snake, camouflage and face paint alone won't make you blend in completely.

MAJOR TOM

In addition to the camouflage itself, your physical position is a crucial dynamic you should keep in mind.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Camouflage and stances
First Person View

MAJOR TOM

Snake, in order to carry out the mission without being spotted, you must learn to detect an approaching enemy well ahead of time.

MAJOR TOM

Press the First Person View Button and use the First Person View to constantly check your surroundings as you proceed.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: First Person View
First person attacks

MAJOR TOM

You can use an equipped weapon during First Person View. This is called a First Person View attack.

MAJOR TOM

When using First Person View attack, you can direct your line of fire up, down, left or right.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: First person attacks
Aiming a gun

MAJOR TOM

Snake, aiming your gun during First Person View is a bit different from what you're used to in training.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Aiming a gun (1)
Reloading

MAJOR TOM

Each time you use up the ammunition in a magazine, you'll need to load the next one.

MAJOR TOM

You'll be vulnerable while changing magazines, so always be aware of your remaining bullets. Remaining bullets are displayed in an icon.

MAJOR TOM

You may want to carry out a tactical reload before the magazine is fully used.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Tactical reloads
Backpack

MAJOR TOM

Snake, what do you do when you get a new weapon or item?

SNAKE

I put it in my backpack first.

MAJOR TOM

But you know that you can't equip items that are still in your backpack, right?

SNAKE

Yeah. The only things that can be equipped with the Weapon and Item Window Buttons are items on my person.

MAJOR TOM

Correct. If you want to equip an item, first you have to remove it from your backpack.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Backpack (1)
Natural enemies

MAJOR TOM

Snake, the Soviet troops are not your only enemies.

SNAKE

How do you mean?

THE BOSS

Nature...

SNAKE

Boss...

THE BOSS

Poisonous snakes, scorpions, crocodiles, hornets - there are dozens of dangerous life forms living in Tselinoyarsk.

THE BOSS

There are even poisonous mushrooms and frogs, and other plants and animals that you must not eat.

THE BOSS

In order to survive in nature, you have to know nature.

MAJOR TOM

Para-Medic has information on the flora and fauna in each area. Ask her for the details.
-->If player hasn't called her yet, go to Para-Medic's frequency
Hanging from branches
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Press the Action Button from on top a branch to hang down from the tree.

MAJOR TOM

But you can only remain hanging as long as your grip strength lasts. Keep an eye on your Grip Gauge when dangling from a tree.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

Be careful -- with low stamina, your grip won't last long.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Hanging from branches
Stalking

MAJOR TOM

In most areas outdoors, your footsteps will create some noise even if you walk slowly by using small movements of the left analog stick.

MAJOR TOM

This could alert nearby enemies to your presence.

MAJOR TOM

If you need to sneak up behind an enemy, use a directional button to utilize stalking.
-->The Boss Radio Conversation: Stalking
•Calls Involving Para-Medic
Stamina gauge

MAJOR TOM

Snake, when your stamina gets low, it negatively affects your physical abilities.

MAJOR TOM

You've got to replenish your stamina before it runs out.
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Stamina
Stamina-reducing actions

MAJOR TOM

Your actions can lower your stamina. The more demanding the activity, the more stamina consumed.

PARA-MEDIC

Exactly.

PARA-MEDIC

Walking slowly will conserve stamina, while actions like rolling, crawling, and stalking consume large amounts of it.

PARA-MEDIC

Try your best to avoid unnecessary actions in order to conserve stamina.
Cure
(1)

ZERO

Snake, this is a solo sneaking operation. There are no medics there to assist you. You'll have to treat your own injuries. Are we clear?

SNAKE

I had a little bit of training, but I'm no doctor...

PARA-MEDIC

That's where I come in.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

To treat an injury, first press the Menu Button to open the Survival Viewer. Then select "CURE" to start the treatment.

PARA-MEDIC

Healing is divided into treatment using medicine with the Item Window Button, and surgical treatment using the Weapon Window Button.

PARA-MEDIC

Treatment with medicine involves administering oral remedies and serum injections. You'll use this treatment method when you have food poisoning or when you've been bitten by a venomous animal.

PARA-MEDIC

Surgical treatment involves applying surgical techniques to injured areas. You'll use this method to take care of burns and gunshot wounds.

PARA-MEDIC

As long as you do everything you're supposed to, your injuries should heal completely. Be sure to follow the proper procedures.
If player has acquired food but hasn't eaten it yet
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, did you find food?

SNAKE

*happily* Yeah!

PARA-MEDIC

You sound happy.

SNAKE

I am!

PARA-MEDIC

Do you know how to eat it?

SNAKE

... (He doesn't know.)

PARA-MEDIC

Then let me explain.
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: How to eat food
(2)

MAJOR TOM

Besides eating food, you can throw it at enemies to confuse them.

MAJOR TOM

So remember, food is not just for eating. Be creative.
How food goes bad

ZERO

Snake, the food you catch will gradually spoil over time.
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: How food goes bad (2)
Save breaks

ZERO

Snake, there are other ways to recover your stamina besides eating.

SNAKE

Such as?

PARA-MEDIC

Such as taking a rest.

SNAKE

A rest?
-->Para-Medic Radio Conversation: Save breaks
Stamina getting worse and worse
(1)

ZERO

Snake, are you all right? You seem awfully tired.

SNAKE

No, not at all.

PARA-MEDIC

You don't have to act tough.

SNAKE

I'm not acting.

PARA-MEDIC

Really? You lose your grip strength after only a few seconds when hanging. I'll bet you can't even hold your gun straight.

SNAKE

... (She hit the nail on the head.)

PARA-MEDIC

Your body is exhausted. Look at your Stamina Gauge. It's almost empty, isn't it?

PARA-MEDIC

You can't continue your mission in this state. You need to eat something and recover your stamina.
(2)
*If player has food

PARA-MEDIC

You've got some food, don't you?

SNAKE

Yeah.
(3)
*If player doesn't have food

PARA-MEDIC

You'll have to put the mission on hold for a little while. First, you've got to capture some food.

SNAKE

But...

PARA-MEDIC

Did you hear me? Go hunting!

SNAKE

...
(4)

ZERO

Eating is a necessary part of your mission. When your stamina gets low, make sure you eat something. Got it?
Player is about to die
*Incoming call if player's LIFE is extremely low

MAJOR TOM

Snake, do you read!? Snake!!

SNAKE

*in pain* ... Major...

MAJOR TOM

Snake, are you all right!?

SNAKE

Yeah... I'm okay...

PARA-MEDIC

You're far from okay!! Look at your Life Gauge! You're on your last leg!

SNAKE

*groans in pain as he tries to say he can go on* No. I can still...

PARA-MEDIC

See!?

MAJOR TOM

Snake, this is a solo sneaking mission. Do you know what that means?

SNAKE

Yeah.

MAJOR TOM

No, you don't.

SNAKE

?

MAJOR TOM

It means there's no backup. No cavalry. If you're taken out, nobody is there to take your place.

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Pull out for now, and recuperate.

PARA-MEDIC

Find a hiding place and get some rest. Your Life Gauge will gradually recover with time.

PARA-MEDIC

But the speed of your Life Gauge recovery depends on the level of your Stamina Gauge, so get plenty to eat, then get some rest! You hear me?

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Do you hear me?

SNAKE

I hear you...
•Field Explanations
Watch out for crocs (1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, crocodiles inhabit that area. One bite could take you right out of action. Avoid approaching them head-on.
Hollow trees, and fallen trees that can be crawled under
*When near a hollow tree (one you can crawl through) or a fallen tree (one you can crawl under)
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, see that fallen tree?

SNAKE

Yeah.

MAJOR TOM

Check it out.

SNAKE

Why?

MAJOR TOM

Just do it.
(2)
*If player calls when near a hollow tree

SNAKE

It's empty.

MAJOR TOM

You can hide by lying down and crawling inside of hollow fallen trees.

MAJOR TOM

If you want to leave, just crawl out.
(3)
*If player calls when near a fallen tree

SNAKE

There's a crevice under this fallen tree...

MAJOR TOM

If you lie down and crawl, you can wedge yourself into the crevice.

MAJOR TOM

To lie down and crawl from a standing position, press and hold the Crawl Button.

MAJOR TOM

When you want to stand back up, press and hold the Crawl Button again.
-->If player hasn't heard it yet, go to Major Zero Radio Conversation: The Major likes explaining things
Fallen trees (2)

MAJOR TOM

When you're out in nature, you'll find lots of places that you can crawl inside. You can use those places to hide from enemies.

MAJOR TOM

You'd be a fool not to take advantage of those hiding places. So always look around with First Person View, and survey your surroundings.
Fallen trees (3)

MAJOR TOM

When you're inside a fallen tree, the view automatically switches to the Intrusion View. Control is the same as normal intrusion.

MAJOR TOM

It's perfect for hiding from enemies. But if your enemies notice you going inside, you'll become target practice. So, be careful.
Tree cavities

MAJOR TOM

You can get inside trees that are hollowed out from decay.

MAJOR TOM

Entering a hollow is an effective method for gaining temporary cover from enemies.

MAJOR TOM

However, if you're caught entering the tree, you'll take concentrated fire. If they throw a grenade in on you, you'll be torn to shreds. Be careful.
Grass
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, do you see any tufts of grass?

SNAKE

Yeah.

MAJOR TOM

What kind of grass?

SNAKE

Just ordinary grass. Nothing special...

MAJOR TOM

You should check it anyhow.

SNAKE

... It's pretty thick grass. About waist-high.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

If you crawl into the grass, you can advance undercover.

MAJOR TOM

When you do, the camera automatically switches to Intrusion View. If you want to stand up again, press and hold the Crawl Button once more.

MAJOR TOM

If you press the Crawl Button briefly, you'll crouch in that spot. This allows you to observe things without blowing your cover.
-->If player hasn't heard it yet, go to Major Zero Radio Conversation: The Major likes explaining things
(3)

MAJOR TOM

Also, when you're hidden in grass, your camouflage effect goes up. As long as you stay in the grass, you'll remain hidden even from nearby enemies.
(4)

MAJOR TOM

Even when hidden in grass, if you make a noise, your enemies will locate you.

MAJOR TOM

When enemies are nearby, move with slight movements of the left analog stick. That way you can proceed with minimal disturbance.
The Major likes explaining things

MAJOR TOM

Got it?

SNAKE

Yeah, but...

MAJOR TOM

But what?

SNAKE

Was that the only reason?

MAJOR TOM

What do you mean?

SNAKE

You had me check it just so you could tell me that?

MAJOR TOM

That's right.

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Pretty useful huh?

SNAKE

... Right.

MAJOR TOM

Shall we carry on?

SNAKE

By all means.
Hornets' nests
(1)

ZERO

Snake, when you knock down a hornets' nest, a large swarm of hornets will come flying out.

ZERO

If used wisely, this can sow panic among the enemy, but if you're not careful, the hornets may end up attacking you.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

If you're attacked by hornets, wiggle the left analog stick around or wave your survival knife to shoo them away.
(3)
*If player has the Torch

PARA-MEDIC

Waving a torch around with the CQC Button should do the trick, too.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Smoke is another useful tool in keeping hornets away. If you're attacked by hornets, I'd advise you to try using a smoke grenade.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

And if you use the insecticidal bug juice, the hornets should stay away as long as the effect lasts.
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

Hornets are prone to becoming agitated and aggressive when they see the color black. Their attacks will be more vicious if you're wearing black clothes.

PARA-MEDIC

If you're attacked by hornets, you should change into white clothes.
Lockers
(1)

ZERO

Ah, you've found some lockers.
(2)

ZERO

Lockers are a highly prized commodity among intelligence agents. Spies throughout the ages have used lockers to help them accomplish their missions.

SNAKE

Are you sure about that?

ZERO

Of course I am.
(3)

ZERO

You can use lockers for any number of purposes - hiding yourself, hiding the bodies of enemy soldiers, using the door as a shield.
(4)

ZERO

Use them wisely and they'll prove valuable during the mission.
(5)

ZERO

To hide inside a locker, first open the locker by standing in front of it and pressing the Action Button.

ZERO

Once the door is open, you can enter the locker to hide inside it.

ZERO

To come out of the locker, just press the Action Button again.
(6)

ZERO

To hide an enemy's body in a locker, simply drag the body in front of an open locker.
(7)

ZERO

You can also break the doors of lockers. If the door of a locker won't open and you're determined to get inside, try breaking into it.
Locker - won't open

ZERO

Snake, it looks like the door of that locker won't open. Maybe it's locked.

ZERO

You can't use that locker. If you need to use a locker, look for another one.
Locker - after it's been destroyed

ZERO

Looks like that locker is missing its door. You won't be able to hide inside or use it to hide enemy bodies.

ZERO

You can't use that locker. If you need to use a locker, look for another one.
Drum explosions
(1)

ZERO

Snake, those drums are filled with fuel. That'll prove to be useful.

SNAKE

What do you mean?

ZERO

Think about it. Shoot a bullet at a drum full of flammable fuel and...

SNAKE

Gotcha.
(2)

ZERO

If you blow up those drums full of fuel, the explosion should take care of any enemies in a fairly wide radius.

ZERO

Just make sure you don't get caught up in the blast yourself.
(3)

ZERO

Those drums could explode due to enemy fire. Watch out for unexpected explosions.

ZERO

Don't assume you can use those drums to hide in during a battle.
Drums you can roll

ZERO

Drums lying on their side can be sent rolling. Time it right and you might be able to use it to bowl over multiple enemies at once.

ZERO

Give it a try. Stand near a drum and press the Action Button.
Wires

ZERO

It looks like there's a wire strung across those trees. I suspect it means that there's some kind of trap nearby.

ZERO

You can also grab onto the wire by hanging. Try climbing the tree and use hanging to cross the wire.
Attack dogs
(1)

ZERO

Snake, it looks like they've got attack dogs in that area.
(2)

ZERO

Attack dogs generally receive extensive military training in tracking and combat techniques. They're formidable close-range fighters, and difficult to elude.

ZERO

Their barking can alert enemy patrols to your presence as well.

ZERO

Take care not to let attack dogs catch sight of you.
(3)

ZERO

Attack dogs may be dangerous, but they can't climb trees. If you've been cornered by attack dogs, try climbing a tree.
(4)

ZERO

Smoke grenades should prove useful as well.
Armory - general purpose
(1)
*When near an armory

ZERO

Snake, that building next to you is an enemy armory.
(2)
*Far from an armory, but EVA has told the player about them

ZERO

EVA mentioned there was an armory in that area, didn't she?
-->Sigint Radio Conversation: Armory – general-purpose
(3)

ZERO

By destroying an armory, you can cut off the enemy's supply of ammunition. That should make your job a lot easier.
Provisions storehouse - general purpose
(1)
*When near a provisions storehouse

ZERO

Snake, that building next to you is a provisions storehouse.
(2)
*Far from a provisions storehouse, but EVA has told the player about them

ZERO

Snake, according to EVA, there should be a provisions storehouse in that area.
-->Sigint Radio Conversation: Provisions storehouse – general-purpose
(3)

ZERO

By destroying a provisions warehouse, you can cut off the food supply to enemies in the surrounding area. It may be worthwhile if you have time and materials to spare.
•Equipment Explanations
Suppressors
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Snake, remember that the suppressor is a limited commodity.
(2)

SNAKE

I know. No suppressor lasts forever.

MAJOR TOM

Exactly.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

When the suppressor's durability wears away, it breaks beyond repair.

MAJOR TOM

See the weapon icon to check the suppressor's present level of durability.

MAJOR TOM

Remove the suppressor from your gun if you want to make it last.

MAJOR TOM

Select the weapon that the suppressor is on with the Weapon Window Button, and press the Enter Button to attach or detach the suppressor.

MAJOR TOM

Regulate usage of the suppressor based on the situation.
Sensor explanations
(1)

MAJOR TOM

When you're in the jungle, determining the position of your enemies is important.

MAJOR TOM

That's why you've been supplied with sensors. Use them well.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

The Motion Detector senses activity in your immediate vicinity.

MAJOR TOM

However, in the jungle, a lot of things other than your enemies are moving. Animals moving around will show up on the sensor just like anything else.

MAJOR TOM

Also, the Motion Detector is only so sensitive. Don't forget that certain enemies, and animals, that make only slight movements will not be detected.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

Press the left analog stick to initiate the active sonar and emit a special sonic wave. The reflected sound from the sonic wave reveals the positions of targeted objects.

MAJOR TOM

In contrast to the Motion Detector, the active sonar reveals still objects as well.

MAJOR TOM

However, there is a risk that the sound of the sonic wave will reveal your position to enemies and animals, so be careful when using the active sonar.
(4)

MAJOR TOM

The Anti-Personnel Sensor vibrates when it detects human life forms.

MAJOR TOM

Unlike other sensors, the Anti-Personnel Sensor has been adjusted to react to humans only, eliminating noise from animal detection.

MAJOR TOM

It can detect hidden, unmoving enemies, and the use of it doesn't betray your own position.

MAJOR TOM

But on the other hand, its accuracy lacks a bit as it has trouble revealing the exact position of detected bodies. Keep that in mind.

MAJOR TOM

When you use it during First Person View, it will work only in the direction you are facing.
How to use thermal goggles

MAJOR TOM

Thermal goggles create a thermal image based on the heat emitted by objects in view.

MAJOR TOM

With the thermal goggles equipped, you will be able to quickly spot enemies hidden deep within the jungle.

MAJOR TOM

Also, you can locate plants, animals, and traps. Use it to your advantage.

MAJOR TOM

However, once you activate the thermal goggles, you begin draining battery energy.

MAJOR TOM

And remember - once you're out of battery juice, you won't be able to use your other electronic devices.
Batteries
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Your sensors and other electronic devices cannot be used indefinitely. Once they are activated, they consume battery power.

MAJOR TOM

Remember, all items draw power from a single battery. Once your battery runs out, all electronic gear becomes inoperable.

MAJOR TOM

You can check your remaining battery power with the icon of any item that uses electricity. Take care not to waste power.
(2)

MAJOR TOM

The battery recharges automatically when not in use. When you want to recharge the battery, unequip all electronic devices and give it some time.

MAJOR TOM

The higher your Stamina Gauge, the faster your battery recharges. If you want it to recharge faster, eat food and recover your stamina.
(3)

MAJOR TOM

Also, if you run, roll, or do other dramatic actions, the battery will recharge faster.
(4)
*Only during Virtuous Mission

SNAKE

Wait a second.

MAJOR TOM

What is it?

SNAKE

The higher my stamina, the faster my battery recharges?

MAJOR TOM

That's what I said.

SNAKE

But what does my stamina have to do with the battery?

MAJOR TOM

Oh, I see what you're getting at. Let's have Para-Medic explain that. Para-Medic?

PARA-MEDIC

Yes, sir. It's because Snake's battery uses bioelectricity.

SNAKE

Bioelectricity?

PARA-MEDIC

Bioelectricity is electricity emitted from cells.

PARA-MEDIC

When the cells of living things are stimulated, sodium and potassium ions move rapidly through the cell membrane's ion channel, creating a difference in electric potential.

PARA-MEDIC

The battery uses that energy to recharge.

PARA-MEDIC

So, unless your cells have plenty of nutrients, the recharge won't work well.

SNAKE

Amazing the kind of machines that are available now...

PARA-MEDIC

But this machine has not been made public. It was designed by a scientist at the CIA's Directorate of Science and Technology.

SNAKE

What kind of person was he?

PARA-MEDIC

The person who designed it?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

I heard he was pretty strange. (Referring to Sigint)

SNAKE

Stranger than the Major?

PARA-MEDIC

There's nothing strange about the Major.

MAJOR TOM

My tea is gone! Who drank it!? How am I supposed to have teatime without tea!?

PARA-MEDIC

*confirming Snake's view* Well, not too strange, at least.

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Hey, my scone's gone, too!!
•Enemy Soldiers
Mode explanations

ZERO

Snake, let me explain the enemy's various states of alert.

ZERO

First of all, there's the state in which the enemy in that area doesn't know that you're there. This is called Normal Phase.

ZERO

In Normal Phase, the enemy will follow normal procedures for patrols and other activities. They won't present much of a danger to you.

ZERO

But if they spot an intruder - that means you - they'll attack in an attempt to neutralize you. This is called Alert Phase.

ZERO

Alert Phase will last until the enemy loses sight of you.

ZERO

Even after they lose sight of you, the enemy will continue to search the area for a while. This is called Evasion Phase.

ZERO

Evasion Phase will last until the enemy exhausts their search effort. Once Evasion Phase is over, the enemy should return to base.

ZERO

After the search is aborted, the enemy will enter Caution Phase.

ZERO

In Caution Phase, enemy soldiers will be more cautious in their patrols, and they'll likely be more difficult to detect.

ZERO

In addition to the regular patrols, there's also a chance that they'll send out additional search units. Keep on your toes.
Take out an enemy before they can alert others

MAJOR TOM

Snake, this operation is a sneaking mission. You'll be doing your job right under the enemy's nose.

MAJOR TOM

In the event that you are spotted by an enemy, disable him before he can alert nearby soldiers.

MAJOR TOM

If you can take him out before he alerts other enemies of your presence, then the Alert Phase will quickly be restored to Normal Phase.

MAJOR TOM

But don't forget - even this should only happen in emergencies. Your top priority is to avoid being spotted by the enemy in the first place. Be effective.
Stars above an enemy's head

MAJOR TOM

Snake, did you notice that when you knock an enemy unconscious, stars appear over his head?

MAJOR TOM

If you take a close look at the stars above the enemy's head, you'll notice that they gradually disappear, one at a time.

MAJOR TOM

Once the stars are all gone, the enemy becomes conscious again, and returns to battle. So, when you knock out an enemy, be sure to plan for his recovery.
Radio men

MAJOR TOM

Snake, certain enemy soldiers are equipped with radios.

MAJOR TOM

These signalers can use their radios to transmit information to and from the command headquarters. If a signaler realizes your presence, you can bet he'll be on the horn calling backup from headquarters.

MAJOR TOM

After headquarters receives the call for backup, they contact a nearby unit and order them to head over to give support.

MAJOR TOM

Once backup arrives, your enemies will outnumber you beyond hope for victory. It'll be too much for even you to handle.

MAJOR TOM

If you notice a signaler making a call for backup with his radio, take him out before he has the chance.

MAJOR TOM

If the call gets through, retreat before the backup unit arrives. If you hang around too long, you'll find yourself immensely outmatched. Got it?
Take out radios

MAJOR TOM

It's possible to destroy the radio that enemy correspondents use.

MAJOR TOM

If you must get involved in a fight, destroying the radio first will allow you to concentrate on the battle without worrying about reinforcements.
Soldiers carrying shields
(1)

ZERO

Be careful of enemy soldiers carrying shields. It'll be difficult to destroy those shields with just a handgun or an assault rifle. Either aim for their feet, or use a grenade.
(2)

ZERO

Taking control of a gun emplacement might be a good idea too.
Soldiers carrying RPGs

ZERO

Snake, watch out for enemy soldiers carrying RPG-7s. A full-on rocket blast is not something you can just walk away from.

ZERO

However, it takes some time to reload a rocket launcher. Use that opening to your advantage.
How it works with soldiers posted indoors

ZERO

Snake, enemy soldiers who operate indoors aren't equipped with radios.

ZERO

To communicate with command, they'll have to use the radio-equipped alarm systems located on the walls.

ZERO

If you're spotted by an enemy, you can avoid going into Alert Phase by taking him out before he can use the alarm system.
•Miscellaneous
Virtuous Mission Only
Origin of Major "Tom"

SNAKE

Major.

MAJOR TOM

What is it?

SNAKE

It's about your code name...

MAJOR TOM

Major Tom?

SNAKE

Yeah. Where did you get that name?

MAJOR TOM

From a tunnel.

SNAKE

A tunnel?

MAJOR TOM

That's right. Snake, have you seen the movie "The Great Escape"?

SNAKE

No.

MAJOR TOM

It's a movie about a determined group of allied POWs trapped in a German POW camp who plan an escape.

MAJOR TOM

The POWs dig three tunnels for their escape. They named them Dick, Harry, and Tom.

SNAKE

I see. So Tom was an escape tunnel. Did they make it?

MAJOR TOM

Out of the camp? Of course. One of the tunnels was even discovered before it was finished, but eventually, they do make it out.

SNAKE

I get it now. So Tom was the tunnel they used to escape.

MAJOR TOM

*sounding unsure* ... Uh, yes, that's right.

SNAKE

What is it?

MAJOR TOM

Mmm, actually, I'm not sure if I remember correctly...

SNAKE

Major...

MAJOR TOM

It's all right. It's Tom, Snake, Tom is the escape tunnel. Yes, no question about it.

SNAKE

...
Origin of "Naked Snake"

SNAKE

Major, what about my code name?

MAJOR TOM

You mean, Naked Snake?

SNAKE

Yeah. What does it mean?

MAJOR TOM

It's because snakes slither through the grass, unnoticed to those around them…

SNAKE

No, I mean the "naked" part.

MAJOR TOM

It means without embellishment, devoid of a specified quality - in other words, basic.

SNAKE

Why's that my code name?

MAJOR TOM

I explained that the Virtuous Mission is designed to test the effectiveness of FOX, right?

SNAKE

Right.

MAJOR TOM

And the procedure used for this mission will represent the modus operandi of FOX for future missions. In other words...

SNAKE

The essence of FOX, naked and pure?

MAJOR TOM

Exactly. And there's the fact that you went in practically naked - no weapons, no equipment.

SNAKE

I see. Means more than I realized.

MAJOR TOM

Yes, clever isn't it? But don't leave yourself naked to the enemy.

SNAKE

Roger that.
Infiltration mission guidelines

MAJOR TOM

Part of your mission is to demonstrate to the brass the core concepts behind FOX.

MAJOR TOM

Leave no evidence. That's the essence of FOX. And avoid engagement with the enemy.

SNAKE

Understood.

MAJOR TOM

Not only that. I mean leave NOTHING behind, including weapons, equipment, footprints, sweat... even bodily waste.

SNAKE

Yeah. When I do my business, I bury it good.

MAJOR TOM

What!?

SNAKE

What's wrong?

MAJOR TOM

That's the American way?

SNAKE

American way for what?

MAJOR TOM

To handle defecation. You're going to BURY it?

SNAKE

Yeah. (Something wrong with that?)

MAJOR TOM

Bring it home with you.

SNAKE

What?

MAJOR TOM

That's what we did in SAS.

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

The U.S. army is sloppy. They do things well, but not perfectly. Here in FOX, we're doing things my way. Got it?

SNAKE

... Yes, sir...
The concept behind FOX

MAJOR TOM

In the two years since Sokolov's asylum operation, I've spent all my time making preparations. And now is the time to show some results.

MAJOR TOM

FOX is a next-generation espionage organization designed to update us for 21st century operations that I proposed to the CIA.

MAJOR TOM

FOX sends individuals who excel in espionage and special tactics on solo sneaking missions like this one...

MAJOR TOM

... A next-generation unit that combines the skills of special forces units like the SAS and Green Berets with the know-how of an infiltration and espionage unit.

SNAKE

Military politics never was my strong suit...

MAJOR TOM

What I'm trying to say is... stealth. This is a stealth mission.

MAJOR TOM

Crucial to the coming cold war.

MAJOR TOM

The CIA director has always frowned upon FOX, but if this mission succeeds, FOX will be added to the CIA as an official unit.

MAJOR TOM

I intend to make FOX the leader in special operations.

MAJOR TOM

And to that end, this mission must succeed.

SNAKE

Right.

MAJOR TOM

I'm counting on you, Snake.
The gunship

SNAKE

Major.

MAJOR TOM

What is it?

SNAKE

About this gunship you sent to Tselinoyarsk...

MAJOR TOM

Yes?

SNAKE

How in the world did you manage that?

MAJOR TOM

Manage what?

SNAKE

That's a special operations craft that hasn't been tested in actual combat, right?

MAJOR TOM

That's exactly right.

MAJOR TOM

The plane, originally a special operations cargo aircraft based on the Air Force's C-130 transport, has been customized just for this mission.

MAJOR TOM

It can fly solo into Soviet territory to insert or retrieve special forces, and it has all the needed specs for this mission.

MAJOR TOM

It has a maximum speed of 380 miles per hour, cruising speed of 335 miles per hour, and a maximum altitude of 33,000 feet.

MAJOR TOM

For electronic equipment, it boasts terrain following and terrain avoidance radars, an inertial navigation system, radar alarm system, and a forward looking infrared device.

MAJOR TOM

It even has chaff and flare dispensers.

MAJOR TOM

It's also equipped with enough firepower to dispense of forces that may attack you during your exit maneuver on this mission.

MAJOR TOM

Two 40mm machine guns, and two 20mm gatling guns.

MAJOR TOM

Even the upper armor of the Soviet's main battle tank, the M-62, is 30 to 36mm on the turret, 30mm on the body. So the gunship has plenty of power to take them out.

MAJOR TOM

And as you said before, even if you were attacked by a tank unit, you'd be safe and sound.

SNAKE

Very impressive, but...

MAJOR TOM

Isn't it, though?

SNAKE

Yeah, but... How did you get it here?

MAJOR TOM

Must you ask me that question?

SNAKE

Yeah.

MAJOR TOM

You sure, now?

SNAKE

Is there some reason I shouldn't?

MAJOR TOM

Yes, I'd say so...

SNAKE

Understood. Forget that I asked.

MAJOR TOM

I will.
The Fulton Recovery System

MAJOR TOM

Snake, I've completed the double-check on the Fulton Recovery System.

SNAKE

Any problems?

MAJOR TOM

None. Leave your recovery to us.

SNAKE

Excellent.

MAJOR TOM

I suppose I should explain the procedure once more before the actual maneuver?

SNAKE

No... (You don't have to.)

MAJOR TOM

I see. Well, the Fulton Recovery System allows for rapid recovery of personnel from enemy territory, and is perfect for these kinds of special operations.

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Basically how it works is the plane flies by and snags a nylon lift line that the soldier has grabbed onto, and that has been elevated by a balloon.

MAJOR TOM

The Fulton Recovery System was first designed in the 1940s as a method of picking up mail for the American postal service.

MAJOR TOM

During the Korean War, that system was redesigned to recover personnel. JACK, an ancillary organization to the CIA...

MAJOR TOM

Yes, good ol' JACK...It stands for Joint Advisory Commission, Korea. Isn't that something?

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

So, JACK first used the Fulton Surface-To- Air Recovery System to extract agents from North Korea and mainland China.

MAJOR TOM

Let's go over the procedure once more - to be on the safe side. First, the plane drops a canister about the size of a coffin to you.

MAJOR TOM

Inside, you'll find a balloon, a 1500-foot cable, and a harness that attaches to your suit.

MAJOR TOM

Take the items out, attach the line to your suit, fill the balloon with helium, and send the line up.

MAJOR TOM

The plane will approach at 125 miles per hour, snag the cable just below the balloon with a hook on the nose of the aircraft, and whisk you away.

MAJOR TOM

Assuming the pickup is successful, you'll be reeled in with a winch, and pulled to safety into the rear of the aircraft. Got it?

SNAKE

...

MAJOR TOM

Snake?

SNAKE

Yeah, I got it. I got it real good.

MAJOR TOM

Were you listening?

SNAKE

Yeah.

MAJOR TOM

All right then.
Wealth of knowledge of HALO jumps

MAJOR TOM

You did an excellent HALO jump.

SNAKE

Not really. I didn't land in the right spot.

SNAKE

A jumper who lost his pack on the first real HALO jump - that'll make a good story for you.

MAJOR TOM

Who cares? There are no records of your operations.

SNAKE

I know, but...

MAJOR TOM

What, you're embarrassed?

SNAKE

No, I'm not embarrassed.

MAJOR TOM

It's The Boss, isn't it? (Realizing Snake didn't want to look bad in front of The Boss.)

PARA-MEDIC

What about The Boss?

SNAKE

*sulks* Nothing, Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

Doesn't sound like nothing.

SNAKE

Nothing to do with The Boss, I mean.

PARA-MEDIC

It has something to do with The Boss, but you don't want to say so?

SNAKE

... Yeah, kinda...

PARA-MEDIC

*thoughtfully* ... I understand, Snake. (I won't prod any more.)

MAJOR TOM

The Boss has done a lot of work on the military study of HALO jumps.

MAJOR TOM

And Snake here wanted to give a perfect performance on the first real jump, you know, to show respect to the mother of the technique.

SNAKE

Major!

MAJOR TOM

*surprised* Snake!? I thought you were over and out?

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Wow, is that right?

SNAKE

You got something to say?

PARA-MEDIC

No.

SNAKE

I bet you do.

PARA-MEDIC

Not really. I just think it's kinda sweet of you to think like that.

SNAKE

I don't know whether to take that as a compliment, or an insult.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a compliment, Snake! So tell me, is it true?

SNAKE

*worked up* What!? (He thought she was asking if he'd been thinking about The Boss.)

PARA-MEDIC

Not that. Is it true that The Boss really worked on research for HALO jumps?

SNAKE

Oh, that...

MAJOR TOM

Yes, it's true.

MAJOR TOM

HALO stands for High Altitude, Low Opening. It's a jump technique developed for covert insertions into enemy territory, just like the area you're in.

MAJOR TOM

A plane flies at 10,000 feet or above to avoid detection by ground forces, and the jumper freefalls until he's within a 1000-foot altitude above the target area, when he finally opens his chute.

MAJOR TOM

By using this technique, the chances of revealing the parachute landing to the enemy are marginal.

MAJOR TOM

The HALO technique was originally developed in France. This was partly due to popularity of parachuting as a sport since the end of World War II.

MAJOR TOM

And The Boss was an instructor for the research that was carried out there.

MAJOR TOM

In 1957 at the JFK Special Operations Center at Fort Bragg, The Boss was invited to instruct at the first ever U.S. Military HALO School.

MAJOR TOM

Of course, none of this is on the record. But she's the mother of modern-day special forces.
The Major and The Boss were in the SAS

SNAKE

Major, didn't you say that The Boss was in the SAS with you?

MAJOR TOM

Yes. We formed the 22nd SAS Regiment together.

MAJOR TOM

When the SAS, the British Special Air Service, was first established, they invited The Boss on board as a special advisor.

MAJOR TOM

In fact, you might say that it was The Boss who put together Rayforce and L Detachment, which laid the groundwork for today's SAS.

MAJOR TOM

You won't find her name in the history books, but her contributions were many and great.

SNAKE

The real heroes are never made public.

MAJOR TOM

Not in our line of work, anyway.

MAJOR TOM

The dummy run on Heliopolis and the nighttime raids on German air bases in North Africa were her idea as well.

MAJOR TOM

Yes, she was always one step ahead of the rest of us, both in thought and action.

MAJOR TOM

It's true what they say: "Who Dares, Wins."

SNAKE

The motto of the SAS.

MAJOR TOM

Precisely. The motto itself is a tribute to her service.

MAJOR TOM

Needless to say, the SAS has become a model for special forces units all over the world.

MAJOR TOM

In that sense, The Boss really is the mother of special forces.
Secret design bureaus

SNAKE

Major, what kind of place is this secret Design Bureau that Sokolov is heading?

ZERO

Mmm. The Soviets have a number of secret Design Bureaus like this one, each engaged in cutting-edge research.

ZERO

OKB-1, the bureau where the Voskhod spacecraft was developed and which plays a leading role in the Soviet space program, is one of those installations.

ZERO

Most of them are located in secret cities built in isolated areas, and we don't even know their exact locations, much less the nature of their research.

ZERO

And Sokolov's OKB-754 is the most secret bureau of them all.

ZERO

The intelligence communities of the West have tried time and again to find out what they're working on, but they've failed consistently.

SNAKE

So you have absolutely no idea what Sokolov is developing?

ZERO

We've got nothing.

SNAKE

Then how did you get the information for this mission? It can't have been from Sokolov...

ZERO

From The Boss.

SNAKE

The Boss?

ZERO

That's right. She has her own intelligence channels that she cultivated during the last war.

ZERO

She shared what she learned with us.

ZERO

That we were able to get the green light for this mission at all is thanks to her pull with the powers that be at the CIA.

ZERO

In other words, this mission would never have come together without The Boss' help in a number of respects.
The rockets Sokolov built

SNAKE

Major, tell me about Sokolov's past work.

ZERO

Mmm. I assume you already know that Sokolov was the developer of the multi-engine cluster.

ZERO

The multi-engine cluster is exactly that - a system for fitting a single rocket with multiple engines.

ZERO

The Vostok rocket, for instance, had 32 engines.

ZERO

With the technology they had, it was difficult for the Soviets to develop large engines with massive thrust.

ZERO

So instead, they decided to focus on using multiple smaller engines to achieve the desired thrust. With this method, though, maintaining the fuel balance between the various engines was a major problem.

ZERO

Sokolov was the man who provided the solution.

SNAKE

And that's what earned him the job as head of the Design Bureau?

ZERO

Apparently so.

SNAKE

So this secret weapon is some kind of ballistic device?

ZERO

That's my best guess. We don't know for sure, but...

SNAKE

You'll find out soon. As soon as I get Sokolov out of here.

ZERO

I'm counting on you.
•Miscellaneous
General purpose - don't get seen

ZERO

Snake, remember that this operation is a solo sneaking mission.

ZERO

We'll be providing you with support over the radio, but out in the field, you're on your own. There's no backup.

ZERO

And there's no way you'll survive a battle with a large enemy contingent. Avoid engagement whenever possible. Your highest priority in this mission is staying out of sight.
Covert action
(1)

MAJOR TOM

Listen up, Snake. Keep in mind that this operation is strictly covert.

MAJOR TOM

Engagements should be avoided. If you must dispose of an enemy, do it with the tranquilizer gun.
(2)
*During Virtuous Mission only

SNAKE

Yup. Sweet dreams, boy scout.

MAJOR TOM

That's right. And by the time he wakes up, you and Sokolov will be safely out of the country.

SNAKE

Sipping hot coffee on a plane back home.

MAJOR TOM

... What did you say?

SNAKE

?

MAJOR TOM

WHAT did you say?

SNAKE

Sipping hot coffee on a...

MAJOR TOM

You're going to drink that foul mud? On the victory flight home?

SNAKE

Okay, then what would you drink?

MAJOR TOM

Tea, of course!
Call after eating food

MAJOR TOM

You ate some food?

SNAKE

Yes.

MAJOR TOM

You aren't expecting food to recover LIFE, are you?

SNAKE

Of course not. Food alone doesn't heal wounds. Food only recovers stamina.

MAJOR TOM

Good.

SNAKE

Why do you ask?

MAJOR TOM

I once had a guy who thought that eating canned food would recover his LIFE.

SNAKE

What was he? Some kind of idiot?

MAJOR TOM

Of sorts, yes. But in the 21st century they'll probably come up with something that does just that.
Sigint's binoculars
*If player calls while using the binoculars after talking to Sigint
(1)

ZERO

I see you've equipped the binoculars.

SNAKE

Yep. Scouting is the bread and butter of sneaking missions.

ZERO

Are you finding them useful?

SNAKE

Yeah. The performance is top notch, and they're easy to use. These are some good binoculars.

ZERO

Really. Sigint will be pleased to hear that.

SNAKE

Why does Sigint care?

ZERO

Because he made them.
(2)
*If player has heard the conversation in which Sigint sings the binoculars's praises

SNAKE

Now I get it...

ZERO

What do you mean?

SNAKE

Don't worry about it...
(3)

ZERO

From what I hear, it took him more than a year to finish them.

SNAKE

I'll admit they're good binoculars, but what took him so long? Was it grinding the lenses?

ZERO

No, it was the style.

SNAKE

The style?

ZERO

Yes. He said he could never get the body design just right.

ZERO

Thanks to all his blasted tinkering, we went three times over budget. He better have a will ready before I get done with him.

SNAKE

...
Powers's gear

SNAKE

Major, I appreciate you allowing me to use weapons, but shouldn't I be carrying some rubles?

ZERO

You mean fake currency?

SNAKE

Right.

ZERO

Snake, do you remember the Francis Gary Powers incident back in 1960?

SNAKE

Powers was flying a U2 on a spy mission for the CIA in Soviet airspace. He was shot down and taken prisoner.

ZERO

His confession brought to light the fact that the CIA was spying in Soviet airspace. As a result, the U.S.-Soviet summit scheduled for two weeks later was canceled.

SNAKE

Yeah, I remember.

ZERO

U2 pilots are required to carry items that mask their identity.

ZERO

Powers was carrying ruble, mark, and lira coins as well as French gold coins.

ZERO

He was also carrying two gold watches and seven women's rings. All of these objects were meant to conceal his national origins.

ZERO

But for this mission, we've got to demonstrate to the Khrushchev regime that America is involved. There's no need to conceal your origins. And besides...

ZERO

All you need to do is complete your mission. As long as you're not captured or killed, the details will take care of themselves.

SNAKE

OK.
The space race

SNAKE

Major, tell me a little bit more about the space race.

ZERO

In 1957, the Soviet Union succeeded in launching their first artificial satellite, Sputnik, into orbit.

ZERO

Having been beaten to the chase by the Soviets, the U.S. government accelerated its own space program in an effort to catch up.

ZERO

The following year, the space development programs of the various service branches were united to form the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, or NASA.

ZERO

That same year, the Mercury program was launched with the goal of putting a man into space. Seven candidates were chosen from the military as the first astronauts. These were the men with the "right stuff."

ZERO

But as you know, it was a Soviet cosmonaut, Yuri Gagarin, who made the first successful manned space flight three years ago.

ZERO

NASA's first successful ballistic flight came one month after Gagarin's mission, with the Freedom 7 carrying Alan Shepard into space.

ZERO

After that, with America still lagging behind the Soviets in orbital flight, President Kennedy made a momentous decision.

ZERO

That America would put a man on the moon before the end of the decade.

SNAKE

Yeah, I heard that speech. But a lot of guys I knew weren't real happy about it...

SNAKE

They said no one was gonna make them go on a mission to blow up some damn moon base.

ZERO

But rocket research and missile research are closely related.

ZERO

Imagine, if you will, a Soviet Union able to send wave after wave of nuclear missiles raining down on Washington from a base on the surface of the moon.

ZERO

Even if that's still a long way from reality...

ZERO

If we lose the initiative, we may never get it back. We're left with no choice but to keep moving forward, one step at a time.

ZERO

The Gemini program launched two years ago represents the initial step toward establishing a moon base.

ZERO

And yet...

ZERO

I don't want to call President Kennedy a liar, but I simply can't imagine that in six years, man will have reached the moon.

SNAKE

I don't know. I never even thought we'd make it up into space.

SNAKE

Guess it all depends on whether you have the will to make it happen.

ZERO

Perhaps you're right.
The fake death pill and the revival pill
(1)

ZERO

Snake, the fake death and revival pills we gave you are the latest in internal medicines developed for intelligence ops by the CIA's technology division.

ZERO

You can use the fake death pill to send yourself into a death-like state for a limited period of time. Use it wisely and you should be able to fool the enemy into thinking you're really dead.

ZERO

It may come in handy if you ever find yourself cornered.

ZERO

To revive yourself from the fake-death state, use the revival pill. But remember - timing is critical. The effect will be ruined if you revive right in front of your enemy.
(2)

SNAKE

Interesting. But how does it work?

ZERO

What do you mean?

SNAKE

I don't feel right taking some pill I don't know anything about. How does it make me look dead? How's it gonna affect my body?

ZERO

Well, Snake... about that... (He was about to tell Snake not to ask since Para-Medic will launch into a long explanation.)

SNAKE

I get it. I should ask Para-Medic. Para-Medic! (Thought the Major was going to tell him to ask Para-Medic.)

PARA-MEDIC

Allow me to explain.

PARA-MEDIC

You know how there are animals in nature that play dead, like weevils, ladybugs, chickadees, opossums and the like.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, the fake death pill takes the natural art of playing dead and applies it to the spy world.

PARA-MEDIC

When you take the fake death pill, it causes your body to rapidly secrete a number of chemicals - adenosine and serotonin as well as opioid peptides such as methionin enkephalin.

PARA-MEDIC

Those chemicals act to induce a state of hibernation, causing your heart rate, your breathing rate, and your body temperature to drop dramatically.

PARA-MEDIC

It'll truly look like you've dropped dead upon initial inspection.

PARA-MEDIC

The revival pill, to put it simply, is a counteracting agent to the fake death pill.

PARA-MEDIC

When you take it, it causes your body to secrete stimulants, like noradrenaline and other chemicals such as naloxone, which block the effects of the fake death pill.

PARA-MEDIC

Basically, it wakes you up.

PARA-MEDIC

Does that help?

SNAKE

... Yeah

PARA-MEDIC

OK, I'll try and explain it in more detail.

PARA-MEDIC

The secretion of methionin enkephalin triggered by the fake death pill causes the opioid receptors...

SNAKE

O... OK, I think I get it now.

PARA-MEDIC

You sure?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

But you must want to know a little bit more.

PARA-MEDIC

There are three types of receptors: delta, kappa, and mu. Methionin enkephalin acts on the...

ZERO

Ah, Para-Medic, I think Snake understands now. Isn't that right, Snake?

SNAKE

Yeah, clear as crystal.

PARA-MEDIC

But...

SNAKE

Major, I've got enough info about the pills, so I'm going to get back to the mission now.

ZERO

Yes. You do that.

PARA-MEDIC

Hey, wait a--!

PARA-MEDIC

*glum* ...
The scientist disguise

ZERO

Snake, I heard you got a scientist disguise from EVA.

SNAKE

Yeah.

ZERO

Go to "UNIFORM" on the "CAMOUFLAGE" screen and choose "SCIENTIST" to disguise yourself as a scientist.

SNAKE

"SCIENTIST", huh. (I'll put it on right away.)

ZERO

But it won't do you any good to go around the jungle wearing a scientist disguise.

PARA-MEDIC

No one would be that stupid.

ZERO

You're right. No one would think of going around the jungle in a scientist disguise. If they did, they'd have to be a fool. No, more than a fool -- a complete dumbass.

ZERO

Don't you think so, Snake?

SNAKE

*dejected* Yeah...
While wearing the scientist disguise
(1)

ZERO

SNAKE

What's wrong, Major?

ZERO

I should be asking you the same question. Why are you wearing that outfit?

SNAKE

Wanted to try it on.
(2)

ZERO

Did you listen to a word that I said?
(3)

What are you thinking, dressing like a scientist in the middle of the jungle? Look at your Camo Index. You're a walking bull's-eye.

ZERO

Get back into your camouflage, now!

SNAKE

ZERO

What was that!?

SNAKE

Nothing.
Origin of Major "Zero"

SNAKE

Major.

ZERO

Yes?

SNAKE

I was just wondering... why do they call you "Zero"?

ZERO

What do you mean?

SNAKE

We go back a long ways, but I just realized I never asked you why you're called "Zero."

ZERO

You want to know where it comes from?

SNAKE

Yeah. If that's all right.

ZERO

... That's a bit nostalgic, really.

SNAKE

Nostalgic?

ZERO

The first British intelligence outfit was established in 1909. The head of the foreign intelligence division was a man named Mansfield George Smith Cumming.

ZERO

He was referred to simply as "C," after the first letter of his last name.

ZERO

Since then, out of respect for Cumming, the heads of the SIS have traditionally taken the name of "C."

PARA-MEDIC

And James Bond's boss is called "M."

ZERO

That's right. I myself was once known as "O."

SNAKE

And that's where "Zero" comes from?

ZERO

Precisely.

ZERO

In another sense though, it signifies a ghost - one whose true identity must remain a mystery. The primogenitor of the solo sneaking operation.

SNAKE

Is that so...
Going over the route
(1)

Snake, your number one priority in this mission is rescuing Sokolov. EVA said he is in the lab, so head over there.
(2)

SNAKE

Right.

ZERO

Do you remember how to get to the lab?

SNAKE

You mean what EVA told me?

ZERO

Yes.

SNAKE

Of course I do. (Isn't really confident.)

ZERO

Alright, repeat it for me.

SNAKE

Major, do you think I'd forget something like that?

ZERO

Let's hear it then.
(3)
*If player hasn't yet reached crevice

SNAKE

First, I head north.

ZERO

Mmm.

SNAKE

Then I'll come to a crevice...
(4)
*If player hasn't yet reached mangrove forest

SNAKE

... First, I head toward the back of this cave.

ZERO

Mmm.

SNAKE

And then I'll come to an aqueduct.
(5)
*If player hasn't yet reached mangrove base

SNAKE

... First, I follow this aqueduct north.

ZERO

Mmm.

SNAKE

Then I'll come to a warehouse.
(6)

ZERO

And then?

SNAKE

And then...

SNAKE

...

ZERO

*stunned* All right, let's go over this one more time.
(7)
*If player hasn't yet reached crevice

ZERO

First, head north through the jungle. Enter the cave through the crevice to the north.
(8)
*If player hasn't yet reached mangrove forest

ZERO

Follow the cave to the end and you'll come out in an aqueduct surrounded by mangrove.
(9)
*If player hasn't yet reached mangrove base

ZERO

Follow the aqueduct to the north and you should arrive at a warehouse. Climb out of the water and enter the warehouse.
(10)

After you've infiltrated the warehouse, pass through it to the north. Then you'll emerge in the woods again. The lab will be directly to the north.
(11)

ZERO

Are we clear now?

•Camouflage
Camouflage yourself
(1)

THE BOSS

Camouflage is an indispensable tool when you're sneaking through the jungle.
(2)
*If Camo Index is low

THE BOSS

To use camouflage, first press the Menu Button to go to the Survival Viewer.

THE BOSS

Then select "CAMOUFLAGE" and press the Enter Button.

THE BOSS

Select "UNIFORM" to select battle fatigues, and "FACE" to select face paint.
(3)

THE BOSS

Choose battle fatigues that match the surrounding environment.

THE BOSS

The most effective camouflage is attained by selecting fatigues that blend in with the environment.
(4)

THE BOSS

Camouflage patterns that stand out in your surroundings will attract attention.
If player refuses to use camouflage

THE BOSS

Snake!

SNAKE

What's up, Boss?

THE BOSS

Don't you "what's up" me!

SNAKE

OK, then... "what is it?"

THE BOSS

I'm talking about your camouflage! Why aren't you using it!?

SNAKE

Oh...

THE BOSS

When you don't use any camouflage at all, you stick out like a sore thumb. Didn't you listen to a word I said?

SNAKE

I was listening but...

THE BOSS

Then start using your camouflage.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

Is that clear?

SNAKE

Yeah.
If player isn't using face paint
(1)

THE BOSS

It takes more than just clothes to make a good disguise. To camouflage yourself effectively, you'll need to wear face paint.
(2)

THE BOSS

Face paint is camouflage applied to the face. Bare skin sticks out like a sore thumb in the jungle, so always protect yourself with face paint.
(3)

THE BOSS

Choose a color that matches the features of your surroundings, and use your finger to apply the face paint.

THE BOSS

Start by applying a light color, then gradually move up in darkness. That way, even if you make a mistake, you can cover it up with a later, darker color.

THE BOSS

In order to flatten the appearance of your face, use light colors on areas of the face that recede, and dark colors on areas that protrude.
(4)

THE BOSS

Open the Survival Viewer, go to "CAMOUFLAGE", then select "FACE," and you'll find the selection of face paints.

THE BOSS

Be sure to select a face paint that makes you blend right into your surroundings. Okay?
The Camo Index

THE BOSS

Normally, you would ask a fellow soldier how well your camouflage is working.

THE BOSS

But this is a solo sneaking mission, so nobody out there is on your side. You have to determine how well your camouflage is working by yourself.

SNAKE

*a little apprehensive* Yeah, I know.

THE BOSS

Don't worry. That's what the Camo Index is for.

THE BOSS

The Camo Index tells you how well you've imitated the surroundings.

THE BOSS

The higher the index, the more well-disguised you are.

THE BOSS

With a high enough Camo Index, you can even fool enemies inches away.

THE BOSS

If you are in an area where encounters are a high concern, keep your Camo Index high. Got it?
Camouflage and stances

THE BOSS

Camouflage is about blending in with nature. To ensure effective camouflage, you have to stay low and keep still.

THE BOSS

As long as you have camouflage fatigues, face paint that matches the environment, and lay on your stomach, you don't need to be concerned with being spotted by distant enemies.

THE BOSS

On the other hand, no amount of camouflage will keep you hidden from the enemy if you're running around.

THE BOSS

So, when you need to hide from the enemy, lie as low as possible, and stay still.

THE BOSS

You can check the Camo Index to see how your movement and position affects the quality of your disguise.
The history of camouflage

THE BOSS

Hunters have known about camouflage since ancient times.

THE BOSS

But it's only quite recently - since the 18th century - that it's been applied to military operations.

THE BOSS

The first camouflage introduced to the military was a solid-colored uniform designed to blend in with the battlefield. It was really more of a protective coloring than true camouflage.

THE BOSS

Camouflage, in the modern sense of the word, wasn't introduced until the First World War.

THE BOSS

During that war, weapons such as aircraft, cannon and warships were painted in camouflage colors.

THE BOSS

But it was almost never used to disguise individual soldiers...

THE BOSS

The widespread use of camouflage began in World War II. The Germans and the Russians, in particular, made active use of it in battle.

THE BOSS

Nowadays, with the Cold War raging, the Eastern bloc has been hard at work developing all sorts of camouflage patterns.

THE BOSS

In the West, the French implemented it in their paratrooper corps and SAS during the wars of independence in Indochina.

SNAKE

I never saw it used in Korea, though.

THE BOSS

America has lagged behind other countries in incorporating camouflage. They're only just beginning to consider introducing it into certain units.

SNAKE

Why is that?

THE BOSS

Apparently, there are those in the U.S. military who consider camouflage too "passive" a technique.

SNAKE

Morons.

THE BOSS

You're telling me. But now more and more people are beginning to appreciate how useful and important camouflage can be.

THE BOSS

I'm sure the brass will see the light soon enough.
If player is using a joke camo that won't help them

THE BOSS

*stunned* Snake...

SNAKE

What's up, Boss?

THE BOSS

Don't you "what's up" me. Just what do you think you're doing?

SNAKE

What do you mean?

THE BOSS

"What do I mean"... What is that camouflage you're wearing?

SNAKE

*proudly* Oh, this. What do you think?

THE BOSS

Of all the...

SNAKE

Looks pretty good on me, doesn't it?

THE BOSS

Are you out of your mind? You can't wear that in battle!

THE BOSS

It's like saying to the enemy, "Hey! Here I am! Shoot me!"

SNAKE

Well, I'll admit, it is a little on the flashy side...

THE BOSS

Then why don't you...

SNAKE

But it does look good on me, doesn't it?

THE BOSS

...

SNAKE

You don't think so?

THE BOSS

Listen, wise ass! Camouflage isn't going to do jack if it doesn't help you blend in with your surroundings!

SNAKE

*mutters* Well, I think it looks good on me...

THE BOSS

Fine! Wear whatever you want!

SNAKE

*hurt* ... I thought you'd like it...
•Uniforms
Naked

THE BOSS

Snake, did you take off your uniform?

SNAKE

Yeah.

THE BOSS

What's the matter?

SNAKE

Just needed to loosen up.

THE BOSS

*stunned* ... I know there's a "NAKED" option under "UNIFORM" in the "CAMOUFLAGE" window that lets you take off your uniform.

THE BOSS

But without a uniform on, your Camo Index will remain low, and you'll burn through your stamina more quickly.

THE BOSS

So stop acting like a fool and put some camouflage on, now!

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

Did you hear me!?

SNAKE

Yeah...
Olive Drab
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're wearing the olive drab uniform.
(2)

THE BOSS

Olive drab, or OD for short, is what you might call the "pre-camouflage" uniform.

THE BOSS

Plain-colored OD fatigues are still worn by infantry today, but they'll be replaced sooner or later by patterned camouflage.

THE BOSS

As you can see, it's got no colors or markings on it, so of course it won't make a very effective disguise. You should change into some other type of camouflage as soon as you can.
Tree Bark
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're wearing the tree bark camouflage.
(2)

THE BOSS

The tree bark pattern was originally created for use by hunters.

THE BOSS

Unlike the somewhat abstract designs seen in other patterns, Tree bark is characterized by a design that resembles photographs of stumps and branches pasted together.

THE BOSS

It's especially good when you're pressed up against a tree.
Squares
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're wearing the squares pattern camouflage.
(2)

THE BOSS

The squares camouflage consists of a series of squares, each varying slightly in color and shape from the next.

THE BOSS

It has the effect of making the contours of the person wearing it more difficult to distinguish.

THE BOSS

You'll find it especially useful against brick and rusted metal backgrounds.
Black
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're wearing the black camouflage.
(2)

THE BOSS

People tend to associate black camo with night operations, but that's not always the case.

THE BOSS

Wearing all black when you're out in the forest at night makes your silhouette darker and more prominent, and you end up standing out instead.

THE BOSS

To get the most out of your camouflage, it's essential to choose a pattern that matches your surroundings - even at night. Don't forget that.
Leaf
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're wearing the leaf pattern camouflage.
(2)

THE BOSS

The leaf pattern was developed to provide cover in forest environments.

THE BOSS

The U.S. military isn't the only one using it. Countries that anticipate operating in forest environments are developing various types of patterns, each suited to the vegetation of the particular region.

THE BOSS

The Soviets and the Eastern European countries all use their own unique patterns.

THE BOSS

Leaf pattern camo will give you an especially low profile in areas of thick vegetation.
Tiger Stripe
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're wearing the tiger stripe camouflage.
(2)

THE BOSS

The tiger stripe pattern has been in use since 1959 among the South Vietnamese Marine Corps.

THE BOSS

But the pattern originated with the French. It's said that it developed out of the brush stroke pattern, also known as "lizard camouflage."

THE BOSS

It provides some cover in trees and grass, but it's especially effective in earth and mud environments. You should find it useful when you're concealing yourself by crawling on the ground.
•Face Paints
Normal
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're not wearing any face paint.
(2)

THE BOSS

Selecting "NO PAINT" for "FACE" under "CAMOUFLAGE" lets you remove your face paint.

THE BOSS

But without face paint your camouflage alone won't be sufficient.

THE BOSS

So if you need a high Camo Index, make sure you're wearing face paint. Got it?
Woodland
(1)

THE BOSS

You're wearing the woodland face paint, I see.
(2)

THE BOSS

The woodland face paint is designed for use in forests. It'll give you a high level of camouflage in a wooded environment.

THE BOSS

Try using woodland paint when you're traveling through the forest.
Black
(1)

THE BOSS

You're wearing black face paint, huh?
(2)

THE BOSS

Painting your face black will raise your Camo Index in dark areas.

THE BOSS

If you find yourself in any dark areas, make sure to use the black face paint.
•CQC
CQC controls
(1)

THE BOSS

Visibility is poor in the jungle, so you'll be finding yourself in a lot of unexpected encounters. Naturally, this means that close-quarters combat will be more important than ever.

SNAKE

So I'll have plenty of chances to use CQC, then.

THE BOSS

That's right.

THE BOSS

In proximity encounters, firing a gun isn't necessarily the best response to every situation. It's only one option among many.

THE BOSS

Rather than taking the time to draw, aim, and fire a gun, engaging your opponent in hand-to-hand combat can sometimes be a faster and more reliable way of subduing him.

THE BOSS

Besides, in a sneaking mission like this one it's too dangerous to go around firing your gun. You'll end up revealing yourself to the enemy.

SNAKE

Yeah, I know. You created CQC to deal with exactly this type of situation.

THE BOSS

With your help of course.

THE BOSS

In a battle situation, you'll only have a split second to decide how to attack. Use the Weapon Button to attack using a weapon, and the CQC Button to attack using CQC.
(2)

THE BOSS

Press the CQC Button once to throw a punch. Pressing it multiple times in succession will allow you to deliver a combo attack.

THE BOSS

But striking your opponent is just one aspect of CQC. It doesn't really start to shine until you've got your enemy in a hold.

THE BOSS

Press and hold down the CQC Button to grab your opponent with your right hand.

THE BOSS

From there, you can use the left analog stick to knock your opponent off balance and throw him to the ground. This can be used to knock an opponent out in a single blow.

THE BOSS

If you don't press the left analog stick, grapple with your enemy until you're behind them and can get your knife to their throat.
(3)

THE BOSS

Grabbing an enemy from behind and holding your knife against his throat will render him virtually powerless. From this point, there are several things you can do.

THE BOSS

Press the CQC Button hard to slit the enemy's throat with your knife.

THE BOSS

Move the left analog stick and press the CQC Button to throw the enemy to the ground.

THE BOSS

Lightly tap the CQC Button rapidly to choke the enemy. You can use this to knock him out, or even kill him if you do it long enough.

THE BOSS

By continuing to hold down the CQC Button, you can move around while keeping your grip on the enemy.

THE BOSS

By pressing the Weapon Button, you can aim your currently equipped weapon at another enemy. With their comrade acting as a human shield, the enemy will be reluctant to attack you.

THE BOSS

Press the left analog stick to press your knife against the enemy and demand information. You'll be surprised at how much you can learn this way.

THE BOSS

But don't get too complacent. While your enemy may be powerless in your grip, he'll use any opportunity he can to counterattack.
You can't use CQC with weapons like rifles

THE BOSS

You can only use CQC to grab enemies when your right hand is free to grab and pull them toward you - in other words, when you're bare handed or equipped with a one-handed weapon like the survival knife or a handgun.

THE BOSS

You won't be able to grab hold of enemies when equipped with two-handed weapons such as the assault rifle or weapons such as hand grenades that don't leave your right hand free to control the enemy.

SNAKE

So in other words, I can't throw enemies with CQC when I'm holding an assault rifle or a hand grenade.

THE BOSS

Exactly. Don't forget it.
The concept of CQC

THE BOSS

In my day, I did my share of sneaking into enemy territory.

SNAKE

You mean since World War II?

THE BOSS

Yeah. Mostly snatch missions.

SNAKE

Snatch mission... that's where you abduct an enemy officer without killing him, right?

THE BOSS

Right. That's where I got the original idea for CQC.

THE BOSS

In a snatch mission, taking out the target's escorts by shooting them is not an option.

THE BOSS

If the enemy hears the gunshot, they'll know there's an intruder and tighten security. And the target will sense danger and try to get away.

SNAKE

You needed a way to take out the guards and secure the target without making a sound...

THE BOSS

That was the idea. The CQC style that you and I developed is based on the techniques I cultivated during those missions. So... (She was about to say "So make good use of it in this mission" before Snake interrupted her.)

SNAKE

First time I've heard this.

THE BOSS

Huh?

SNAKE

You've never told me any of this before.

THE BOSS

I didn't?

SNAKE

No. Why?

THE BOSS

?

SNAKE

Why didn't you tell me this before? Why now?

THE BOSS

I have my reasons... (Because this will be the last time we see each other.)
Physique, technique, and heart

THE BOSS

The techniques themselves - the strikes and the throws - are only one aspect of CQC.

THE BOSS

In order to make those techniques work, it's essential to have a strong body as well.

THE BOSS

But the most important tools in CQC are your wits - the ability to instantly comprehend and analyze the enemy's behavior and psychological condition to determine your actions. In short...

SNAKE

Mind, body and technique.

THE BOSS

That's right. CQC can only be used effectively when all three of those elements are combined.

SNAKE

Sounds like some sort of oriental martial art.

THE BOSS

It does, doesn't it? Anyway, it's not something that's easily taught or easily mastered. It takes rigorous training and years of experience to learn it.

THE BOSS

You helped create it, and you're the only one who can use it.

SNAKE

Except you, right?

THE BOSS

Yeah.
•Weapons
Survival Knife

THE BOSS

I see you've got the survival knife equipped.

THE BOSS

The survival knife is a necessity in the field.

THE BOSS

Press the Weapon Button to swing the knife. Press it repeatedly to perform a combo attack.

THE BOSS

The knife lets you kill an enemy silently, so you should find it useful when the situation calls for stealth.

THE BOSS

In addition to fighting the enemy, you can also use the knife to capture wild animals.

THE BOSS

That one knife can provide you with everything you need to survive in the field. Use it well.
Mk22

THE BOSS

The gun you're using is a test model of a suppressor-equipped pistol currently in development by the Navy that's been modified by the CIA into a tranquilizer gun.

THE BOSS

The suppressor-equipped pistol it's derived from is itself being developed for use by Special Forces based on the M39...

SNAKE

The Mk22.

THE BOSS

That's what they're going to call it if they decide to adopt it for official use...

THE BOSS

It uses a slide-lock mechanism, that will keep the firing sound down to a minimum...

SNAKE

But I'll have to reload it by hand every time I fire. Right?

THE BOSS

Right. You won't be able to fire multiple shots at once, so make every shot count. Aim for the enemy's vital spots.

THE BOSS

There's talk of designing the Mk22 to accommodate special subsonic rounds, but for this mission you'll be using specifically designed tranquilizer rounds.

THE BOSS

In a way, these tranquilizer rounds are like miniature syringes.

THE BOSS

When one of them strikes a target, the impact causes a needle contained within to shoot out. At the same time, chemicals inside the round are mixed to create a gas, which pushes the plunger and injects the tranquilizer into the target.

THE BOSS

You can knock out an enemy immediately by shooting them in the head. But if you shoot them in the arm or leg, the tranquilizing agent will take some time to set in. Aim carefully.
M1911A1
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're using the .45.

SNAKE

Yeah. It's an M1911A1.

THE BOSS

The stopping power of those .45 ACP rounds ought to come in handy.

SNAKE
