And it uses a simple single-action system, so it won't jam up on me so much. Even if I get caught in mud or sand, it'll keep on shooting.

THE BOSS

The perfect handgun for this mission.

SNAKE

Yeah. We'll make a good team.
(2)

THE BOSS

The .45 can also be equipped with a suppressor. The suppressor will reduce the noise of the gunshot.

THE BOSS

If you find a suppressor, open the Weapon Window and press the Enter Button to attach or detach it.

THE BOSS

But remember: the suppressor will deteriorate little by little each time you fire.
RGD Grenade

THE BOSS

I see you've found yourself an RGD-5.

THE BOSS

RGD stands for "Ruchnaya Granata Degtyareva" in Russian. It basically means 'hand grenade of the Degtyarev design.'

THE BOSS

It's the standard issue blast-fragmentation grenade of the Soviet army.

SNAKE

It's lighter than the M26 (an American-made hand grenade).

THE BOSS

And it carries fewer explosives as well. But I'd say it's more or less equal to an M26 in terms of performance.

THE BOSS

Be careful, though - the safety pin ring is on the opposite side.

THE BOSS

You'll be fine as long as you keep the safety lever pressed down with your finger.

SNAKE

I'll keep that in mind.

THE BOSS

Blast-fragmentation grenades use a combination of blast and shrapnel to kill their targets.

THE BOSS

This makes them effective against standing targets, but significantly less effective against targets lying on the ground. Remember that.
Magazine

THE BOSS

You got a magazine, huh.

THE BOSS

That is an empty magazine for your guns. It can be an effective weapon itself, if you know how to use it.

SNAKE

You mean throwing them at people?

THE BOSS

No. You can't take out an enemy just by throwing a magazine at him.

THE BOSS

But if you use the sound it makes when it lands to attract the enemy's attention...

SNAKE

I get it. It creates a diversion.

THE BOSS

Weapons will be in short supply during this mission. If you want to succeed, you'll need to use your head.
EZ Gun
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you're using the EZ GUN.

THE BOSS

The EZ GUN is a silenced tranquilizer gun for special-ops use developed for FOX by the CIA's technology division.

SNAKE

A silenced tranquilizer gun? I don't see a suppressor on here...

THE BOSS

Apparently, the tranquilizer rounds themselves are designed to suppress the sound.

SNAKE

Interesting. In other words, I won't have to worry about the suppressor wearing out on me, right?

THE BOSS

That's right.

THE BOSS

It's also equipped with a laser sight so that you can make accurate shots even at a distance.
(2)

THE BOSS

In addition, merely equipping the EZ GUN should have a positive effect on your Camo Index.
(3)

THE BOSS

I've even heard it helps you recover your stamina.
(4)

THE BOSS

Put it to good use.
XM16E1

THE BOSS

The weapon you're equipped with now is called the XM16E1.

THE BOSS

It's a new type of rifle currently being developed by the U.S. Army.

SNAKE

If it's still in development, then what's it doing here?

THE BOSS

My guess is they captured it when it was it was being battle-tested in Southeast Asia.

THE BOSS

But the one you've got there is quite a bit different from the ones I've been hearing about.

THE BOSS

For one thing, it's camo-painted and it's fitted with a three-shot burst mechanism. It even looks like you could attach a suppressor...

THE BOSS

All of these modifications are geared towards jungle combat. This doesn't look like the work of the Soviets.

THE BOSS

My guess is they were added on-site by an American gunsmith during the army field trials.

THE BOSS

Open the Weapon Window and press the Enter Button to attach or remove the suppressor. Press the Action Button to switch between semi-auto, full auto, and three-shot burst modes.

THE BOSS

Make use of each of these functions as the situation warrants.
Dragunov
(1)

THE BOSS

I see you've got your hands on an SVD.

THE BOSS

The SVD is the Soviet Union's most advanced automatic sniper rifle. It's said to be better designed and more durable than anything the West has.

SNAKE

It looks kind of like an AK-47.

THE BOSS

The shape is similar, but the internal mechanism is one of a kind. It uses 7.62 x 54 mm rimmed cartridges, which are more powerful and precise than the ones the AK uses.

THE BOSS

It can be a powerful weapon if you know how to use it.
(2)

THE BOSS

Sniper rifles aren't meant to be used on the move. When you equip one, you'll immediately go into First Person View.

THE BOSS

The more stable your stance, the less your hands will shake when you're aiming the rifle. Make sure you're lying down before attempting to make a long-distance shot.

THE BOSS

To use the scope, press the Aim Button. You can also use the Action Button to change the level of magnification.

THE BOSS

By taking out enemies from a distance with the sniper rifle, you can shift the odds in your favor. Use it well.
White Phosphorous Grenade

THE BOSS

You've got a white phosphorus grenade, I see.

THE BOSS

White phosphorus grenades use white phosphorus to create an incendiary blast. They were widely used on the Pacific front.

THE BOSS

Upon detonation, all living things in the area of effect will suffer serious burns.

THE BOSS

Just make sure you don't end up getting burned yourself.
Smoke Grenade

THE BOSS

I see you've got a smoke grenade.

THE BOSS

The smoke grenade does exactly what the name implies.

THE BOSS

It creates a thick, dispersion-resistant cloud of white smoke that blocks the enemy's field of vision.

THE BOSS

It should be useful when you need to make a quick getaway. Keep it in mind.
Stun Grenade

THE BOSS

That's certainly a strange-looking grenade you've got there.

SNAKE

Yeah. I've never seen one like this. What is it...?

THE BOSS

It must be a new type of grenade developed by the Russians.

THE BOSS

From what I can tell, it's a non-lethal weapon that uses a flash of light and intense sound to overpower the senses of human targets.

THE BOSS

You can probably use that grenade to knock out the enemy without killing them. It might prove useful.
Chaff Grenade

THE BOSS

That's an interesting grenade you've got there.

SNAKE

Yeah. I've never seen anything like this before...

THE BOSS

Apparently it's designed to disrupt radio waves by scattering tiny pieces of metal into the air.

THE BOSS

The Russians probably developed it as a personal anti-electronics weapon.

THE BOSS

You can use that grenade to block radio communications between enemy soldiers.

SNAKE

Then they won't be able to call for reinforcements, huh?

THE BOSS

That's right.

THE BOSS

But remember that as long as the radio disruption lasts, your active sonar and motion detector will also be rendered inoperable.
Magazine

THE BOSS

*coldly* What is that you have in your hands?

SNAKE

!!! (She caught me!)

THE BOSS

Honestly, when did you start reading magazines like that?

SNAKE

I, uh...

THE BOSS

Didn't I teach you how to take care of business without having to rely on that sort of thing?

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

... anyway.

THE BOSS

I'm sure some of the enemy grunts will find that sort of magazine as appealing as you seem to.

THE BOSS

Place it on the ground and you might be able divert their attention.
Directional Microphone

THE BOSS

Ah, you've got a directional microphone.

THE BOSS

The directional microphone is a high-performance listening device. When you equip it, you'll go into First Person View, where the microphone will pick up sounds in whichever direction it's facing.

THE BOSS

By pointing the microphone into the forest, you can sometimes hear the footsteps of enemy soldiers lurking beyond the trees.

THE BOSS

In jungle combat, success depends on how well you can sense the enemy's presence. Use it wisely.
•Items
Binoculars

THE BOSS

I see you're using binoculars. The ones you've got are a high performance military model equipped with a zoom function.

SNAKE

Yeah. They give me a flat image across the entire viewing range.

THE BOSS

They're completely waterproof and highly shock- and flame-resistant. You won't need to worry about them breaking.

THE BOSS

Scouting is key during a sneaking mission. If you can determine enemy positions and the lay of the land from a distance, it'll make your job that much easier. Use them wisely.
Thermal Goggles

THE BOSS

Those things you're wearing... those are...

SNAKE

Thermal goggles. Some kind of electronic gadget that shows the distribution of heat sources in image form.

THE BOSS

I know they're based on the same principle behind the FLIR system on gunships. But to think they actually made it small enough to carry with you...

SNAKE

They're not just making good rockets huh? Never underestimate the power of Soviet science.

THE BOSS

Tell me about it. In any case, those thermal goggles should allow you to easily see through enemy camouflage and spot traps.

THE BOSS

Just don't leave them on for too long, or you'll drain the batteries.
Mousetrap

THE BOSS

So, you want to use a mousetrap?

THE BOSS

The mousetrap is designed to capture smaller animals.

THE BOSS

If you press the Weapon Button and place the mousetrap on the ground, you might be able to catch something with it.

THE BOSS

Use the Survival Viewer "MAP" to see where you've already placed the traps.

THE BOSS

However, don't forget that the mousetrap is designed to lure animals in using some kind of bait in the middle.

THE BOSS

If you capture one animal by using it, don't expect to capture any more.

THE BOSS

Crawl to pick it up again, refill the bait, and put it back on the ground to catch more animals.
LIFE Medicine

THE BOSS

You have some LIFE medicine on you.

THE BOSS

LIFE medicine is a recent pharmaceutical product developed by the Soviet Union. It works with your metabolism to quickly treat wounds.

THE BOSS

If you use it, you can recover LIFE on the spot. Try it when your LIFE is starting to run low in battle.
Cigar

THE BOSS

Are you smoking a cigar?

SNAKE

Uh huh.

THE BOSS

I don't approve of you smoking during a mission.

SNAKE

Hey, you used to smoke them.

THE BOSS

Never mind what I did.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

But that being said, cigars can be useful in a number of different ways. Like getting rid of leeches.

SNAKE

Did you say leeches?

THE BOSS

Yes. If a leech clamps onto you, try pressing the lit end of a cigar into it. The leech should cringe and detach itself from you.

THE BOSS

If you try to yank it off by yourself, you run the risk of it leaving its teeth inside you. With the cigar method, you won't have that problem.

SNAKE

Fascinating.

THE BOSS

And unlike a cigarette, a cigar burns slowly, so you can use it in place of a torch in dark places.

SNAKE

I never knew a cigar had so many different uses...

THE BOSS

Now you know. But quit smoking them during the mission.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

Hear me?

SNAKE

Yes, ma'am...
Weight of objects

THE BOSS

Keep in mind that your weapons and equipment each have their own weight.

THE BOSS

Storing a heavy item on your person will cause your stamina to drain more quickly.

THE BOSS

If you're getting tired or want to conserve your stamina, it's a good idea to put any items you're not going to use back into your backpack.
Use your sensors

THE BOSS

The sooner you find the enemy, the better you'll be able to deal with the situation.

THE BOSS

So be sure to make use of sensors like the motion detector and active sonar.
•Controls Explanations
First Person View

THE BOSS

Press the First Person View Button to switch to the First Person View. In First Person View, you can look at your surroundings through your own eyes.

THE BOSS

The Overhead View's range is limited. If you plow ahead using only the Overhead View, you put yourself in danger of running into an enemy without even realizing he was there.

THE BOSS

Make regular stops, and check your surroundings with First Person View. Okay, Snake?
First Person View attacks

THE BOSS

The First Person View attack is a fundamental part of gunfighting.

THE BOSS

It allows you to aim in directions impossible to hit with the Overhead View like shooting enemies that are above or below you. It also makes it possible to aim for your enemies' weak points.

THE BOSS

When you need to take an enemy out in one shot, use a First Person View attack and aim for the head.
Tactical reloads
(1)

THE BOSS

A tactical reload is a change of magazines carried out before the bullets in the magazine are completely used up.
(2)

THE BOSS

It keeps you from running out of bullets near your enemies, so that you can keep up your level of firepower, and you will always have a bullet in your chamber.

THE BOSS

The trick is: don't lower your gun or your line of sight when reloading. Keep your line of sight up and concentrate on your surroundings while changing magazines.

THE BOSS

And don't forget to retrieve magazines that still have bullets remaining in them.
(3)

THE BOSS

The actual procedure involves unequipping your gun, and then equipping it once again. That will load the gun with a new magazine.

THE BOSS

I recommend pressing the Weapon Window Button quickly to carry out a quick reload.
Backpack
(1)

THE BOSS

To place a weapon on your person, go to the Survival Viewer, then "BACKPACK," then select "WEAPON."

THE BOSS

A list of weapons will be shown in a window in the upper left.

THE BOSS

Select the weapon you wish to put on your person with the left analog stick and press the Enter Button to remove the weapon from your backpack and equip it to your person.

THE BOSS

However, you can only carry so many weapons at once on your person. Put unnecessary weapons back into your backpack.
-->(2) or (3)
(2)

THE BOSS

On the same screen, move the left analog stick while pressing the Weapon Window Button to move the icon for weapons that are already on your person.

THE BOSS

Line up the weapon icon with the lower right and press the Enter Button to put that weapon into your backpack.
(3)

THE BOSS

Select a weapon on your person from the weapon list and press the Enter Button to put that weapon into your backpack.
(4)

THE BOSS

Your situation determines what weapons are most useful. Consider this when choosing which weapons to put on your person. Okay, Snake?
The map

THE BOSS

Select "MAP" in the Survival Viewer to view a map of the area you're currently in.

THE BOSS

It shows your present location and the places you've been to. In addition, if you acquire information from enemies, the map may also display enemy unit positions and the location of items.

THE BOSS

To get information from an enemy, grab him from behind using CQC and press the left analog stick.

THE BOSS

To succeed in any mission, knowing how to put information about the zone of operation to effective use will be essential. "MAP" will serve you well.
Aiming a gun
(1)

THE BOSS

When you aim your handgun in First Person View, align the front sight and the rear sight of the gun with the target, then fire.
(2)
*Every difficulty besides Very Easy

SNAKE

No laser sight?

THE BOSS

What?

SNAKE

A laser sight. I heard the military was developing them but...

THE BOSS

You want a laser sight?

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

A well-trained soldier has no use for a laser sight. No training-wheels on this mission Snake.

SNAKE

*disheartened* ...
(3)

THE BOSS

For the assault rifle and certain other weapons, pressing the Weapon Button will first ready the gun for shooting from the hip.

THE BOSS

If you're in a close-quarters fight or other situation that requires immediate action, fire from that position. Observe where your shots are hitting, and correct your aim accordingly.

SNAKE

I understand, but that doesn't sound too accurate.

THE BOSS

Of course not. So when you require pinpoint targeting, like when firing from afar or sniping, hold the Aim Button to aim.

THE BOSS

Carefully align your front and rear sights to concentrate fire and gain a sharper view on your target.
Aiming a gun (2)

THE BOSS

If you rapid-fire the assault rifle, the recoil of the gun will cause your shots to stray from their intended targets.

THE BOSS

Firing from a crouched position or while lying on your stomach will stabilize the recoil, and keep your hits more consistent.
Hanging from branches

THE BOSS

Even while hanging, you can fire your handgun with one arm. And if you are attacked during a hanging maneuver, don't panic and claim the advantage.
Stalking
(1)

THE BOSS

Stalking is a movement technique that eliminates even the sound of your footsteps.
(2)

THE BOSS

Stalking involves putting your weight on your rear foot, then stepping forward slowly with your front foot.

THE BOSS

Before putting down the front foot, use the tip of your foot to check for dangerous objects or branches that might create a noise when stepped upon.

THE BOSS

Once you've determined the spot is safe to step on, slowly lower your foot to the ground, placing it down from the outside edge first, and then slowly lowering your weight onto the foot.

THE BOSS

Throughout the entire process, you have to strain your calves to retain balance.

SNAKE

... (This sounds difficult.)
(3)

THE BOSS

But all you need to do is press the directional button in the direction you wish to move.

THE BOSS

When stalking, you can move without creating sound with your footsteps.

THE BOSS

And, since your posture is low while stalking, you are that much less likely to be spotted by the enemy.

THE BOSS

Since you move cautiously while stalking, you will be able to detect a trap on the ground before it is set off.

THE BOSS

However, the slow, concentrated movement while stalking consumes high amounts of stamina.

THE BOSS

Switch between walking and running with the left analog stick, and stalking with the directional buttons depending on the situation.
•Miscellaneous
One-man infiltration
(1)

THE BOSS

This is a solo sneaking mission. There's no one out there to support you.

THE BOSS

You'll need to be more than just a soldier. You'll have to be a medic, a pilot, and even a cook.
(2)

SNAKE

You don't need to remind me.

THE BOSS

I'm glad to hear that.

SNAKE

Glad to hear what?

THE BOSS

That you haven't changed a bit.

SNAKE

?

THE BOSS

The truth is, you're nervous, aren't you?

SNAKE

I'm not nervous.

THE BOSS

There's no need to be embarrassed. No one's ever attempted a mission like this before. In fact, you might say that getting nervous is the natural way to react.

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

Relax. That's why you have the Survival Viewer.
(3)

THE BOSS

The Survival Viewer contains everything you'll need to stay alive in the field.

THE BOSS

Use "CAMOUFLAGE" to change your camouflage, "BACKPACK" to select a weapon, "FOOD" to eat, and "CURE" to heal yourself.

THE BOSS

The "MAP" option lets you view the map.

THE BOSS

And the "OPTIONS" function lets you change the settings to suit your individual style.

THE BOSS

The Survival Viewer is going to be your best friend in this mission, so learn to make the most of it.
How to hide from the enemy

THE BOSS

Treetops, bushes, hollow logs... there are plenty of places in nature you can use to hide yourself.

THE BOSS

Search each area carefully in First Person View. Use nature to its fullest extent. You'll thank me later.
On-site procurement

THE BOSS

Equipment captured in the field often needs to be fixed or have its parts replaced before it can be used.

THE BOSS

But you won't need to worry about that in this mission.

SNAKE

Why's that?

THE BOSS

Because your adversaries are highly trained professionals. They'll no doubt have made sure their reserve gear is in working condition.

SNAKE

So in other words, I can use the stuff I pick up right away?

THE BOSS

Right. One more thing - when you pick up a new item, don't forget to read its description in the window.
Tape

THE BOSS

In the jungle, it's absolutely crucial to keep your position secret from the enemy.

THE BOSS

Sometimes even the smallest sound can be enough to give your position away and get you killed.

THE BOSS

You'll have to make sure your weapons and equipment don't make noise bumping around.

THE BOSS

Use tape to secure metal objects and other items that seem likely to produce noise.

THE BOSS

After you've secured your gear, jump up and down to see whether it makes a sound.

SNAKE

Don't worry. I remember the drill.
The will to live
(1)

THE BOSS

There is one weapon greater than any other in battle - do you know what that is?

SNAKE

Yeah. (The Boss taught him this before.)

THE BOSS

What?

SNAKE

*protests a little* Do we have to go through this again?

THE BOSS

Yes.

SNAKE

... Will. An unflinching will to survive no matter what.

THE BOSS

Exactly.
(2)

THE BOSS

The will to carry out your mission and return home alive will see you through even the most desperate of situations. It's the most potent weapon in your arsenal.

THE BOSS

Don't forget that. No matter what.
How to capture animals
(1)

THE BOSS

In order to capture an animal, you first need to know its habits.

THE BOSS

Their paths, their food, how fast they move, the times when they're active...

THE BOSS

If you don't have a grasp of these things, you won't be able to catch them.

THE BOSS

When you're hunting, first observe the animal you want to capture. If you do that, you'll surely be able to form a successful strategy.
(2)
*If player hasn't contacted Para-Medic yet

THE BOSS

Para-Medic has information on the flora and fauna available in the mission area. Ask her if you have any questions about the plants and animals you find.
(3)

THE BOSS

Para-Medic's frequency is 145.73.
The five senses
(1)

THE BOSS

If you want to survive in the jungle, you're going to need to hone all of your senses.

THE BOSS

An unnatural movement in the undergrowth, a tiny shadow peeking out through the trees in the distance - always keep an eye out for any signs of the enemy's presence.

THE BOSS

Your sense of hearing is equally important. Visibility is poor in the jungle, so you've got to learn to pick up the enemy's presence from the sounds you hear around you.

THE BOSS

Always be listening for that one snap of a twig among the chirping of the birds and the babbling of the brooks.
(2)

THE BOSS

Your sense of smell is also important. Body odor, sweat, gunpowder, food... these faint smells wafting in the wind will tell you where the enemy...

SNAKE

Uh, no.

THE BOSS

No?

SNAKE

I can't smell.

THE BOSS

You... what now?

SNAKE

I can't smell.

THE BOSS

Not at all?

SNAKE

Nope.

THE BOSS

Not even a little bit?

SNAKE

Not a thing.

THE BOSS

Oh... well, then, you'll just have to trust in your instincts as a gamer.
The advantage of working alone

THE BOSS

Tell me, what's the advantage of a solo sneaking mission?

SNAKE

It's easier to go in undetected than with a group.

THE BOSS

Exactly. And therein lies the entire reasoning behind this Virtuous Mission.

THE BOSS

This mission into Soviet territory is a violation of international law. If this gets out to the public, we'll be faced with an international crisis even greater than the one four years ago.

SNAKE

Four years ago... the U2 crash.

THE BOSS

Failure is not an option.

SNAKE

Not a problem. I'll get Sokolov out without them ever knowing I was here.
When you spot the enemy, don't lose your cool

THE BOSS

When you see an enemy, the first thing to do is conceal yourself and watch what he's doing.

THE BOSS

If you make any sudden moves, your Camo Index will decrease and there's a good chance the enemy will catch sight of you.

THE BOSS

And don't start to panic just because an enemy is acting like he knows you're there.

THE BOSS

It doesn't necessarily mean he's figured out exactly where you are.

THE BOSS

As long as you hide someplace like the bushes and stay perfectly still, you'll usually come out all right.

THE BOSS

Stay calm, keep a grip on the situation, and use clear judgment. Got it?
Recon is key

THE BOSS

Your ultimate objective in this mission is to find Sokolov and get him to safety, not to slaughter the enemy.

SNAKE

So basically I should avoid getting into battles, right? You don't have to tell me.

THE BOSS

To avoid battles, it will be essential to scout out the enemy's numbers and positions. That's what you binoculars are for.
The enemy's AKs
(1)

THE BOSS

You said the enemy is equipped with AK-47s, didn't you?

THE BOSS

The AK-47 is the official assault rifle of the Soviet army. It's employed not only by the Soviets, but throughout the entire Eastern bloc.

THE BOSS

It uses 7.62mm x 39 ammunitions, with a magazine capacity of 30 rounds.

THE BOSS

The AK is reliable, precise, powerful, and easy to handle - in short, one of the best assault rifles there is.
(2)

THE BOSS

Don't even think about getting into a one-man firefight against an enemy unit equipped with AKs. Avoid battle as much as possible. Are we clear?
The enemy's grenades

THE BOSS

You mentioned the enemy was also carrying grenades, correct?

THE BOSS

Those grenades are RGD-5s, the standard blast-fragmentation grenade of the Soviet army.

THE BOSS

You can protect yourself from a large part of the blast and shrapnel from a grenade by lying flat on the ground.

THE BOSS

If someone throws a grenade at you and you sense that you can't get away in time, get into a crawl position. It should reduce the damage to a minimum.
Retreat isn't an option

THE BOSS

If confronted with multiple enemies during a standard operating procedure, you'd retreat and call for backup. But that's not an option in this mission.

THE BOSS

If you encounter multiple enemies, either find a way to go around them... or, if it looks like you'll have to eliminate them, lure them over one at a time and take them out that way.
Use the element of surprise

THE BOSS

Your objective in this mission isn't to get into fights. But if you're faced with a situation where you have no choice but to get rid of an enemy, attack him from behind.

THE BOSS

If you use stalking to sneak up behind an enemy and take him out in one strike, the other enemies probably won't even notice.

THE BOSS

If it doesn't look like you'll be able to sneak up from behind, wait for him to come toward you.

THE BOSS

Either figure out the enemy's patrol route and get there before he does, or make a sound or throw something to get his attention.

THE BOSS

And if he does spot you, don't hesitate. Take him out before he has a chance to alert his comrades to your presence. Got it?
Attack patrols from the rear

THE BOSS

Enemies pose a greater threat when they patrol in squads.

THE BOSS

The members of a squad are constantly watching out for each other, making it difficult to take them out without being noticed.

THE BOSS

If you absolutely have to attack a squad, use CQC or a gun equipped with a suppressor and start with the last one in line, then work your way up.
If player has been spotted a lot

THE BOSS

What the hell have you been doing these past five years, anyway?

SNAKE

What's with you all of a sudden?

THE BOSS

It's like you've forgotten everything I taught you.

SNAKE

That's not true.

THE BOSS

Then why do you keep getting spotted?

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

You keep getting spotted because your camouflage isn't effective enough and because you're not being careful enough.

THE BOSS

Pay attention to your Camouflage Index, watch how the enemy moves, and proceed one step at a time. Is that clear?

SNAKE

...

THE BOSS

Is that clear!?

SNAKE

Okay...
Paranormal phenomenon
*After the abandoned factory, contact with The Boss is lost, but the player can still get through if they try to call her

SNAKE

*finally gets through* Boss!?
The player can hear The Sorrow muttering "Sad... So sad..." intermittently.
The call abruptly ends.

SNAKE

???
•Controls Explanations
Stamina

PARA-MEDIC

The gauge below your Life Gauge is your Stamina Gauge.

PARA-MEDIC

It shows, as the name suggests, your remaining stamina.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

As you consume stamina, your natural LIFE regeneration is slowed, and your hands shake more. Your O2 Gauge and Grip Gauge also become shorter.

PARA-MEDIC

Excessively low stamina can often impede your mission objectives.

PARA-MEDIC

Make sure you replenish stamina before that occurs.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Eat food to recover stamina.

PARA-MEDIC

Capture plants and animals to get food.

PARA-MEDIC

I have information on the local plants and animals, so don't hesitate to ask.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

My frequency is 145.73.
How to eat food

PARA-MEDIC

To eat food, press the Menu Button to enter the Survival Viewer, then select "FOOD."

PARA-MEDIC

Select the food you want to eat, and press the Enter Button.

PARA-MEDIC

Select "EAT" and you will eat the selected food.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

When you eat, you will recover your stamina, but the extent of recovery depends on what you eat.

PARA-MEDIC

When your stamina is down only slightly, you should save your tastier morsels for later.

PARA-MEDIC

But don't leave food for too long, or it'll rot. This is where a little planning ahead goes a long way.
How food goes bad
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Any food you catch will gradually spoil over time, even if you store it in your backpack.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Some types of food spoil faster than others.

PARA-MEDIC

Animal and fish meat goes bad relatively fast, but plants and mushrooms generally last a little longer.

PARA-MEDIC

Animals won't go bad if you capture them alive, though.

PARA-MEDIC

You can tell whether food has gone bad or not by looking closely at the icon on the "FOOD" screen in the Survival Viewer.

PARA-MEDIC

So be sure to check the icon before you eat the food.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

If you eat spoiled food, you'll get sick and end up with a stomach ache.

PARA-MEDIC

It'll get better eventually if you leave it alone, but that means you throw up and lose a lot of stamina.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get a stomach ache, go to "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and take some digestive medicine.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Digestive medicine and antidotes aren't the only ways to cure stomach aches and food poisoning. You can also induce vomiting.

PARA-MEDIC

Go into the Survival Viewer and press the Viewer Button to enter Viewer Mode.

PARA-MEDIC

Then rotate the right analog stick to spin your body around and eventually you'll start feeling queasy.

PARA-MEDIC

When you get dizzy enough, exit the Survival Viewer and you'll throw up. That should get rid of any stomach ache and food poisoning you have. Give it a try.
Capturing food alive and dead flesh

PARA-MEDIC

You can capture animals alive by using the tranquilizer gun or a mousetrap.

PARA-MEDIC

When you capture a live animal, you can carry it on you as a weapon by going to "BACKPACK" in the Survival Viewer.

PARA-MEDIC

Once an animal is on your person, equip it and press the Weapon button to throw it.

PARA-MEDIC

Throwing a venomous animal at an enemy might be enough to knock him out.

PARA-MEDIC

Even non-venomous animals like frogs can be used to distract the enemy's attention.

PARA-MEDIC

And since I know you're going to ask me, yes, keeping animals alive prevents them from rotting and makes them taste better when you eat them.

PARA-MEDIC

Remember, though, you've only got three cages for capturing live animals.
Save breaks

PARA-MEDIC

To take a rest, all you have to do is save and exit the game.

PARA-MEDIC

The next time you load your save data and continue the game, your stamina and LIFE will have recovered.

PARA-MEDIC

How much they recover depends on how long of a rest you take.

SNAKE

So the longer I rest, the more I'll recover?

PARA-MEDIC

That's right.

PARA-MEDIC

If you're so exhausted that you don't even have the strength to find food, save the game and take a rest and you'll be back on your feet.

SNAKE

I hope that never happens.

PARA-MEDIC

So do I. But you never know. Just don't forget okay?

SNAKE

I won't.
Cure items

PARA-MEDIC

Treating serious wounds will require you to use additional medical items besides your knife and cigar.

PARA-MEDIC

That's why it's always a good idea to carry as many medical items with you as possible.

PARA-MEDIC

If you start to run out of medical items, find some more as soon as you can.

PARA-MEDIC

The enemy should be carrying medical supplies as well. You can get them by holding up enemy soldiers and shaking down their bodies.
LIFE recovery

PARA-MEDIC

When you get hurt, your body will heal itself naturally over time.

PARA-MEDIC

However, the speed at which your LIFE recovers depends on how much stamina you have at the time.

PARA-MEDIC

The more stamina you have, the faster you'll recover. So if you want your wounds to heal quickly, you should eat something and replenish your stamina first.
LIFE recovery (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

*tense* Snake, your LIFE will naturally recover even if you're wounded.

PARA-MEDIC

But how fast it recovers depends on how much stamina you have. If your stamina is low, your LIFE will recover more slowly.

PARA-MEDIC

If you want your wounds to heal, you should eat something first and replenish your stamina.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You can make your LIFE recover faster by staying in a crouching or lying position.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get injured, find someplace where you're safe from enemy attacks and let your LIFE recover! OK?
How to treat serious injuries

PARA-MEDIC

When you have a serious injury, like a gunshot wound or a burn, your maximum LIFE will decrease.

PARA-MEDIC

So if you're seriously hurt, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and use "CURE" to treat it.
General advice on serious injuries (1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, be careful when you approach the enemy.

PARA-MEDIC

The closer you are to them, the more accurate their shots will be, and the more damage their weapons will do.

PARA-MEDIC

That means you've got a greater chance of getting seriously wounded.

PARA-MEDIC

Daring frontal assaults are not a good idea.

PARA-MEDIC

But if you do get seriously injured, go into the Survival Viewer and treat it immediately.
General advice on serious injuries (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you run a higher risk of getting seriously injured if you're hit by an attack at close range. If you're engaging in proximity combat, use caution!

PARA-MEDIC

If you get seriously injured, go into the Survival Viewer and treat it right away!
Stamina advice (1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, keep an eye on your stamina gauge.

PARA-MEDIC

When you run low on stamina, you won't be able to fight at full strength. You'll recover less LIFE and your aim won't be as steady.

PARA-MEDIC

Don't let that happen to you. Use the "FOOD" option in the Survival Viewer to eat some food and replenish your stamina.
•Snakes
Reticulated python
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is home to the Reticulated Python.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught yourself a Reticulated Python.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Reticulated Python is said to be the longest snake in the world. The biggest ones can grow up to 10 meters in length.

PARA-MEDIC

Although they're not poisonous, they're still very dangerous, so be careful around them.

PARA-MEDIC

They have a highly ferocious temperament, and they can swallow whole even large animals like deer and pigs.

PARA-MEDIC

Their most distinguishing feature is the mesh pattern of their scales. This pattern acts as a highly effective natural camouflage.

PARA-MEDIC

If you think there might be a Reticulated Python about, pay close attention to your surroundings. Otherwise you could get bitten before you even know it's there.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

It's a huge snake, but you should be able to capture it alive by using the tranquilizer gun. I'll bet if you capture one and throw it at an enemy, it'll give him a good scare.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Right. But - how do they taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

Do they taste good?

PARA-MEDIC

You're actually going to eat one? (I knew it)

SNAKE

Why else would I be asking?

PARA-MEDIC

*whispers* Cannibal.

SNAKE

What was that?

PARA-MEDIC

Nothing. Let's see what the guide says... Ah, you're in luck. It says they taste pretty good.

SNAKE

Good. I can hardly wait.

PARA-MEDIC

...
(6) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

You've eaten one, haven't you?

SNAKE

Yeah. It wasn't half bad.

PARA-MEDIC

*whispers* Cannibal.

SNAKE

What was that?

PARA-MEDIC

Nothing. Talk to you later.
(7)

PARA-MEDIC

The reticulated python is said to be the longest snake in the world. It's not venomous, but it still poses a threat, so watch out.
Giant anaconda
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by the Giant Anaconda.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've captured a Giant Anaconda.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Giant Anaconda is believed to be the largest snake in the world in terms of weight and diameter.

PARA-MEDIC

It's not poisonous, but its large size makes it extremely powerful. They say it even eats crocodiles. Its only natural predator is man.

SNAKE

And snake.

PARA-MEDIC

... And snake.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The Giant Anaconda is a very large snake, but you should be able to capture it alive using the tranquilizer gun.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Got it. So how does it taste?

PARA-MEDIC

I knew you were going to ask me that.

SNAKE

Glad I didn't disappoint you. So?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, the guide says it tastes all right...

SNAKE

Good. I'll have to try some.

PARA-MEDIC

...
(6) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

The taste is... oh, you've already eaten one.

SNAKE

Yeah. It was delicious.

PARA-MEDIC

*stunned* ...

SNAKE

No, really. It tastes like chicken, with a surprisingly light flavor. Maybe a little bit stringier than chicken, but all in all, I'd say... (Was about to say that too was delicious before he got interrupted.)

PARA-MEDIC

Uh, Snake...

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

I don't really care. (She doesn't want to hear about snake meat.)

SNAKE

Oh, OK.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. Talk to you later.
(7)

PARA-MEDIC

The Giant Anaconda is said to be the largest snake in the world in terms of weight and thickness.

PARA-MEDIC

It's not venomous, but its huge size makes it dangerous. Be careful.
Thai cobra
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is home to the Thai cobra.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a Thai cobra.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Thai cobra is a large venomous snake that carries an extremely potent neurotoxin. Be careful not to get bitten.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you do get bitten, go into the Survival Viewer right away and use "CURE" to give yourself a serum injection.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

The Thai cobra originally comes from Indochina, Thailand, and southern China.

PARA-MEDIC

The ones in that area were probably imported as pets and research subjects before they escaped and turned feral.

SNAKE

Not as food?

PARA-MEDIC

Come again?

SNAKE

They weren't imported as food?

PARA-MEDIC

They're NOT for eating.
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

Why not? They taste pretty good.

PARA-MEDIC

...
(7) *Before eating

SNAKE

*disappointed* So they don't taste good then.

PARA-MEDIC

That's not my point. It's not a matter of whether they taste good or not. People don't raise snakes for food, period.

SNAKE

OK... so, you're saying they might be good to eat, right?

PARA-MEDIC

... Only one way to find out.
Taiwanese cobra
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is inhabited by the Taiwanese cobra.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught yourself a Taiwanese cobra.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Taiwanese cobra is native to Taiwan and southern China. It's quite vicious, and carries a potent neurotoxin in its fangs. Be careful.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If it bites you, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and use the "CURE" option to inject yourself with serum.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Sounds interesting...

PARA-MEDIC

Don't ask me.

SNAKE

Huh?

PARA-MEDIC

The guide doesn't say. If you absolutely have to know, then you'll just have to try it yourself and see.

SNAKE

I didn't say anything.

PARA-MEDIC

But you were going to ask, weren't you? About the taste?

SNAKE

... Maybe.

PARA-MEDIC

I'll talk to you later, Snake.
Green tree python
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by the green tree python.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught yourself a green tree python.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The green tree python isn't venomous, so no need to worry. It's fairly docile, too, so I don't think it's likely to attack you.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The green tree python originally comes from Australia and New Zealand. It's a really pretty green color, and it lives... Oh my God...

SNAKE

What's wrong?

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, what did I just say?

SNAKE

They come from Australia and New Zealand?

PARA-MEDIC

No, after that.

SNAKE

They're a really pretty green color.

PARA-MEDIC

I thought so. What was I thinking? Seeing a snake and calling it "pretty"...

SNAKE

What's wrong with that?

PARA-MEDIC

Everything! When a normal woman sees a snake, she's supposed to scream or get sick or something like that.

SNAKE

*hushed voice* And you think you're normal?

PARA-MEDIC

What was that!?

SNAKE

Nothing.

PARA-MEDIC

Ooh, it's all your fault!!
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Geez, I'm sorry. But enough of that...

PARA-MEDIC

What do you mean, enough of that? This is serious!

SNAKE

No, I... I just wanted you to tell me how it tastes.

PARA-MEDIC

How should I know!?

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

*whispers* ... It was awfully pretty, though...
Coral snake
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, be careful, that area is inhabited by coral snakes.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Wow, you caught a coral snake?
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The coral snake is a venomous snake that originally hails from the Americas. Its venom is a very potent neurotoxin, so don't let it bite you.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you do get bitten, go into the Survival Viewer right away and use "CURE" to neutralize the poison with a serum injection.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

The colorful red and black patterns on the coral snake are a warning sign.

PARA-MEDIC

Apparently, the bright, flashy colors and pattern let other animals know that it carries a deadly poison. That keeps them from attacking.

PARA-MEDIC

There are many animals that mimic the colors of known poisonous animals as a defense.

PARA-MEDIC

See, by mimicking other poisonous creatures, they increase their chances of survival.

PARA-MEDIC

There is another non-poisonous snake called the milk snake that borrows its coloring from the coral snake.

SNAKE

*completely uninterested* Uh huh...

PARA-MEDIC

You're not even listening, are you?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

*sigh of resignation* ...
(6) *Before eating

PARA-MEDIC

OK, we'll talk about something you are interested in, then.

SNAKE

The taste!?

PARA-MEDIC

Yes.

PARA-MEDIC

It says here... that coral snakes are pretty good, in a snaky kind of way.

SNAKE

A snaky kind of way, huh...
Milk snake
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is inhabited by the milk snake.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a cor... I mean, a milk snake.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The milk snake closely resembles the coral snake, but it's actually not venomous.

PARA-MEDIC

Even so, you'll still take damage if it bites you, so don't get too close.
(4)

SNAKE

Hmm. So is there a way to tell the difference between a milk snake and a coral snake?

PARA-MEDIC

It's pretty difficult. They really do look almost exactly alike.

PARA-MEDIC

I guess if I had to pick something, I'd say it's that the milk snake is much less aggressive.

SNAKE

OK...

PARA-MEDIC

Ah, I just thought of a better way. You're going to love this.

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

Eat it.

SNAKE

Eat it?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. The guide says milk snakes don't taste very good.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Is that right...?
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

Yeah, I know.
(7)

SNAKE

But if I've already caught and eaten it, what does it matter which kind of snake it was?

PARA-MEDIC

... It doesn't, does it? Shoot, I thought I had a good idea...

SNAKE

...
King cobra
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, king cobras are making their home in the area you're in now.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a king cobra.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The king cobra is the world's largest venomous snake. Its large size means that it has a lot of venom to inject. One bite is supposedly enough to kill an elephant.

PARA-MEDIC

And it's extremely vicious as well, so watch out.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you get bitten by a king cobra and injected with venom, your LIFE will start to decrease rapidly.

PARA-MEDIC

As soon as you're bitten, go into the Survival Viewer and use "CURE" to give yourself a serum injection.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

The king cobra's diet consists mostly of other snakes. Be careful or you might end up as its next meal.
(6)

SNAKE

Got it. So...?

PARA-MEDIC

What -- How does it taste?

SNAKE

Yep.

PARA-MEDIC

*stunned* It seems you're the one whose diet consists of other snakes.

SNAKE

You're making me blush.

PARA-MEDIC

... The guide says they taste just fine.

SNAKE

*happy* Mmm.

PARA-MEDIC

...
Tsuchinoko
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, there's supposed to be a tsuchinoko in that area.
(2)

SNAKE

Tsuchinoko?

PARA-MEDIC

You've never heard of it? It's a mysterious snake that's found all over Japan.

SNAKE

If it lives all over Japan, then why is it so mysterious?

PARA-MEDIC

Many people have seen them, but no one's ever caught one.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

If you do manage to catch one, it'll be a major historic discovery. I think you should look for it!
(4)

SNAKE

If I have time. So what kind of snake is this "tsuchinoko"?

PARA-MEDIC

The body is about as thick as a beer bottle, and the tail tapers off to a point.

PARA-MEDIC

It doesn't slither around like other snakes, but rather goes in a straight line like an inchworm. Sometimes it even jumps several yards at a time.

PARA-MEDIC

It's got sinister looking eyes, and it can even blink and move its eyes around.

PARA-MEDIC

It's also been known to snore, cry, and stand up straight on its tail.

SNAKE

And this is an actual snake?

PARA-MEDIC

Of course.

SNAKE

Uh huh. Then how come you seem to know so much about them? Is it in that guide of yours?

PARA-MEDIC

No.

SNAKE

Then maybe you saw it in a movie, like "Curse of the 50-Foot Tsuchinoko" or something.

PARA-MEDIC

There's no such movie. I heard about it from Sigint.

SNAKE

Sigint?

PARA-MEDIC

He's an expert on UMAs.

SNAKE

UMAs?

PARA-MEDIC

Unidentified Mysterious Animals, dummy.

SNAKE

Oh, excuse my ignorance... Why does he know so much about them?

PARA-MEDIC

Probably because he likes them. At the CIA, he was the vice president of an unofficial group called the "UMA Watcher Club."

SNAKE

The UMA Watcher Club?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. Just the other day he was working on the newsletter at his desk.

SNAKE

At the office? How does he get away with that...?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, the Major is the chairman of the club.

SNAKE

... (What a bunch of weirdos.)
(5) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you caught a tsuchinoko!

ZERO

What!?

SIGINT

Is it true, Snake!?

SNAKE

Yeah...

SIGINT

Way to go, my man! You really are The Boss' apprentice!

ZERO

Yes. It looks like sending you in was worth it after all!

ZERO

Hurry up and finish your mission and then bring it back to us. Under no circumstances are you to eat it. Is that clear?

SNAKE

... (You're all crazy.)
•Birds
Magpie
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by Magpies.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've captured a Magpie.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Magpies are members of the crow family. They're distinguishable by their beautiful dark blue and white bodies and their long tails.

PARA-MEDIC

Their favorite food is insects, but they'll also eat small fish, acorns, and fruit. They're omnivores, which means...

SNAKE

They'll eat anything.

PARA-MEDIC

Right. Just like you, huh.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you use the tranquilizer gun, you should be able to capture Magpies alive.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Okay. So, how do they taste?

PARA-MEDIC

You always ask me that.

SNAKE

Naturally. So?

PARA-MEDIC

... I've never heard of anybody actually eating a Magpie, but I suppose there's no reason you couldn't.

SNAKE

*happy* You don't say.

PARA-MEDIC

...
(6) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

They taste... well, you should know, since you've already eaten one.

SNAKE

It didn't taste all that great.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, what a shame.

SNAKE

Yeah, no kidding.

PARA-MEDIC

Um, Snake...

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

I was being sarcastic.

SNAKE

Oh, really? I didn't notice.

PARA-MEDIC

...
(7)

PARA-MEDIC

Magpies are dark blue and white birds with long tails that belong to the crow family. You should be able to capture them alive using the tranquilizer gun.
Red Avadavat
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is home to a small bird called the Red Avadavat.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught yourself a Red Avadavat.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Red Avadavat is a small bird native to Southern China and Southeast Asia.

PARA-MEDIC

This is its mating season, so the males ought to be a brilliant red color right now.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you want to catch one alive, use the tranquilizer gun. By catching one and then releasing it, you might be able to distract the enemy's attention.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

I see. How do they taste?

PARA-MEDIC

*surprised* Er... what?

SNAKE

The flavor.

PARA-MEDIC

You... you're not going to eat such a cute little bird, are you?

SNAKE

Yeah. (It'd be stupid not to.)

PARA-MEDIC

...

SNAKE

Something bothering you?

PARA-MEDIC

No.

SNAKE

OK, then. So? How about it?

PARA-MEDIC

How should I know?
(6) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

And they taste... you've eaten one already, haven't you?

SNAKE

*disappointed* Yep. But it didn't taste very good.

PARA-MEDIC

*sarcastic* Oh, that's good.

SNAKE

What's so good about it? It tasted terrible.

PARA-MEDIC

*whispers* No sense of irony whatsoever.

SNAKE

What's that?

PARA-MEDIC

Nothing. Talk to you later.
Sunda Whistling-Thrush
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is home to the Sunda Whistling-Thrush.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught yourself a Sunda Whistling-Thrush.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Sunda Whistling-Thrush is a bird native to Java and Sumatra.

PARA-MEDIC

It's distinguished by its large blue body and long beak. It really stands out in the forest.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

If you're aiming to catch one alive, use the tranquilizer gun.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Got it. So?

PARA-MEDIC

How does it taste?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

I dunno.

SNAKE

You don't know?

PARA-MEDIC

The guide doesn't say. I guess there's no reason you couldn't eat them.

SNAKE

*disappointed* Oh, I see...

PARA-MEDIC

*sarcastic* But it's nice and plump, so I'm sure it'd make a hearty meal.

SNAKE

*happy* That's a good point!

PARA-MEDIC

...
(6) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

It tastes... oh, you've already eaten one.

SNAKE

Yeah. I wouldn't call it a delicacy, but it certainly was filling.

PARA-MEDIC

...
Parrot
(1) *Before capturing

SNAKE

Para-Medic, I saw a parrot just a minute ago...
(2) *After capturing

SNAKE

Para-Medic, I caught a parrot...
(3) *Before eating

PARA-MEDIC

What kind of parrot?

SNAKE

It's green all over, with a large beak.

PARA-MEDIC

Then it's probably an Alexandrine Parakeet. It's sometimes also called the Alexandrine parrot.

PARA-MEDIC

The Alexandrine Parakeet originally comes from Indochina, and is distinguished by its green body and red beak. It's very talkative and makes a good pet.

PARA-MEDIC

But it's strange. The guide doesn't say anything about there being Alexandrine Parakeets in that area.

PARA-MEDIC

I'm thinking it must be someone's pet that got away. (It's The End's pet.)

SNAKE

Hmm...

PARA-MEDIC

SNAKE!!

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

Don't EVEN think about it! Eating a cute little bird like that...

SNAKE

But I didn't say (anything)...

PARA-MEDIC

Just don't!

SNAKE

...
White-rumped vulture
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

There should be white-rumped vultures living in that area.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've captured a white-rumped vulture.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The white-rumped vulture is a type of vulture found in India. Its diet consists mostly of dead animal carcasses.

PARA-MEDIC

I don't think it'll attack you, but it's a fairly large bird of prey, so you probably won't be able to capture it alive using the tranquilizer gun.
(4)

SNAKE

Got it.

PARA-MEDIC

But there is something here that's bothering me...

SNAKE

What is it?

PARA-MEDIC

They say the white-rumped vulture doesn't just eat animal carcasses. It eats human ones as well.

SNAKE

Is that so?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

So, then, if a person eats a white-rumped vulture, does that mean he's eating human meat, too?

SNAKE

... (That's an unsettling question.)

PARA-MEDIC

What do you think?
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Stop it already. You're going to make me lose my appetite.
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

You had to tell me that after I ate one.
•Frogs
Tree frog
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area should be inhabited by Tree Frogs.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a Tree Frog.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Tree Frog is a green frog that's found throughout Asia.

PARA-MEDIC

It's arboreal, spending most of its time in shrubs and bushes.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Use the tranquilizer gun to catch one alive. I bet you could scare an enemy good if you toss one at him.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

But the tree frogs that live in that jungle are a lot bigger than ordinary tree frogs.

SNAKE

They've got an appetite, huh? (It looks delicious.)

PARA-MEDIC

You've got a one-track mind, don't you?

PARA-MEDIC

But seriously, that is one theory. However, there are people who think it's a mutation caused by nuclear testing and waste from the research facility.
(6) *Before eating

SNAKE

Do you think they're safe to eat?
(7) *After eating

SNAKE

Yeah, I ate one. But it didn't taste that great.
(8)

PARA-MEDIC

Is that all you ever think about? (She figured he'd take the conversation in that direction.)

SNAKE

What else is there? (What else is there to say about a giant frog?)

PARA-MEDIC

Lots.

SNAKE

Like what?

PARA-MEDIC

Like why a frog would get so big in the first place.

PARA-MEDIC

Whether it's a temporary phenomenon created by a unique environment, or a permanent mark of evolution, or a product of the toxic waste coming out of the research facility.

PARA-MEDIC

If it is the waste that's causing it, then it means humans are interfering with the ecosystem. It really makes you think about the changing relationship between... (She was about to say "between man and nature" before he interrupted.)

SNAKE

This isn't interesting.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh fine, be that way...
(9) *Before eating

SNAKE

So? How about it?

PARA-MEDIC

You mean is it edible?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

Hmm. I guess it's probably OK...

SNAKE

Probably?

PARA-MEDIC

I don't know. The guide doesn't say anything.

SNAKE

Pretty useless guide if you ask me.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, try one for dinner and you can help improve it.
Otton frog
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that's the home to the Otton frog.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught an Otton frog.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Otton frog is a large, corpulent species of frog. They're known as a delicacy, so it might be worth catching them for food.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The Otton frog was originally found only on Amami Oshima in Japan.

PARA-MEDIC

Frogs usually have four toes on their front legs, but the Otton frog is unique in that it has five.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Got it. By the way, you said they were known as a delicacy, right?

PARA-MEDIC

Right.

SNAKE

So that means they must taste pretty good, huh?

PARA-MEDIC

I guess so.
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

I tried one, and it was pretty tasty. I can see why it's a delicacy.

PARA-MEDIC

Glad to hear it.
(7)

PARA-MEDIC

I hear that in Japan, Otton frog sashimi and sukiyaki are popular dishes.

SNAKE

Really?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. (She really thinks this.)

SNAKE

Japan, huh... that place is starting to sound better and better (He believes her.)
Poison dart frog
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by the poison dart frog.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've captured a poison dart frog.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The poison dart frog is native to the tropical rain forests of Central and South America.

PARA-MEDIC

They normally grow between two and five centimeters in length, but for some reason the ones in that area seem to be much bigger than that.

PARA-MEDIC

Poison dart frogs are known to carry a potent neurotoxin called pumiliotoxin.

PARA-MEDIC

Long ago, people used the poison to coat their arrows for hunting. Watch out because if you eat one, you'll get food poisoning.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

... Yeah, I know.

PARA-MEDIC

How?

SNAKE

You really want to hear?

PARA-MEDIC

*Realizes he's saying this because he's already eaten one* Never mind, I got it.
•Fish
Bigeye trevally
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is home to the bigeye trevally.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught yourself a bigeye trevally.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The bigeye trevally is a type of mackerel. The adult fish lives around coral reefs, but the young can be found in fresh water areas such as estuaries and rivers.
(4) *Before eating

SNAKE

Good to know. So, how do they taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Hmm, the guidebook doesn't say.

SNAKE

Huh... well, if they're a kind of mackerel, they should be okay to eat, right?

PARA-MEDIC

You'd think so, but...

SNAKE

But what?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, I've heard stories about people getting ciguatera poisoning after eating the adult fish.

SNAKE

Ciguatera poisoning?

PARA-MEDIC

Uh huh. Fishes that live near coral reefs are sometimes contaminated with a poison known as ciguatera toxin.

PARA-MEDIC

It apparently gives you food poisoning when you eat it.

SNAKE

So I can't eat those bigeye trevally?

PARA-MEDIC

I don't know whether those trevally are contaminated with ciguatera or not, but use caution just in case. (They aren't actually poisonous.)
Maroon shark
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, it says here you can catch maroon sharks in that area.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught yourself a maroon shark.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The maroon shark is found mostly in Southeast Asia. But it's not actually a shark - it's related to the carp.

PARA-MEDIC

It's also known as the red finned cigar shark, the river barb, and the sultan fish.
(4) *Before eating

SNAKE

Interesting. So, how does it taste?

PARA-MEDIC

According to the guide... it's good. But it's kind of oily and has a lot of little bones.

SNAKE

Fine with me. I never worry about the little things.

PARA-MEDIC

So I gathered.
(5) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

The taste is,.. well, you've already eaten one, right?

SNAKE

Yeah. It was pretty good.

PARA-MEDIC

That's all?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

You didn't mind all the little bones or how oily it was?

SNAKE

Not really.

PARA-MEDIC

...
Arowana
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that river is inhabited by arowanas.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught yourself an arowana.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The arowana is an ancient fish that lives in tropical freshwater areas. Because of its large size, I don't think you'll be able to capture one alive.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Ancient fish like the arowana are living fossils. They've hardly changed their forms since the Devonian and Jurassic periods.

PARA-MEDIC

Other ancient fish besides the arowana include the coelacanth, the starlet, and the knifefish.

PARA-MEDIC

Almost all organisms on earth have evolved in various shapes and forms, but these fish have kept the same form for hundreds of millions of years. Baffling, isn't it?

SNAKE

*uninterested* Sure.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, I can see you're not interested.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Not at all. I'm fascinated by ancient fish.

PARA-MEDIC

Why?

SNAKE

They're supposed to be huge, aren't they?

PARA-MEDIC

You're wondering whether they'd make a good meal.

SNAKE

Yeah. So? Do they?

PARA-MEDIC

The guide says they taste just fine for a fish.

SNAKE

Great!
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

Not at all. I love ancient fish.

PARA-MEDIC

Why?

SNAKE

They taste pretty good.

PARA-MEDIC

...
•Miscellaneous Animals
Indian gavial
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

That area is inhabited by Indian Gavials.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've captured an Indian Gavial.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Indian Gavial is a large crocodile native to India and Nepal. It's extremely aggressive, so watch out.

PARA-MEDIC

It's got a tough hide, so you'll have a hard time catching one. Capturing them alive is probably out of the question.
Hornets' nest
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you will encounter Baltic Hornets' nests in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've got yourself a Baltic Hornets' nest.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Baltic Hornets are a variety of hornets that inhabit that area. The difference between them and other hornets is that they produce honey in their nests.

PARA-MEDIC

Inside the nest are larva, pupa, and adults - you can eat them all.

PARA-MEDIC

In particular, the honey you find inside the nest is delicious and full of nutrients. It's easy to digest and helps pep you up when you're feeling tired. In short, it's the perfect survival food.

PARA-MEDIC

Honey can also be used as a burn ointment. When honey is applied to a burn, it creates a protective coating over the skin.

PARA-MEDIC

When you knock down a hornets' nest, a burn ointment will appear along with it, so don't forget to pick it up.

PARA-MEDIC

Of course, the hornets aren't going to give up their nest without a fight. If you knock a nest down, a large swarm of hornets will come flying out, so be careful.
Rat
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, there are rats living in that area.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught yourself a rat.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The rats in that area are the descendants of wild Norway rats that were domesticated by humans as pets and lab animals.

PARA-MEDIC

They're not poisonous, and I don't think they'll attack you. But they're quick little creatures, so you might have a hard time catching one.
(4) *Before eating

SNAKE

Uh huh. So, how do they taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Snake...

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

They're rats. (You're really going to eat that?)

SNAKE

I know what they are. Do they taste OK?

PARA-MEDIC

*stunned* ... The guide says they're not that bad.

SNAKE

Good enough for me.

PARA-MEDIC

...

(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by markhors.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught a markhor.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The markhor is a kind of wild goat that lives in mountainous areas.

PARA-MEDIC

It's quite large, so I don't think you'll be able to capture one alive, even with the tranquilizer gun.
(4)

SNAKE

All right.

PARA-MEDIC

Speaking of which, do you know the origin of the name "markhor"?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

It means "snake eater" in Persian.

SNAKE

"Snake Eater"...

PARA-MEDIC

Lost your appetite?

SNAKE

Not at all.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

PARA-MEDIC

SNAKE
