(6) *After eating

SNAKE

It tasted pretty good. I think I'll have it again sometime.

PARA-MEDIC

...
Japanese flying squirrel
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by the Japanese flying squirrel.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you caught yourself a Japanese flying squirrel.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Japanese flying squirrels are non-venomous, and they shouldn't attack you.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The head, front legs, hind legs, and tail of the Japanese flying squirrel are connected by a membrane of skin, which allows the squirrel to glide from tree to tree.

PARA-MEDIC

It says here that if it catches a good wind, it can fly more than 100 yards.
(5) *Before capturing, before eating

SNAKE

Sounds like it's going to be tough to catch one.
(6) *After capturing, before eating

SNAKE

Yeah. I had a hard time catching one.
(7) *Before eating

PARA-MEDIC

So aren't you going to ask me...

SNAKE

You know it. How does it taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Not sure.

SNAKE

Not sure?

PARA-MEDIC

The guide doesn't say anything about it.

SNAKE

Why not?

PARA-MEDIC

Gee, maybe it's because no one would ever think of eating a flying squirrel.

SNAKE

*happy* Then I must be the first one.

PARA-MEDIC

*stunned* Maybe you are.
(8) *After eating

SNAKE

For all the trouble it took to catch one, it wasn't that good.

PARA-MEDIC

*hushed voice* If only you were so enthusiastic about the mission...

SNAKE

What was that?

PARA-MEDIC

I didn't say anything. So long, Snake.
European rabbit
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is inhabited by European rabbits.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a European rabbit.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The European rabbit is said to have come from the Mediterranean region originally. But nowadays they're found all over the world.

PARA-MEDIC

They've been used since ancient times as a source of food, so it might be worth catching them.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Rabbits are known to eat their own excrement.

SNAKE

They eat their own...?

PARA-MEDIC

That's right. It's called caecal feces. When the rabbit eats fiber, the fiber is fermented in the rabbit's appendix, or caecum, and turned into a nutritious substance full of vitamins.

PARA-MEDIC

The rabbit excretes this substance and then eats it again to absorb the nutrients.

SNAKE

That's a neat trick. I think I'll give it a try.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake! Rabbits and humans don't work the... (Same!)

SNAKE

I'm just kidding. You really thought I was going to eat it?

PARA-MEDIC

... A little, yeah.

SNAKE

Even I wouldn't do that.

PARA-MEDIC

I guess not.

SNAKE

But how do those caecel feces taste?

PARA-MEDIC

What!?

SNAKE

Just kidding. (He actually wasn't.)

PARA-MEDIC

...
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

It seems the rabbits in that area have some kind of natural resistance to poison inherent in their system. If you capture one, you should be able to get some serum out of it. Try to capture a few.
Kenyan mangrove crab
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, that area is home to the Kenyan mangrove crabs.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught yourself a Kenyan mangrove crab.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Kenyan mangrove crab is a land-going crab. It lives in burrows dug near seashores and mangrove swamps.

PARA-MEDIC

It's not poisonous, but it might hurt a little if it attacks you with its pincers. Treat it with caution.
(4) *Before eating

SNAKE

Got it. So this thing must taste pretty good, huh?

PARA-MEDIC

Why do you say "must"?

SNAKE

It's a crab, isn't it?

PARA-MEDIC

It is.

SNAKE

And crabs are good to eat.

PARA-MEDIC

What's so good about them?

SNAKE

*a little surprised* You don't like crab?

PARA-MEDIC

Not at all.

SNAKE

Why not?

PARA-MEDIC

Why? How can you eat those things? They've all purple and yellow striped, and they stink like cat pee... (Doesn't realize she clearly isn't describing a crab.)

SNAKE

...? (I'm pretty sure that isn't a crab you're describing?)

PARA-MEDIC

But that's just my opinion, don't listen to me. (Her mind is made up.)

PARA-MEDIC

Let's see here. The guide says... no way. It says they're delicious.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, if you want to eat one, then you go right ahead. But count me out.

SNAKE

...
Vampire bat
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, be careful. That cave is inhabited by vampire bats.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a vampire bat.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The vampire bat bites its victims and sucks their blood.
(4)

SNAKE

Got it.

PARA-MEDIC

Speaking of bats...

SNAKE

Just save it.

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

I know you're just going to talk about vampire movies. "Attack of the Vampire Doughnuts" or "Dracula Versus the Space Hippos" or something like that... (No such movies exist.)

PARA-MEDIC

Actually, I was going to say that bats are known to use supersonic waves to sense their surroundings.

SNAKE

Oh.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

Bats use supersonic waves to sense their surroundings. So you might be able to keep them away by blasting them with a special kind of sound wave.
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

Alternatively, you could try equipping a torch and waving it around with the CQC Button.
(7) *Before eating

PARA-MEDIC

As for taste... I suppose there's no reason you couldn't eat them.
(8)

SNAKE

Hmm...

PARA-MEDIC

*out of the blue* Snake, do you hate vampire movies?

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

Just now you sounded like you really hated them.

SNAKE

I did?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah.

SNAKE

Oh. Well, no one really likes them, do they?

PARA-MEDIC

Some people do.

SNAKE

Like you?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. They're fascinating, you know? Like the movie "Dra..."

SNAKE

Don't say it.

PARA-MEDIC

Why not?

SNAKE

Just don't.

PARA-MEDIC

Are you afraid?

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

You're afraid of vampires, aren't you?

SNAKE

Don't be ridiculous.

PARA-MEDIC

But...

SNAKE

Listen, there are no such things as vampires. They're just a stupid made-up legend. Even if they do seem real sometimes.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, sure.

SNAKE

You think I'd be afraid of something like that?

PARA-MEDIC

No.

SNAKE

Exactly!

PARA-MEDIC

Right.

SNAKE

I'm not afraid of vampires.

PARA-MEDIC

Uh huh.

SNAKE

... It's just that whenever somebody starts talking about vampires, I end up dreaming about them that night. And I don't need that right now. That's all.

PARA-MEDIC

...OK...??? (She was going to say "Kinda sounds like you ARE scared of them" but decided not to. This conversation alludes to the following: If the player saves their game later on in the cell, Para-Medic will talk about a vampire movie. If the player exits the game and loads back into that save file, they'll briefly get to play an entirely different game.)
Cobalt blue tarantula
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, be careful. That area is supposed to be inhabited by cobalt blue tarantulas.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught a cobalt blue tarantula.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The cobalt blue tarantula is a poisonous spider with a highly potent venom.

PARA-MEDIC

If you get bitten, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and use "CURE" to administer a serum injection.
*(4) and subsequent dialogue occurs if player has listened to "Post-save conversation (7)"
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

There are many different varieties of tarantulas. The cobalt blue is part of a group called earth tigers.

PARA-MEDIC

They build their nests mainly underground and are highly aggressive. Their diet consists of not only insects, but also mice and even snakes.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Interesting. So how do they taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Are you really going to eat them?

SNAKE

Naturally... So?

PARA-MEDIC

It says here they're not very good.

SNAKE

*disappointed* Damn...

PARA-MEDIC

Don't act so surprised. Isn't it obvious?

SNAKE

Why would it be obvious?

PARA-MEDIC

It's a spider, for goodness' sake. A big one, but still a spider, and there's not much to it.

SNAKE

Yeah. (I guess.)

PARA-MEDIC

If only it were as big as the one in "Earth Versus the Spider."

SNAKE

The what?

PARA-MEDIC

"Earth Versus the Spider." It's a movie about this gigantic spider. When it's small it's about 15 feet wide, but when it's big, it's about 35 feet wide.

SNAKE

What do you mean, when it it's small and when it's big?

PARA-MEDIC

*like it's common knowledge* The size changes from scene to scene. It happens all the time. (This does happen often in Z movies.)

SNAKE

...
Emperor scorpion
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, watch out. That area is home to the emperor scorpion.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've caught yourself an emperor scorpion.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The emperor scorpion is said to be the largest scorpion in the world. Its venom is a potent neurotoxin, so take care that you don't get stung.

PARA-MEDIC

If you do get stung, go into the Survival Viewer and use "CURE" to inject yourself with serum right away.
(4) *Before eating

SNAKE

OK. So how's it taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Not very good, I'm afraid.

SNAKE

Oh...

PARA-MEDIC

Don't get so discouraged. There are other ways to use it besides eating it, right?

SNAKE

Like what?

PARA-MEDIC

Like catching one alive with the tranquilizer gun and throwing it at the enemy.

SNAKE

Oh, yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

Sometimes I wonder if you even remember that you are on a mission.

SNAKE

...
•Mushrooms
Ural luminescent
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, the Ural luminescent mushroom grows in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found some Ural luminescent mushrooms.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Ural luminescent mushroom is a mushroom found only in Tselinoyarsk. It looks like a shiitake mushroom, and it's often found growing on the trunks of trees.
(4)

SNAKE

If it looks like a shiitake mushroom, then it must be edible, right?

PARA-MEDIC

Yep. I can't guarantee that it'll taste like a shiitake mushroom, though,
(5) *After eating

PARA-MEDIC

And it tastes like...

SNAKE

It was poisonous.

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

It was a poison mushroom.

PARA-MEDIC

Are you sure?

SNAKE

What do you mean, am I sure?

PARA-MEDIC

Er, I mean, of course it's poisonous. Says so right there in the guide. (Her materials said it was edible, but she pretends otherwise.)

SNAKE

*suspicious* ...
(6)
*If player eats it after hearing from Para-Medic that it's edible, only it turns out it's poisonous

SNAKE

By the way, Para-Medic...

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

I tried that Ural luminescent mushroom you were talking about.

PARA-MEDIC

So, how did it taste?

SNAKE

It was poisonous.

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

It was a poison mushroom.

PARA-MEDIC

Really?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

That's weird... The guide says it's...

SNAKE

Are you sure that guide is reliable?

PARA-MEDIC

Don't worry, it's fine. It just happened to be wrong this one time...

SNAKE

*disbelieving* ...
Russian Oyster Mushroom
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

You should be able to find Russian Oyster Mushrooms in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found some Russian Oyster Mushrooms.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Russian Oyster Mushroom is an edible variety that belongs to the Shimeji family.

PARA-MEDIC

It's known to be particularly rich in vitamin B1 and Niacin.

PARA-MEDIC

Apparently, it's usually found growing on tree stumps and hollow logs. So look there if you want to eat some.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

I tried some, but they weren't all that good.

PARA-MEDIC

Really? I think they're great. You just lightly sauté them in butter with some potatoes, add a little salt and pepper, and... (Trying to express how delicious they are.)

SNAKE

How am I supposed to sauté them out here?

PARA-MEDIC

You're not. I'm just saying...

SNAKE

...
Russian glowcap
(1) *Before capturing

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, there's a mushroom called the Russian glowcap growing in that area.
(2) *After capturing

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found some Russian glowcaps.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Russian glowcap is a kind of luminescent fungus - a mushroom that glows in the dark.
(4)

SNAKE

Why would a mushroom glow in the dark?

PARA-MEDIC

It's bioluminescent, just like a firefly. It uses the so called luciferin-luciferase reaction.

PARA-MEDIC

To put it simply, luciferin reacts with luciferase in the presence of magnesium two plus ions, breaking it down into oxyluciferin and carbon dioxide.

PARA-MEDIC

The carbonyl groups in the oxyluciferin are initially in an electrically excited state. When they return to their base state, they give off light.

PARA-MEDIC

Did you get all that?

SNAKE

Not really.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh. (She won't lose sleep over him not getting this.)
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

By the way, does that mushroom recharge your batteries when you eat it?

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

I mean, it seems like if you ate a glowing mushroom, it might recharge your batteries or something.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, your batteries are organic batteries. They produce electricity by utilizing the potential difference between cells.

PARA-MEDIC

Organic batteries are known for their highly efficient energy conversion, but they still rely on chemical reactions between proteins and enzymes to...

SNAKE

So you're saying they'll get recharged?

PARA-MEDIC

*gives up* Believe what you want.

SNAKE

Great!
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

I ate one, and it recharged my batteries!

PARA-MEDIC

Huh!?

SNAKE

I thought a mushroom that glows that bright was bound to charge up my batteries if I ate it. And I was right.

PARA-MEDIC

Y... you're serious...??

SNAKE

What's wrong?

PARA-MEDIC

N... nothing...
-->(8)
(7) *If player eats it after hearing (5)

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

What's up?

SNAKE

You were right.

PARA-MEDIC

About what?

SNAKE

I ate a Russian glowcap and it charged up my batteries.

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

What's wrong?

PARA-MEDIC

I, uh... that's... that's great!
(8)

PARA-MEDIC

Um, Snake, can you excuse me for a second?

SNAKE

Sure.

PARA-MEDIC

Did you just hear that?

SIGINT

Yeah. There's no way eating a bioluminescent mushroom would cause your batteries to recharge.

PARA-MEDIC

What do you think it means?

SIGINT

Beats me... Maybe it's all in his mind.

PARA-MEDIC

You mean like a placebo effect?

SIGINT

Why not? You've seen how gullible he is.

PARA-MEDIC

I guess there's no harm done. Should we let him keep believing it?

SIGINT

Sounds good to me.

PARA-MEDIC

OK, Snake, I'm back.
(9)

PARA-MEDIC

Yes, the Russian glowcap is a glowing mushroom, so it'll recharge your batteries when you eat it.
(10)

SNAKE

??? (He didn't hear their conversation, so he's perplexed by their sudden change in attitude.)
Fly agaric
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, there should be fly agaric mushrooms growing in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found some fly agaric mushrooms.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The fly agaric is a relative of the deathcap mushroom that grows only in that region.

PARA-MEDIC

You'll find it growing on the ground, but it's poisonous, so if you pick one up, don't eat it.

PARA-MEDIC

If you do eat one, go into the Survival Viewer immediately and use "CURE" to take some antidote.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The poisons found in the fly agaric include fallotoxins and amatoxins.

PARA-MEDIC

It says here that when you eat it, the initial symptoms include nausea, stomach pain, and diarrhea. Finally, your liver and kidneys will break down into a sponge-like substance and you die.

SNAKE

Sounds like a horrible way to die.

PARA-MEDIC

Isn't it?

SNAKE

Yeah. So how does it taste?

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

How does it...

PARA-MEDIC

Were you listening to me? The fly agaric is poisonous...

SNAKE

I heard you. But if I did eat it, it might taste good right?

PARA-MEDIC

*gives up* ... I give up.
Siberian ink cap
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

You should be able to find Siberian Ink Cap mushrooms growing in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found some Siberian Ink Cap mushrooms.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Siberian Ink Cap is a mushroom from the ink cap family.

PARA-MEDIC

Its life cycle is transitory. As soon as the spores mature, the cap starts to turn black, liquefy, and melt away.

SNAKE

And that's why they call it an ink cap?

PARA-MEDIC

That's right. It doesn't really turn to liquid, but you get the idea.

PARA-MEDIC

In its immature state - before it melts away - it's valued as a source of food.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

I ate some, but they weren't that good.

PARA-MEDIC

Really...
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

Just be sure not to eat them while you're drinking alcohol.

SNAKE

Why's that?

PARA-MEDIC

Ink Caps contain coprin, which inhibits the function of aldehyde dehydrogenase.

PARA-MEDIC

This prevents the body from breaking down alcohol, causing a buildup of acetaldehyde.

SNAKE

... Meaning? (He doesn't understand.)

PARA-MEDIC

Meaning it will give you the hangover from hell.

SNAKE

Oh.
(6)
*After meeting Granin, but before learning of his death

SNAKE

I'd better go warn Granin.

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

Nothing important.
(7)

SNAKE

Wait a minute...

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

You think I'd drink alcohol in the middle of a mission?

PARA-MEDIC

Wouldn't you?

SNAKE

Hell no.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, I'm knocking a shot back now.

SNAKE

What!?

PARA-MEDIC

Just teasing you.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, come on, where's your sense of humor?

SNAKE

... I need a drink...
(8)

PARA-MEDIC

The Siberian inkcap is a mushroom in the inkcap family.

PARA-MEDIC

It's known to be edible, so keep an eye out for it.
Spatsa
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

There's a mushroom called the spatsa growing in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found a spatsa.
(3)

SNAKE

Spa...?

PARA-MEDIC

Spatsa.

SNAKE

Spatsa?

PARA-MEDIC

Right.

SNAKE

Interesting name.

PARA-MEDIC

Mmm.

PARA-MEDIC

...

PARA-MEDIC

...

SNAKE

So, Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

What kind of mushroom is a spatsa?

PARA-MEDIC

Uh...

PARA-MEDIC

You really want to know?

SNAKE

I guess so.

PARA-MEDIC

OK... let's see, the spatsa...

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

It's gray...

SNAKE

Hmm.

PARA-MEDIC

And it grows on the ground...

SNAKE

Yeah... and?

PARA-MEDIC

That's all.

SNAKE

That's all?

PARA-MEDIC

That's all the guide says.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

OK, so I don't know that much about it. Why don't you eat one and see? It might be pretty tasty.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

Eat one and see? What do I look like, a lab rat?

PARA-MEDIC

Shhh!

SNAKE

What? What'd I say?

PARA-MEDIC

What if the rats hear you? You'll hurt their feelings.

SNAKE

...
(6) *After eating

SNAKE

I already tried one.

PARA-MEDIC

Really? How was it?

SNAKE

I passed out.

PARA-MEDIC

It was that good?

SNAKE

No, I mean I fell asleep.

PARA-MEDIC

You were that tired?

SNAKE

NO, I mean the mushroom put me to sleep.

PARA-MEDIC

I know. I was just teasing you a little.

SNAKE

...
-->(9)
(7) *If player eats it after hearing (5)

SNAKE

Para-Medic...

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah?

SNAKE

I ate one of those spatsa mushrooms you were talking about.

PARA-MEDIC

Really? How did it taste?

SNAKE

I passed out.

PARA-MEDIC

Seriously?

SNAKE

Yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

*whispers* So THAT'S why they call it "the bringer of sleep"...

SNAKE

What!?

PARA-MEDIC

Oh. I looked the word "spatsa" up afterwards and found out it means "bringer of sleep" in Russian.

SNAKE

... (You coulda told me.)
(8)

PARA-MEDIC

But anyway, the reason the spatsa puts you to sleep when you eat it is because it contains a type of anesthetic substance similar to an alkaloid.
-->(10) or (11)
(9)

PARA-MEDIC

The spatsa appears to contain a type of vegetative alkaloid with anesthetic properties.
(10)
*If player doesn't have knockout handkerchief

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe if you soak a handkerchief or something in it, you could use it to put the enemy to sleep.
(11)
*If player has knockout handkerchief

PARA-MEDIC

I'll bet if you pick one, you could soak it into a handkerchief to create a sleeping drug.
(12)

PARA-MEDIC

Eating a spatsa and falling asleep might cause your LIFE and stamina to recover as well. Why don't you find a safe spot and try it out?
Baikal Scaly tooth
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Baikal Scaly Tooth mushroom is used as an antidote to poison. It usually grows on the trunks of trees, so look for it there.

SNAKE

How does it taste?

PARA-MEDIC

I think you're going to be disappointed.

SNAKE

PARA-MEDIC

•Fruit
Golova
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, there's a fruit called the Golova growing in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Looks like you've found a Golova.
(3)

SNAKE

Golova?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. It's a fruit that's found only in that region. It's related to the jackfruit, which is commonly found in Southeast Asia.

SNAKE

Jack... fruit, huh...

PARA-MEDIC

*quietly* Yep, he's a cannibal.

SNAKE

Huh?

PARA-MEDIC

I didn't say anything.

SNAKE

No, I'm sure you (did)...

PARA-MEDIC

I said I'm sure you'd like it.

SNAKE

Oh.

PARA-MEDIC

Golova means "head" in Russian. It's probably called that because the fruit grows to about the size of a human head.

PARA-MEDIC

It's supposedly pretty good to eat, with a uniquely sweet flavor. The fruit itself is fairly large, so you could make a meal out of it.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

Yeah, I tried one. It was pretty good.

PARA-MEDIC

Naturally.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

Golovas grow directly off the trunk of the tree. If you're running low on stamina, it might be a good idea to keep an eye out on the tree trunks.
Golova (2)

PARA-MEDIC

The golova is a variety of jackfruit found only in Tselinoyarsk.

PARA-MEDIC

It's big and tasty, so I think it'd be worth searching for.
Russian False Mango
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

A fruit called the Russian False Mango grows in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found a Russian False Mango.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Russian False Mango is a mango-like fruit found only in Tselinoyarsk.

PARA-MEDIC

The egg-shaped fruit is sweet and tangy with a pleasing aroma; just like a mango.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

Yeah. It was pretty tasty.

PARA-MEDIC

See?
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

Also, the seeds can be used to make a medicine that aids in digestion.

PARA-MEDIC

It might come in handy if you ever have an upset stomach.
Yabloko Moloko
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

You'll find a fruit called the Yabloko Moloko growing in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found a Yabloko Moloko.
(3)

SNAKE

Yablo... what now?

PARA-MEDIC

Yabloko Moloko. It's a Russian name that roughly translates as "milk apple."

PARA-MEDIC

It's a type of star apple. The juice is thick and sweet, like milk - hence the name.

PARA-MEDIC

And if you cut one in half lengthwise, you'll see a star-shaped ring radiating out from the center.

SNAKE

Hence the star apple?

PARA-MEDIC

Right. The star-shaped part has a gelatinous texture and is said to be especially tasty.
(4) *Before eating

SNAKE

Sounds useful.

PARA-MEDIC

You're welcome.

SNAKE

For once...

PARA-MEDIC

Did you say something?

SNAKE

No. Back to the mission.
(5) *After eating

SNAKE

I ate one... it didn't taste that great.

PARA-MEDIC

Are you sure? It's supposed to be delicious.

SNAKE

Nope, it tasted terrible.

PARA-MEDIC

Huh... that's strange.

SNAKE

Yeah. Looks like that guide of yours...

PARA-MEDIC

No, it's your sense of taste.

SNAKE

...
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

The yabloko moloko is a variety of starfruit.

PARA-MEDIC

It grows mainly on the branches of trees and is quite delicious.
Vine Melon
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, there should be Vine Melons growing in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've found a Vine Melon.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The Vine Melon is a kind of melon commonly found in Tselinoyarsk.

PARA-MEDIC

Like the name says, it's a melon that grows on a vine. The flesh is crisp and delicious.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

I tried one. It was all right.

PARA-MEDIC

That's good.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

The Vine Melon is full of potassium and carotene, so it's good for you as well.

PARA-MEDIC

Next time you see a vine, why not check to see if there's a melon growing on it?
•Miscellaneous Food
Ration
(1) *Before acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you should be able to find some rations in that area.
(2) *After acquiring

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've got yourself a ration.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Rations are portable meals carried by Soviet soldiers.
(4) *After eating

SNAKE

No they're not.

PARA-MEDIC

Huh?

SNAKE

They're "disgusting" portable meals carried by Soviet soldiers.
(5) *Before eating

SNAKE

I've heard some nasty stories about how they taste.

PARA-MEDIC

It looks like the rumors are true.

SNAKE

Great...
(6)

PARA-MEDIC

Hey, you should be grateful. Those things are designed to last.

PARA-MEDIC

No matter how long you keep a ration, it'll never go bad. And they're surprisingly good for you, too.

SNAKE

I'd take a snake over this any day, even if it is a little rotten...

PARA-MEDIC

*stunned* You are hopeless...
Instant noodles

PARA-MEDIC

You got some instant noodles, huh?

SNAKE

Instant noodles?

PARA-MEDIC

Uh huh. It was invented in Japan just recently. Add some hot water and it's ready to eat.

PARA-MEDIC

It's cheap and can be stored for a long time. And besides, it's delicious. It's like a miracle food.

SNAKE

Wow.

PARA-MEDIC

Speaking of which...

SNAKE

Yeah?

PARA-MEDIC

Are you going to eat that?

SNAKE

I was planning on it, yeah.

PARA-MEDIC

*disappointed* ... Oh, all right.

SNAKE

Is there some reason I shouldn't?

PARA-MEDIC

No, that's not what I meant.

SNAKE

Then what did you mean?

PARA-MEDIC

I was just going to say that if you weren't going to eat it, you should bring it back to me. I've always wanted to try some.

SNAKE

...
Calorie Mate
(1) *If player has one

PARA-MEDIC

I see you have a Calorie Mate.

SNAKE

Calorie Mate?

PARA-MEDIC

The thing you're holding now.

SNAKE

Oh, the little block that looks like a cookie?
(2) *After eating

SNAKE

It was pretty good.

PARA-MEDIC

Wasn't it?

SNAKE

Yeah, but what the hell was it?

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

I've never seen anything like it, what...

PARA-MEDIC

Hold on... you just ate something without even knowing what it was?

SNAKE

Yeah, it looked good.

PARA-MEDIC

...

SNAKE

So, what was it?
(3) *Before eating

PARA-MEDIC

Try it. It's pretty good.

SNAKE

Okay.

SNAKE

But what is this thing? I've never seen anything like it.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Calorie Mate is an energy supplement that contains all the proteins, lipids, vitamins, carbohydrates and minerals needed for a balanced diet.

PARA-MEDIC

It is a well-balanced food. Because of that, it's just perfect for giving your body the nutrition it needs in combat.

SNAKE

It sounds like a space-age food.

PARA-MEDIC

Real astronaut food is not very good, but that should taste fine.

SNAKE

Yeah, and it will help balance out all this jungle food I'm eating.

PARA-MEDIC

It's easy and quick to eat, so it's perfect when you are running late for an important mission in the morning.

SNAKE

I've never been late for a mission.

PARA-MEDIC

Really? Aren't you always keeping people waiting? (Referring to how Snake always says "Kept you waiting, huh?" to the player.)

SNAKE

?
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

It's easy to keep track of your calorie intake and receive the nutrition your body needs, so it's good for losing weight too.

PARA-MEDIC

All of the geisha girls in Japan use it for watching their calories.

SNAKE

Is that why they're all so slim?

PARA-MEDIC

Right. And any diet where you eat nothing at all is bad for the body.

SNAKE

I see. You seem to know a lot about Japan don't you?

PARA-MEDIC

Yes, I love Japan.
•Medicinal Plants
Chinese plantain
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

There should be an herb called Chinese plantain growing in that area.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

The Chinese plantain is an herb that resembles a plantain root.

PARA-MEDIC

The leaves and seeds contain large amounts of aucubin, choline, and tannin.

PARA-MEDIC

When you mash it up and apply it to a wound, it helps stop the flow of blood and eases the pain a bit.

PARA-MEDIC

The Chinese plantain becomes a styptic when you pick it up. If you see one, don't forget to take it with you.
Slav Horehound
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, I think there's a plant called Slav Horehound growing in that area.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Slav Horehound is an herb in the horehound family.

PARA-MEDIC

It contains large amounts of diterpene, flavonoids, and alkaloids, which give it strong germicidal properties.

PARA-MEDIC

If you find one, it should make a good disinfectant.
Ezo Comfrey
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

You should be able to find Ezo Comfrey in that area.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Ezo Comfrey is a plant in the Comfrey family that's found only in Tselinoyarsk.

PARA-MEDIC

If you find one, you can use it as a cast to treat broken bones.
(3)

SNAKE

How can a plant be turned into a splint?

PARA-MEDIC

The roots of the Ezo Comfrey are extremely sticky. You can use them as a kind of plaster cast to fasten the affected area in place.

SNAKE

I get it.
Amur Kudzu
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

There's an herb called the Amur Kudzu growing in that area.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Amur Kudzu is a member of the bean family and a close relative of the Kudzu weed. The roots contain a number of isoflavones such as daidzin, which give it strong fever-reducing properties.

PARA-MEDIC

It'll make a good cold medicine if you find some.
•Cure
Broken bone
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

I see you've got a bone fracture.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You'll suffer broken bones if you jump from too high a place or get hit with a severe blow.

PARA-MEDIC

When you have a fracture, your maximum LIFE goes down.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Fractures will heal little by little over time, but you can heal them right away by going into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and following the necessary procedure.

PARA-MEDIC

To treat a bone fracture, first secure the affected area with a fastener and then wrap it in bandages. That should do it.
Broken bone (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've got a broken bone!
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Broken bones can be fully healed by fixing the affected area in place with a fastener and wrapping it in bandages. Do it quickly!
Poisoned
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you're poisoned.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

When you're bitten by a venomous animal such as a snake or a spider, or hit by a poisoned arrow, the poison will start to affect your body.

PARA-MEDIC

Your LIFE will decrease with each passing minute, so cure the poison as soon as possible.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

To cure poison, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and inject yourself with a dose of serum.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

You can get serum from enemies. Either hold them up or shake their bodies down after you defeat them.
(5)

PARA-MEDIC

I'm pretty sure you can also get serum by capturing the rabbits that live in that area.
Poisoned (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you been bitten by a venomous animal!?

SNAKE

Yeah...

PARA-MEDIC

It looks like the poison is already starting to affect you. Unless you cure it, your LIFE will just keep decreasing. You've got to treat it now.

PARA-MEDIC

To cure poison, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and administer a serum injection.
(2)

SNAKE

But I don't have any serum...

PARA-MEDIC

Then you had better go find some quick!
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

The enemies in that area might have some. Hurry!
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

The animals in that area might have the ingredients to make serum. Go catch some!
Cut
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

That's a nasty cut you've got there.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Cuts happen when you get slashed with a knife or other sharp object.

PARA-MEDIC

When you have a cut, your maximum LIFE goes down depending on its severity.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Cuts heal naturally over time, but if you go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and treat it, it'll heal instantaneously.

PARA-MEDIC

To treat a cut, you need disinfectant, styptic, sutures, and a bandage. As long as you have all those things, the cut should heal up nicely.
Cut (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've got a nasty cut.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

To treat a cut, you need disinfectant, styptic, sutures, and a bandage. As long as you use all those items, the cut should heal up completely. Hurry and get it fixed up!
Gunshot wound
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've got a gunshot wound!
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

When you get shot, you'll sometimes suffer a gunshot wound. The chance of suffering a serious injury is especially high at close range.

PARA-MEDIC

When you have a gunshot wound, your maximum LIFE will decrease depending on its severity.

PARA-MEDIC

Gunshot wounds will heal naturally over time, but if you want it to heal faster, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and treat it.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

To treat a gunshot wound, you need to dig out the bullet with your knife, disinfect the wound, and apply styptic. Then wrap it in a bandage.

PARA-MEDIC

When all that's finished, the gunshot wound will be fully healed.
Gunshot wound (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've got a gunshot wound!
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

The way to treat a gunshot wound is to dig out the bullet using your knife, disinfect the wound, apply a styptic, and bandage it up.

PARA-MEDIC

Follow all those steps and the wound should heal nicely. Take care of it, quickly!
Burn
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've got a bad burn.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Burns happen when you're engulfed in flames or get caught in an explosion.

PARA-MEDIC

When you've got a burn, your maximum LIFE will go down depending on its severity.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

Burns heal naturally over time without you doing anything, but if you go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and treat the burn, you can heal it instantaneously.

PARA-MEDIC

To treat the burn, lightly spread the ointment over the wound and wrap it in bandages. If you do both of these things, you can heal the burn altogether.
Burn (2)
*If player is in a tight spot, such as in a boss battle
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've been burned!
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

The way to treat a burn is with ointment and bandages. Put both of those on and the burn should heal right up. Treat it quickly!
Arrow wound
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you've got an arrow stuck in you.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

When you get shot with an arrow, your maximum LIFE will go down depending on how bad it is, so watch out.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

You can let the wound heal naturally, or you can treat it using "CURE" in the Survival Viewer to make it heal right away.

PARA-MEDIC

To treat an arrow wound, first use your knife to dig the arrow out. Then disinfect the wound and apply styptic to stop the flow of blood.

PARA-MEDIC

Once that's all done, the arrow wound should heal right up.
Cold
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Ooh, you've got a terrible cold.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You'll catch a cold if you hang around too long without any clothes on, or spend too much time in the water or the swamp.

PARA-MEDIC

When you catch a cold, your stamina goes down more rapidly.

PARA-MEDIC

You'll also sneeze from time to time, and the noise can alert enemies to your presence. Plus, your body will shake, so you might not be able to distinguish vibrations very well.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

To cure a cold, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and take some cold medicine.
Stomach ache
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, do you have a stomach ache?
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

You'll get a stomach ache if you eat something rotten.

PARA-MEDIC

When you have a stomach ache, your stamina will drain faster and your stomach rumbling can alert the enemy.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

To cure a stomach ache, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and take some digestive medicine.
Food poisoning
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

It sounds like you've got food poisoning.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Food poisoning is caused by eating poisonous food. When you have food poisoning, your LIFE will continuously decrease.

PARA-MEDIC

If left untreated, you'll eventually throw up whatever it was you ate. That'll get rid of the food poisoning, but you'll also use up a lot of stamina.

PARA-MEDIC

So it's a good idea to treat it yourself before you vomit.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

To cure food poisoning, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and take some antidote.
Leech
(1) *If player calls while a leech is attached to them

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, look at your body.

SNAKE

*looks at his crotch* Yep, looking good.

PARA-MEDIC

Not there!

SNAKE

Then where?

PARA-MEDIC

See the leeches?

SNAKE

Leeches?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. You've got leeches all over you.
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Leeches will sometimes attach themselves to you if you spend a long time in the water or the swamp.

PARA-MEDIC

When you've got leeches on you, they'll suck your blood, causing you to lose stamina. You should get rid of them as soon as possible.
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

To get rid of leeches, go into "CURE" in the Survival Viewer and press your cigar into them.
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Or, if you use the insecticidal bug juice ahead of time, the leeches won't bother you as long as the bug juice is in effect.
•Miscellaneous
Adrenaline

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, do you know what epinephrine is?

SNAKE

What's with the questions?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, do you?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

Also known as adrenaline?

SNAKE

Never heard of it.

PARA-MEDIC

Really.

SNAKE

Nope.

PARA-MEDIC

I have.

SNAKE

Good for you.

PARA-MEDIC

Do you want to hear about it?

SNAKE

Not really.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, I think you should hear about it.

SNAKE

Here we go.

PARA-MEDIC

So...

PARA-MEDIC

Epinephrine is a type of hormone. It's secreted from the adrenal glands in high-stress situations - like when you're exercising, or you're under pressure.

PARA-MEDIC

The epinephrine is released into the blood-stream and stimulates special receptor cells on various organs throughout the body.

PARA-MEDIC

This causes the heart to beat faster, the blood vessels to constrict, and the respiratory passages to expand. It also raises blood pressure.

PARA-MEDIC

You ever notice how you're faster and stronger than normal when you're under stress? That's because of epinephrine. And when you're bleeding, it... (She's trying to explain that the bleeding will stop, but Snake interrupts her.)

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah?

SNAKE

Is there a point to all of this?

PARA-MEDIC

Of course. In the Alert Phase, your body secretes epinephrine, and so your stamina won't be depleted as fast.

SNAKE

... Uh huh. (Discontented. He didn't need that long of an explanation just for that.)

PARA-MEDIC

There, good thing I told you, huh?

SNAKE

As always.
Para-Medic's background

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

What's up?

SNAKE

Are you a medic, or a doctor?

PARA-MEDIC

I'm a well-respected physician. Or I was, until I joined the CIA.

SNAKE

How was your reputation?

PARA-MEDIC

My what?

SNAKE

Your reputation.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, that.

SNAKE

How was it?

PARA-MEDIC

Why? Don't you trust me?

SNAKE

That's not what I meant.

PARA-MEDIC

Fine, then. (She thinks it's over.)

SNAKE

Mm hmm. ...So?

PARA-MEDIC

So what?

SNAKE

Your reputation - how was it?

PARA-MEDIC

My! You're relentless!

SNAKE

Hey, I'm a snake. So?

PARA-MEDIC

My reputation was spotless. I'm highly skilled, patient, and good-looking to boot. Everybody wanted to see me. What else would you expect?

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

No, seriously.

MAJOR TOM

Incidentally, her nickname back then was "Quack."

PARA-MEDIC

Major!

SNAKE

...Is that true?

PARA-MEDIC

*feigning ignorance* Mm? Is what true?

SNAKE

About your nickname.

PARA-MEDIC

No!... Well, maybe a few people did call me that...

SNAKE

So you were a quack?

PARA-MEDIC

No!... Well, yes and no. I mean, in a sense I was, but then again I wasn't...

SNAKE

???

MAJOR TOM

Snake, her skills as a doctor are beyond reproach. You have my word on that.

PARA-MEDIC

Yes! That's exactly what I was trying to say, Snake.

SNAKE

*ignores Para-Medic and talks to the Major* Then why did they call her "Quack"?

MAJOR TOM

It's because she...

PARA-MEDIC

Never mind that! It doesn't matter. We've got a job to do, and we have to stay focused. Besides, my past doesn't have anything to do with the mission and...

SNAKE

Because she never shuts up?

MAJOR TOM

Yes, that's it.

PARA-MEDIC

No, that's not it! Snake, tell him that's not true!

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Say something!

SNAKE

I'd better get back to the mission.

MAJOR TOM

Yes, you do that.

PARA-MEDIC

Just a minute! Snake! Don't you hang up on me!
Fan service

PARA-MEDIC

If you have any questions about stamina or healing, just ask me. I'll tell you everything you need to know. It'll have to be over the radio, though.

SNAKE

So you won't be able to see me naked, then. (MGS1 reference.)

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, I'm devastated. But I'll bet that 50 years from now, you'll be able to see who you're talking to on the radio.

SNAKE

I'll be retired from active duty by then.

PARA-MEDIC

I don't know. Somebody somewhere might just decide to give you a call. (Hinting at upcoming MGS games in the series, chronologically speaking.)

SNAKE

Wouldn't surprise me. Let's both pray that never happens.
Origin of "Para-Medic"

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, if you or one of your comrades is wounded in battle, what do you usually do?

SNAKE

I call for a medic.

PARA-MEDIC

What if there's no medic nearby?

SNAKE

I don't even want to think about that.

PARA-MEDIC

Think about it.

SNAKE

... That's my worst nightmare. Any soldier can perform basic first aid, but it takes a specialist to perform the more complicated procedures.

SNAKE

I know a lot of guys who'd be still be alive today if they'd had access to a medic.

PARA-MEDIC

Me, too.

PARA-MEDIC

So I got to thinking - wouldn't it be great if we could parachute medics into the front lines, where they're needed most?

SNAKE

*realizing* You bet... That's why you're called "Para-Medic"?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. With a unit like that, we could save a couple of lives, huh?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

No?

SNAKE

Not a couple. We could save many lives.

PARA-MEDIC

... Thanks. I think the army needs a unit like that. And if no one else will do it, I'm going to create one myself.

SNAKE

Sounds like a plan.

PARA-MEDIC

Will you help me?

SNAKE

Count on it.
Cigar
*If player is smoking a cigar

PARA-MEDIC

Snake!

PARA-MEDIC

What?

SNAKE

Are you smoking a cigarette?

SNAKE

Nope... (Audible exhale of cigar smoke.)

PARA-MEDIC

Yes, you are.

SNAKE

It's not a cigarette. It's a cigar.

PARA-MEDIC

Same thing.

SNAKE

Not at all. In fact, there's a world of difference. There's nothing quite like the rich smell and mellow flavor of a cigar. And that thick, luxurious smoke is almost sensual when it... (He was about to say "when it rises into the air" before she interrupted him.)

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, yeah, yeah. Whatever. You know something?

SNAKE

*has a bad feeling* Probably not, but I don't want to hear it.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, you don't have a choice.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Cigarettes are bad for you.

SNAKE

It's not a cigarette, it's a...

PARA-MEDIC

Quiet, you!

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Smoking is bad for you.

PARA-MEDIC

In a recent study, scientists found that tobacco smoke is full of carcinogenic substances, like nitrosamines.

PARA-MEDIC

You know what that means? It means you're going to give yourself lung cancer if you keep on smoking.

SNAKE

But that's just what some scientists think, right?

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, give me a break.

SNAKE

I heard it was just a bunch of hu-hah. (In the 60s, the tobacco industry was responsible for propaganda claiming tobacco wasn't harmful.)

PARA-MEDIC

Do you really believe that?

SNAKE

Sure.

PARA-MEDIC

God, you're gullible.

PARA-MEDIC

You ought to read this year's report from the Surgeon General. It proves, beyond a shadow of a doubt, that smoking causes lung cancer.

PARA-MEDIC

Pretty soon the whole world will know that smoking is bad for you. Better quit now before it's too late.

SNAKE

But... (He was about to say "cigar smoke is harmless because it doesn't go down into your lungs" before she interrupted him.)

PARA-MEDIC

And don't tell me cigar smoke is harmless because it doesn't go down into your lungs. It just means the cancer shows up in a different place.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Got it?

SNAKE

Yeah, yeah...
"The Fly" helmet

PARA-MEDIC

Say, Snake, about that helmet and oxygen mask you took off right after you parachuted in...

SNAKE

Oh, those? Those are the helmet assembly and oxygen system assembly I used to make the HALO jump.

SNAKE

The helmet is fitted with a bayonet fastener that attaches to the oxygen mask. It's also got earphones and a boom mike...

PARA-MEDIC

I'm not interested in all that stuff.

SNAKE

So why did you bring it up?

PARA-MEDIC

It reminds me of something.

SNAKE

Reminds you of something?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah.

SNAKE

The mask?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. But I can't remember what it is, and I can't stop thinking about it...

SNAKE

... That's what you've been thinking about?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. Every time I'm about to remember it, it slips away from me again. Don't you just hate that?

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

I know I've seen it somewhere before... any ideas?

SNAKE

*interrupted by Para-Medic* How would I...

PARA-MEDIC

*suddenly realizing* That's it!

SNAKE

What!?

PARA-MEDIC

The Fly!

SNAKE

The Fly?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, it finally came to me. You looked just like him. Aah, I feel better...

SNAKE

...The Fly?

PARA-MEDIC

From the movie "The Fly." You've never seen it?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

Geez, where have you been? It's about this scientist who's conducting teleportation experiments when he gets mixed up with a fly and ends up with the fly's head attached to his body.

SNAKE

Never heard of it.

PARA-MEDIC

That's too bad... It's a good movie...
"The Great Escape" and tunnel Tom
*After talking to the Major about "The Great Escape" and Para-Medic about "The Fly"

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

PARA-MEDIC

Hmm?

SNAKE

You said you like movies, right?

PARA-MEDIC

I love 'em.

SNAKE

About the Major's code name...

PARA-MEDIC

Major Tom?

SNAKE

He sounded like he wasn't sure whether or not "Tom" was the name of the tunnel that worked in "The Great Escape."

PARA-MEDIC

So I heard.

SNAKE

So was it?

PARA-MEDIC

Was it what?

SNAKE

Was "Tom" really the name of the tunnel that worked?

PARA-MEDIC

Right.

SNAKE

So it was "Tom"?

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe.

SNAKE

Maybe?

PARA-MEDIC

I dunno.

SNAKE

Why don't you know?

PARA-MEDIC

Why should I know?

SNAKE

You watch a lot of movies, don't you?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah.

SNAKE

But you've never seen "The Great Escape"?

PARA-MEDIC

No.

SNAKE

Why not?

PARA-MEDIC

It didn't look interesting.

SNAKE

You don't watch movies that don't look interesting?

PARA-MEDIC

That's right.

SNAKE

And yet you've seen "The Fly"?

PARA-MEDIC

"The Fly" looked interesting. And it was.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Something wrong?

SNAKE

Nothing. Tell me, what other kind of movies do you like?

PARA-MEDIC

Let's see. There's "The Quatermass Xperiment," and... "It Conquered the World," and "Earth Vs The Spider." Oh, and "Mondo Cane!"

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Did I say something weird?

SNAKE

Forget it...

PARA-MEDIC

???
Canned food
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Looks like you're in a building. If people are living there, there's bound to be people food.
(2)

SNAKE

People food?

PARA-MEDIC

Soviet military rations. It beats eating raw snakes and mushrooms all the time, doesn't it?

SNAKE

I'm getting to like raw snake and mushroom.

PARA-MEDIC

You really are turning into an animal...
Rain and taking shelter from it (1)

PARA-MEDIC

It looks like it's raining out there. Be aware that you burn up a lot more stamina than usual in the rain.

PARA-MEDIC

If you want to conserve stamina, then you should find some shelter. Is there any place that'll keep the rain off your head?
Attack dogs
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

You say there are attack dogs?
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Those attack dogs are Great Danes.

PARA-MEDIC

The breed is originally from Germany. They've been used for hundreds of years as hunting dogs.

PARA-MEDIC

As you can see, they're very large. Strong, too. They've got a calm yet courageous temperament. And on top of that, they're extremely intelligent.

PARA-MEDIC

In some cases, a trained Great Dane can be more dangerous than a human opponent. Watch out for them.
(3)

SNAKE

Interesting.

PARA-MEDIC

Forget it, Snake!!

SNAKE

Forget what?

PARA-MEDIC

You were thinking about how they taste, weren't you?

SNAKE

I wasn't thinking...

PARA-MEDIC

Don't lie to me. I could tell by the look on your face.

SNAKE

You can't see my face.

PARA-MEDIC

No, but I can imagine it!

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Don't you dare think about trying to capture an attack dog.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

You hear me!?

SNAKE

Yeah, yeah...
(4)

PARA-MEDIC

Those dogs may be highly trained, but you might still be able to distract them by throwing them something tasty to eat. Give it a try!
The future of attack dogs

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, be careful of those attack dogs.

SNAKE

Don't worry. I know how dangerous they are.

PARA-MEDIC

No, you're the one who's dangerous.

SNAKE

Me?

PARA-MEDIC

Those dogs are just innocent animals, even if they've been trained to kill. You shouldn't hurt them unless you have to.

SNAKE

But...

PARA-MEDIC

You know, humans and dogs have been living together for 50,000 years, ever since the Stone Age.

PARA-MEDIC

Sure, they make good pets and watch dogs...

PARA-MEDIC

But they also help us out in a variety of different fields - not just as police and army dogs, but as hunters, shepherds, rescuers, and seeing-eye dogs.

PARA-MEDIC

They deserve our respect.

SNAKE

I know what you mean. I'm a dog-sled fan, myself.

PARA-MEDIC

In the future, many of the jobs that dogs do now will probably be taken over by machines.

PARA-MEDIC

They'll have miniature unmanned reconnaissance vehicle and security systems...

PARA-MEDIC

And in the 21st century, I bet they'll even be selling robot dogs as pets.

SNAKE

You've got to be kidding.

PARA-MEDIC

But even if that happens, dogs will still be our most trusted companions.

SNAKE

Unmanned recon vehicle... that's a pretty scary thought.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, for now, trained dogs are the best they've got.
Kerotans
(1)
*Kerotan is a frog character created by Konami Traumer. For reasons unknown, these figures have been placed throughout the jungle. Shooting one will cause it to croak, attracting any enemy in the vicinity.

PARA-MEDIC

Hey, that's Kerotan!

SNAKE

Huh!?

PARA-MEDIC

Right there. See it?

SNAKE

Where?

PARA-MEDIC

Right in front of you.

SNAKE

... This frog doll?

PARA-MEDIC

That's Kerotan. Don't tell me you've never heard of him.

SNAKE

Is he famous or something?

PARA-MEDIC

Come on, everybody knows about Kerotan.

SNAKE

... Oh. OK. But what's this frog thing doing here?

PARA-MEDIC

Kerotan.

SNAKE

?

PARA-MEDIC

He's called Kerotan.

SNAKE

Right... So what's this Kerotan doing here...

PARA-MEDIC

He must be getting popular in the Soviet Union.

SNAKE

*doubtful* Here?

PARA-MEDIC

Not that you'd know anything about the magic of Kerotan.

PARA-MEDIC

On the other hand, you might be able to use Kerotan's power to help you in your mission.

SNAKE

What did you have in mind?
(2)

PARA-MEDIC

Kerotan cries when you shake him. If the enemy hears that, they might come to check it out.

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe you could use it as a diversion?
(3)

PARA-MEDIC

And I hear that if you find all of the Kerotans and shake them, something good will happen. Try it out. (This impacts the player's codename, etc., after finishing the game.)
Ocelot

PARA-MEDIC

By the way, Snake...

SNAKE

What?

PARA-MEDIC

You know the Ocelot Unit commander?

SNAKE

Ocelot?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. That's not his real name, is it?

SNAKE

I wouldn't think so.

PARA-MEDIC

Is it a code name?

SNAKE

You mean like Snake?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah.

SNAKE

Maybe... why, is that strange?

PARA-MEDIC

No, I was just wondering why he's called Ocelot.

SNAKE

Why's that?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, I looked it up, and it turns out the ocelot is a wild cat whose habitat stretches from the southern U.S. down to northern Argentina.

PARA-MEDIC

They live in a variety of different environments, from tropical rain forests to savannas. The biggest ones can grow up to one meter in length.

PARA-MEDIC

They're normally solitary creatures, and their diet consists mainly of small animals and fish. During the day they sleep up in the trees, but at night...

SNAKE

Para-Medic... (We're getting off-track here.)

PARA-MEDIC

*realizing the conversation has digressed* Oh, right.

PARA-MEDIC

So the ocelot is an animal that lives on the American continent.

PARA-MEDIC

But then I wondered - why would a Soviet officer be using the name of an American wildcat?

SNAKE

... Good question. Maybe it's because he's fast and agile like an ocelot?

PARA-MEDIC

Hmm. Yeah, maybe you're right.

SNAKE

Mmm. But why'd you go to all the trouble of looking it up?

PARA-MEDIC

Because I was curious. Was it helpful?

SNAKE

...Uh, sure. (Doesn't see how this is helpful in any way.)
Radiation exposure

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, I looked at your medical record... You've been exposed to an atomic blast?

SNAKE

Yeah. The "Bravo Shot." It was a hydrogen bomb test conducted at Bikini Atoll on March 1, 1954.

SNAKE

I was at the American base on Kwajalein in the Marshall Islands when the ashes of death started falling from the sky.

PARA-MEDIC

... Any symptoms?

SNAKE

None... at least not yet.

SNAKE

But a lot of the guys who were in it with me are now suffering from thyroid cancer and leukemia. Some of them are dead already.

SNAKE

One of these days... (I might become sick too.)

SNAKE

... Anyway, I'd better get back to the mission.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah...
Human clones

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, whatever happens to you, make sure you leave a descendant, OK?

SNAKE

Are you saying you want to have my baby?

PARA-MEDIC

No. I'm saying that in the 21st century, the genes of soldiers like you are going to be in high demand.

SNAKE

Genes?

PARA-MEDIC

Uh huh. Remember when Watson and Crick discovered the double helix structure of DNA back in 1953?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

You know, they won the Nobel Prize in Medicine for it the year before last?

PARA-MEDIC

Of course, you have to feel sorry for Pauling and Franklin. They were researching the exact same thing.

SNAKE

Sorry. I don't follow.

PARA-MEDIC

Inside every living creature are little blueprints called genes.

PARA-MEDIC

Through the union of the sperm and egg cells, these blueprints are transformed and inherited by the next generation. That's why parents and children resemble each other.

PARA-MEDIC

The concept of genes was first proposed over a hundred years ago by Mendel, but he didn't know what they were exactly.

PARA-MEDIC

For a while, it was thought that chromosomes were composed not of deoxyribonucleic acid, but of proteins called polypeptides.

PARA-MEDIC

Later, it was shown that deoxyribonucleic acid, or DNA, was a biological macromolecule.

PARA-MEDIC

Then, 11 years ago, Watson and Crick discovered that DNA had a double-helix structure.

SNAKE

Yep. This is all fascinating stuff, but what exactly does it have to do with me?

PARA-MEDIC

The inherent characteristics of any given individual are determined by his or her genes.

PARA-MEDIC

By duplicating a set of superior genes, a separate body with the same set of characteristics - a clone - can be created.

SNAKE

But genes don't control a person's fate.

PARA-MEDIC

That's true. But having an offspring that's genetically identical to the parent is more efficient, right? You can expect better results that way.

SNAKE

More efficient? You can't mass-produce human beings!

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe. But now that we know the true nature of genes, human cloning is that much closer to reality.

PARA-MEDIC

Nuclear transplanting is already theoretically possible. So one day...

SNAKE

My genes are going to be a valuable commodity?

PARA-MEDIC

Exactly.

SNAKE

They'd never let that happen.

PARA-MEDIC

Just think - even if your body dies, you survive and go on to bigger and better accomplishments.

PARA-MEDIC

If you think about it, it's kind of an honor.

SNAKE

Does that kind of technology seriously appeal to you?

PARA-MEDIC

Well, I am a doctor.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

I can't condone it on moral grounds, but I'm fascinated by the possibilities.

PARA-MEDIC

Especially when I see such an excellent specimen as yourself.

SNAKE

Yeah, well, thanks for the compliment, but it doesn't make me feel any better.

PARA-MEDIC

Don't be so glum. It's not like it's going to happen anytime soon.

PARA-MEDIC

We'll just have to wait and see.
The Crocodile Cap
(1)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, what are you...
(2)

SNAKE

How does it look? (Wants her to take the bait.)

PARA-MEDIC

It looks cool!

SNAKE

Huh? (Not the reaction he was expecting.)

PARA-MEDIC

It looks cool on you.

SNAKE

It does?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah!

SNAKE

I don't think "cool" is the right word.

PARA-MEDIC

Why? What's wrong with it?

SNAKE

What's wrong... Don't you think it looks silly? Doesn't it make you laugh? Aren't you going to ask me what the hell was I thinking?

PARA-MEDIC

No. (She honestly doesn't feel this way.)

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

I think it really does look good. It reminds me of "The Alligator People."

SNAKE

Oh... the what?

PARA-MEDIC

"The Alligator People." It's a science fiction movie. You've never heard of it?

SNAKE

No. (Why would I have?)

PARA-MEDIC

Oh... well, you should see it sometime.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this guy who gets hurt in a car accident and tries to heal his wounds by injecting himself with a crocodile serum, but then his head turns into a crocodile head.

PARA-MEDIC

You look just like him with that mask on. That's awesome.

SNAKE

Right... (Crushed to hear he looks like some Z movie monster.)

PARA-MEDIC

??? (Has no idea why he's so crushed.)
•Save Conversations
Post-save conversation (1)

PARA-MEDIC

Hey Snake, you ever heard of "Godzilla, King of Monsters"?

SNAKE

No. What is it?

PARA-MEDIC

It's a movie. You haven't seen it?

SNAKE

Nope.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this monster called Godzilla who grows to an enormous size in a nuclear test and goes on a rampage in Tokyo.

SNAKE

Nuclear test, huh? Then the Marshall Islands must be crawling with giant monsters right about now.

PARA-MEDIC

It's just make-believe.

SNAKE

Maybe that's why my pants have been so tight lately.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, it's a movie, not a report out of Los Alamos.

SNAKE

I know. So then what happened?

PARA-MEDIC

Godzilla is immune to all weapons, and humanity has no way to stop the monster.

PARA-MEDIC

Dr. Serizawa develops a new type of weapon, but meanwhile Godzilla is getting closer and closer to Tokyo, obliterating everything in its path...

PARA-MEDIC

It was originally a Japanese movie, but they made an American version, too. I recommend seeing the original Japanese one if you ever get the chance.

PARA-MEDIC

It's mostly mindless fun, but it's also got a serious anti-nuke message as well.

SNAKE

Where can I see the original?

PARA-MEDIC

You'll just have to go to Japan.

SNAKE

Really... that's too bad.

PARA-MEDIC

If you wait 40 years, you might be able to see it in America, too.

SNAKE

Why is that?

PARA-MEDIC

2004 will be Godzilla's 50th birthday.

SNAKE

You think they're still going to be making Godzilla movies then?

PARA-MEDIC

Of course! Everybody loves Godzilla.

SNAKE

You sure know a lot about movies.

PARA-MEDIC

I don't suppose you're the movie watching type, are you?

SNAKE

Not really.

PARA-MEDIC

OK, then, I'll tell you everything I know.

PARA-MEDIC

When the going gets tough, movies can save your life. It's always good to be able to look at things from a different perspective when you get in a jam.

PARA-MEDIC

That's the magic of movies.

SNAKE

No kidding. Well, I guess it might at least make a nice distraction.

PARA-MEDIC

That's the spirit, Snake. Have a little fun.
Post-save conversation (2)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "007: From Russia with Love?"

SNAKE

I don't like those movies. Real spies are nothing like James Bond. It's pure fantasy.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, I don't think the Major's going to like you saying that.

SNAKE

And even though it's fiction, I can't help but comparing myself to Bond.

MAJOR TOM

What exactly don't you like about James Bond? Is it the fantastic gadgets? The cars? The guns?

SNAKE

Major...!

MAJOR TOM

Snake, wouldn't you like to have a gun shaped like a pen?

SNAKE

What good is a pen going to do me in the jungle? I'd look like a fool.

MAJOR TOM

Then what about a snake-shaped gun? You could make it look like you're grappling with a giant snake and then get a shot in on the enemy while they're distracted.

SNAKE

OK, now you're being ridiculous.

MAJOR TOM

We'll make you a snake-shaped gun that folds up and fits into an attaché case.

SNAKE

Will you give it a rest?

MAJOR TOM

Oh, I get it. You're worried about how to handle the ladies, aren't you?

SNAKE

No...

MAJOR TOM

I knew it. Hmm... To tell you the truth, I don't like the idea of playing hanky-panky with enemy femme fatales, either.

MAJOR TOM

But that's part of Bond's appeal. You could learn a thing or two from him.

MAJOR TOM

What about this EVA? What are you planning to do with her?

SNAKE

I... I don't even trust her yet.

MAJOR TOM

That's not what I mean. You can't let yourself get involved. This is a game of spy versus spy.

MAJOR TOM

She's using you just as much as you're using her.

SNAKE

I realize that.

MAJOR TOM

You've got to grab the initiative. And to do that, you have to get the upper hand in the relationship.

MAJOR TOM

That's what a spy is supposed to do.

SNAKE

Get the upper hand... I don't think I'm cut out for that mission.

MAJOR TOM

Maybe if you changed you code name to Double-O-Snake?

SNAKE

Major...

MAJOR TOM

007 is the biggest thing to come out of England since the Mayflower. I wouldn't be surprised if they made 20 more of those movies.

PARA-MEDIC

*slightly hushed voice* Didn't you know? The Major is a huge James Bond fan. Don't get him worked up like this.

SNAKE

Worked up?

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe you don't realize this, but now that you've got him started talking about Bond, I'm going to have to listen to him lecture for a whole hour after he gets off the radio.

SNAKE

You have my sympathy.

PARA-MEDIC

It's too bad you can't enjoy such a great movie, though.

SNAKE

I guess I'm just one of those people who can't enjoy spy flicks.
Post-save conversation (3)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, do you know "The Creature from the Black Lagoon"?

SNAKE

Nope, never heard of it.

PARA-MEDIC

These scientists are investigating a place deep in the Amazon called the Black Lagoon, and they get picked off one after the other by this fish-man thing.

PARA-MEDIC

*faster* And there was this scene when the heroine is going for a swim, and the creature sneaks up on her from underwater... Ooh, I thought my heart was going to stop!

PARA-MEDIC

*even faster* I mean, of course the 3-D effects in "It Came from Outer Space" were a lot more intense, but...

SNAKE

"It" wouldn't be referring to you coming from outer space would it?

PARA-MEDIC

How rude! Why do you say that?

SNAKE

Because no one on Earth could be as charming as you.

PARA-MEDIC

*sighs* Fine, I'll just get to the point, Snake. Be careful of what's around you when you're in the water.

PARA-MEDIC

Just imagining you swimming in those jungle rivers makes me think of you being attacked by a fish-man.

SNAKE

I appreciate the concern.

PARA-MEDIC

Fish-men aren't the only things that'll attack you in the water. Really, be careful out there.

SNAKE

OK.

PARA-MEDIC

And don't be attacking any pretty girls going for a swim, either.

SNAKE

Are you calling me a fish-man?

PARA-MEDIC

You started it.
Post-save conversation (4)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you heard of "It Came from Outer Space"?

SNAKE

Yeah, you told me already.

PARA-MEDIC

So this astronomer sees a meteor, but it's really an alien spaceship, right? And the aliens start replacing the townspeople with clones and forcing them to help repair the ship.

PARA-MEDIC

The 3-D effects were quite realistic...

SNAKE

I've got all the "real" I can handle here in the jungle.

PARA-MEDIC

No, you don't get it. Precisely because it's realistic, with the images jumping out of the screen at you, it makes for a nice escape from reality.

PARA-MEDIC

I have to admit it made my eyes tired, but it was really intense. Unfortunately, they don't make very many of those movies anymore.

SNAKE

When did it come out?

PARA-MEDIC

I was still in college, so probably about 10 years ago...

SNAKE

Guess I'm out of luck, then.

PARA-MEDIC

You know, they're coming out with household versions of video cassette recorders. One day, you'll be able to see old movies any time you want.

PARA-MEDIC

It'll be like having a movie theater in your own home!

SNAKE

Really?

PARA-MEDIC

It's like if you had a record with movie film etched onto it instead of music. It'll work the same way.

SNAKE

You're kidding.

PARA-MEDIC

No, really. And someday, they might make movies where you control the characters yourself.

SNAKE

Sounds like magic.

PARA-MEDIC

It'll happen. Make sure you stay alive to see it, Snake.
Post-save conversation (5)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you heard of "The Last War"?

SNAKE

Nope, doesn't ring a bell.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a Japanese movie where the world ends in a nuclear war.

PARA-MEDIC

Tensions between East and West reach the breaking point, and before anyone can stop it, they launch the ICBMs.

PARA-MEDIC

Humanity is wiped out by a war that no one wanted. The movie depicts that destruction from the eyes of ordinary people.

PARA-MEDIC

Their simple daily lives are torn apart by the terrible power of a war that has nothing to do with them.

SNAKE

Everybody's afraid of the next big war. But there's only so much that one person can do.

PARA-MEDIC

That's why the people who have the power to stop it, have to.
Post-save conversation (6)

PARA-MEDIC

Hey Snake, have you ever seen "Forbidden Planet"?

SNAKE

No, can't say I have.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this expedition that goes to the planet Altair-4 in an ultra-fast spaceship. When they arrive, they meet the survivor of the last expedition, Dr. Morbius.

PARA-MEDIC

Dr. Morbius was exploring the planet along with his daughter Altaira and the versatile Robby the Robot.

PARA-MEDIC

Ignoring the doctor's warnings, the expedition team is suddenly attacked by an invisible creature called the "Monster from the Id."

PARA-MEDIC

The special effects they used for the science stuff were really neat. I wish I had a robot like Robby that could make anything I wanted it to.

SNAKE

I'm more interested in that invisible monster. If I were invisible, I wouldn't have to bother hiding. Or wearing camouflage.

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe someday you will be able to turn invisible.

SNAKE

*self-deprecatingly* Yeah, that'll be the day...
Post-save conversation (7)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "Earth Vs The Spider"?

SNAKE

Nope.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this spider that suddenly mutates into a giant monster. They bring it into the city in a state of hibernation, but it wakes up and starts wrecking the place.

SNAKE

So why did the spider turn huge?

PARA-MEDIC

I told you. It suddenly mutated.

SNAKE

Yeah, right.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, it's people like you that take all the fun out of watching movies. Always nitpicking and taking things too seriously - honestly, why even bother?

PARA-MEDIC

Look, the important thing isn't that it got big.

SNAKE

Then what is important?

PARA-MEDIC

The fact that there's a huge spider destroying the city!

PARA-MEDIC

Suspend your disbelief... that's the whole point of movies.
Post-save conversation (8)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "On the Beach"?

SNAKE

No, don't know it.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about the survivors of the Third World War.

PARA-MEDIC

The entire northern hemisphere is obliterated in a nuclear holocaust, and it's only a matter of time before the few survivors left in the southern hemisphere are poisoned by the deadly fallout.

PARA-MEDIC

Their only hope is an American nuclear submarine that escapes to the southern hemisphere. They set out for the Arctic to investigate the fallout...

PARA-MEDIC

The movie came out in '59, and the year that the war was supposed to happen was 1964. In other words - this year.

SNAKE

Nice warning. Let's hope it stays just a movie.
Post-save conversation (9)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The War of the Worlds"?

SNAKE

Nnnno.

PARA-MEDIC

These flying saucers from Mars arrive on Earth disguised as meteorites. The saucers use their heat rays to attack the nearby towns...

PARA-MEDIC

And then...

PARA-MEDIC

Umm...

SNAKE

Something wrong?

PARA-MEDIC

Uh, the thing is, I was too scared to watch. I had my eyes shut almost the whole time.

SNAKE

Then you haven't seen it.

PARA-MEDIC

No, it's not that. It's... based on a novel by H. G. Wells...

SNAKE

You haven't seen it, have you?

PARA-MEDIC

That does remind me though--When I was 2 years old, my father listened to the radio drama version of the story. It was right after dinner on Sunday, and we were relaxing in the living room.

PARA-MEDIC

They said monsters had come out of meteorite that landed in New Jersey. It sounded just like a real live news broadcast.

PARA-MEDIC

My father said he and my older brother actually believed it and started yelling and panicking.

PARA-MEDIC

My mother supposedly grabbed me from my crib and took me out to the car still wrapped up in blankets.

PARA-MEDIC

But then, just as my dad was about to start the car, he realized that it was all just a radio drama.

PARA-MEDIC

Because on the car's radio, they were playing Bing Crosby tunes.

PARA-MEDIC

No matter what station he turned to, no one else seemed to be reporting on this big, history-making news story.

SNAKE

Sounds like something out of "The Big Broadcast."

PARA-MEDIC

Nobody said a word. We all went back to our rooms. My father and brother got off with a scolding from my mother. But I was the one who really suffered.

PARA-MEDIC

After that incident, every time I acted up, my father and brother would scare me by saying, "The Martians are coming!"

SNAKE

That's terrible.

PARA-MEDIC

Isn't it, though?

SNAKE

... So, you haven't seen the movie.

PARA-MEDIC

I... I saw it! So... so... even nuclear weapons wouldn't work against the Martian war machines.

SNAKE

Uh huh.

PARA-MEDIC

Anyway, Snake, if you conceal yourself like the Martians did, the enemy won't know what hit them.

SNAKE

Conceal myself?

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe not in a meteorite, but if you can hide yourself inside something a little more close at hand...

SNAKE

Hmm, close at hand...

PARA-MEDIC

Something like...a "box."

SNAKE

Ah, I get it... So, you never saw the movie.

PARA-MEDIC

I SAW it, all right!?
Post-save conversation (10)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake have you ever seen "For a Fistful of Dollars"?

SNAKE

Nope, never.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a spaghetti western.

SNAKE

*dubious* Spaghetti western?

PARA-MEDIC

It's really cool. Especially the main character's stylish gunplay.

SNAKE

Gun play... (Remembers Ocelot.)

PARA-MEDIC

I saw it in England on the Major's recommendation, but it hasn't come out in the States yet.

PARA-MEDIC

It's so cool! They'll bring it to America, I'm sure. You have to see it sometime.

SNAKE

Sure.
Post-save conversation (11)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen the movie "Them"?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about these giant ants that appear in the desert of New Mexico after a nuclear test. The army tries to fight them off with flamethrowers.

PARA-MEDIC

The ants were so big that they filled up the entire screen. The whole movie theater was screaming.

SNAKE

An ant that big could make a good meal.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, well, if you find any, don't eat them.

SNAKE

Come on, they're not that bad for you.

PARA-MEDIC

If you end up growing huge like that, you won't have any place left to hide.

SNAKE

Just like a Gurlugon. (A boss who appears in MGS2: Substance.)
Post-save conversation (12)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "Jason and the Argonauts"?

SNAKE

I can't say I have.

PARA-MEDIC

It's based on Greek mythology. There's this ship called the Argo, and it sets sail in search of the 'Golden Fleece.' Along the way, it encounters many dangers.

PARA-MEDIC

They run into all kinds of monsters, like bronze giants and the deadly seven-headed Hydra and the vicious, birdlike Harpies.

PARA-MEDIC

The most spectacular part of all was the battle scene with an army of skeletons. It was like they were actually standing up and fighting.

SNAKE

Are you serious?

PARA-MEDIC

If you don't believe me, go see it for yourself. Then you'll understand the magic of movies. It was totally amazing.

SNAKE

Yeah, all right. If I make it back alive, I'll go see it.

PARA-MEDIC

It just came out, so I'm sure it'll still be playing.
Post-save conversation (13)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "Dr. Strangelove, or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb"?

SNAKE

... What?

PARA-MEDIC

"Dr. Strangelove." Have you seen it?

SNAKE

Uh no.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this insane American Air Force commander who sends a bomber out to drop an H-bomb on Russia. It's a black comedy.

SNAKE

Doesn't sound very funny to me.

PARA-MEDIC

The actor who plays Dr. Strangelove also plays two of the other main characters.

PARA-MEDIC

It just came out this year, so I bet you could still go and see it...

SNAKE

Maybe when I'm in a lighter state of mind, I'll give it a try.
Post-save conversation (14)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The Guns of Navarone"?

SNAKE

Never.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about a mission to blow up the huge guns on the island of Navarone during World War II.

PARA-MEDIC

Six men are chosen to participate in the operation, each with his own special ability. They only have until an English destroyer passes by the island to complete their mission.

PARA-MEDIC

Facing impossible odds, the six men have to sneak onto the island from a cliff on the southern shore.

SNAKE

That doesn't sound like something I'd want to watch in my free time.

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe not for you, but the Major was absolutely crazy about it.

SNAKE

The Major...

PARA-MEDIC

He told me to tell you how great it was.

SNAKE

Tell him I'll go see it as soon as I get back to the States.

PARA-MEDIC

Do you want to tell him yourself?

SNAKE

Uh, no, let's save that for later. I'd better get back to the mission.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah...
Post-save conversation (15)

PARA-MEDIC

Hey Snake, have you seen "20,000 Leagues under the Sea"?

SNAKE

No, haven't seen that one.

PARA-MEDIC

After a number of battleships mysteriously sink at sea, the American government investigates and finds that the culprit is this pacifistic Captain Nemo.

PARA-MEDIC

The scene where the giant squid attacks Captain Nemo's submarine the Nautilus is breathtaking.

PARA-MEDIC

The movie was filmed in Cinemascope, and it was great to see it on the big screen.

SNAKE

A giant squid huh...

PARA-MEDIC

What? Don't tell me you think it sounds tasty.
Post-save conversation (16)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The Beast from 20,000 Fathoms"?

SNAKE

Nope.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this monster that comes to life from deep within a glacier as a result of an H-bomb test in the Arctic. It crosses the ocean and emerges in New York.

PARA-MEDIC

I especially liked the scene where the monster attacks the lighthouse, and the one where it pops out of a valley in Manhattan and makes a big hole in a building.

PARA-MEDIC

And the last scene on the burning roller coaster was simply incredible.

PARA-MEDIC

And because I saw it in a drive-in theater, I actually felt like I was part of the movie.

PARA-MEDIC

It's funny, isn't it? How you can let yourself get absorbed into these things without thinking even when you know it's not real.

SNAKE

Distinguishing between what's real and what's not isn't always as simple as we think.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, don't get too absorbed in your mission. It's important to take a rest every now and then.
Post-save conversation (17)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "The Magnificent Seven"?

SNAKE

Sorry.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a remake of the Japanese classic "The Seven Samurai," only in a Western setting.

PARA-MEDIC

This tiny Mexican village is attacked every year by bandits. Finally, the village elder can't stand it any longer and decides to hire someone to protect the village.

PARA-MEDIC

Seven gunmen respond to the call. They teach the villagers how to shoot and prepare for the oncoming attack.

PARA-MEDIC

But then the enemy shows up at the village with a huge band.

SNAKE

Then what happens?

PARA-MEDIC

You'll just have to see it for yourself. I don't want to spoil it.

SNAKE

... Oh.

PARA-MEDIC

Movies are only fun when you actually watch them. They're something you have to experience for yourself.
Post-save conversation (18)

PARA-MEDIC

Hey Snake, have you ever seen "My Mother was a Teenage Spider Queen from Mars"?

SNAKE

I can't say that I have...

PARA-MEDIC

... Neither have I.
Post-save conversation (19)

SNAKE

Para-Medic, what was that movie you were talking about earlier?

PARA-MEDIC

Which one?

SNAKE

My mother... the teenage... whatever.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, that. Sorry, the Major was talking to me at the time and I wasn't really paying attention. Don't worry, I'll get it right next time.

SNAKE

Hmm... (Was kind of looking forward to it.)
Post-save conversation (20)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "North by Northwest?"

SNAKE

Missed that one.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this ordinary guy who runs an ad agency. He's mistaken for someone else and gets kidnapped and forced to do a certain job.

PARA-MEDIC

As a result, he gets tangled up in a conspiracy, and pretty soon he's traveling to New York, Chicago, and even Mount Rushmore in pursuit of the real culprit.

PARA-MEDIC

Hitchcock's films always keep you on the edge of your seat, but sometimes they can be funny when you least expect it. That's why I love them.

SNAKE

Have you seen all of his films?

PARA-MEDIC

All of them? Not even close. He's been making movies since before I was born. I guess I might have seen some of them on TV...

PARA-MEDIC

But the first movie I ever saw in the theater was a Hitchcock film. We all went and saw it as a family. It was "Rebecca."

SNAKE

This was when you were a kid?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, my parents loved watching movies, so they took me along. I didn't quite understand the plot, but for some reason I thought it was really scary.

PARA-MEDIC

Actually, I remember the candy bar they bought me on the way home better than the movie itself.

SNAKE

That's when you fell in love with movies?

PARA-MEDIC

You could say that. It was like an irresistible force - at that point, I was completely swept away.
Post-save conversation (21)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever heard of "The Blob"?

SNAKE

No, I haven't.

PARA-MEDIC

A meteorite falls in a small town, and inside there's this kind of living ooze. The ooze starts swallowing people and grows to an enormous size.

PARA-MEDIC

After it eats a bunch of the townspeople, it starts to fill up a movie theater.

PARA-MEDIC

Then these young people try to save the town from its gruesome fate.

PARA-MEDIC

It's pretty frightening to see something that's not even supposed to be alive suddenly start moving around and eating people.

SNAKE

Not something you see everyday.
Post-save conversation (25)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, you know "The Bridge on the River Kwai"?

SNAKE

Haven't seen it.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about a group of Allied prisoners in Japanese-occupied Burma in World War II who work together to build a bridge.

PARA-MEDIC
