Under the leadership of an English officer, the prisoners and the Japanese gradually bring the project toward completion.

PARA-MEDIC

But at the same time, the Allied forces are hatching a plan to blow up the bridge.

SNAKE

War and futility go hand in hand.

PARA-MEDIC

I suppose so.

SNAKE

I didn't think you were the type to go for war movies, though.

PARA-MEDIC

Actually, this guy invited me to go see it with him.

SNAKE

A date?

PARA-MEDIC

I guess you could call it that.

SNAKE

Still, you just don't seem like the type.

PARA-MEDIC

Well, he seemed to like war movies. He was a Navy boy. I was still an intern back then.

PARA-MEDIC

They brought him in with a broken leg. He said, "When I'm all healed up, will you go see a movie with me to celebrate? If it's okay..." He was so shy.

SNAKE

Where is he now?

PARA-MEDIC

With the Seventh Fleet.

SNAKE

I see... (At the time, the Seventh Fleet instigated the Vietnam War in the Gulf of Tonkin.)
Post-save conversation (26)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "Invasion of the Body Snatchers"?

SNAKE

Y... no, I haven't.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this town where, one by one, the people disappear and are replaced by someone else.

PARA-MEDIC

It keeps getting worse and worse, until finally the main character's friends and family start getting replaced.

PARA-MEDIC

It turns out it was a giant plant thing producing human clones. Creepy, huh?

SNAKE

Clones?

PARA-MEDIC

A clone is a body or cell that's genetically identical to another one. They didn't use that term in the movie, though.

SNAKE

*suppressing a laugh* You mean a copy of a human being?

PARA-MEDIC

It's technologically feasible. We know it's possible to do it in theory, and they've already started the research.

PARA-MEDIC

One day - maybe toward the beginning of the next century - the genes of super soldiers like you are going to be a hot commodity.

SNAKE

Just to make copies of me?

PARA-MEDIC

Precisely.

SNAKE

Like a thoroughbred horse?

PARA-MEDIC

Right.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

...

SNAKE

You know they'd never allow it.

PARA-MEDIC

Maybe. But technology changes people. We can't predict how people will think 50 years from now.

SNAKE

Some things shouldn't be changed.

PARA-MEDIC

We're not the ones who decide that.

PARA-MEDIC

I think maybe the only thing we can do is to try and pass on our beliefs to our children.

PARA-MEDIC

So that they won't head in the wrong direction.
Post-save conversation (27)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The Alamo"?

SNAKE

No, I haven't seen that one.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a true story about a band of American volunteers holed up in a fort called the Alamo. They fight against the Mexican army for the freedom of Texas.

SNAKE

Remember the Alamo...

PARA-MEDIC

Now the Alamo is Los Alamos: the center of the atomic bomb project.

SNAKE

How ironic.
Post-save conversation (28)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "Curse of the Werewolf"?

SNAKE

Nope.

PARA-MEDIC

There's this young woman who's in the service of a nobleman. She can't stand the cruel treatment she's given and runs away from the castle.

PARA-MEDIC

She collapses in the woods, but is saved by a scholarly couple from a nearby town. In the end she dies giving birth to a baby boy.

PARA-MEDIC

That boy undergoes a strange transformation every time the moon is full. Before he knows it, he's turning into a werewolf and killing people.

PARA-MEDIC

The terrible curse grows so bad that he can no longer control himself and starts to hurt the ones he loves.

SNAKE

Poor guy.

PARA-MEDIC

It's frightening when you can't take responsibility for your own actions. You be careful, too. Don't do anything you might regret later.

SNAKE

That's why I call and SAVE with you, right?

PARA-MEDIC

It's more than just that. Don't you ever forget to look where you're going and rush out where the enemy can see you, or use too much ammo or too many items.

PARA-MEDIC

Acting without thinking can be dangerous. Always pay attention to your surroundings and know what's going on around you. ...Eh?

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, above you!

SNAKE

*looks up instantly* !?

PARA-MEDIC

Nice reflexes. Keep that up and you'll do fine.

SNAKE

Right...
Post-save conversation (29)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The Thing"?

SNAKE

No... don't think so.

PARA-MEDIC

The corpse of an alien life form is found in the Arctic and taken back to a base.

PARA-MEDIC

When the corpse thaws out, it comes back to life and starts attacking the scientists and soldiers in the base.

SNAKE

Scientists and soldiers, huh? They sure have it rough.

PARA-MEDIC

The victims in these kinds of movies are usually soldiers or scientists. They get their blood sucked by the alien.

SNAKE

If I see any aliens, I'll be sure to keep my distance.

PARA-MEDIC

Knowing you, you'd probably catch it and eat it...
Post-save conversation (30)

PARA-MEDIC

Hey Snake, have you ever seen "Frankenstein"?

SNAKE

No.

PARA-MEDIC

The scientist Dr. Frankenstein succeeds in creating a human being out of dead body parts.

PARA-MEDIC

But his creation escapes from the laboratory and heads down to the nearby town. The creature is physically strong, but mentally he's like an innocent child.

PARA-MEDIC

So his emotions drive him to kill people, and he doesn't even understand what he's doing.

PARA-MEDIC

The scene where he's playing with flowers with a little girl by the side of a lake sent chills down my spine.

SNAKE

A classic tale about the dangers of rapid scientific progress. When human beings become too powerful, they lose their ability to think rationally.

PARA-MEDIC

Really makes you think, doesn't it? Especially nowadays.
Post-save conversation (31)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein"?

SNAKE

Hmm... no.

PARA-MEDIC

Abbott and Costello play delivery men who have to deliver a box to a spooky mansion. But what they don't know is that inside the box are Frankenstein and Wolf Man.

PARA-MEDIC

Then Dracula shows up and they get chased around by the monsters. It's a comedy with an all-star monster cast.

SNAKE

Sometimes tragedy can be funny.
Post-save conversation (33)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you seen "The Incredible Shrinking Man"?

SNAKE

Uh uh.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this guy whose body starts shrinking after he's exposed to a combination of radiation and insecticide. After a while, he's being stalked by tiny spiders and his pet cat.

PARA-MEDIC

Imagine that, Snake. The guy's body just keeps getting smaller and smaller.

SNAKE

I thought you were a doctor.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, so?

SNAKE

So how can you get so excited about a story you know could never happen in real life?

PARA-MEDIC

Whether I'm a doctor or not has nothing to do with it. It's a movie. You can't expect it to follow the same rules as real life, can you?

PARA-MEDIC

It's the same no matter who you are. Movies are fun because they take you away from your everyday life.

SNAKE

Even though they're not real?

PARA-MEDIC

BECAUSE they're not real. You need to loosen up, Snake.

SNAKE

Yeah, maybe...

PARA-MEDIC

Although in your case, reality might be more exciting than the movies.
Post-save conversation (34)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The Quatermass Xperiment"?

SNAKE

Nope.

PARA-MEDIC

These three astronauts go up in a test rocket. Two of them get vaporized, but the third comes back with a bizarre change in his body.

PARA-MEDIC

After conducting an investigation, they discover that the astronauts were attacked by an alien life form.

PARA-MEDIC

But then the surviving astronaut escapes and starts looking for prey.

SNAKE

Prey?

PARA-MEDIC

Anything he touches with his hand has the energy sucked out of it. Every time that happens, his body gets bigger and bigger.

PARA-MEDIC

... Space is a scary place. You never know what's out there waiting.

SNAKE

Yeah. Even if your body doesn't change, your mind might never be the same.

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah. That's what I've heard happens.
Post-save conversation (34)

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever seen "The Day the Earth Stood Still"?

SNAKE

Never heard of it.

PARA-MEDIC

It's about this man who comes to Earth in a flying saucer and warns us humans against using nuclear power to make war.

PARA-MEDIC

But when the human race fails to meet his demands, he causes all motion on the face of the Earth to come to a standstill.

SNAKE

We could really use a visit from that guy right about now.

PARA-MEDIC

He was a friendly alien who wanted peace on Earth.

SNAKE

If only there were more people like him on this planet.

PARA-MEDIC

Let's hope your wish comes true.
Post-save conversation (35)
*If player saves in the cell after being tortured

PARA-MEDIC

Snake...?

SNAKE

*groans* ...

PARA-MEDIC

Snake?

SNAKE

My mouth hurts when I talk.

PARA-MEDIC

Did you get cut up?

SNAKE

*snorts* It feels like someone shoved me under a lawnmower... Do me a favor. Tell me a story to take my mind off the pain.

PARA-MEDIC

Snake, have you ever heard of Renfield?

SNAKE

Is that a movie?

PARA-MEDIC

It's the name of a character. He's locked up in a cell, waiting for the master to return, eating the spiders that crawl along the walls.

SNAKE

Change the channel.

PARA-MEDIC

He waits and waits for ages. Finally, just as he's beginning to forget whether he's human or not, the master comes for him, saying "the time has come." Renfield is overjoyed.

SNAKE

Wait, isn't this...

PARA-MEDIC

The master spreads his huge wings, and a gust of wind fills the cell.

SNAKE

C'mon, I don't want to hear this...

PARA-MEDIC

And there, standing before Renfield in human form, was...

SNAKE

Dracula...!

PARA-MEDIC

Exactly! If you stay there too long, your old buddy Dracula's going to come and get you, too. So you'd better start thinking of a way out of there.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

You better not leave me without someone to talk to.

SNAKE

...

PARA-MEDIC

Please, Snake. Think. There's got to be a way out of there.

SNAKE

... I'll try.

PARA-MEDIC

OK. Just let me know if you start having nightmares about Dracula.

SNAKE

...
•Camouflage
What is camouflage?
(1)

SIGINT

Patterned clothing, facepaint, tactical movements - these are the elements of camouflage that will allow you to deceive your enemy.
(2)

SIGINT

To camouflage yourself, first press the Menu Button to check out the Survival viewer.

SIGINT

Then select "CAMOUFLAGE" and you'll see two more options: "FACE" and "UNIFORM."

SIGINT

Choose "FACE" to apply face paint, and "UNIFORM" to change your field uniform. Simple really.

SIGINT

Make sure and choose something that'll match your surroundings.
Choosing a pattern

SIGINT

Your field uniform is not just a set of threads to wear.

SIGINT

To get the max-effect out of your camouflage, you gotta correspond with your environment.

SIGINT

So no matter where you are, make sure to choose a camo pattern that lets you blendin.
Face paint
(1)

SIGINT

Covering your body is a good start, but a bare face will kill even the best camouflage.

SIGINT

If the situation calls for a high Camo Index, you'd better break out the face paint.
(2)

SIGINT

To apply face paint, select "FACE" from the "CAMOUFLAGE" menu in the Survival Viewer.

SIGINT

Then, choose a face paint that blends in with your surroundings.
The Camo Index

SIGINT

The Camo Index, located in the top right corner of the screen, tells you if your outfit is gettin' the job done.

SIGINT

The higher the value of this index, the harder it is for the enemy to spot you.

SIGINT

Try your best to keep the Camo Index as high as possible.
Camouflage and stances

SIGINT

So you've got your uniform and your face paint, but that alone isn't enough to make for good camouflage.

SIGINT

Camouflage means blending in with nature. To make your disguise complete, you've got to keep a low profile and avoid overt movements.

SIGINT

As long as you've got the uniform and face paint workin' for you, and you're lying flat keepin' still, you won't have to worry about being spotted from a distance.

SIGINT

On the flip side, dancin' around your enemy in perfect camo is still a dead giveaway.

SIGINT

So if the enemy's looking for you and he's gettin' too close for comfort, just lay low for the time being.
•Camo Fatigues
Naked
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, what's up? Why are you naked?
(2)

SIGINT

I know there's a "NAKED" option under "UNIFORM" that lets you take off the upper part of your uniform.

SIGINT

But without a shirt on, your camouflage sucks, and your stamina goes down faster. You don't get any advantages whatsoever.
(3)

SNAKE

Sure there are.

SIGINT

Like what?

SNAKE

It feels good.

SIGINT

... Man, you do whatever you want.

SNAKE

I will, thanks. Just one question, though.

SIGINT

What?

SNAKE

Is there a way to take off my pants?

SIGINT

Say WHAT!?

SNAKE

My pants, can I...

SIGINT

Ah, hell no! This FOX Unit is a nut fest!

SNAKE

...
Olive Drab
(1)

SIGINT

I see you're wearing the olive drab uniform.
(2)

SIGINT

Olive drab, or O.D. for short, is the standard battle uniform for G.I.s.

SIGINT

It's a solid-color outfit with no camouflage pattern, so naturally it's not going to be much use as camouflage. I'd change into something else as soon as possible if I were you.
Tiger Stripe
(1)

SIGINT

You're wearing the tiger stripe pattern camouflage, huh?
(2)

SIGINT

Tiger stripe is a forest camouflage. As you may have guessed by the name, it mimics the stripe pattern on a tiger's coat.

SIGINT

It was originally worn by South Vietnamese Marines. Then it caught the attention of an American military advisor, and now they're thinking of introducing it into all kinds of special forces units.

SIGINT

It works best in places with lots of trees and grass, but it should blend in with dirt and mud, too.
Leaf
(1)

SIGINT

Wearing the leaf pattern camouflage, are you?
(2)

SIGINT

Leaf pattern is a forest camouflage created to provide cover in woodland areas.

SIGINT

Now that our involvement in Vietnam looks set to expand, they're thinking about adopting it for official use.

SIGINT

It'll help you blend in especially well when you're hiding in the bushes.
Tree Bark
(1)

SIGINT

So you're wearing the tree bark camouflage.
(2)

SIGINT

Tree bark is a forest pattern created primarily for use by hunters.

SIGINT

It'll give you an exceptionally low profile if you wear it when you're pressed up against a tree.
Chocolate Chip
(1)

SIGINT

Ah, you're wearing the chocolate chip pattern.

SNAKE

Chocolate chip? You mean this camouflage?

SIGINT

Yeah.

SNAKE

I've never heard of a camo pattern called that before...

SIGINT

Yeah, I know. I just thought it up right now. (In reality, It was actually developed during the Gulf War.)
(2)

SIGINT

The chocolate chip pattern is probably designed to provide cover in a desert environment.

SIGINT

It should work best against a sandy or rocky background.
(3)

SNAKE

Makes sense. But why'd you call it chocolate chip?

SIGINT

Cause that's what it reminds me of.

SNAKE

What?

SIGINT

Those little round cookies the Major is always snackin' on.

ZERO

They're not cookies. They're scones.

SIGINT

Major!

ZERO

And it's not a snack. It's afternoon tea.

SIGINT

Snack, tea, same thing.

ZERO

No, it's not! Look here, afternoon tea is a fine old English tradition.

SIGINT

Uh oh. Here we go again. Talk to you later, Snake.

ZERO

The origins of afternoon tea go back to the Victorian Era. Anna Maria, the seventh Duchess of Bedford, was...
Splitter
(1)

SIGINT

Looks like you're wearing the splitter pattern camo.
(2)

SIGINT

Splitter was used quite a bit in World War II on German aircraft and stuff.

SIGINT

The pattern helped mask the plane's attitude and direction in dogfights. Even now, it's still being used as camouflage in some places.

SIGINT

It works best when you wear it against a steel or stone background.
Raindrop
(1)

SIGINT

Wearing raindrop pattern camo, huh?
(2)

SIGINT

Raindrop was used by Germany during World War II. Even now, it's still used a lot in Eastern Europe.

SIGINT

It's designed to be especially inconspicuous in the rain, so you'll get the most out of it if you put it on during a downpour.
Squares
(1)

SIGINT

Looks like you've got the squares pattern on.
(2)

SIGINT

Squares is a mountain camo that's basically a bunch of square patterns.

SIGINT

It might look conspicuous at first glance, but it actually blurs the contours of the person wearing it and makes them more difficult to pick out.

SIGINT

It should give you a low profile against reddish backgrounds, like bricks and rusty metal.
Water
(1)

SIGINT

Wearing the water pattern, are we?
(2)

SIGINT

The water pattern was used a lot by the old German Defense Force.

SIGINT

Even though it's called the water pattern, it wasn't designed specifically to blend in underwater.

SIGINT

They only gave it that name because the pattern resembles the waves on the surface of a pool of water.

SIGINT

But still, it really does look like it could be confused for liquid waves. It might conceal you underwater.
Black
(1)

SIGINT

So, you're wearing the black camouflage.
(2)

SIGINT

The black uniform isn't really camouflage.

SIGINT

It was intended to have a psychological shock effect on enemies in hostage-rescue operations and stuff like that.

SIGINT

But it should also make you pretty hard to see if you wear it in a dark environment. And it might also work on black, earthy surfaces like you'd find in swamps.
Snow
(1)

SIGINT

The camo pattern you're wearing now is called snow.
(2)

SIGINT

Snow, as you might have guessed, is a winter camouflage developed to provide cover in a snowy environment.

SIGINT

It's not solid white, though. It's got a little bit of vegetation pattern mixed in, too.

SIGINT

It should work pretty well if you wear it against a white background.
Sneaking Suit
(1)
*If player is wearing Sneaking Suit

SIGINT

Those are some funky clothes you're wearing.
(2)
*If player has obtained Sneaking Suit but isn't wearing it

SIGINT

Looks like you got yourself some funky clothes there.
(3)

SNAKE

Yeah. It's called a sneaking suit.

SIGINT

Sneaking suit? What's that all about?

SNAKE

I'm not sure, but it looks like what The Boss was wearing...

SIGINT

Huh. Well, whatever it is, it's a fine piece of work.

SIGINT

The suit seems to be made of some kind of special bulletproof fiber. Wearing it should reduce all the damage you take by half.

SIGINT

The waterproofing and heat and moisture insulation are top-notch. Just having it on will reduce the amount of stamina you burn.

SIGINT

It even increases your overall Camo Index. You got yourself a keeper, Snake.

SNAKE

Yeah. Maybe we should make it the official uniform of FOX.
Scientist uniform
(1)

SIGINT

So, you're wearing the scientist uniform.
(2)

SIGINT

Wearing that scientist outfit lets you pose as a scientist.

SIGINT

But be forewarned - you can't equip most of your weapons while you're disguised as a scientist.

SIGINT

Even when you're disguised, your cover will be blown if you get blood on your clothes or something.

SIGINT

If you do get blood on your clothes, take them off and switch to another outfit. The blood stain should come out after a little while.
(3)
*If player is wearing it in a situation other than the lab infiltration

SIGINT

But, uh, Snake...

SNAKE

What?

SIGINT

There's really no point wearing a scientist uniform out there.

SNAKE

Why not?

SIGINT

Why not? Look around you! You see any scientists?

SNAKE

No.

SIGINT

So why are you wearing it?

SNAKE

Because I feel like it.

SIGINT

... Man, you're screwed up.
Officer's uniform
(1)
*If disguise is complete

SIGINT

OK, you're disguised as Raikov.

SIGINT

You ought to be able to pass for the real deal in that outfit.

SIGINT

You can go anywhere you want and nobody's going to ask questions.

SIGINT

But don't forget that you can't equip most of your weapons when you're in disguise.
(2)
*If disguise isn't complete

SIGINT

OK, you're wearing Raikov's uniform. But there's still something missing. I don't think the disguise is going to work unless you make yourself look more like him.
(3)
*After end of Raikov disguise event

SIGINT

You're wearing Raikov's uniform?

SIGINT

But the enemy already knows you disguised yourself as him, and on top of that, you lost your cap.

SIGINT

I don't think that disguise is going to fool anyone anymore.

SIGINT

Besides, that uniform doesn't have any camouflage patterns, so your Camo Index is going to be low.

SIGINT

Don't you think you'd be better off wearing some other kind of gear?
Maintenance crew uniform
(1)

SIGINT

You're wearing a maintenance crew uniform?
(2)

SIGINT

With the maintenance crew uniform on, you can pretend you're one of the workers assigned to the Shagohod hangar.
(3)

SIGINT

But people are going to suspect something's up if you suddenly get down on your belly or start punching somebody. Don't do anything that'll draw suspicion.
(4)
*If player is wearing it outside of the hangar

SIGINT

But there aren't any maintenance personnel around there. All that outfit's going to do is make you stand out.

SIGINT

I'd change into something else if I were you.
Tuxedo
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, what are you wearing now?

SNAKE

A tuxedo.

SIGINT

What, you late for a wedding or something?

SIGINT

Come to think about it, the tuxedo is an all-black outfit. It'll probably help you blend in in a dark environment.

SIGINT

One thing you can't do, though, is equip knife-type weapons. And you can't use CQC, either. Remember that.
Hornet Stripe

SIGINT

Snake, what's that camouflage...?

SNAKE

It's called 'hornet stripe.' I got it from The Pain.

SIGINT

No kidding. Sounds like a pretty unique design. From the looks of it, it's somehow infused with the power of hornets.

SNAKE

The power of hornets?

SIGINT

Sure. When you're wearing that outfit, hornets won't attack you. Neither will spiders or leeches.

SIGINT

You might even be able to tame the ones that come flying out of a hive.
Spider

SIGINT

Hey Snake, what's that you're wearing...?

SNAKE

It's spider camouflage. It used to belong to The Fear.

SIGINT

Is that right? Well, it's not as good as the stuff The Fear was wearing, but it still seems to have a pretty decent amount of stealth capability.

SIGINT

From the looks of it, the wearer uses stamina to power the stealth function.

SIGINT

With this thing on, your Camo Index will stay at a high level no matter where you go.

SIGINT

But if you run out of stamina, the stealth function will stop working. Keep that in mind.
Moss

SIGINT

Snake, what's that you're wearing...?

SNAKE

It's moss camouflage. I got it from The End.

SIGINT

Interesting. It seems to have part of The End's power sealed within it.

SIGINT

If you wear it in a place where the sun shines, you'll automatically recover stamina.

SIGINT

It'll also give you a high rate of camouflage in Svyatogornyj and Sokrovenno, The End's home territory.
Fire

SIGINT

Snake, what's that you're wearing now...?

SNAKE

It's fire camouflage. The Fury had it on him.

SIGINT

That camouflage seems to have fire-resistant properties.

SIGINT

When you wear it, you'll only take half damage from flames and explosions. You won't ever get burned, either.

SIGINT

Sounds like something The Fury would use, all right.
Spirit

SIGINT

Eh? That's some bizarre camo you got on, Snake...

SNAKE

It's spirit camo... I think it was a gift from The Sorrow.

SIGINT

The Sorrow? But he's been... (But I thought he was dead?—wonders if Snake's lost his mind.)

SIGINT

Man, I don't even want to know. Anyway, that camouflage seems to have some kind of special power.

SIGINT

When you're wearing it and grab an enemy using CQC, you can drain stamina out of the enemy while choking him. And you won't make a sound when you move around.

SNAKE

Sounds good.

SIGINT

*puzzled* ... Tell me the truth. Did you really get that from The Sorrow?

SNAKE

Yeah.

SIGINT

... Hell, the Major says he's been abducted by a UFO, so why not...?

SNAKE

???
Cold War

SIGINT

Snake, what kind of camo is that?

SNAKE

It's called Cold War. Volgin had it with him.

SIGINT

Cold War camo, huh. Well, I suppose the Soviets won't attack you from behind when you've got that thing on.

SNAKE

Really? You mean it's got advantages other than being stylish?

SIGINT

Stylish?

SNAKE

Yeah. Don't you think so?

SIGINT

Ah... sure, whatever you say. (Doesn't think it looks cool at all.)
Snake

SIGINT

Eh? That's some crazy camouflage you got on.

SNAKE

Yeah. It's snake camo.

SIGINT

Snake? Well, I guess it does kind of suit you.

SNAKE

Thanks for the compliment.

SIGINT

... Still, it does look like pretty effective stuff.

SIGINT

It's a good all-purpose camo -- it should give you a high level of cover against just about any type of background.
GA-KO

SIGINT

Snake, what is that stuff you're wearing?

SNAKE

I dunno. It's called GA-KO camo, whatever that means...

PARA-MEDIC

What!?

SIGINT

Para-Medic...?

PARA-MEDIC

You've never heard of GA-KO?

SNAKE

Nope.

SIGINT

Never.

PARA-MEDIC

You must live in a cave or something...

SIGINT

Well, excuse me.

SIGINT

By the way, Snake, that outfit is really killing your Camo Index. Unless you want the enemy to see you, I'd suggest you change your clothes as...

PARA-MEDIC

Why?

SIGINT

Why? Because his Camo Index is...

PARA-MEDIC

Camo Index, shmamo Index.

SIGINT

Hold on now...

PARA-MEDIC

He's wearing the GA-KO suit.

SIGINT

Why?

PARA-MEDIC

Because it looks cute.

SIGINT

Snake, talk some sense into her!

SNAKE

What's wrong with being cute?

SIGINT

... Am I the only normal person around here...?
•Face Paints
Normal
(1)

SIGINT

Eh? You mean you're not wearing any face paint?
(2)

SIGINT

You can take off your face paint by selecting "NO PAINT" from "FACE."

SIGINT

Just select "NO PAINT" when you want to skip wearing any face paint at all.

SIGINT

But your Camo Index is never going to be as high without face paint as it is with it.

SIGINT

Unless you want the enemy to see you, you ought to be wearing face paint.
Woodland
(1)

SIGINT

So, you're wearing woodland face paint.
(2)

SIGINT

The woodland paint is most effective in forest environments.

SIGINT

It'll work best if you use it when infiltrating forest areas.
Black
(1)

SIGINT

Wearing black face paint, huh?
(2)

SIGINT

Painting your face with black paint should give you a high rate of camouflage in dark areas.
Water
(1)

SIGINT

Wearing the water face paint, are you?
(2)

SIGINT

Water face paint should be most effective underwater.

SIGINT

So, put it on when you want to hide in the water.
Desert
(1)

SIGINT

Looks like you got your face painted in desert color.
(2)

SIGINT

Desert is a brown-colored face paint used for operations in mountainous terrain as well.

SIGINT

It should let you blend in well in mountain and desert environments.
Splitter
(1)

SIGINT

Looks like you're using splitter face paint.
(2)

SIGINT

Splitter is an indoor face paint.

SIGINT

Painting your face with splitter should help you blend in better when you're infiltrating a building.
Snow
(1)

SIGINT

You're wearing snow face paint.
(2)

SIGINT

Snow face paint was designed for use in arctic operations.

SIGINT

It's most effective against snowy backgrounds.
Kabuki

SIGINT

Snake, what's that face paint you're wearing?

SNAKE

Kabuki.

SIGINT

Kabuki?

SNAKE

Right. It's used in traditional Japanese theater. Apparently, it gives whoever's wearing it some kind of mystical power.

SIGINT

Get out of here.

SNAKE

That's what I heard.

SIGINT

From who?

SNAKE

Para-Medic

SIGINT

Figures. Well, whatever it does, it doesn't make for very good camouflage.

SNAKE

Really?

SIGINT

Yeah. You should switch to another kind of paint.

SNAKE

But I was just starting to like it...

SIGINT

...
Zombie

SIGINT

Snake, your face paint, it's...

SNAKE

I know. It's called zombie.

SIGINT

Zombie? What does that mean?

SNAKE

Beats me.

PARA-MEDIC

Are you serious!?

SIGINT

Hello, Para-Medic...

PARA-MEDIC

You mean you've never heard of zombies?

SNAKE

Nope.

SIGINT

Never.

PARA-MEDIC

You guys don't know anything.

PARA-MEDIC

A zombie is a dead body that's been cursed and brought back to life by a master of black magic.

PARA-MEDIC

Supposedly, they revive the dead and use them as slaves.

PARA-MEDIC

It's also seen as a kind of punishment - people who commit terrible crimes can be forced to labor even after they're dead.

SNAKE

Interesting... how do you know all this stuff?

PARA-MEDIC

I saw it in movies.

PARA-MEDIC

Like "White Zombie." Never seen it?

SNAKE

Nope.

SIGINT

Can't say I have.

PARA-MEDIC

How about "Plan 9 from Outer Space"?

SNAKE

No.

SIGINT

Missed it.

PARA-MEDIC

You can't just focus on the things you like all the time. You have to expand your horizons, try new things. You guys need to get out more.

SNAKE

... (Look who's talking.)

SIGINT

... Yeah, well, anyway, that face paint doesn't look all that useful.

SIGINT

Go ahead and wear it if you want, but I think you should change to...

PARA-MEDIC

You don't need to change anything.

SIGINT

Why not?

PARA-MEDIC

It makes him look awesome.

SIGINT

...

PARA-MEDIC

Doesn't it?

SIGINT

Look, arguing about it isn't going to get us anywhere. Snake, you do whatever you want.

PARA-MEDIC

It does makes you look cool!
Oyama

SIGINT

Snake, what's with that face paint...?

SNAKE

It's called Oyama.

SIGINT

Oyama?

SNAKE

Yeah. It's the name of an androgynous Japanese deity.

SIGINT

Are you serious?

SNAKE

That's what I heard.

SIGINT

From who?

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

SIGINT

... Nevermind.

SIGINT

In any case, that face paint doesn't seem to work very well. Your Camo Index is way down.

SIGINT

Unless you want the enemy to see you, I'd change to something else.

SNAKE

*disappointed* Oh... OK...

SIGINT

Let me guess. You were just getting to like it.

SNAKE

It kind of grew on me...

SIGINT

... Fine. Get yourself shot.
Disguise mask
(1)

SIGINT

Ah, you're wearing the mask.

SIGINT

I made it myself. Pretty good work, don't you think?

SIGINT

A while back they were planning to disguise someone as this one GRU officer and send them in to steal some secret documents.

SIGINT

I created the mask for that operation. But then the mission ended up being canceled... And then the Major came and told me to throw it out? Can you believe that guy?

SNAKE

But you didn't throw it out.

SIGINT

Are you kidding? Tossing a superior quality product like that into the garbage without using it would be an insult to science.
(2)
*If player was wearing disguise mask at the start of the game

SIGINT

So I decided to use it to hide your face from the crew of the gunship during the Virtuous Mission.
(3)
*If player wasn't wearing disguise mask at the start of the game

SIGINT

So I decided to sneak it into your gear.
(4)

SNAKE

OK... but is it really that big of a deal?

SIGINT

Of course it is.

SNAKE

What's so great about it?

SIGINT

Everything.

SIGINT

But if I had to pick one reason, I'd have to say it's because it's the first mask ever that can blink its eyes.

SNAKE

What about the lips?

SIGINT

What's that?

SNAKE

Can it open its mouth?

SIGINT

Ha ha ha! That's a good one, Snake. You're crazy, man.

SNAKE

I'm serious...

SIGINT

Are you even listening to me, Snake? Where's your common sense!? Damn! (In Sigint's mind, the reason for this is self-explanatory.)

SNAKE

S... sorry...????
•Weapons
Cigarette Knockout Gas Gun
(1)

SIGINT

So you found yourself a cigarette-shaped narcosis gun.

SIGINT

The cigarette-shaped narcosis gun is just what the name says - a sleeping gas gun shaped like a cigarette.

SIGINT

It must be a test model that Granin's lab is working on for KGB spies.

SIGINT

Equip it and press the Weapon Button to fire sleeping gas. It's got a short range, but any enemy that gets hit by the gas will be knocked out cold.
(2)
*During lab infiltration

SIGINT

You can't be seen with a weapon while you're disguised as a scientist.

SIGINT

But you ought to be able to equip that cigarette gun without attracting any attention.

SIGINT

Make the most of it.
Knockout Handkerchief
(1)

SIGINT

Ah. A handkerchief soaked with a knockout drug, you say?

SIGINT

With that thing, I'll bet you could put the enemy to sleep just by grabbing them in CQC.

SIGINT

You could also press the Weapon Button to wave the hanky around and spread the knockout drug that way.

SIGINT

But there's only enough drug for one use, so you'll have to go soak it if you want to use it again.

SIGINT

You should be able to find some sort of anesthetic around there. (From a mushroom.)
Tranquilizer Gun
(1)

SIGINT

The Mk22 is a tranquilizer gun. You can use it to take enemies down without hurting them.

SIGINT

The thing is, the amount of time it takes for the tranquilizer to work depends on which part of the body the dart hits.

SIGINT

If you need to drop an enemy in one shot, aim for the head.
(2)

SIGINT

The Mk22 can also be equipped with a suppressor. With a suppressor equipped, you won't need to worry about anybody hearing the shot.
(3)

SIGINT

But, the suppressor will deteriorate each time the gun is fired.

SIGINT

The durability of your suppressor is displayed on the weapon icon whenever the suppressor is equipped. Be sure to keep an eye on it.
(4)

SIGINT

A suppressor can be unequipped by pressing the Enter Button while the Weapon Window is open.

SIGINT

It's a good idea to take the suppressor off a gun when you don't need it.
Torch
(1)

SIGINT

A torch? A little primitive but, a light's a light.

SIGINT

From what I can tell, that torch is made of white birch dipped in turpentine.

SIGINT

It burns long, so I don't think you'll have a problem with it burnin' out on you.

SIGINT

If you equip it and press the CQC Button, you can use it to smack the enemy.

SIGINT

You can also swing it around by pressing that button repeatedly. Useful when you need to clear the room of bats and stuff.

SIGINT

With the Weapon Button, you can light and extinguish the torch, so make sure that thing is out if an enemy is closing in. Get used to it.
(2)

SIGINT

The light from the torch is visible from a long way off, though.

SIGINT

It probably goes without saying, but marching into battle with a torch in your hand is not the sanest course of action.

SIGINT

You should only light a torch when you're someplace like a cave where you can't find your way around without a light.

SNAKE

Yeah, I hear you.
Grenade

SIGINT

Gonna use a grenade huh?

SIGINT

That's an RGD-5, the standard blast-fragmentation grenade of the Soviet army.

SIGINT

The grenade itself is composed of two steel-plated casings. Each of those casings has an inner fragment liner that causes it to burst into over 300 shards when the grenade explodes.

SIGINT

The grenade will deliver heavy damage to any enemies within its blast area.

SIGINT

The safety pin is on the opposite side relative to the M26, so be sure to hold the safety lever down with your finger when you grip it.

SIGINT

The safety is released when you actually throw the grenade, and it'll explode about three seconds later.

SNAKE

So what you're saying is, it won't explode in my hand while I'm holding it? (Up until MGS2, grenades would always explode several seconds after the button was pressed, whether the player had thrown them or not.)

SIGINT

(Why wouldn't they?) Of course not!

SNAKE

Oh... (A little sad since until the last game they would explode regardless.)

SIGINT

To throw a grenade, press and release the Weapon Button. Remember that how far you throw it depends on how hard it's pressed.

SIGINT

Press lightly if you want to drop it close to you, and press harder if you want to lob it away.

SIGINT

It'll probably be easier to control your throw if you do it in First Person View.
White Phosphorous Grenade
(1)

SIGINT

You're thinking of using a white phosphorus grenade?

SIGINT

Like the name says, a white phosphorus grenade is one that uses white phosphorus to create an incendiary effect.

SIGINT

White phosphorus grenades were used by the U.S. military during World War II. Back then, they were known as "Willy Petes," after the first two letters of "white phosphorus."

SIGINT

The one you've got there is probably the exact same thing.

SIGINT

White phosphorus is a white, waxy substance that spontaneously combusts when it reacts with oxygen.

SIGINT

The combustion temperature is over 5,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Any human targets within the area of effect when it explodes are going to get seriously burned.

SIGINT

Just make sure you don't accidentally set yourself on fire.
(2)

SIGINT

If your body does catch on fire, either plunge into some water or take off the burning clothes and put on new ones.

SIGINT

Rolling repeatedly should put the flames out pretty quick, too.
Stun Grenade

SIGINT

Hmm, I've never seen a grenade like that one before.

SIGINT

There are two basic types of grenades: fragmentation grenades, which use shrapnel to kill or maim the target, and explosive grenades, which use the blast from the explosion as the offensive means.

SIGINT

But the grenade you've got there isn't either of those.

SIGINT

My best guess is that it's meant to knock the enemy out without hurting them.

SIGINT

Most likely it's an entirely new kind of weapon developed exclusively at Groznyj Grad.

SIGINT

I've heard that the SAS is working on a low-impact grenade for training purposes... but I never thought they'd be used in an actual battle...

SIGINT

The flash of light that occurs when the grenade explodes is probably produced by magnesium. It's the same stuff that's used in camera flashes.

SIGINT

I'm thinking they cut down on killing power by reducing the amount of explosives and made up for it by making the flash and bang so strong that it overwhelms the enemy's senses.

SIGINT

I guess you could call it a "stun grenade."

SNAKE

If I'm going to be stunned, I'd rather it be by a woman.

SIGINT

Snap out of it. Anyone around when that thing goes off'll be laid out.

SIGINT

It ought to come in handy when you're trying to storm a room, or when you don't want to kill the enemy.
Smoke Grenade
(1)

SIGINT

Thinking of using a smoke grenade, huh?

SIGINT

As you might expect, smoke grenades can be used to create a smoke screen.

SIGINT

The combustion agent is a mixture of zinc oxide, ammonium chloride, aluminum, and some other stuff.

SIGINT

When it explodes, it releases a thick cloud of grayish-white smoke that resists dispersion. That should provide some nice cover.

SIGINT

The smoke will confuse the enemy by blocking their field of vision. That'll help you out when you're trying to make a quick getaway.

SIGINT

It also works the other way around - you can use it as cover to sneak up on an enemy position.
(2)

SIGINT

The smoke screen should work just as well when you're being chased by dogs, too.
Chaff Grenade

SIGINT

That's a weird grenade you got there.

SIGINT

From what I can tell, it's an anti-electronics weapon that works by scattering a bunch of metal foil in the air to interfere with radio signals.

SIGINT

Call it a chaff grenade, if you will.

SIGINT

By using a chaff grenade, you can disrupt the function of enemy radios and electronic devices for a short period of time.

SIGINT

The enemy won't be able to make radio contact and it'll disable surveillance cameras. It should also throw off guided missiles, too.

SIGINT

But keep in mind that as long as the chaff is in effect, you won't be able to use your motion detector or active sonar, either.
Magazine

SIGINT

You say you're using a magazine?

SIGINT

A magazine is what's left when you empty the clip of a gun.

SIGINT

But what do you plan to do with it?

SNAKE

I'm going to throw it.

SIGINT

Throw it?

SNAKE

Yeah. The sound it makes when it hits the ground will distract the enemy's attention.

SIGINT

Ah... a diversion!

SIGINT

Guess state-of-the-art weapons aren't the only things that determine victory or defeat.
Survival Knife

SIGINT

Ah, you're using the survival knife.

SNAKE

Yeah. This thing provides me with all the bare essentials I need to survive in the field.

SIGINT

Hey, wait. What'd you do with the knife I made you? That was a work of art. It had matches and fishhooks and thread and stuff in the grip.

SNAKE

Sorry to have to tell you this, but that thing is useless in a fight.

SIGINT

No way! Really?

SNAKE

Yeah. When the grip is hollowed out like that, there's not as much space to stabilize the blade.

SNAKE

So the joint between the blade and the grip is weaker. That makes it easier to break.

SIGINT

I get it. You're right - with your knife, you don't have to worry about it breaking no matter how much you swing it around.

SIGINT

So the important thing is durability... Man, I gotta write this stuff down.

SIGINT

Next time, I'll make it so the matches and fishhooks go in the sheath instead.

SNAKE

... (That wouldn't be helpful either.)
Fork
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, what do you have in your hand?

SNAKE

A fork. Why?

SIGINT

A fork? What'd you do with your knife? It ain't dinner time yet!

SNAKE

Sigint, you have to think bigger than that. A fork's good for more than just eating dinner.

SIGINT

Oh yeah? Like what?

SNAKE

It's a weapon.

SIGINT

A weapon?

SNAKE

Yeah. I can use it with the Weapon Button the same way I use the survival knife.
(2)

SNAKE

Of course, it's not going to be much use for CQC.
(3)

SNAKE

This mission is all about procuring on-site. I have to use whatever limited equipment I can find any way I can to achieve my objective.

SNAKE

So, I have to make the most out of every item by adapting them to different situations.

SNAKE

Take this fork, for instance. At first glance it looks useless, but it can be an effective weapon if used the right way. You have to learn to think flexibly and see all the different possibilities.

SIGINT

Think flexibly, huh... Thanks for the advice, man.

SNAKE

No problem. And the best part is, if I use this to spear a snack, I can eat it right there without having to put it in my backpack first.

SIGINT

... I knew it! You ARE using it to eat!
EZ GUN
(1)

SIGINT

Aha, you're using the EZ GUN.

SNAKE

Yeah. What is this gun, anyway? I've never seen anything like it...

SIGINT

Of course you haven't. It's a noise-suppressed tranquilizer gun I designed especially for FOX.

SNAKE

A noise-suppressed tranquilizer gun? But it doesn't have a (suppressor)...

SIGINT

It doesn't need a suppressor.

SNAKE

What do you mean?

SIGINT

The noise-suppressing mechanism is built into the tranquilizer rounds themselves.

SIGINT

The inside of the powder case contains a tiny piston. It's set up so that when the firing gas pushes the piston, the piston pushes the bullet out of the chamber.

SIGINT

The firing gas is sealed within the chamber by the piston, preventing it from escaping outside. That's why there's no sound when it fires.

SNAKE

Fascinating...

SIGINT

While I was at it, I also fitted it with an experimental laser sight. That ought to give you a good aim even when you're shooting from the hip.
(2)

SIGINT

And just having the EZ GUN equipped makes it tougher for your Camo Index to drop.

SNAKE

Wow.
(3)

SIGINT

And it'll help you recover your stamina.

SNAKE

Nice.
(4)

SIGINT

And you won't make a sound when you walk.

SNAKE

Good to know.
(5)

SIGINT

On top of all that, it looks just like a Liberator.

SNAKE

... A what?

SIGINT

A Liberator. We supplied them to the Resistance in Europe during World War II. They look alike, don't they?

SNAKE

... Yeah.

SIGINT

To be honest, that's the part I had the most trouble with. Getting the feature I just mentioned to work in a gun of that size and shape wasn't easy.

SNAKE

But why?

SIGINT

Why what?

SNAKE

Why'd you go to all the trouble of making it look like a Liberator?

SIGINT

Cause it looks cool, man. Why d'you think?

SNAKE

...
Mk22

SIGINT

The weapon you've got equipped now is a prototype model of the Mk22, a suppressor-equipped pistol currently in development by the Navy. It's been modified to act as a tranquilizer gun.

SIGINT

The Mk22 is a heavily modified special ops version of the M39 pistol used as a sidearm by the SEALS.

SIGINT

Probably the biggest change from the M39 is that it's got a longer barrel, which allows it to be equipped with a suppressor.

SIGINT

And it uses a slide-lock mechanism. That makes it a lot quieter, but it also means you have to load a new round into the chamber by hand every time you fire.

SIGINT

It's also fitted with tall adjustable sights, so you can use the front and rear sights to line up your shot even with a suppressor attached.

SNAKE

Looks like they got rid of the magazine safety, too.

SIGINT

Good eye. That feature wasn't too popular with guys like you who know their guns.

SIGINT

The shear release lever's been taken off as well, meaning the hammer won't fall even with the safety on.

SNAKE

So I can just cock and lock?

SIGINT

That and you get the added bonus of not having any mechanical noise from decocking, even with the safety on.

SIGINT

The perfect pistol for a sneaking mission, huh.
M37

SIGINT

Ah, I see you got yourself an M37.

SIGINT

The M37 is a 12-gauge pump-action shotgun.

SIGINT

Don't expect any kind of accuracy from a distance, but one blast will send the enemy flying, and it's got some serious firepower too. Good thing to have with you in close-range combat.

SIGINT

It takes awhile to reload, though, so plan accordingly.

SIGINT

The thing that really distinguishes the M37 is that it's light weight.

SIGINT

It's about 2 pounds lighter than other shotguns. In fact, it's so light that it's been nicknamed the "Featherlight."

SNAKE

Yeah, and to top it off, this one's had its barrel and stock sawed off.

SIGINT

That's probably a modification to make it easier to wield in the jungle. Those Soviet boys know what they're doing.

SIGINT

I guess the other distinguishing feature would be the lack of an ejection port on the side of the receiver.

SNAKE

Ambidextrous, huh.

SIGINT

Exactly. It's been designed so you can use it left-handed or right-handed with equal ease.

SIGINT

But that's not all. The low number of apertures means that it won't get jammed up as much with mud and dirt when you use it out in the field.

SIGINT

This weapon is made for the jungle.

SNAKE

Good to know.

SNAKE

But what are they doing with an American-made shotgun?

SIGINT

Good question. I guess they could be doing research on Western weapons, but...

SIGINT

Did you ever hear about the SAS using shotguns in jungle combat in Malaya?

SNAKE

Just stories.

SIGINT

In the jungle, you're always running into the enemy when you least expect it. The SAS found the shotgun to be extremely effective delivering massive firepower in a short period of time.

SIGINT

Because of that, lately a lot of point men are starting to use shotguns as their weapon of choice.

SIGINT

Volgin's men might be trying that tactic out for themselves.
M1911 (standard)
(1)

SIGINT

Hey, you've got an M1911A1.

SNAKE

Yeah. a .45. Fifty years since the Army adopted the first model, and they're still using them. It's a real gem of an automatic pistol.
(2)

SIGINT

But aren't you going to need more than just one little handgun?

SNAKE

Not at all.

SNAKE

When you're in a tight spot or fighting in close quarters, sometimes a handgun works better than a rifle.

SNAKE

And if I equip a knife at the same time, I can instantaneously switch over to hand-to-hand combat.

SIGINT

I see.
(3)
*If player has received the customized model from EVA

SIGINT

That .45 you've got there is a lot different from the original, though.

SIGINT

Looks like someone did some serious work on it.
-->Sigint Radio Conversation: M1911 (custom)
M1911 (custom)
*If player heard the "M1911 (standard)" conversation before The Boss field stripped it
(1)

SIGINT

So you've got an M1911A1, huh?

SNAKE

Yeah. EVA gave it to me. She said it used to belong to a Western officer.

SIGINT

Looks like someone did a little work on it, too.
(2)

SNAKE

It's more than a little.

SNAKE

First of all, the feeding ramp is polished to a mirror sheen. It's not going to have any feeding problems.

SNAKE

The slide's been replaced with a reinforced version. And it meshes perfectly with the frame.

SNAKE

The frame itself has been iron-welded and scraped down multiple times for maximum precision.

SNAKE

The front strap part of the frame has been checkered to make it dig into the hand. That prevents any slipping.

SNAKE

The sight system's original, too.

SNAKE

It's a 3-dot type. It's got an enlarged front sight, giving it superior target sighting capability.

SNAKE

The regular hammer's been replaced with a ring hammer.

SNAKE

That enhances the cocking control and increases the hammer-down speed.

SNAKE

They also reworked the grip safety to accommodate the ring hammer. Looks like they eliminated it altogether. This is a tool for pros.

SNAKE

The thumb safety and the slide stop are extended to allow for more precise handling.

SNAKE

The base of the trigger guard is whittled down, so you can use a high grip.

SNAKE

And the trigger itself is a long type for easy finger access.

SNAKE

The trigger pull is about 3.5 pounds. That's about a pound and a half lighter than normal.

SNAKE

The magazine well has been widened to make it easier to put in a new magazine.

SNAKE

The magazine catch button has been cut down low to make it harder to hit it by mistake.

SNAKE

The mainspring housing has been changed to a flat type to increase grip. And it's even been fitted with stepping so that it doesn't slip from the recoil when firing.

SNAKE

On top of that, they added cocking serrations to the front part of the slide. That lets you load and eject cartridges faster in an emergency.

SNAKE

Whoever did this is a professional. No question - this thing could shoot a one-hole at 25 yards in a machine rest.

SIGINT

Well, I'll be damned. That's some gun.

SNAKE

Yeah. I've never used a weapon this fine in my life.
Single Action Army

SIGINT

You say you're using a single action army?

SIGINT

The single action army was first manufactured in 1873. It's been in production ever since then, except for a short hiatus.

SIGINT

People started calling it the "single action army" after the Army adopted it as their official sidearm in 1875.

SIGINT

It's also sometimes called the "Peacemaker," owing to the fact that a lot of sheriffs used it to keep law and order in the old West.

SIGINT

There are a lot of different models. The one you've got is probably the "Black Powder" model.

SIGINT

The single action army uses .45 Long Colt rounds. It's powerful enough to fire a 255-grain bullet at an initial velocity of 800 feet-per-second.

SIGINT

The muzzle energy is almost 10% higher than the .45 ACP bullets the M1911A1 uses.

SIGINT

You want stopping power? You got it!

SIGINT

The only thing is, it takes a while to reload.

SIGINT

This is a gun with history. You can do all sorts of tricks with it. Why don't you practice with it for a while? Go into First Person View and use the right analog stick.
Patriot

SIGINT

Using the Patriot, eh?

SNAKE

Yeah. It's the same one The Boss was using.

SIGINT

Where'd you get it?

SNAKE

Hmm?

SIGINT

I said, where'd you get it?

SNAKE

*trying to dissuade him* Sigint, don't get worked up over details. (This is acquired as a reward item after finishing the game once.)

SIGINT

???

SIGINT

Whatever. Anyway, the Patriot is a one-of-a-kind sidearm made especially for The Boss.

SIGINT

It's basically an XM16E1 with the barrel cut short and the stock taken off.

SIGINT

The idea was to create a large pistol that combined the feel and quick handling of a handgun with the force of a rifle.

SIGINT

But with a barrel that short, the recoil is unbelievable. It's tough to aim, but it more than makes up for it in firepower.

SIGINT

From the looks of it, it's fitted with a 100-round drum magazine... and it never runs out of ammo?

SNAKE

Never.

SIGINT

Why is that?

SNAKE

*like this is all perfectly normal* Because the internal feed mechanism is shaped like an infinity symbol. (This is common knowledge for the characters in this universe—e.g., how wearing a bandana with the infinity symbol embroidered on it bestows infinite ammo.)

SIGINT

*sees what he means* Ah, I get it. Yep, that'll give you unlimited ammo.
Scorpion

SIGINT

I see you're equipped with a Scorpion.

SIGINT

The Scorpion is a new type of small submachine gun made in Czechoslovakia.

SNAKE

I've heard of it, but...

SIGINT

... But you've never used one, right? Well, they only started making it three years ago, after all.

SIGINT

There are a bunch of different models of Scorpion... What kind of rounds does that one take?

SNAKE

.32ACP.

SIGINT

Then it's gotta be the Vz-61.

SIGINT

The Scorpion is different from a lot of other submachine guns in that it operates on a closed bolt system.

SIGINT

So you get a high degree of precision even when firing in semi-auto mode.

SIGINT

Another special feature on the Scorpion is the rate reducer, a mechanism that also functions as a shock absorber.

SIGINT

What it does is lock the bolt in place for a split second when it's in the rearward position.

SIGINT

That keeps the firing rate down to a reasonable level, and also helps make the gun easier to control when firing in full-auto mode.

SIGINT

The Scorpion's firing rate is 750 rounds per minute. It ought to be a heck of a lot easier to control than the MAC11, which has a rate of 1200 rounds per minute.

SIGINT

You should be able to handle it with one hand no problem in semi-auto mode. In full-auto mode, you could probably manage short bursts.

SIGINT

And it looks like that one's fitted with a laser sight, too.

SIGINT

The Soviets probably developed this one on their own.

SIGINT

You can't use the Aim Button to aim from the shoulder, but with the laser sight accuracy it shouldn't be that big of a problem.
XM16E

SIGINT

Snake, you've got a...

SNAKE

I know. It's some new kind of rifle out of the West. Looks kind of like a "black rifle"...

SIGINT

No, it's not an AR-15. It's an XM16E1, a top-of-the-line rifle that the Army adopted recently on a trial basis.

SIGINT

The U.S. military was working on a new concept for a light infantry weapon from the late 40s through the mid 50s.

SIGINT

In the end, they decided they wanted a .22-caliber, high muzzle velocity rifle with full-auto capability.

SIGINT

What they came up with was the AR-15, the so-called "black rifle."

SIGINT

The one you've got there, the XM16E1, is a modified AR-15 that's been fitted with a bolt forward assist.

SIGINT

I heard they're doing performance evaluations down in Southeast Asia.

SNAKE

So they captured one in Vietnam and brought it here?

SIGINT

That's my guess.

SIGINT

But that thing looks a lot different from a regular XM16E1.

SIGINT

There must have been a gunsmith present at the field tests who made all these modification on the spot.

SIGINT

The fact that it's painted in camouflage colors shows that more and more people these days are starting to realize the importance of camouflage.

SNAKE

They made it so it takes a suppressor, too.

SIGINT

Yep. That's a nice feature to have for a recon unit on a sneaking mission deep in enemy territory.

SIGINT

You can attach and detach the suppressor by opening the Weapon Window and pressing the Enter Button.

SIGINT

Oh, and the firing mechanism's been modified to enable three-shot bursts.

SNAKE

Why the hell would they do that?

SIGINT

These days, a lot of new recruits aren't used to firing in full-auto mode. They have no trigger control and end up emptying the whole clip at once.

SIGINT

Maybe they were experimenting with ways to prevent that and came up with the burst mechanism as a possible solution.

SNAKE

Stupid idea if you ask me.

SIGINT

Hey, give it a chance, it might come in handy.

SIGINT

Open the Weapon Window and press the Action Button to switch between semi-auto, full-auto, and 3-shot burst modes.

SIGINT

Have fun with that.
AK-47

SIGINT

Got yourself an AK-47, huh?

SIGINT

The AK-47 is the official assault rifle of the Soviet army.

SIGINT

The first model was completed in 1946, and in '49 it beat out all its competitors to become the standard assault rifle of the Soviet military.

SIGINT

It uses 7.62 mm x 39 rounds, developed in 1943, and a 30-round box magazine originally designed for a different assault rifle.

SIGINT

You can aim it from the shoulder by equipping it in First Person View and holding down the Aim Button.

SIGINT

It's sturdy and extremely reliable, with high power and precision. There's no better assault rifle in the world.
M63

SIGINT

I see you got yourself an M63.

SIGINT

The M63 is an American-made system weapon.

SNAKE

Yeah, I've heard of it before, but...

SIGINT

... But you've never got your hands on one? Doesn't surprise me - it's brand new. They only developed it last year.

SIGINT

I'm thinking they probably captured some in Southeast Asia and sent them back for research.

SIGINT

The term "system weapon" refers to a design where most of the parts are interchangeable, allowing you to create a lot of different variations from a single original model.

SIGINT

Using a set of basic components as the core, you can mix and match parts to create any number of different weapons. It's like a convertible rifle.

SIGINT

By switching barrels and magazines around, you can make everything from an assault rifle and a carbine to a light machine gun and even a belt-feeding medium machine gun.

SIGINT

Not only does this save the trouble of having to organize a bunch of different weapons on different lines, but it also has the added benefit of cutting down on the amount of training needed foreach soldier.

SIGINT

Most of the parts are made by press work and lost-wax casting, so they can be manufactured in countries that lack a developed technological base.

SNAKE

Nice touch.

SIGINT

The variation you've got there is the belt-fed light machine gun. It was originally designed for use in squad support missions.

SNAKE

It's a lot lighter than the M60.

SIGINT

Yeah. You won't find a lighter-weight light machine gun than that.

SIGINT

It ought to be pretty easy to handle in the jungle. Make good use of it.
Dragunov
(1)

SIGINT

Ah, you've got an SVD.

SIGINT

That's the Soviets' top-of-the-line semi-automatic sniper rifle, adopted just last year.

SIGINT

SVD stands for the Russian words that mean "Dragunov semi-automatic sniper rifle."

SIGINT

For a long time, the standard Russian sniper rifle was the Mosin Nagant.

SIGINT

But at the beginning of the 1950s, when Soviet troops started carrying automatic rifles and assault rifles, the need for an automatic sniper rifle increased.

SIGINT

The SVD was developed to fulfill that need.

SIGINT

It can use the same ammo as the Mosin Nagant, 7.62 mm x 54 rimmed cartridges, but they developed a new type of ammo with a tighter firing pattern to go along with it.

SIGINT

I heard that these new rounds have a steel core and are 2.5 times more precise than regular rifle bullets.

SIGINT

Nothing can match that thing in terms of precision. Try it out for yourself and see how powerful it is.
(2)

SIGINT

When you equip a sniper rifle, you'll go straight into First Person View.

SIGINT

Once you're in position, press the Aim Button to look through the scope. The trigger is the Weapon Button, as usual.

SIGINT

You can change the magnification on the scope by pressing the Action Button.

SIGINT

You can fire from a standing position, but your aim will be a heck of a lot steadier if you're lying down.

SIGINT

Try it out.
Mosin Nagant

SIGINT

You're using a Mosin Nagant?

SNAKE

Yeah. It's what The End was using.

SIGINT

I see.

SIGINT

The M1891/30 Mosin Nagant is a real beauty of a bolt-action sniper rifle. It's been in use since World War II.

SIGINT

Mosin Nagants are created by selecting the best-made weapons out of the regular M1891/30 rifle production line for their high precision and upgrading them to sniper rifles.

SIGINT

They add an optical sight, make the trigger pull lighter, bend the charging handle underneath - that kind of stuff.

SIGINT

The Mosin Nagant has been known far and wide since the war for its superior capabilities.

SIGINT

They were so highly valued that a lot of German snipers on the eastern front preferred to use captured Mosin Nagants instead of their own rifles.

SIGINT

It looks like The End took the one he'd been using since the war and modified it to fire tranquilizer rounds.

SNAKE

Yeah. It's also been fitted with a folding stock and a pistol grip.

SIGINT

Maybe for parachute jumps? Well, I dunno why he did it, but that's the tool of a legendary sniper. It's got to be a fine piece of work.

SIGINT

But remember - the Mosin Nagant is a bolt-action rifle, so you'll have to load a new tranquilizer round into the chamber by hand every time you fire.

SIGINT

That means no repeat firing. One shot, one kill.
RPG-7

SIGINT

You're using an RPG-7, huh?

SIGINT

The RPG-7 is a state-of-the-art portable anti-tank weapon developed as the successor to the RPG-2.

SIGINT

It first saw active deployment in 1962 the year before last.

SIGINT

Actually, maybe portable's not the right word. The launcher and the grenade together weigh over 20 pounds. It's not something you can use on the move.

SIGINT

When you equip it, make sure you use First Person View to aim.

SNAKE

Got it.

SIGINT

You can fire it as soon as you're in position, but if you use the Aim Button to look through the scope, you should be able to get a pretty accurate shot.

SIGINT

Then just use the Weapon Button to pull the trigger and the propellant will shoot the grenade out of the launcher.

SIGINT

Immediately after that, stabilizer fins will deploy from the back of the grenade. After it travels about 35 feet, the rocket fuel inside the grenade will ignite, accelerating the grenade towards its target.

SIGINT

Even if it doesn't hit the target, the safety mechanism will kick in and cause it to self-destruct when it exceeds the target range or after a few seconds of flight.

SIGINT

The warhead is made of the plastic explosive HEAT. It's capable of penetrating up to 13 inches of armor. That should be enough to shoot down a heavily-armored attack chopper.

SIGINT

Oh, one more thing - the rocket fires when the grenade first starts its descent. So don't try to fire it real close to the ground.

SNAKE

So, you can't use it from a lying position?

SIGINT

Right. Don't forget that.

SNAKE

I won't.
C3

SIGINT

Got some C3, I see.

SIGINT

C3 is a type of plastic explosive developed in the West for special operations use following World War II.

SIGINT

It's composed of 77% RDX and 23% moldable plastic. Like EVA was saying, you can mold it into different shapes like clay.

SIGINT

C3 is less volatile than TNT, so a little heat or shock won't be enough to set it off. It's extremely easy to handle and highly effective.

SIGINT

Looks like EVA set up the detonators with a special timer mechanism.

SNAKE

Yeah. She made it so that when the timer hits zero, all four charges will detonate at the same time.

SIGINT

Did she now? Then you'd better wait until you plant all four charges on the liquid fuel tanks before you start the timer.

SIGINT

And remember you only have enough C3 to do the job.

SIGINT

Don't go sticking that stuff anywhere but the liquid fuel tanks in the hangar, got it?

SNAKE

Got it.
Claymore
(1)

SIGINT

Ah, you got yourself some Claymores.
(2)

SIGINT

The M18A1 Claymore is a new type of anti-personnel directional mine developed in the U.S. after the Korean War.

SIGINT

The gently curved casing is packed with a pound and a half of high-grade explosives. The side facing the enemy is lined with 700 steel ball bearings.

SIGINT

So when the mine explodes, the ball bearings simultaneously burst out of the casing. Anyone in the kill zone, be he friend or foe, is instant Swiss cheese.

SIGINT

The mine is triggered by an electric detonator. Apparently, the detonator's got some kind of special motion detector built in.

SNAKE

Yeah. When the mine is planted, it reacts to anything that comes close and automatically explodes.

SIGINT

Just make sure you don't trip your own mine or something stupid like that.

SNAKE

I'll be careful.

SIGINT

You can pick up a planted Claymore by crawling over it.

SIGINT

Mines planted by the enemy can also be picked up in this way, so if you come across a minefield, it's a good idea to crawl through it and pick up the mines.

SNAKE

What are they doing making minefields out of Western mines, anyway?

SIGINT

They're probably doing field performance evaluations on mines they either captured or stole from the West.

SIGINT

The structure of the Claymore isn't actually all that complicated. They must be learning a lot about them.

SIGINT

It might not be long before we start seeing "Claymorasky" mines. (In reality, it was shortly after this that the Soviet Union developed Claymores.)
TNT
(1)

SIGINT

Looks like you've got some TNT.

SIGINT

TNT is short for trinitrotoluene, a pale yellow crystalline compound made from a tri-nitrified mix of nitric acid and sulfuric acid.

SIGINT

It's used throughout the world as a military explosive.

SIGINT

It has a low sensitivity and is chemically stable, making it easy to handle. It's also got a low melting point, and can easily be shaped by boiling or steaming it.

SIGINT

But because the sensitivity is so low, you need a booster to actually get it to explode.

SNAKE

No problem. It came with its own remote control detonator.

SIGINT

Good. Then all you have to do is press the Weapon Button to place the TNT and then press the CQC Button to set it off.

SIGINT

The "MAP" screen in the Survival Viewer will display the locations where you've planted TNT.
(2)

SIGINT

Take warning though - the radio signal for the detonator is pretty weak.

SIGINT

Don't forget that pressing the CQC Button will only set off TNT that's planted in the same area.
Mousetrap

SIGINT

Hey, you got a mousetrap!

SIGINT

That mousetrap is a portable tool for capturing small animals alive.

SIGINT

Press the Weapon Button to place it on the ground. Come back a little bit later, and there might be a frog or a snake caught in there.

SIGINT

Whether or not you actually catch anything, though, is all a matter of luck. Don't get all down if there's nothing in the trap. Try, try again.

SIGINT

Also, don't forget that you need some bait in the trap or nothing's gonna come crawling in there.

SIGINT

If you capture an animal with a trap, it won't have any bait left.

SIGINT

Just crawl to pick it up. Then put some more bait back in and set it down again.

SIGINT

You can use the "MAP" in the Survival Viewer to see where you've placed traps. If you forget where you put a trap, just look at the "MAP."
Directional Microphone

SIGINT

I see you've picked up a directional microphone.

SIGINT

The directional microphone is exactly what it looks like - a listening device.

SIGINT

When you equip it, you'll go into First Person View and the mike will pick up sounds in whatever direction you point it in. The directional microphone will let you hear a lot of things you couldn't hear otherwise, like really soft noises and the footsteps of faraway enemy soldiers.

SIGINT

You ought to find it useful when you want to know whether there's an enemy on the other side of the woods or something. Try it out!!
•Items
Binoculars (1)
(1)

SIGINT

I see you're using the binoculars.

SIGINT

Those are high-performance binoculars made especially for the military. They're completely waterproof and are filled with nitrogen gas to prevent lens fog.

SIGINT

The eyepiece, objective lenses and the prism have been coated to reduce glare. They ought to work plenty well even in dark places.

SIGINT

And they're even equipped with auto-focus and zoom functions. Won't find a better pair of binoculars than that.
(2)
*If player hasn't heard that Sigint made them

SNAKE

What are you, a binocular salesman?

SIGINT

Hey, I know a good product when I see one, that's all. (He in fact made them.)

SNAKE

...? (He's not quite convinced.)
(3)
*If player has heard that Sigint made them

SNAKE

I know.

SIGINT

Know what?

SNAKE

You made these binoculars, right?

SIGINT

!! Y-yeah, but... they're good, aren't they?

SNAKE

...
Thermal Goggles

SIGINT

Hey... what's that you've got there?

SNAKE

Thermal goggles. From what I can tell, they detect and display sources of heat.

SIGINT

You're kiddin' me! They actually made a passive infrared night-vision device small enough to carry around with you....

SNAKE

What, is that special or something?

SIGINT

Is it special? Here in the West, we've just barely got the technology to install it on aircraft.

SNAKE

So that's what the thing is they put on the gunship...

SNAKE

But doesn't the Army have something like that for driving vehicles at night? I thought I saw...

SIGINT

You mean the AN-PAS-5.

SIGINT

That's an active infrared night-vision device. It fires infrared beams from an infrared projector, and uses the reflections to build an image.

SIGINT

Those goggles you've got there are completely different.

SIGINT

Basically, when you've got those equipped, you'll be able to spot enemy soldiers in the jungle with ease, even if they're camouflaged.

SIGINT

They might even help you find traps. Ah, but you won't be able to see the terrain as well, so watch your step.
Night Vision Goggles

SIGINT

Hey, what's that you're wearing...?

SNAKE

Night-vision goggles. This gadget lets me see in the dark by amplifying light and displaying it as images.

SIGINT

Amplifying light?

SNAKE

That's what it looks like to me.

SIGINT

Well, I'll be damned.

SIGINT

They're working on something like that here in the States, but so far it's not viable unless it's coupled with an infrared searchlight.

SIGINT

And now the Russians have something you can carry with you...

SIGINT

... Anyway, those goggles should give you a decent visual range even in dark places.

SIGINT

But don't look at anything bright, like fire, or it'll get burned into your eyes and you won't be able to see for a while. Be careful.
Anti-Personnel Sensor
(1)

SIGINT

Using the anti-personnel sensor, I see.

SIGINT

The sensor vibrates when it detects organic reactions from human targets.

SIGINT

It's been adjusted to respond only to humans, so unlike other sensors, it'll let you ignore animals and focus only on the enemy.

SIGINT

It'll even detect enemies that aren't moving, and you won't have to worry about it giving away your position.

SIGINT

But on the flip side, it won't tell you the exact location of the target. Keep that in mind when you're using it.

SIGINT

Also, remember that when you use it in First Person View, it'll only scan in the direction you're facing.
(2)
*If player heard the same information from the Major during the Virtuous Mission

SNAKE

?

SIGINT

Something wrong?

SNAKE

The Major told me the exact same thing...

SIGINT

You mean during the Virtuous Mission?

SNAKE

Yeah.

SIGINT

He must have been reading those notes I gave him word for word. That guy doesn't know tech.

SNAKE

...
Motion Detector
(1)

SIGINT

The motion detector will display any moving objects in your vicinity.

SIGINT

But the enemy isn't the only thing that's moving around in the jungle. If there are animals moving nearby, the sensor will pick up those animals, too.

SIGINT

And remember that there's a limit to how sensitive it is. Enemies and animals that don't move around very much won't get picked up.
(2)
*If player heard the same information from the Major during the Virtuous Mission

SIGINT

Did he tell you that, too?

SNAKE

Yeah. Did you give him notes for it?

SIGINT

Yup.

SNAKE

...
Active Sonar
(1)

SIGINT

Active sonar sends out a special type of sound wave whenever you press the left analog stick. It uses the echo from those waves to calculate and display the position of nearby objects.

SIGINT

Unlike the motion detector, it'll show you objects that aren't moving.

SIGINT

But because you're blasting out sound waves, there's a risk that the noise will alert enemies and animals to your presence. Be careful about when and where you use it.
(2)
*If player heard the same information from the Major during the Virtuous Mission

SNAKE

I've heard that one, too.

SIGINT

Did he use the exact same words?

SNAKE

Yeah.

SIGINT

Man, that guy still lives in the Stone Age. Just the other day, he bought this brand-new washing machine and...

ZERO

Sigint!

SIGINT

... Oops. Talk to you later, Snake.
Mine Detector

SIGINT

Using the mine detector, huh?

SIGINT

When you equip the mine detector, it lets you know with a sound if there are any Claymore mines nearby.

SIGINT

A mine detector is basically a metal detector, so ordinarily it reacts to scrap iron the same way it reacts to mines.

SIGINT

They say that only about one out of every 100 objects it responds to is an actual mine.

SIGINT

Not exactly what you'd call reliable. So they're researching other ways to detect mines, like sniffing for molecules given off by explosives and using a kind of underground radar.

SIGINT

One of these days, they might actually make something that works.

SIGINT

But the one you're using is apparently set up so that it only reacts when it finds a Claymore on the ground.

SIGINT

No need to worry about it being fooled by anything other than a mine.
Cardboard Box

SIGINT

Uh, Snake... what are you doing?

SNAKE

I'm in a box.

SIGINT

A cardboard box? Why are you...?

SNAKE

I dunno. I was just looking at it, and suddenly I got this irresistible urge to get inside.

SNAKE

No not just an urge - more than that. It was my destiny to be here; in the box.

SIGINT

Destiny...?

SNAKE

Yeah. And then when I put it on, I suddenly got this feeling of inner peace.

SNAKE

I can't put it into words. I feel... safe. Like this is where I was meant to be. Like I'd found the key to true happiness.

SIGINT

*weirded out* ...

SNAKE

Does any of that make sense?

SIGINT

Not even a little.

SNAKE

You should come inside the box... Then you'll know what I mean.

SIGINT

Man, I don't wanna know what you mean!

SIGINT

Between you and Para-Medic, is everyone but me that is hooked up with the Major strange!?

SNAKE

... (You're the weirdest one of all.)

SIGINT

Yeah, well, anyway, I suppose even that dumbass box might make a decent disguise if you wear it inside a building.
Cigar
(1)

SIGINT

Snake, you smoking a cigarette?

SNAKE

It's not a cigarette. It's a cigar.

SIGINT

Ah, same thing.

SNAKE

It's not the same thing.
(2) *If player has heard the conversation with Para-Medic about the cigar

SNAKE

Why am I the only one who can tell the difference...?
(3)

SIGINT

Doesn't matter to me. What I want to know is, why'd you take it with you?

SNAKE

Because I need it.

SIGINT

For what?

SNAKE

I can't smoke a cigar if I don't have one, can I?

SIGINT

So you just wanted to smoke it?

SNAKE

Yeah.

SIGINT

... Man, you got problems.

SIGINT

Do what you want. Just keep in mind that your LIFE goes down when you're smoking it.
Pentazemin

SIGINT

Whatcha got there, Snake?

SNAKE

Some kind of drug. The label says "Pentazemine."

SIGINT

Pentazemine? What the hell is that?

SNAKE

Beats me.

SIGINT

Let's ask Para-Medic.

SIGINT

Yo, Para-Medic!

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah?

SIGINT

You ever heard of a drug called pentazemine?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, it's an anti-anxiety drug related to benzodiazepine.

PARA-MEDIC

It's a minor tranquilizer used to treat things like depression, autonomic ataxia and aporioneurosis and things like that.

PARA-MEDIC

Besides its calming and anti-depressant properties, it's also known for its anti-convulsant effect.

SNAKE

Anti-convulsant effect?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah.

SNAKE

So in other words, it can help keep your hands from shaking?

PARA-MEDIC

Yeah, I guess so...

SNAKE

*speaks to himself* This could be useful.

PARA-MEDIC

What are you talking about?

SNAKE

Nothing. I just thought that if I took this drug when I used a sniper rifle, it'd help make my aim steadier.

PARA-MEDIC

Oh, I see. That's an interesting idea. I think it might work. Give it a try.
LIFE Medicine

SIGINT

Got some LIFE medicine, huh? LIFE medicine is...

PARA-MEDIC

LIFE medicine is a drug recently developed by the Soviet Union for use in battle.

SIGINT

The com...

PARA-MEDIC

The components are still a mystery, but it seems to activate the body's regenerative processes and make injuries heal faster.

SIGINT

Well, open th...

PARA-MEDIC

Open the window and press the Enter Button to instantly replenish your LIFE. Useful, huh?

SIGINT

... (Quit stealing my lines.)

PARA-MEDIC

Huh? What's wrong, Sigint? (She didn't have any bad intentions, so she doesn't understand why he's mad.)

SIGINT

Nevermind...
Bug Juice (1)
(1)

SIGINT

I see you have the bug juice equipped.
(2)

SIGINT

It's useful for keeping the bugs away.

SIGINT

If you open the Item Window and press the Enter Button, you'll be able to keep the nasty critters like hornets and leeches at bay for a brief period of time. Use it well!
•Miscellaneous
Origin of "Sigint"

SNAKE

Tell me something, Sigint...

SIGINT

What's that?

SNAKE

What does "Sigint" mean, anyway?

SIGINT

It's short for "Signal Intelligence."

SNAKE

Signal Intelligence?

SIGINT

The part of intelligence that deals with electronic information.

SIGINT

Things like intercepting and analyzing electronic communications, determining enemy force strength and positioning from radar emissions and radio chatter - you get the idea.

SIGINT

Codebreaking is considered part of SIGINT as well.

SIGINT

40 years from now, we'll be in the age of electronic warfare. It won't be long before information replaces firepower as the most valuable commodity on the battlefield.

SNAKE

So you're saying they won't need guys like me anymore?

SIGINT

Sorry to break it to you, but that's not gonna happen. No matter how advanced our technology gets, there's still no substitute for human beings.

SNAKE

...

SIGINT

Anyway, the Major is a man of foresight. He knew the electronic age was coming, and so he called out to me.

SNAKE

And you responded.

SIGINT

Well, I didn't have anyplace else to go.

SNAKE

You couldn't find a job?

SIGINT

Nope. None of the places where they do this kind of high-tech research would even let me in the door.

SNAKE

Why not? I know you've got social problems, but...

SIGINT

Come again?

SNAKE

Nothing. I mean, someone with your talent ought to be able to...

SIGINT

Yeah, well, maybe it had something to do with the fact that I'm Black.

SNAKE

...

SIGINT

The Major, though, he doesn't care about what color you are. I've never met anyone like him before. He's... different, you know?

SNAKE

Oh, yeah, I know.

SIGINT

I don't think racism's going to go away even in the 21st century. But I want to work with computers and use them to bring people closer together.

SIGINT

In the digital world, it doesn't matter whether you're black or white, American or Russian, or whatever. Everybody's going to be the same. That's what I think.
The Davy Crockett

SIGINT

The Davy Crocketts that The Boss took with her when she defected are mortars that fire nuclear warheads.

SIGINT

They're named after Davy Crockett, the hero who died defending the Alamo in the Texan War of Independence.

SNAKE

"Remember the Alamo."

SIGINT

That's right.

SIGINT

The warheads are equivalent to between 10 and 20 tons of TNT. Every building within 150 yards of the hypocenter is completely obliterated.

SIGINT

But the warheads The Boss had with her were some kind of experimental super-bomb. So they're actually even more powerful than that.

SIGINT
