I don't even want to think about what'd happen if she used it again. Snake, you know what you have to do... (Take out The Boss.)

SNAKE

Yeah... I know.
Origins of the Cobras' names

SIGINT

Sounds like the Cobra Unit's members' names came from the specific emotions they each carry into battle.

SNAKE

Emotions? (Snake remembers how when The Boss defected and she was asked if they were taking him with them, she responded, "He has not yet found an emotion to carry into battle.")

SIGINT

*having no regard for Snake's feelings* Yeah.

SIGINT

For unbearable torment, The Pain.

SIGINT

For true oblivion, The End.

SIGINT

For infinite rage, The Fury.

SIGINT

For absolute terror, The Fear.

SIGINT

And for unsurpassed bliss, The Joy.

SNAKE

The Joy?

SIGINT

It's another name for The Boss. Because of the joy she feels in battle, I suppose.

SNAKE

...

SIGINT

During the war, she had a partner named The Sorrow. Sorrow and Joy. They say there couldn't have been a more perfect pair.
Armory - general purpose
(1)

SIGINT

As you might have guessed, those armories you sometimes run into are where they keep their ammo and other stuff.

SIGINT

If you take out an armory, the enemy units in the area will have their ammo supply cut off.

SIGINT

And if they know they're on their last leg, they'll use ammo a little more sparingly in a gunfight.

SIGINT

Bottom line - if you blow up an armory, the enemy's firepower decreases.
(2)
*If player has called Sigint

SIGINT

If you find an armory, you should try blowing it up with TNT or something. You'll be glad you did later on.
Provisions storehouses - general purpose

SIGINT

A provisions storehouse is where the enemy keeps their food. Enemy units in that area use it to stock up on rations.

SIGINT

So, if you happen to blow up a provisions storehouse, the enemies in that area won't be able to get any more rations.

SIGINT

Spetsnaz are people, too. They gotta eat, or their stamina starts to go down.

SIGINT

They might pass out more easily, or lose their concentration and start to shoot less accurately.

SIGINT

Who knows - they'll probably be a little more desperate for food just lying around.

SIGINT

Basically, if you get rid of a provisions storehouse, the enemies in that area will get physically weaker.
(4)
*If player has called Sigint

SIGINT

To destroy a provisions warehouse, you'll want to use TNT or something like that.
Attack dogs
(1)

SIGINT

They sicced attack dogs on you?
(2)

SIGINT

People have been using dogs in war since before recorded history.

SIGINT

The Greek and Roman armies used to send out packs of dogs with spiked collars to charge at enemy ranks.

SIGINT

Attack dogs were regularly employed in the First and Second World Wars as well.

SIGINT

Traditionally, dogs have been used to keep watch, send messages, and assist in search operations. Then the Soviets came up with a new idea: using them to carry bombs.

SNAKE

Bomb dogs?

SIGINT

Yeah, they were trained to dive beneath tanks, carrying a payload of bombs.

SIGINT

Apparently it worked pretty well, but the Russians messed up, man - they used their own tanks for the training.

SIGINT

Turns out the dogs kept going after Russian tanks and blowing them up. So, the plan was scrapped before it got off the ground.

SIGINT

Well, I don't think you need to worry about those dogs exploding on you. They don't seem to be the bomb-carrying type.

SIGINT

But they are highly trained in tracking and detection. Don't underestimate them - they're excellent trackers and ferocious fighters.
(3)

SIGINT

Attack dogs move fast and are deadly in proximity encounters.

SIGINT

They'll pick up your scent and use it to track you, so it'll be hard to shake them off.

SIGINT

In a way, they're more dangerous than any human opponent. Be prepared.
(4)
*If player has smoke grenades

SIGINT

The Soviet-made smoke grenades you might find around there also seem to act as a mild tear gas.

SIGINT

It might not have that much of an effect on human targets wearing balaclavas, but it ought to wreak havoc to a dog's nose.

SIGINT

If you're being chased by attack dogs, give 'em a taste of the smoke grenade.
Backpack
(1)

SIGINT

Whenever you find a new weapon or piece of equipment, the first thing you do is drop it in your backpack, right?

SIGINT

But you can't use your new goodies if they're just sittin' in your backpack.

SIGINT

To use a weapon or a piece of equipment, first you have to take it out of your backpack and place it on your person.

SIGINT

To take an item out of your backpack, use the "BACKPACK" option in the Survival Viewer.
(2)

SIGINT

To place a weapon on your person, select "WEAPON" under the "BACKPACK" section of the Survival Viewer.

SIGINT

See that window on the left? That shows a list of all the weapons you've got.

SIGINT

Choose the weapon you want to carry from the list and press the Enter Button to take it out of your backpack.

SIGINT

Just remember that there's a limit to the number of weapons you can carry at the same time. So put back any stuff you don't need.

SIGINT

To put a weapon on your person back into your backpack, choose a weapon that's already on you from the weapon list and press the Enter Button.

SIGINT

Or, you can just line up the icon for the weapon you want to put away with the lower right and press the Enter Button.

SIGINT

Do whatever works best.
Weight and stamina

SIGINT

Keep in mind that every weapon and piece of equipment weighs something.

SIGINT

The heavier the equipment you're lugging around, the faster you'll burn up stamina.

SIGINT

You can see how much your equipment weighs by going into the "BACKPACK" screen in the Survival Viewer.

SIGINT

If you're trying to conserve your stamina, make some cuts and toss the equipment you don't need in your backpack.
Aiming a gun

SIGINT

When you're using the assault rifle, pressing the Weapon Button will hold it at waist level.

SIGINT

That's nice if you need to drop nearby enemies with some speed. But it's difficult to aim straight.

SIGINT

If you need to take more accurate shots; like taggin' enemies in vital spots from a distance; use the Aim Button instead.

SIGINT

Equip the weapon in First Person View and press the Aim Button to aim the gun from the shoulder.

SIGINT

You can take precise aim with the front and rear sights. When you're focusing on your mark, it will be as accurate as if you were zoomin' in.
Gun recoil

SIGINT

When you fire continuously with a gun like the assault rifle, the recoil will cause your shots to veer off target.

SIGINT

But if you crouch or lie down, you can suppress the recoil and keep a tight fire pattern.

SIGINT

So when you gotta hit that bull's eye, take a low position.
Survival Viewer

SIGINT

You're on a solo sneaking mission. Your success is based on your ability to survive.

SIGINT

That's where the Survival Viewer comes in.

SIGINT

The Survival Viewer contains everything you need to survive out in the field.

SIGINT

Use "CAMOUFLAGE" to change your camouflage, and "BACKPACK" to select your gear.

SIGINT

Use "FOOD" to eat, "CURE" to treat wounds, and "MAP" to view a detail of the area.

SIGINT

You've also got "OPTIONS" that lets you change the settings to suit your mission preferences.

SIGINT

Got it?
The difference between GRU and KGB soldiers
(1)

SIGINT

I heard you fought against KGB troops in the Virtuous Mission. But this time you're up against Spetsnaz.

SIGINT

Spetsnaz is the special forces unit of GRU, the intelligence wing of the Soviet Defense Ministry's General Staff Office.

SIGINT

Spetsnaz troops undergo rigorous training in all types of special ops, from assassination and demolition to intelligence gathering.

SIGINT

That, and Volgin's loaded, man. His unit is one of the best equipped in the entire Soviet Union, if not THE best.

SIGINT

I heard the enemies you encountered in the Virtuous Mission were only carrying weapons like AKs and grenades. Well, it ain't that simple anymore.
(2)

SIGINT

In addition to AKs, some of the patrols you'll encounter might be equipped with Scorpion submachine guns and shotguns.
(3)

SIGINT

The Scorpion is even lighter than the AK, making it much easier to handle.

SIGINT

Basically, a guy with a Scorpion is not gonna miss you as often as with an AK.
(4)

SIGINT

The shotgun is a powerful weapon. One blast is enough to floor you and you're likely to be seriously wounded. Watch for that, man.
Flame troopers
(1)

SIGINT

You seen any enemies equipped with flamethrowers?
(2)

SIGINT

Those flamethrowers are M2s. They were first used in World War II during the invasion of Guam.

SIGINT

The M2 uses pressurized nitrogen gas to fire a fuel mixture of napalm and gasoline.

SIGINT

It comes in handy for torchin' places that are tough to secure with conventional firepower, like trenches and bunkers and pillbox enclosures.
(3)

SIGINT

Watch out though. Get hit by a flamethrower in a narrow spot like a closet or a trench and it's barbeque time.
(4)

SIGINT

Don't wander too close to an enemy carrying a flamethrower. If you need to take one out, try sniping from a distance so the flames can't reach you.
(5)

SIGINT

The flame troopers' weak point is the fuel tank they carry around on their backs. Put a bullet in the tank, and you'll toast 'em.
(6)

SNAKE

What are they doing with American-made flamethrowers, anyway?

SIGINT

Well, like a lot of other Western weapons, those M2s were probably jacked for research purposes.

SIGINT

But if they're actually using them... man, they must really have it in for you.

SNAKE

The flamethrower is heavy, short-ranged, and can only be used for a short period of time.

SIGINT

Not only that, but when a flame trooper gets captured, he's almost always put to death.

SIGINT

Basically it's a bad idea all the way around to use flamethrowers unless you're sweepin'.

SIGINT

And despite all that, they're keepin' 'em at the ready just for you. What do you think of it?

SNAKE

... They're out for revenge.
(7)
*If player has killed a lot of enemies

SIGINT

Well, you've offed an awful lot of Volgin's men out there. No wonder they hate you.
(8)
*if player hasn't killed a lot of enemies

SIGINT

Well, you've killed three members of the Cobra Unit already. So you can see why Volgin has it in for you.
The Kiss of Death

SIGINT

That thing EVA was carrying is a gun disguised to look like a tube of lipstick, also known as the "Kiss of Death."

SIGINT

It's a hidden weapon used by KGB spies since around 1950.

SIGINT

The gun uses 4.5 mm rounds. It only carries one shot, but that's enough to get the job done if you fire it at the right spot from point-blank range.

SIGINT

They don't call it the Kiss of Death for nothing.
The Crocodile Cap

SIGINT

A cap shaped like a crocodile head, you say?

SNAKE

Yeah. What do you think? (Doing this on purpose to get a reaction.)

SIGINT

*honestly impressed* I think it's a great idea!

SIGINT

You know, animal disguises are one of the oldest tricks in the book in the intelligence world.

SIGINT

I don't know whether it's true or not, but I've heard that during World War II, the OSS (Office of Strategic Services) used to use cow suits.

SIGINT

Supposedly they'd send agents out to hide in herds of real cows so they could spy on enemy units as they passed by.

SIGINT

Nowadays, I guess most people wouldn't even give a crocodile-shaped cap a second look. They'd think it was just a gag item.

SIGINT

But if you use it the right way, it can be an effective weapon for spying.

SIGINT

I gotta hand it to you, Snake, you're one sharp guy.

SNAKE

*disappointed* ...

SIGINT

You OK, Snake?

SNAKE

*dejected* Forget it...

SIGINT

??? (Doesn't get why Snake is upset.)
•Miscellaneous
Volgin

EVA

Snake, have you heard about the massacre that happened in the forest near the village of Gnezdovo?

SNAKE

The Katyn Forest Massacre, right?

EVA

During WWII, the German army came upon the bodies of 4,000 dead Polish in the forest of Katyn.

SNAKE

Germany blamed the Soviet Union, but the Soviet Union denied it, blaming Germany in return.

EVA

The truth is that Stalin ordered the NKVD (the Soviet Union's People's Commissariat for Internal Affairs) to carry out the killings.

EVA

And it's not just Katyn. In places like Western Ukraine and Belarus, there must have been at least 20,000 Poles in the prison camps.

SNAKE

Why are you telling me this?

EVA

Volgin was one of the people responsible. He was one of the vicious leaders behind it.

SNAKE

Volgin was?

EVA

He blamed it on a prisoner revolt to allay any fears, and requested they be put to death.

EVA

I've heard that Volgin even removed the blindfolds from each prisoner before he beat them to death.

SNAKE

I knew he wasn't all there in the head, but this...

EVA

Not someone you could be friends with.
Calorie Mate
(1)

EVA

By the way Snake, do you have a Calorie Mate?

SNAKE

Yeah.

EVA

Is it any good?
(2) *After eating

SNAKE

Yeah.
(3) *Before eating

SNAKE

I haven't tried it yet.
(4)

EVA

Oh... (Seems like she wants to say something.)

SNAKE

You want it?

EVA

What?

SNAKE

Do you want the Calorie Mate?

EVA

*hit the nail on the head* Wha--, What are you saying?

SNAKE

You want it don't you...

EVA

I didn't say that.

SNAKE

So you don't want it then.

EVA

No...

EVA

... But... if you were going to give it to me as a token of thanks for me helping you out, then of course I wouldn't refuse it.

SNAKE

Are you on a diet?

EVA

What did you say?

SNAKE

Calorie Mate is supposed to be really good for losing weight.

EVA

Are you saying I'm fat?

SNAKE

No...

EVA

I'm not on a diet, and I don't need one. I just wanted to try the taste.

SNAKE

Oh, sorry.

EVA

Be careful with what you say.

SNAKE

Yeah, sorry.

EVA

... So, is it true?

SNAKE

Is what true?

EVA

That it's good for losing weight.

SNAKE

... Yeah.

SNAKE

Calorie Mate provides a nutritionally balanced source of energy and it makes counting calories easy. That's what's supposed to make it good for dieting.

EVA

Ah, I see...

SNAKE

I heard that all of the geisha in Japan use it. (Believes what Para-Medic told him.)

EVA

Geisha?

SNAKE

Yeah.

EVA

I've never heard about that.

SNAKE

Really?

EVA

Yes. I'm sure there are some geisha out there using Calorie Mate for diets, but I doubt all of them are using it.

SNAKE

I guess not...
Otton frogs and sushi
*Para-Medic mentioned how Japanese people eat Otton frogs, like as sushi or sukiyaki. Also, Snake made a promise to take EVA out for a sushi dinner after the mission is over.

EVA

Snake, don't forget about our dinner.

SNAKE

I haven't forgotten. Sushi, right... I want to try the Otton frog.

EVA

The what?

SNAKE

The Otton frog.

EVA

Frog!?

SNAKE

They have frog at sushi bars, don't they?

EVA

Of course not!

SNAKE

But I heard they eat frogs as sashimi and tempura over in Japan.

EVA

Who told you that?

SNAKE

Para-Medic.

EVA

... I suppose they might eat frogs on certain occasions. But not normally, and certainly not as sushi.

SNAKE

Oh... OK.
Story about the time The Boss carried EVA's bags
*Ties into how if the player puts EVA to sleep with a tranquilizer gun, she'll say "Mmm, right there... Boss, that feels so good..." in her sleep

SNAKE

EVA

EVA

Hmm?

SNAKE

You said you got along with The Boss, right?

EVA

Yeah, we get along pretty well. I admire her. Although she's supposed to be the distant hero, for some reason she's nice to me.

EVA

She even carried my bags for me the other day. I was impressed.

SNAKE

Your bags?

EVA

Maybe because we're both defectors. We never talk much, but I get the feeling that she understands how I feel.

EVA

I've had dreams about the whole thing.
EVA had a dog
*Ties into how if the player puts EVA to sleep with a tranquilizer gun, she'll say "Mmm, right there... Fido, that feels so good..." in her sleep

EVA

Snake, the enemy's attack dogs are very highly trained, so be careful.

SNAKE

You can tell if a dog's been highly trained or not?

EVA

I can tell.

SNAKE

How?

EVA

I used to have a dog.

SNAKE

*skeptical* YOU had a dog?

EVA

Yeah. What's so funny about it?

SNAKE

Nothing. It's just hard to picture you with a puppy.

EVA

Who asked you?

EVA

He was really cute, but I had a hard time housebreaking him... When he finally did learn, I was so happy...

EVA

I still dream about it sometimes.
EVA's driving

SNAKE

EVA, that was some pretty nice driving.

EVA

Really?

SNAKE

Ballsy yet overwhelmingly accurate. That kind of driving isn't something you can pick up in a couple days.

EVA

I told you to trust me. I love motorcycles.

SNAKE

It is not easy to jack-knife a bike like that.

EVA

So, you believe me now?

SNAKE

Think I'll pass on going tandem though.

EVA

That's too bad.
While wearing the Crocodile Cap
*Snake was wearing this hat, consisting of a crocodile's head, as a joke when he called Sigint and Para-Medic. Sigint was honestly impressed by the idea, while Para-Medic thought it looked cool. So far, everyone has killed the joke.

EVA

Snake?

SNAKE

EVA, what do you think?

EVA

*bursts out laughing* What a dork! You must be kidding me! Are you willing to risk your life for that joke?

SNAKE

All right! Finally, I get a normal response...

EVA

Wha...?

SNAKE

Everyone was giving me strange responses and acting like nothing was odd about it. I was starting to wonder myself, but now I feel better.

EVA

I'm not sure what you're talking about, but you look adorable in it.

EVA

...

EVA

*bursts out laughing* Sorry, I've got to go. This is too much...

SNAKE

...
裏表紙
